title: Data Analyst - SEM
content:
doxo is disrupting bill pay.  
We are founded on the simple idea to create a simple, secure way to pay all your bills from a single account. We’re a rapidly growing startup seeking a data analyst to help us establish and grow our paid consumer acquisition business. This position is an integral part of the doxo marketing team, collaborating with the doxo acquisition team to devise, execute, measure and optimize acquiring new customers to the platform.

Key Responsibilities

Absorb millions of rows of keyword and ad level data from multiple ad networks (Google Ads, Bing Ads, Yahoo Gemini, Facebook, and others).

Maintain and expand the doxo paid acquisition metric mySQL database and ETL processes.

Organize, visualize and analyze data sets to help inform both short- and long-term campaign operational decision-making.

Work closely with the PPC campaign team to drive process improvement through automation of campaign tasks and bid optimizations with automated scripting through paid search ad networks, MYSQL, Elastic Search, Google Analytics, and other tools.

Track, report on, and make recommendations to improve all campaign metrics including active billers, user conversion, cost per acquisition, revenue per acquisition, keyword performance and bid strategy effectiveness.

Requirements

3+ years of direct experience in a data analyst role, preferably in environments with data requirements from multiple sources.

Expert-level knowledge of scripting languages like Python.

Excellent organizational and communications skills, with the ability to translate technical data into actionable insights, and sales and marketing goals into effective digital campaigns

Expert-level knowledge of the Google Analytics, MYSQL, Zendesk, and other general experience with APIs

Proficiency with Microsoft Excel and Power Point

Work independently and as part of a team

Proven ability to accomplish objectives and work proactively

Capacity for learning quickly in a fast-paced environment and handling multiple tasks simultaneously

Strong written and spoken communication skills

Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field

title: Lead Software Engineer
content: doxo is disrupting bill pay. We are looking for a high energy Lead Software Engineer with experience building scalable web applications and leading a small team. This is a chance to work closely with product management on a talented team creating exceptional software.
• Create and maintain high-quality software while meeting deadlines.
• Work closely with product management on the definition of software requirements.
• Make selected new technologies available for use in the creation of software.
• Participate in the creation of internal and external documentation supporting the software.
• Prior experience leading a small engineering team
• Experience with high scale, distributed, 24x7 systems and applications
• Fluency with Ruby or similar programming language
• 3+ years of experience with SQL in a transactional application
• Capacity for learning quickly in a fast paced environment and handling multiple tasks simultaneously
• Strong written and oral communication skills
• BS/MS in Computer Science or Engineering

content:
doxo is disrupting bill pay. We are founded on the idea to create a simple, secure way to pay all your bills from a single account. We’re a rapidly growing startup looking for a high lead energy Data Engineer with experience building scalable data collection, storage, and analysis systems.

title: Senior Front End Developer
content:
doxo is disrupting bill pay. We are founded on the simple idea to create a simple, secure way to pay all your bills from a single account. We're a rapidly growing startup looking for a high energy user experience engineer with experience building high performance and responsive user interfaces to join our talented team.

Major Responsibilities:

Work closely with designers, product management and other software engineers on the definition of user interface design and requirements, estimate complexity, and advise about the feasibility of features.

Be a technical leader for the front end engineering team, providing insights into best practices, and passing on your expertise to the rest of the team.

Work with engineers on the frontend team to identify opportunities for technical skill growth and development.

Be a technical mentor for the team by doing presentations of new patterns/technology, developing custom training courses and making sure engineers take courses that they could help them develop their skills.

Create and maintain high-quality software while meeting deadlines.

Participate in the definition and creation of user interface style guides and shared components.

Continue your own professional growth and engage in continuous improvement, education, and learning.

Work collaboratively with the team to deploy and support your user interface applications.

Skills and Qualifications:

6 years of industry experience

At least 2 previous work experience with the title senior engineer or equivalent.

Experience with high scale, distributed, 24x7 systems and application fluency with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript 

1+ years of experience with Vue, React, or similar frameworks experience with GraphQL a plus

Strong analytical and design skills

Capacity for learning quickly in a fast-paced environment and handling multiple tasks simultaneously

Strong written and oral communication skills

Education

BS/MS in Computer Science or Engineering, or equivalent experience

title: Head of Engineering Operations
content: At Navigating Cancer, our mission is to improve the lives of cancer patients and those who care for them. We enable oncology clinics to provide personalized, efficient care to every patient by providing relevant educational materials, giving the whole care team visibility to patient issues and needs, and delivering useful insights so that care teams can identify and resolve gaps in care. Through our platform, patients receive a holistic service offering to support their individual goals and needs.

Our company is backed by industry-leading patient satisfaction ratings and currently supports over a million patients, thousands of care providers, dozens of pharmaceutical manufacturers, and several payer models nationwide to lower costs, improve patient satisfaction, and drive better outcomes.
In order to advance our mission to – “Enable Personalized Care for Every Cancer Patient,” we are seeking the following:

As Head of Engineering Operations, you will lead Interoperability (Engineering), and liaise with our teams in Sales, Product Management, Order Fulfillment, Support and Marketing to implement and manage a streamlined process for handling all engineering aspects of onboarding a new client successfully onto NC’s solution. The primary objectives of the role are to gain an in-depth understanding of our client’s business needs and collaborate to ensure those needs are met throughout the sales, setup, training, go-live, and support hand-off processes.

You will also be responsible for leading SRE (Site Reliability Engineering) to establish robust DevOps and Quality Management practices. You will be responsible for managing all of Navigating Cancers’ applications in productions, ensuring availability and performance, monitoring key infrastructure performance indicators and business services defined under Service Level Agreements (SLAs), Operational Level Agreements (OLAs) and Underpinning Contracts (UCs).

This position acts as a thought leader for measuring our overall production health and drives for a higher level of quality through transparency to the client experience. This position requires commitment to exceptional results, a strong desire for continuous improvement and the ability to build a collaborative culture within the team.
Establish a world-class Interoperability team to integrate Navigating Cancer’s platform Clinical EMR’s, Lab data, 3rd party and partner systems.
Establish interop requirements in partnership with Sales, Product Management, Order Fulfillment, Support, Marketing and Platform Engineering teams.
Oversee the design and development of bi-directional HL7 & FHIR interfaces, API oriented interfaces and/or other interface types between Clinical systems, 3rd parties and NC Platform.
Design standardize and own interoperability Key Performance Indicators and performance dashboards, compliance scorecards and associated processes.
Lead and contribute to processes that create strategic interoperability technology roadmaps.
Establish clear and concise interoperability onboarding processes and procedures, including verification and validation of interfaces
Manage communications across departments to ensure proper use cases, implementation configuration, and software setup are completed to client specifications within the established timeline(s)
Ensure each new client interface timelines are kept on track and manage risk to prevent tasks and projects from “falling through the cracks”.
Work with internal teams to define and document the specific tasks, milestones, and plans for client interfaces implementation. Supervise execution on plans based on urgency and client needs.

Record all client-related engineering communications so we know what the client’s success criteria are, what we did to meet/not meet those criteria, and any lessons learned to make the process better going forward.

Partner with the Order Fulfillment and Support teams as they handle and maintain existing and new client accounts and communicate service objectives/performance measurement standards between clients, associates and various support areas; assist in building new services based on current customer input.
Direct, motivate and lead team to ensure "World Class Service" is provided to external and internal clients, tracking and reporting performance to ensure team accountability and quality of service.
Stay current with industry and regulatory rules and requirements; partner with clients, senior leadership and internal teams to ensure products / solutions are current and in compliance.
Participate and contribute in the development of annual operating budgets for InterOps.
Ensure reliability of internal networks, systems, infrastructure and key software applications
Responsible for reliability of technology infrastructure, integrity of data and integration of systems into business processes
Ensures the security of the company's data/systems by keeping up-to-date on the latest cyber security advancements and finds ways to guard against threats on an organization-wide scale
Keeps abreast of trends in technology as they relate to Interoperability and DevOps and incorporates these trends into strategic direction and decision-making
Oversees IT team and ensures adequacy of technology capabilities across the organization
Provide strategic direction for: workforce design that optimizes individual opportunities and team results, business processes, marketing and executive level communications.
Drive increased Automation, establish robust Quality Management with an objective of reducing Operational risks, eliminating errors, driving increased efficiency and balancing cost of operations.

Partner with Product, Order Fulfillment, Support and Engineering leaders to translate business requirements into planned improvements and monitor effectiveness of systems, policies and procedures, making recommendations to ensure daily operations are efficient.
Be accountable to assess readiness, plan and deploy product releases.
Define non-functional requirements as part of the product life cycle to influence the new designs, standards, and methods for scalable, highly available distributed systems.

Establish clearly defined department and individual goals and objectives. Hire, train, develop and mentor associates; foster professional growth and career development, as well as build bench strength within the team.
Oversees the development of annual operating budgets for SRE (Operations)
Partner with the CTO and Product leadership to be a thought leader in defining and realizing the Infrastructure, DevOps and QMS vision & roadmap.
Establishes the strategic direction for building the business’s cloud and hosting program and optimizing how the business uses cloud solutions both internally and externally.

10 recent (within the past 5 years) years’ experience leading in senior leadership position designing, implementing and operating multi-site, high-availability, data center infrastructures and associated virtualization implementations in an Enterprise class SaaS environment, preferably in the healthcare industry.

7 or more years in IT and business/industry with technical leadership responsibility in managing multiple, large, cross-functional teams or projects and influencing senior-level management and key stakeholders. Extensive experience in managing Cloud infrastructure and operations
Understanding and/or work experience utilizing of HL7V2 and HL7V3, Healthcare integration gateways / solutions.
Experience operating on AWS (both PaaS and IaaS offerings)
Experience in Security triage & forensic analysis
Experience with Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery concepts, including Infrastructure as code, Containerization concepts like Docker, and PaaS services on AWS.
Experience with elastically scalable, fault tolerance and other cloud architecture patterns
Demonstrated strength in SaaS services, experience in massive scale web and data operations
Experience in setting up testing, quality assurance, test automation and or certification or audit programs.
Working knowledge of standards, regulations and other regional or national standards, as necessary.
Demonstrated knowledge and application of project-handling concepts, systems, tools, applications, policies and processes

Ability to compose a variety of complex documents including analyses, policies and proposals. Ability to present information to, respond to controversial inquiries from and negotiate with individuals or groups of internal or external clients, top management, government agencies or other influential groups.

We support thousands of healthcare professionals and tens of thousands of cancer patients every day. We help cancer patients get better care—and consider this a valuable and meaningful reason to come to work everyday. You get to work with leading technology, wear many hats, and contribute every day to our business success! You get to help us grow and establish ourselves as a world-class business. We are lean, agile, and lightweight. We believe in each other, believe in our work, and have fun along the way.
This position is full time, in our downtown Seattle office. We offer competitive compensation, benefits and a fantastic work environment:
- 100% employer paid medical, dental and vision
- Central location equidistant from Pike Market and Pioneer Square
- Company sponsored lunch every Monday and monthly Waffle Wednesdays
Work with Purpose. Work together to improve the lives of cancer patients. Collaborate with team members, have passion, enthusiasm and mission for the work that we do.
Act with Integrity. Communicate openly, be honest, follow through.
Be Agile. Discover creative solutions, welcome change. Adapt and pursue continuous improvement.
Seek Simplicity. Reduce complexity for our customers and patients. Simplify our products, our processes and our messages.
Strive for Growth. Constantly strive to achieve personal, professional, and company goals. Continuous reflection, learning and achievement.

title: Senior Data Engineer, Health Technology
content: Navigating Cancer is the pioneer in patient relationship management software and services for cancer care. The company has developed the first patient-centered oncology platform that improves the care delivery model for patients, providers, pharmaceutical manufacturers, and payers. By putting patients at the center of their care, providers become economically viable in value-based payment models, payers and at-risk providers reduce the total cost of cancer care, and pharmaceutical manufacturers improve medication adherence for their life-saving treatments. Most importantly, patients receive a holistic service offering to support their individual goals and preferences.

The company is backed by industry-leading patient satisfaction ratings and currently supports over a million patients, thousands of care providers, dozens of pharmaceutical manufacturers, and several payer models nationwide to lower costs, improve patient satisfaction, and drive better outcomes.

As our Senior Data Engineer, your primary role is to support key analytic and business intelligence across the company. You will be responsible for developing and implementing data models for multiple data platforms including but not limited to relational databases, big data, etc. Collaborating closely with peers in the Product, Engineering & Data Sciences team, you will also be at the forefront of utilizing data from a variety of sources in and outside of the data warehouse, developing insightful conclusions through descriptive analysis, and effectively communicating findings to colleagues and business partners. There will be a strong focus on supporting the development of standard metrics as well as producing recurring and ad hoc reports. You will be a key part of the company’s script for collecting, analyzing, creating visualizations and storytelling using clinical data. Your work will improve the efficiency of care delivery and have a positive impact on existing Oncology Care Models.
Have a minimum of 5 years experience in Datawarehouse/ETL development

Participate in discussions with business and technical teams about consolidation of business data into data warehouses, data marts, data lakes, and other data structures – on-premise and in the cloud.

Research business domain concepts and common data modeling approaches to problems faced by the organization in the analytics arena, ensure completeness, correctness, and consistency of clinical data and data structure.
Advise on logical data modeling techniques, and transformation methods appropriate to requirements and architecture preferences.
Participate in discussion around emerging solutions on big data platform, storage platforms, physical data organization techniques.

Design and create the data structures needed to support dashboarding, reporting, and data science projects, including dimensional data warehouses, column store databases, OLAP cubes, Microsoft tabular models, Hadoop / distributed file system, and other logical and physical organization techniques.
Leverage various data integration platforms, including AWS, ETL tools, emerging open source options, and other platforms using appropriate ELT / ETL / Message Based design patterns.
Analyze existing data warehouse designs to identify potential enhancements, performance improvements, design improvements.
Have extremely strong skills in at-least one programming and scripting language (Java, Python, Scala, Julia, Stata, Ruby, R).
Have familiarity handling high volume heterogeneous data Clinical Data, electronic health records.
Have demonstrated experience with one or more data analytics and visualization packages.

Work collaboratively with Clinical Programmers, Data Scientists, Biostatisticians and Project Management staff to meet project deliverables and timelines for routine to basic clinical data acquisition, quality checking and reporting.
Prior experience in regulated industries with high Data Quality and Governance standards.
Basic knowledge of the medical terminologies, messaging standards, healthcare coding systems.
Bachelor's degree in Information Systems, MIS, Statistics, related field or equivalent work experience.

We support thousands of healthcare professionals and tens of thousands of cancer patients every day. We help cancer patients get better care—and consider this a valuable and meaningful reason to come to work every day. You get to work with leading technology, wear many hats, and contribute every day to our business success! You get to help us grow and establish ourselves as a world-class business. We are lean, agile, and lightweight. We believe in each other, believe in our work, and have fun along the way.

This position is full time, in our downtown Seattle office. We offer competitive compensation, benefits, and a fantastic work environment. Come join our team and make a difference! (No recruiters, please.)

title: Lead, Clinic Data Analytics
content:
Company Overview

Navigating Cancer is the pioneer in patient relationship management software and services for cancer care. The company has developed the first patient-centered oncology platform that improves the care delivery model for patients, providers, pharmaceutical manufacturers and payers. By putting patients at the center of their care, providers become economically viable in value-based payment models, payers and at-risk providers reduce the total cost of cancer care, and pharmaceutical manufacturers improve medication adherence for their life-saving treatments. Most importantly, patients receive a holistic service offering to support their individual goals and preferences.

The company is backed by industry-leading patient satisfaction ratings and currently supports over a million patients, thousands of care providers, dozens of pharmaceutical manufacturers, and several payer models nationwide to lower costs, improve patient satisfaction, and drive better outcomes.
Job Description

Lead the building of logical data modeling techniques, and transformation methods

appropriate to requirements and architecture preferences.

Design the data structures needed to support dash boarding, reporting, and data

science projects, including dimensional data warehouses, column store databases,

OLAP cubes and other logical and physical organization techniques for a clinical and

pharmaceutical domain

Participate in discussions with business and technical teams about consolidation of

business data into data warehouses, data marts, data lakes and other data structures

Work with Product teams to leverage Patient Reported Outcomes and real time Clinical

data to develop a solution to enable Oncology stakeholders to understand treatment

and prescribing patterns, publish real world evidence for health economics and

outcomes, understand in real time, patient sales effectiveness.

Collaborate with Product and data engineering teams to develop solutions for Oncology

specific precision medicine at scale to classify and segment cohorts of patients. 

Perform deep analysis and inference on real time and real world data to enable

manufacturers to understand treatment and prescribing patterns for market research,

publish real world evidence for health economics and outcomes research, understand

real time patients who are diagnosed for sales force effectiveness, and gain the patient

experience through patient surveys and patient reported outcomes and more. 

Research business domain concepts and common data modeling approaches to

problems faced by the organization in the analytics arena, ensure completeness,

correctness and consistency of clinical data and data structure.

Qualifications

5+ years of proven experience in clinical data analytics

Have familiarity handling high volume heterogeneous data Clinical Data, electronic health records.

Working knowledge of modern large-scale data systems and architectures

Excellent communication and presentation skills, strong problem-solving skills, strong analytical and organizational skills

Ability to work independently or within a group

Prior experience with developing bioinformatics analysis pipelines, Pharmacology and/or clinical related data analysis would be preferred 

PhD, M.S. in Computer Science, Information Science, Health Care administration, Statistics, Data Science

title: Site Reliability Engineer
content: Navigating Cancer is the pioneer in patient relationship management software and services for cancer care. The company has developed
the first patient-centered oncology platform that improves the care delivery model for patients, providers, pharmaceutical manufacturers
and payers. By putting patients at the center of their care, providers become economically viable in value-based payment models, payers

and at-risk providers reduce the total cost of cancer care, and pharmaceutical manufacturers improve medication adherence for their life-saving treatments. Most importantly, patients receive a holistic service offering to support their individual goals and preferences.
The company is backed by industry-leading patient satisfaction ratings and currently supports over a million patients, thousands of care
providers, dozens of pharmaceutical manufacturers, and several payer models nationwide to lower costs, improve patient satisfaction, and
drive better outcomes. Navigating Care platform supports over one million patients and thousands of cancer care providers nationwide to
lower costs, improve patient satisfaction and drive better outcomes.
In this role as a Site Reliability Engineer, you will be an integral member of a dynamic SRE team continuously improving our AWS cloud
deployment platform, “automation first”, in support of our rapid expansion.
 Contribute to team initiatives to continuously refine our AWS deployment practices for improved reliability, repeatability and
security. These high-visibility initiatives will help to increase service levels, lower costs, and deliver features more quickly.
 Write code and scripts to automate provisioning of AWS services and to configure services, using tools and languages including
AWS CLI / API, Terraform, Ansible, Chef, Python, Bash, and Git.
 Troubleshoot issues in production and other environments, applying debugging and problem-solving techniques (e.g., log
analysis, non-invasive tests) , working closely with development and product teams.
 Suggest deployment patterns & practices improvements based on learnings from past deployments and production issues;
collaborate with DevOps team to implement these.
 Promote a DevOps culture, including building relationships with other technical and business teams.
 Work closely with InterOps to deploy and configure the platform to on-board clinics.
 Design effective monitoring / alerting (for conditions such as application-errors, high memory usage) and log aggregation
approaches (to quickly access logs for troubleshooting, or generate reports for trend analysis) to proactively notify business
stakeholders of issues and communicate metrics, working closely with these stakeholders, using tools including AWS
 Work to ensure system and data security is maintained at a high standard, ensuring the confidentiality, integrity and availability
of the Navigating Cancer's applications is not compromised.
 Establish audit and access control for NC’s Infrastructure
 Help refine DevSecOps security practices (including regular security patching, minimum-permissions accounts and policies,
encrypt-everything) in compliance with Health IT, government and other standards regulations, implement, and verify them,
using tools like Sonarqube, VeraCode to analyze and verify compliance.
 Suggest deployment patterns & practices improvements based on learnings from past deployments and production issues;
collaborate with DevOps team to implement these.
 Ability to automate away manual interactions and have a passion for helping enable developers to write code that works
 A strong understanding of Linux administration including Bash scripting
 Networking knowledge including VPCs, SDNs (e.g., Amazon / Azure) / VLANs, routers and firewalls
 Familiarity with at least one IAC / CM tool such as Terraform, Ansible, Chef, or Puppet
 Familiarity with at least one code build / deploy tool such as Jenkins, Circle CI
 Familiarity with DB setup, configuration and monitoring
 A bachelor's degree in science, technology, engineering, or a similar field is required.
 Work in terms of enabling capabilities through a blend of process and technology
 4+ years AWS administration experience / training including provisioning EC2 instances, VPCs, Elastic Beanstalk, Lambda
functions, RDS Aurora Server/serverless databases, S3 storage, IAM security, ECS containers, Cloudwatch metrics & logs
 3+ years of experience developing and / or deploying serverless functions using AWS Lambda, Azure Functions, or Google
 Experience in automating provisioning of Infrastructure to enable complete application ecosystem on demand
 Hands on Experience with SQL; Knowledge in using RDS-PostgreSQL or other DBMS
 Experience with monitoring / alerting tools such as New Relic, Grafana, Prometheus, Sysdig
 Experience with log aggregation tools such as Datadog, ELK, Splunk, Dynatrcace
 Experience in at least one programming language such as Ruby, Java, Scala, JavaScript / Node.js, Python, Go, C#, or C/C++
 Experience in setting up framework for Service canary and Blue-green deployments
 Preferred experience in setting up and managing components in AWS Data stack framework

title: Quantitative Scientist, Clinical Oncology - EMR Curation
content: At Navigating Cancer, our mission is to improve the lives of cancer patients and those who care for them. We enable oncology clinics to provide personalized, efficient care to every patient by providing relevant educational materials, giving the whole care team visibility to patient issues and needs, and delivering useful insights so that care teams can identify and resolve gaps in care. Through our platform, patients receive a holistic service offering to support their individual goals and needs.

Our company is backed by industry-leading patient satisfaction ratings and currently supports over a million patients, thousands of care providers, dozens of pharmaceutical manufacturers, and several payer models nationwide to lower costs, improve patient satisfaction, and drive better outcomes.
In order to advance our mission to – “Enable Personalized Care for Every Cancer Patient,” we are seeking a
Quantitative Scientist, Clinical Oncology - EMR Curation

This position will be responsible for being the oncology clinical expert. As we build out a data platform, this role with be responsible to working with the data technology team and constructing and maintaining curation models for EMR (electronic medical record) clinical data to build clinical endpoints in the Navigating Cancer data set. Additionally, this role will be instrumental in helping to provide clinical support in building products and tools using the Navigating Cancer data set that includes both clinical electronic medical records data and patient reported outcomes data, including conducting independent secondary epidemiological research and analysis. This position will interface with the technical data team and will be the primary lead for the emerging clinical team.
Develop quantitative epidemiological models and curation models to develop clinical endpoints from EMR data
Create models for converting unstructured data to structured data
Extract relevant information from large patient Navigating Cancer databases and potentially other databases as needed for projects
Work with the data science team and ensure the models built are extended through data science and clinical team
Assist clients in understanding the patient population data sets and curation models used to derive clinical endpoints and presenting the results of the epidemiological analysis
Prepare detailed reports explaining the methodology for deriving patient endpoints
Provide ongoing input on business opportunities with our data and work with product teams and technical teams to build products
Assist in business development activities and help Navigating Cancer pursue additional epidemiology related engagement work
Manage multiple engagements, balancing internal and external client expectations, workload and timelines
Ensure appropriate communication on project related matters within the internal project team
Prepare reports of findings, illustrating data graphically and translating complex findings into written text
Advanced degree in Epidemiology (MPH or PhD)
4+ years relevant experience in epidemiology and / or pharmaceutical industry
Experience with EMR data and building out clinical endpoints in oncology
Knowledge of current oncology epidemiology and treatment practices
Experience with quantitative epidemiological and scientific analysis.

title: Site Reliability Engineer - II
content:
Company Overview

Navigating Cancer is the pioneer in patient relationship management software and services for cancer care. The company has developed the first patient-centered oncology platform that improves the care delivery model for patients, providers, pharmaceutical manufacturers and payers. By putting patients at the center of their care, providers become economically viable in value-based payment models, payers and at-risk providers reduce the total cost of cancer care, and pharmaceutical manufacturers improve medication adherence for their life-saving treatments. Most importantly, patients receive a holistic service offering to support their individual goals and preferences.

The company is backed by industry-leading patient satisfaction ratings and currently supports over a million patients, thousands of care providers, dozens of pharmaceutical manufacturers, and several payer models nationwide to lower costs, improve patient satisfaction, and drive better outcomes.

 The Opportunity:

In this role as a Site Reliability Engineer, you will be an integral member of a dynamic SRE team continuously improving our AWS cloud deployment platform, “automation first”, in support of our rapid expansion. 


Responsibilities:

Lead team initiatives to continuously refine our AWS deployment practices for improved reliability, repeatability and security. These high-visibility initiatives will help to increase service levels, lower costs, and deliver features more quickly.

Design effective monitoring / alerting (for conditions such as application-errors, high memory usage) and log aggregation approaches (to quickly access logs for troubleshooting, or generate reports for trend analysis) to proactively notify business stakeholders of issues and communicate metrics, working closely with these stakeholders, using tools including AWS CloudWatch, Datadog, ClearData etc.

Write code and scripts to automate provisioning of AWS services and to configure services, using tools and languages including AWS CLI / API, Terraform, Ansible, Chef, Python, Bash, and Git.

Troubleshoot issues in production and other environments, applying debugging and problem-solving techniques (e.g., log analysis, non-invasive tests) , working closely with development and product teams.

Suggest deployment patterns & practices improvements based on learnings from past deployments and production issues; collaborate with DevOps team to implement these.

Promote a DevOps culture, including building relationships with other technical and business teams.

Work closely with InterOps to deploy and configure the platform to on-board clinics.

Work to ensure system and data security is maintained at a high standard, ensuring the confidentiality, integrity and availability of the Navigating Cancer's applications is not compromised. 


Qualifications:

Ability to automate away manual interactions and have a passion for helping enable developers to write code that works

A strong understanding of Linux administration including Bash scripting

Networking expertise including VPCs, SDNs (e.g., Amazon / Azure) / VLANs, routers and firewalls

Familiarity with at least one IAC / CM tool such as Terraform, Ansible, Chef, or Puppet

Familiarity with at least one code build / deploy tool such as Jenkins, Circle CI

Familiarity with DB setup, configuration and monitoring

A bachelor's degree in science, technology, engineering, or a similar field is required.

Work in terms of enabling capabilities through a blend of process and technology


Experience Required:

 4+ years AWS administration experience / training including provisioning EC2 instances, VPCs, Elastic Beanstalk, Lambda functions, RDS Aurora Server/serverless databases, S3 storage, IAM security, ECS containers, Cloudwatch metrics & logs

3+ years of experience developing and / or deploying serverless functions using AWS Lambda, Azure Functions, or Google Cloud Functions

Experience in automating provisioning of Infra to enable complete application ecosystem on demand 

Hands on Experience with SQL; Knowledge in using RDS-PostgreSQL or other DBMS

Experience with monitoring / alerting tools such as New Relic, Grafana, Prometheus, Sysdig

Experience with log aggregation tools such as Datadog, ELK, Splunk, Dynatrcace

Experience in at least one programming language such as Ruby, Java, Scala, JavaScript / Node.js, Python, Go, C#, or C/C++


Why work here? 

We support thousands of healthcare professionals and tens of thousands of cancer patients every day. We help cancer patients get better care—and consider this a valuable and meaningful reason to come to work everyday. You get to work with leading technology, wear many hats, and contribute every day to our business success! You get to help us grow and establish ourselves as a world-class business. We are lean, agile, and lightweight. We believe in each other, believe in our work, and have fun along the way.

This position is full time, in our downtown Seattle office. We offer competitive compensation, benefits and a fantastic work environment. Come join our team and make a difference!
Our Values: 

Work with Purpose. Work together to improve the lives of cancer patients. Collaborate with team members, have passion, enthusiasm and mission for the work that we do.

Act with Integrity. Communicate openly, be honest, follow through.

Be Agile. Discover creative solutions, welcome change. Adapt and pursue continuous improvement.

Seek Simplicity. Reduce complexity for our customers and patients. Simplify our products, our processes and our messages.

title: Senior Healthcare Data Analyst-Data Quality and Validation
content: At Navigating Cancer, our mission is to improve the lives of cancer patients and those who care for them. Our company is backed by industry-leading patient satisfaction ratings and currently supports over a million patients, thousands of care providers, dozens of pharmaceutical manufacturers, and several payer models nationwide to lower costs, improve patient satisfaction, and drive better outcomes.

He or she will possess a work style that promotes progress through collaborative teamwork in a

dynamic environment. The candidate must be enthusiastically committed to delivering world-class analytics solutions, the highest levels of customer service, be committed to continual process, product and performance improvements, be able to communicate with confidence, clarity, and honesty, take initiative and assume ownership of a wide variety of systems, processes & deliverables.

● Works with the Business Analyst, Data Scientists, Project Manager and Functional Owner to interpret the test needs as requirements are being developed in order to ensure the standard of testing supports the business

● Determines the types of testing that must be conducted (i.e. data validation, regression, etc.) and creates a comprehensive Test Plan that supports the business and technological solutions being delivered.
● Creates Test Cases, Test Scenarios and Scripts in support of business functional requirements and in a reusable state.
● Works with the Business Analysts, Data Scientists, Developer and Project Manager to resolve defects identified during the testing cycle.
● Responsible for capturing and documenting metrics in support of the user acceptance testing and recommends improvements.
● Develop Data Quality dashboards and reports to visualize key insights, trends and monitor the performance of key metrics
● Maintaining manual and automated test scripts and recommending modification as needed
● Execute data profiling and provide interpretation for various data sets.
● Work with various stakeholders like product and engineering to ensure applications are instrumented with proper tracking mechanisms to enable analytics.
● Actively question and challenge customers to understand their requirements and
reach the best solutions, near term and long term.
● Successfully implementing process improvements impacting their own work and work of others.
● 3+ years of proven experience in data analytics, Data Quality and Validation
● M.S. in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Information Science, Health Care administration, Statistics, Data Science or related area
● Strong analytical, quantitative, statistics, and math skills preferred
● Excellent knowledge of data warehouse, ETL and statistical methods
● Expertise in SQL is a must
● Hands on experience in Tableau, Python, R etc
● Strong domain expertise in health care
● A positive attitude and enthusiasm to get things done goes a long way
● Adept at juggling multiple priorities and exploring innovative solutions to
● Creative thinking, an eye for detail, the ability to work independently, and a
positive attitude are important prerequisites for this job.

title: Interview Engineering Recruiter
content: Interviewing is a universal experience, but it is no one’s job

Interviews are the gateway between people and jobs--they are a critical connection point. And yet, while the interview is a universal experience, it has never been recognized as its own discipline. In fact, the
vast majority of people conducting interviews receive no formal training in how to do so
Karat is the market leader in Interview Engineering
At Karat, our mission is to make every interview predictive, fair, and enjoyable. To do so, we created and established the category of Interview Engineering.

Karat conducts technical interviews on behalf of organizations hiring software engineers. We do this through a community of Interview Engineers who are equipped with Karat's interviewing infrastructure, battle-tested questions, and data-informed best practices. The result is highly predictive and fair interviews at scale that candidates truly enjoy. Karat has amassed the largest, most robust dataset of structured-interview intelligence to produce never-before-seen hiring analytics.
Founded in 2014, Karat is a privately held and
based in Seattle. Key clients include Pinterest, PayPal, Citrix, Intuit, and InVision.

As our Interview Engineer Recruiter you’ll work alongside the Interview Engineer Recruiting Manager and Interviewer Engineer Team to build our global Interview Engineering community. As we enter a pivotal year of growth you’ll be a strategic partner in helping build and refine how we identify, engage and hire this critical part of Karat’s solution.
Track and manage postings that drive direct applicant pipeline
Own strategic social outreach efforts within Interview Engineer community
Oversee application to onboarding operations for IVE candidates
Manage an ongoing pipeline of talent for future hiring needs
2+ years of technical recruiting experience or recruiting coordination supporting technical candidates
Experience with high volume recruiting or coordination experience
Comfortable generating candidate messaging ie: reach outs, pass emails and giving feedback
Experience with applicant tracking systems - bonus if you’ve used Greenhouse
Comfortable with G-Suite and remote collaboration tools like google hangouts, slack and zoom

In keeping with our beliefs and goals, no employee or applicant will face discrimination or harassment based on: race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, age, gender, marital/domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability status, or veteran status. Above and beyond discrimination and harassment based on “protected categories,” we also strive to prevent other subtler forms of inappropriate behavior (i.e., stereotyping) from ever gaining a foothold in our office. Whether blatant or hidden, barriers to success have no place at Karat.
We value a diverse workforce: people of color, womxn, and LGBTQIA+ individuals are strongly encouraged to apply.
With thanks to the Level Playing Field Institute for this statement of non-discrimination.

Karat has amassed the largest, most robust dataset of structured-interview intelligence to produce never-before-seen hiring analytics.
Founded in 2014, Karat is a privately held and
based in Seattle. Key clients include Pinterest, PayPal, Citrix, Intuit, and InVision.

We've all been through technical interviews (one side or the other). You believe in our mission and crave the ownership and responsibility we will give you.

title: Interview Engineer
content: Interviewing is a universal experience, but it is no one’s job

Interviews are the gateway between people and jobs--they are a critical connection point. And yet, while the interview is a universal experience, it has never been recognized as its own discipline. In fact, the
vast majority of people conducting interviews receive no formal training in how to do so
Karat is the market leader in Interview Engineering
At Karat, our mission is to make every interview predictive, fair, and enjoyable. To do so, we created and established the category of Interview Engineering.
Founded in 2014, Karat is a privately held and
based in Seattle. Key clients include Pinterest, PayPal, Citrix, Intuit, and InVision.

Karat Interview Engineers are a community of experienced software developers who are equipped with best practices and technology needed to provide the most predictive, fair, and enjoyable interviews to software engineering job candidates. Interview Engineers include software development managers, software engineers, and freelancers covering the full technology stack. As an Interview Engineer, you will interview job candidates using the Karat approach and interviewing infrastructure in a wide variety of roles on behalf of leading companies worldwide.
Flexible, high impact work that is compensated at highly competitive rates.

As an Interview Engineer, you will be compensated at highly competitive rates for your interviewing expertise. The time commitment is flexible---many of our interviews happen on nights and weekends. Some experts do 10 interviews/week while others do over 25 interviews/week. You can work from anywhere, anytime. You will sharpen your interviewing skills and transform the interviewing experience for every candidate and company.
Experienced software engineers who believe that interviewing is a first-class job

Interviewing experience focused on evaluating fundamental computer science skills (i.e. data structures, algorithms etc.), software craftsmanship (i.e. understanding of unit testing, source control, APIs etc.), and/or specific technologies (i.e. iOS, distributed systems etc.)
Strong oral and written communication skills
Able to empathize with candidates and provide actionable feedback
A genuine desire to continuously improve the Karat service and technical interviewing

title: Data Analyst
content:
Who is Karat?


Interviewing is the gateway to building careers and teams. Yet, it’s no one’s job to do it with fairness and professionalism -- so we made it our job.

Karat conducts first-round technical interviews on behalf of companies like Indeed, Intuit, Pinterest, and Citrix. Our network of experienced Interview Engineers have conducted tens of thousands of technical interviews with software engineering candidates. Clients increase capacity to interview and unlock engineering productivity, all while providing exceptional candidate experiences.


Our Mission

Our mission is to be the world’s interviewer. We conduct highly predictive interviews for our clients with rigor, humanity and fairness. Karat helps companies hire the engineers they need to create the future and helps ensure that engineers are in jobs that maximize their strengths.

Data and Engineering at Karat

As a Data Analyst, you will support a wide variety of business stakeholders within Karat to help drive decision-making and improvements to our product. As a key member of our engineering team, you will advance your skills rapidly through mentorship and a wide array of tasks.

Core Responsibilities

As a principal member of this team, you will help create repeatable, sustainable tools for giving teams the data they need and making the most important data visible throughout our company.

You will work with individual users to help create SQL queries and dashboards that are critical to our day-to-day business intelligence.

You will help optimize and improve the processes by which we review and analyze our data.

As you grow in this role, you will help us improve our data quality, ingest new data at scale, and drive improvements in our user experience and business decisions.

You will proactively deliver insights that will help make all of our teams more focused and productive.

About you

You can compose complex SQL queries in response to user needs.

You are comfortable working with both technical and non-technical users to understand data requirements.

You are comfortable explaining nuances of data to non-data-oriented teammates.

You want to learn and understand our business in order to better understand teams' actual data needs and draw meaningful, predictive conclusions.

You have a desire to learn and improve your craftsmanship, and you always go the extra mile to provide happiness to your customers.

You are comfortable with mathematical and statistical concepts such as confidence intervals, probability distributions and statistical significance.

You have s
trong skills at prioritization and triaging incoming requests by importance.

You have a Bachelor's degree (or equivalent experience) in a relevant field, such as computer science, mathematics, statistics, information management, or business administration

Some experience writing code in a dynamic language like Python or Ruby helps you read and understand data models that feed into the database.

Bonus Experience

Interviewing, teaching, or mentoring experience is a plus to help you relate to our mission and culture!

2+ years of experience using SQL, R, or similar tools.

2+ years operating in a data role or data-driven business role.

Specific experience with PostgreSQL or Metabase is a plus.


Statement of Non-Discrimination:
In keeping with our beliefs and goals, no employee or applicant will face discrimination or harassment based on: race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, age, gender, marital/domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability status, or veteran status. Above and beyond discrimination and harassment based on “protected categories,” we also strive to prevent other subtler forms of inappropriate behavior (i.e., stereotyping) from ever gaining a foothold in our office. Whether blatant or hidden, barriers to success have no place at Karat.

We value a diverse workforce: people of color are strongly encouraged to apply.

title: Full Stack Software Engineer
content: What are we up to at Tango Card:

Tango Card helps thousands of companies reach their goals by making rewards and incentives easy and awesome! Our customers genuinely love working with us and it shows. We are among the top 10% of Inc’s 5000 fastest growing companies; and are backed by a stellar group of investors including private equity firm FTV, Fyrfly Venture Partners, Floodgate Capital, Eric Schmidt’s Innovation Endeavors, SWaN & Legend partners, and WTI.

We have 2500+ live enterprise customers today, including some of the World’s most recognizable businesses like Twitter, Google, Extole, Microsoft, Salesforce and F5. We also work with the top Gift Card brands, such as Amazon, Starbucks, Target, Walmart, Home Depot and over 300 more in 30+ countries.
Tango Card is proud to have been rated one of the best companies to work for by
. We are on an incredible path to be the #1 rewards provider, and to get there we need amazing people (like you) in support, sales, engineering, operations, and finance to realize this vision.

We foster a culture of autonomy, collaboration, and transparency with flexible working hours and slim org structures. We provide our team members with what they need to be successful, whether this is the latest technologies and tools or going to conferences to learn about industry trends. Our offices are designed for collaboration and comfort with standing desks, comfortable pod-chairs, and a very dog-friendly environment. Every TangoCardian has the chance to create, own, and grow their role. With a company like Tango Card that is experiencing high growth year over year, career growth opportunities are everywhere.
Reward yourself and join the Tango Card team.

The Full Stack Software Engineer at Tango Card plays a critical role in our mission to make rewards easy to send and awesome to receive! You will work with our growing Engineering team on projects that impact thousands of businesses and reward recipients every day, all while using the newest technologies to solve real-world problems. Far from your typical Engineering role, you will have the chance to work with all aspects of our business.
As a Full Stack Software Engineer at Tango Card, you will:
Rapidly build innovative software products and applications
Be a team player by working on both front-end and back-end engineering projects
Ensure our enterprise-level products and applications are stable, secure, and scalable
Have fun while multi-tasking in a small startup environment
Work effectively both independently and as part of a team
Our ideal Full Stack Software Engineer will have the following skills and experience:
A passion for coding evident in excellent coding skills
3+ years experience of shipping high quality web-based software
Familiarity with Vue, Angular, or similar frontend frameworks
Familiarity with cross-browser XHTML, CSS, JavaScript best practices
Experience with server-side technologies including Java, Spring, Spring Boot or similar
Familiarity with Agile project management methodologies and practices in a software development environment
Understanding of cloud-based software development environments (AWS, Azure, etc.)
NoSQL and Big Data distributed processing (e.g., Hadoop) a plus
Competitive pay (money isn’t everything, but it helps)
Medical, Dental and Vision benefits (100% employer paid premium)
Unlimited PTO and a generous holiday schedule
Transportation stipend to make the Seattle commute just a bit easier
Dog-Friendly office located in the heart of West Seattle.
Culture that fosters autonomy, creativity, inclusion, transparency, and ownership
Tango Card is proud to be an equal opportunity employer; we are strong because we are diverse.

title: Software Development Engineer II, Marketing Platform
content:
At Remitly, we help immigrants around the world send over $6 billion a year to their loved ones. Sending money is faster, easier, and costs less with our all-digital money transfer platform. Our vision is to transform the lives of immigrants and their families by providing the most trusted financial service products on the planet. At Remitly, your work has a direct and positive impact on people around the globe. Your work matters, every day.

On the Marketing Platform team you’ll be focusing on building great customer experiences that help them discover, consider and adopt Remitly while improving and expanding our acquisition and retention efforts. Our team owns building the systems that enable marketers to execute sophisticated campaigns, develops product marketing systems, integrates with third party advertising systems and provides marketing performance insights to drive business growth. Our marketing platform will enable the marketing team to do this at high quality, reliably and efficiently across thousands of markets worldwide.

What kind of things will you work on?

Work on improving our content management system (Node.js, React) to make it more powerful, scalable and easy to use for non technical people.

Improve website platform performance and create personalized customer experiences by leveraging your front end development skills.

Build backend services that help power business needs like running complex promotions and perform analytics on large data sets.

Collaborate directly with your customers (marketing team) within Remitly to design and develop products and features that help our customer acquisition efforts.

What we need from you?

A BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent professional experience.

3+ years of experience as a software developer

Expertise in one or more general purpose programming languages like JavaScript, TypeScript, Java, Kotlin, Ruby or Scala.

Experience working in a cross functional group and ability to collaborate and improve the team’s processes

A growth mindset and willingness to receive coaching and mentorship 

Who we are:

Remitly is an independent digital remittance company that transfers over $6 billion in annualized volume through its proprietary global money transfer network across Africa, Asia, Central, and South America. Its reliable and easy-to-use mobile app makes the process of sending money faster, easier, more transparent and less costly by eliminating the forms, codes, agents, extra time and fees typical of the traditional, century-old money transfer process. Remitly is backed by industry-leading investors, World Bank's International Finance Corporation (IFC), Naspers' PayU, Silicon Valley Bank, Stripes Group, DFJ, DN Capital, QED Investors, Trilogy Equity Partners, Bezos Expeditions, Founders' Co-Op, and TomorrowVentures. The company is headquartered in Seattle, with additional offices in London, the Philippines, and Nicaragua. For more information, visit remitly.com.

Remitly is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
 Individuals seeking employment at Remitly are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or sexual orientation.

Remitly is an eVerify Employer.

title: Software Development Manager Global Product, Client Platform
content:

The Client Platform team builds and maintains a scalable, robust platform that empowers and accelerates application development across Remitly. We own a shared React and React Native codebase that’s shipped on both web and native, along with the native Android and iOS architectures that host it. We implement the native-specific features necessary to deliver great product experiences. This platform multiplies the efficiency of our other frontend product teams, enabling features written once to run in all three environments. We’re also responsible for the build, test, and release pipeline of our native applications.

As a Software Development Manager, you’ll hire and develop the engineers on the team with a focus on mentorship and career growth, set and drive a technical roadmap, and define and improve the engineering processes used by the team. You’ll ensure we make sound technical decisions and suitable trade-offs between delivering projects and long-term investments. You should enjoy learning and working with different technologies spanning application environments. You’ll partner closely with product managers, designers, and senior management dedicated to driving our business and customer experience forward. You'll also collaborate with engineering leaders across Remitly to ensure our roadmap anticipates future needs.

Key Responsibilities

You’ll set and drive the team's technical direction, making appropriate trade-offs between shipping code and technical investments.

You’ll build frameworks and processes enabling the team to operate autonomously and deliver new projects rapidly, with a focus on quality and customer value.

You’ll anticipate technical challenges within the team and Remitly and will drive architectural changes to address them.

You’ll drive design discussions and work hands on with the code, diving in where and as necessary to help deliver new features or debug live issues.

You'll help define Remitly’s core native and web application architecture, acting as a central point of contact for other developers working on product features.

You’ll lead the team to build tools and infrastructure allowing teams to independently deliver client features.

You’ll engage team members and other engineering leaders in design reviews to promote collaboration and shared patterns across the organization. 

You’ll partner with product and engineering management, influencing the product roadmap by presenting technical options and trade-offs.

You’ll foster a positive, challenging, and rewarding environment.

You’ll help define and meet the hiring plan for the team, sourcing and interviewing diverse candidates.

You’ll manage and mentor engineers, helping them grow and advance their careers.

Qualifications

A BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent professional experience.

7+ years of experience as a software developer.

2+ years of experience leading teams.

Experience defining and driving technical designs and processes across a team.

Experience building and shipping client applications, notably Android, iOS, or React.

A proven track record of shipping features and products to customers.

Expertise in one or more general purpose programming languages like TypeScript, Kotlin, Swift, JavaScript, Java, or Objective-C.

Strong ability to develop, mentor, and influence other engineers.

Exceptional verbal and written communication skills.

Who we are

Remitly is an independent digital remittance company that transfers over $6 billion in annualized volume through its proprietary global money transfer network across Africa, Asia, Central, and South America. Its reliable and easy-to-use mobile app makes the process of sending money faster, easier, more transparent and less costly by eliminating the forms, codes, agents, extra time and fees typical of the traditional, century-old money transfer process. Remitly is backed by industry-leading investors, World Bank's International Finance Corporation (IFC), Naspers' PayU, Silicon Valley Bank, Stripes Group, DFJ, DN Capital, QED Investors, Trilogy Equity Partners, Bezos Expeditions, Founders' Co-Op, and TomorrowVentures. The company is headquartered in Seattle, with additional offices in London, the Philippines, and Nicaragua. For more information, visit remitly.com.

Does leading a global team of software engineers directly responsible for customer and revenue growth of a fast growing company excite you? Would you like to be a technical thought leader and grow a team of passionate engineers? You can help us build experiences customers love, hire and develop a growing engineering team and set the foundation for a global engineering organization with engineers in North America and Europe.

On the Store Experience team, you’ll lead a team of engineers focused on executing a rapid test and learn agenda with the goal of improving our customer on-boarding experience resulting in an improvement in our customer acquisition and retention. You’ll be partnering with a passionate cross-functional team of marketers, analysts, UX designers, and product managers dedicated to understanding our customers’ needs and tailoring the customer experience. You will own the technical direction and execution of order path experience that needs to be optimized and customized for over thousands of remittance corridors. As part of this unique team, you will make a meaningful impact every day on both our customers and our business.

As an Engineering Manager at Remitly, you are a builder and a leader, responsible for taking on complex technical and customer problems and creating great products backed by great systems. We use cutting-edge languages, tools, and frameworks to build applications and services on top of a scalable cloud architecture. Our startup work environment is fast-paced, mission-driven, and growing quickly.

A successful Engineering Manager will use their experience and vision to hire and develop a diverse engineering team, coaching the team members to grow in their careers and have an impact on our customers. Examples of high impact results from this leadership will be simple and well-defined plans for both (a) our marketing platform architecture and (b) how we execute towards that vision.

The Engineering Manager will be responsible for all aspects of software development for a broad set of services improve existing systems, and reduce technical debt. They will demonstrate a high level of partnership with Product Management, Senior Engineering Management, and other company stakeholders.

Qualifications

A degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field or equivalent experience

6+ years of engineering experience with at least 3 years leading teams

Experience defining and influencing technical designs and processes across a team spanning multiple disciples

A deep understanding of software development practices, system design, software design patterns, and algorithms

Expertise in one or more general-purpose languages like Java, JavaScript, Go, PHP, Python, or Ruby

Strong ability to mentor and influence other engineers

Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Experience leading remote teams is a plus

Who We Are

Remitly is an independent digital remittance company that transfers over $6 billion in annualized volume through its proprietary global money transfer network across Africa, Asia, Central, and South America. Its reliable and easy-to-use mobile app makes the process of sending money faster, easier, more transparent and less costly by eliminating the forms, codes, agents, extra time and fees typical of the traditional, century-old money transfer process. Remitly is backed by industry-leading investors, World Bank's International Finance Corporation (IFC), Naspers' PayU, Silicon Valley Bank, Stripes Group, DFJ, DN Capital, QED Investors, Trilogy Equity Partners, Bezos Expeditions, Founders' Co-Op, and TomorrowVentures. title: Software Development Engineer, Destination Experience
content: At Remitly, we help immigrant communities around the world send over $6 billion a year to their loved ones. Sending money is faster, easier, and costs less with our all-digital money transfer platform. Our vision is to transform the lives of immigrants and their families by providing the most trusted financial service products on the planet. At Remitly, your work has a direct and positive impact on people around the globe. Your work matters, every day.

at Remitly, you are a builder, responsible for taking on complex technical and customer problems and creating great products backed by great systems. We use cutting edge languages, tools, and frameworks to build applications and services on top of a scalable cloud architecture. Our startup work environment is fast-paced, mission-driven, and growing quickly.

The Destination Experience (DEX) team is responsible for the core of Remitly’s product; a platform transferring funds in a reliable, consistent and timely manner ensuring our customers always have a great experience – from the time they send, to the time their remittance is received. The DEX team is a fundamental driver of Remitly's ability to reach international customers and provide a diverse set of disbursement methods such as bank deposit, cash pickup, mobile wallets, and home delivery. The mission of this team is to create reliable, defensible, global disbursement networks and delight our customers with personal destination experiences to support international remittance expansion. From the quality of integrations to the customer facing personal experiences we build, the DEX team directly impacts the Remitly experience.
What will your experience on the team be like?
Our team is tasked with building the next generation platform that is at the heart of Remitly, used for all money transfers.
We run on modern technology stacks, relying on AWS offerings, automated testing, monitoring, and mature deployment infrastructure.
We aim for quality software as a starting point and believe that work-life balance is required to make this happen.
Some examples of current interesting problems include:
Building APIs, services, mobile, and web applications for our next-generation customer experience.
Designing a robust system to provide timely and cost-effective customer support across a variety of modern communication channels.
Building a scalable platform for integrating with diverse bank APIs around the globe to collect, manage, track, and disburse funds.
Integrating online machine learning and predictive analytics models with our transactional systems to predict customer demand and prevent fraud.
Some examples of things you’ll work on:
Contribute to company expansion by laying the foundations for a next generation platform to enable payments across the globe
Make customers transfers fast and reliable by evolving the distributed software architecture that is at the heart of Remitly
Helping to build an intelligent rules engine to ensure transfers are routed optimally every time over the best available banking partner
Building a scalable, maintainable, and reliable platform for integrating with diverse bank APIs around the globe to collect, manage, track, and disburse funds
What do we need from you?
3+ continuous years of experience as a software developer.
Understanding of software development practices, system design, software design patterns, and algorithms
Experience with Amazon Web Services and related cloud technologies a plus
Experience with distributed systems or microservices architecture in production a plus.
Experience defining and influencing technical designs and processes across a team.
A deep understanding of software development practices, system design, software design patterns, and algorithms.
Expertise in one or more general purpose languages like Java, JavaScript, Go, PHP, Python, or Ruby.
An understanding of database fundamentals and expertise in working with one or more databases. Preferable experience in SQL, NoSQL, and related technologies.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Remitly is a group of passionate people working to make international payments easier and more transparent on both the web and mobile devices. We are seeking team members to join us that want to make a difference and change an industry. We pride ourselves on aiming high and delivering results, data being at the heart of everything we do, and encouraging our team to own business decisions and outcomes. Does this sound like the place for you? Join us!

Remitly is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Individuals seeking employment at Remitly are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or sexual orientation.

content:
At Remitly, we help immigrant communities around the world send over $6 billion a year to their loved ones. We’re looking for an experienced software engineer to help us build the next generation of our fraud prevention systems. In this role, you’ll work on high impact initiatives across a variety of technologies with a focus on scalability and customer experience.

What will your experience on the team be like?

You’ll be part of an early-stage team of experienced developers

We run on modern technology stacks, relying on AWS offerings, automated testing, monitoring, and mature deployment infrastructure

Our team is resourced and focused on identifying and building new systems from the ground up to address fraud risk, which is a core part of Remitly’s strategy

We aim for quality software as a starting point and believe that work-life balance is required to make this happen

Build and adapt network analysis systems to find bad actors with related accounts

Machine-learning infrastructure used to train and deploy models

Specialized data stores for low latency feature generation

Building high availability event pipelines for real-time fraud analysis

Investigation tools used by our global workforce to review transactions

A degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field or equivalent experience

5+ years of engineering experience

Strong desire to develop your skills in software development best practices, system design, software design patterns, algorithms and building great customer experiences.

title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
content: At Remitly, we help immigrant communities around the world send over $6 billion a year to their loved ones. Sending money is faster, easier, and costs less with our all-digital money transfer platform. Our vision is to transform the lives of immigrants and their families by providing the most trusted financial service products on the planet. At Remitly, your work has a direct and positive impact on people around the globe. Your work matters, every day.

We are looking for an exceptional Machine Learning Engineer to join our global ML team to work on data products that underpin our business. Our ML team currently builds systems that set our FX rates for customers, detect bad actors using our product, and forecast volume to inform our currency trading strategy. This role will focus on the Pricing space where you will develop models that are used to price tens of millions of dollars worth of volume in real time every day.
Build production systems that set FX rates for customers in real time.

Be a subject matter expert in Pricing and Treasury, and a thought leader with respect to pricing choices throughout Remitly. In this capacity you will partner with Economists, Analysts, and Engineers to build the strategies and products that power our pricing engine.
Provide insightful statistical and econometric analysis that extracts value from complex datasets and achieves targeted outcomes.

Have a significant impact on Remitly’s bottom line. Your work will impact our customer facing product and dictate the exchange rates customers receive on transactions every day. As an exceptional business thinker, you will also provide analytical expertise and judgement to other teams including Treasury and Marketing.

Your models will be directly impacting the economics of everyday life for immigrants and their families. As a senior team member in this space, this role requires a high degree of empathy and commitment to our customers to ensure model outputs align with our cultural values.
All models start and end with a business problem. You enjoy seeing and measuring the results of your work and are excited to build products with a large impact to the company.
We approach many problems from a microeconomic perspective. You enjoy finding the simplest form for a problem and aligning your underlying models with business intuition and economic theory.

You continually exhibit high energy and an ability to stay positive under pressure. We should be a self-starter, able to work independently, as well as work in a team-oriented and fast paced environment.

You ask why, and you question every assumption. If you've ever said "oh, I just did it that way because [Important Person] said so," you won't do well here. We need you to probe assumptions, question the status quo, and follow up on unexpected data results.
Confident in your data and ideas.

You can explain the method to your analysis and validate your results. Once the data supports your ideas, you're willing to advocate your recommendations to any stakeholder that needs to buy-in (fortunately for you, we're happy to rally behind your great idea).
An MS or PhD in Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, Applied Mathematics or a related area
6+ years of work experience building production ready systems, with at least 4+ years applying statistics and machine learning that resulted in data-driven business impact.
Solid knowledge of both the theory and application of ML algorithms.

Proficiency with systems design and data processing. Candidates should have hands on experience with Python, ML libraries (e.g., scikit-learn, scipy, numpy, matplotlib, pandas etc), and SQL. Experience with AWS, Scala, Spark, and Hadoop are also sought but not necessary.

Strong knowledge of professional software engineering practices and best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.
Ability to present complex concepts in a clear narrative that influences stakeholders to take action.
You are curious, love to continuously improve and exhibit the aptitude to learn quickly.
