If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and growth, recognizes your unique contribution, fills you with purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment - apply now!

The Challenge

A
s a resource planning & optimization senior analyst, you will oversee capacity across all internal and partner services resources. You partner with senior leadership across the globe to create robust capacity plans and forecast models. You will be empowered to ensure we have adequate capacity to begin work on customer engagements without delay. You will make recommendations on how to optimize our resource planning, including how we route engagements and when to hire more consultants or decrease demand as appropriate. You will also be entrusted to ensure the handoff motion from sales to services is continually improving and that the appropriate resources are staffed for each engagement.

Responsibilities

Partner with senior leadership across the globe to help manage their team’s capacity, monitor the pipeline of incoming customer work, and ensure we have adequate resources to begin engagements without delay. 

Ensure the handoff motion from sales to services is continually improving and that appropriate resources are staffed for each engagement. 

Develop and maintain a robust analytical model that forecasts our services capacity across service lines and across the globe

Identify strategic recommendations on how to optimize our resource planning, including how we route engagements and when to hire more consultants or decrease demand as appropriate. 

Collaborate with business leaders to execute on your ideas and initiatives, taking your recommendations through to real customer impact


The resource planning & optimization role oversees our services capacity across all internal and partner resources. This is a high-profile, analytical, and operational role that is central to scaling our growth. In this role, you will:


Day-in-the-Life


Weekly meeting with global delivery leaders (US, EMEA, APJ) to discuss changes to their teams resources and review updated capacity plans

Daily monitoring of pipeline of incoming work across regions and BUs to ensure we are able to meet customer demands

Development/ refinement of an analytical model to forecast our global services capacity

Analysis to identify strategic and tactical changes to our resource planning and optimization process / systems 

Execute / roll out policy changes that drive improved resource optimization and customer experience

Requirements 

BA / BS degree

3-6 years experience in operations management or workforce management

Strong analytical problem solving skills with experience creating analytical forecasts

Ability to work cross-functionality and influence outcomes without direct authority

Experience managing priorities and timelines without significant oversight

Proficient in Excel and other analytics tools (i.e. SQL, Tableau)

Preferred Qualifications

2+ years experience in resource planning, workforce optimization, or forecasting of FTE needs

2+ years experience in an highly analytical role

Prior experience in a technology services delivery context

Prior experience creating operational demand or capacity forecasts

Degree in statistics, data analytics, data science, or other related STEM degree 

What Differentiates Us From Other Companies

Work-life integration is deeply important to us - we have frequent office events and team outings to connect with our coworkers.

We take pride in our office design aimed at cultivating creativity from our rooftop views to an open and collaborative workspace.

On top of the standard benefits package (medical, dental, vision, life insurance, etc), we provide snacks, drinks, and free lunches in our office.

We believe in sharing Qualtrics success which is part of the compensation for all employees.

title: Principal Front End Engineer
content: Qualtrics is the technology platform that organizations use to collect, analyze, and act on experience data, also called X-data™. The Qualtrics XM Platform™ is a system of action, used by teams, departments, and entire organizations to manage the four core experiences of business—customer, product, employee and brand—on one platform. Over 10,000 enterprises worldwide, including more than 75 percent of the Fortune 100 and 99 of the top 100 U.S. business schools, rely on Qualtrics to consistently build products that people love, create more loyal customers, develop a phenomenal employee culture, and build iconic brands. Qualtrics was recently acquired by SAP, and together we will accelerate XM globally and power the experience economy. Join us on this adventure and define the future of Experience Management from technical perspective! If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and growth, recognizes your unique contribution, fills you with purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment - apply now!

This is a prime opportunity to have impact across hundreds of engineers, product managers, UX team members, and most importantly: thousands of customers. As a Principle Front-End Developer you will play a key role in shaping and executing on an ambitious vision for the future of Qualtrics. The Front-End is primarily how our users experience our product, and hence it’s very important for it to be world-class. With each of our teams owning their full stack - including their front-end technologies of choice - this becomes a challenging project.
If you’re looking for a solid growth opportunity to tackle big problems and increase your contribution and value, then Qualtrics might have just the puzzle for you.

At Qualtrics, we do all we can to give you the best space we can in which to tackle these problems. You’ll have to bring years of deep experience with engineering, product managers, UX, and front-end technologies, along with an aptitude for tackling challenges of this scale, and excitement for the impact you’ll have on our customers.

You will work closely with engineering and product teams to craft a beautiful and engaging product, collect feedback, and iterate quickly. We are constantly challenged by hard problems, such as quickly rendering complex charts, efficiently handling large amounts of data, and designing sophisticated frameworks for extensive customization requests.
You will mentor engineers on and off the team, lead projects and be the 'go to' person for all things front end.
You will provide technical thought leadership for a global, dynamic, and growing engineering organization

You will lead and engage in design reviews, architectural discussions, requirements definitions and other technical activities as a leader within Qualtrics. You’ll have the opportunity to work on our most complex problems. You will also give to the health of our engineering culture. You are a pragmatic visionary who can translate business needs into workable technology solutions. Your expertise is deep and broad; you’re hands on, capable of producing both detailed technical work and high-level architectural designs.
ou will coach and mentor a diverse team of engineers, fostering an environment of continuous improvement, and championing innovation, quality, and operational excellence
You will contribute thought leadership, architectural and technical direction to product vision and roadmap development, and ensure that the technical teams understand their strategic goals
full-stack software development across multiple technologies, languages, and frameworks/5+ years JavaScript web application development experience
Experience with MVC and single page application technologies, including some of AngularJS, Angular2, Polymer, Vue, Ember, React or ReactNative
Minimum of a Bachelor's of Science degree in Computer Science or related fields.
Familiarity with web application build pipelines using WebPack, Gulp, Babel, Sass / LESS
Ability to develop in vanilla JavaScript, but also leverage existing libraries or frameworks when applicable
Experience with Agile Management (SCRUM, RUP, XP), Data Modeling, API design, Containerization, Networking, UNIX, and database or other storage and compute related projects
Expertise in mentoring and developing junior developers. You get satisfaction from helping others succeed, and you constantly seek ways to improve.
2+ years of hands-on experience as a Principal-level software engineer.

In this role you’ll interact daily with software engineers, designers, product managers as a leader in the field. Additionally you will build new universes for those people to work inside, dive very deeply into current issues while looking ahead at upcoming issues and challenges, and making sure we’re building a solid roadmap that will serve us well into the future.
What differentiates us from other companies:
(do not need for internal job board)

We take pride in our offices design aiming at fostering creativity from our rooftop views to an open and collaborative work space.

title: Principal Engineer XM Platform
content:
Principal Engineer XM Platform
Why Qualtrics: 

Qualtrics is the technology platform that organizations use to collect, analyze, and act on experience data, also called X-data™. The Qualtrics XM Platform™ is a system of action, used by teams, departments, and entire organizations to manage the four core experiences of business—customer, product, employee and brand—on one platform. Over 10,000 enterprises worldwide, including more than 75 percent of the Fortune 100 and 99 of the top 100 U.S. business schools, rely on Qualtrics to consistently build products that people love, create more loyal customers, develop a phenomenal employee culture, and build iconic brands. Qualtrics was recently acquired by SAP, and together we will accelerate XM globally and power the experience economy. Join us on this adventure and define the future of Experience Management from technical perspective! If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and growth, recognizes your unique contribution, fills you with purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment - apply now!

The Challenge 

As a Principal Engineer for XM Platform, you will be responsible for defining and deploying autonomous services with deep focus on architecture, production operations, capacity planning, performance management, deployment, and release engineering. You will work with multiple cross-functional teams helping deliver new and outstanding experiences to our stakeholders while ensuring reliability and performance. You will design and develop systems to automate away the engineering effort required to operate our services at scale. You will apply leading edge open source and internally developed technologies to ensure our platform exceeds performance and availability SLAs. 


Expectations For Success 

Exert technical influence over multiple teams, increasing their productivity and effectiveness by sharing your deep knowledge and experience.

Functionally decompose complex problems into simple, straight-forward solutions.

Fully and completely understand system inter-dependencies and limitations.

Serve as a technical lead on our most demanding, cross-functional customer projects.

Ensure the quality, performance, and scalability of our platform architecture and design.

Day In the Life 

You will work with individual teams to ensure that all systems can scale to meet the ever-increasing demands of our rapidly growing business. You will identify and pursue opportunities to integrate technical solutions across all Qualtrics teams. You will also be expected to dedicatedly identify common problem spaces across teams and ensure we build best-in-class solutions to meet our customers’ needs without impeding the agility of individual business verticals. You will help drive the direction and development of a premier technology organization and be at the center of all key system level decisions.

You will lead and engage in design reviews, architectural discussions, requirements definitions and other technical activities as a leader within Qualtrics. You’ll have the opportunity to work on our most complex problems. You will also give to the health of our engineering culture. You are a pragmatic visionary who can translate business needs into workable technology solutions. Your expertise is deep and broad; you’re hands on, capable of producing both detailed technical work and high-level architectural designs.

Requirements 

Minimum of a Bachelor's of Science degree in Computer Science or a related field

12+ years of relevant, broad engineering experience

Hands-on experience with architecting and automated provisioning (IaC), configuration management for infrastructure and applications.

Hands-on experience with envisioning, designing, building and managing release systems, code merging and promotion, and CI/CD workflows and tools.

Experience establishing, implementing, and delivering using Agile practices.

Good exposure to Agile software development and DevOps practices such as Infrastructure as Code (IaC), Continuous Integration, automated deployment and configuration management.

What differentiates us from other companies
Work life integration is deeply important to us - we have frequent office events, team outings, and happy hours

Qualtrics Experience Program - $1,500 for an experience of your choosing (eligible after a year)

We take pride in our offices design aiming at fostering creativity from our rooftop views to an open and collaborative work space.

30 paid days off - 15 PTO + 5 Personal Days + 10 Holiday Closures (additional after a year)

On top of standard benefits package (medical employees and their families, dental, vision, life insurance, etc) we provide snacks, drinks, and free lunches in our office

We believe in sharing Qualtrics success which is part of the compensation for all employees

content:

The Challenge: 

Our goal is to personalize the Qualtrics experience using ML and AI features showcasing Qualtrics data as a core value proposition and competitive advantage.

As a Machine Learning software engineer at Qualtrics, you should love building simple solutions to solve hard customer problems. Crafting systems in an agile environment to withstand hyper growth and owning quality from end to end is a rewarding challenge and one of the reasons Qualtrics is such an exciting place to work!

Expectations for Success: 

A passion for 
building simple solutions to solve complex customer problems.

Craft systems in an agile environment to withstand hyper growth and owning quality from end to end 

Effectively research and benchmark Qualtrics’ technology against other best-in-class technologies and participate in technology adoption decisions.

Work with Research Engineers to implement, tune, and productize machine learning models

Develop new algorithms with a track record in top journals or conferences

Conduct state-of-the-art research, system design, and apply novel techniques to live production systems

Develop scalable, fast, robust, and simple web-based solutions to solve complex business problems

Implement new features and optimize existing ones to drive maximum performance

Deep expertise with Machine Learning systems over the entire software development lifecycle:

You will balance significant long-term R&D investments with short-term product deliverables, and partner with product management and company leadership to ensure alignment against strategic and tactical goals.

title: Senior Sales Engineer - Seattle
content:
Why Qualtrics?

At Qualtrics, our mission is to close experience gaps—the costly differences between what customers and employees expect, and what they’re receiving.

9,000+ organizations worldwide and more than 80% of the Fortune 100 rely on the Qualtrics Experience Management Platform™ to collect, analyze, and act on feedback—more feedback than they ever thought possible. About the Team

As a Sales Engineer you will be responsible for providing pre-sales technical / functional support to prospective clients and customers while ensuring customer happiness with minimal supervision. Provides direction and specialist knowledge in applying the technology/application to client business. Develop and deliver high quality Qualtrics presentations and product demonstrations. Design, validate, and present Qualtrics software solutions to include advanced product concepts, future direction, and 3rd party complimentary products. Present and articulate Qualtrics product's strengths, relative to competitors.

Effectively consult with management of customer organizations. Participate in sales planning and business development activities. Develop and demonstrate moderately complex solutions. Architect solutions and prototype solutions for customers. Participate in industry functions, seminars, and round tables to stay ahead of with industry. Interact with development to enhance/refine Qualtrics products in areas of expertise. Deliver high quality technical Qualtrics presentations and demonstrations in area of expertise.

A Day in the Life

Provide exemplary pre-sales technical expertise through technical and product presentations, demonstrations, pilot implementations, and ongoing sales consultation

Drive the adoption of Qualtrics solutions within strategic accounts, rapidly growing usage across departments within the enterprise. Translate product/technical features into value drivers.

Develop and maintain training materials, and deliver training to improve product knowledge and demo abilities of both inside and enterprise salespeople.

Build working knowledge of contending products and how to technically sell against them

Work collaboratively with Product Management, Marketing and Engineering during the development, launch and continuing refinement of existing and new Qualtrics products.

Respond to initial product requests and frame product issues for discussion and resolution with Product and Engineering teams

Become an expert in Qualtrics XM Platform and other Qualtrics products

Develop/maintain technical and business knowledge of industry directions and trends

What are the qualifications?

Must be located in the Seattle area.

Bachelor's degree (E.g. Marketing, Business, Human Resources Management, Organizational Behavior, Organizational Leadership, Computer Science, Information Systems, Mathematics, Statistics, or other quantitative field. Strong academic performance.)

3+ years of prior Sales/Systems Engineering, or Solution Architect experience with software in a SaaS/Cloud environment, selling to C/VP level buyers

High energy, self-starter comfortable with ambiguity in entrepreneurial environments.

Outstanding professional, sales, and technical capabilities; comfortable supporting both enterprise (field) and inside sales teams on targeted accounts

Ability to explain and resolve common technical aspects of SaaS software, including security, protocols for APIs, SLAs, email/communication specifications, etc.

Ability to see and present 'the big picture', architect solutions to tackle customer problems, and uncover business challenges and develop custom solutions to solve them

Strong customer facing and relationship building skills

Demonstrate excellent communication skills: needs analysis, positioning, business justification, and closing techniques.

Possess "best of breed" functional sales experience that could be applied across an entire sales area in general or specific functional categories

Strong leadership skills and ability to lead, encouraging both individual and team accomplishments

Ability to learn new technologies

Ability to pivot to other system related tasks if and when needed

Ability to travel

What differentiates us from other companies

Work life integration is deeply important to us - we have frequent office events, team outings, and happy hours.

We take pride in our offices design aiming at cultivating creativity from our rooftop views to an open and collaborative work space.

On top of standard benefits package (medical, dental, vision, life insurance, etc) we provide snacks, drinks, and free lunches in our office.

We believe in sharing Qualtrics success which is part of the compensation for all employees.

title: Senior Software Engineer - XM Directory
content: At Qualtrics, our mission is to close experience gaps—the costly differences between what customers and employees expect, and what they’re receiving.

9,000+ organizations worldwide and more than 3/4 of the Fortune 100 rely on the Qualtrics Experience Management Platform™ to collect, analyze, and act on feedback—more feedback than they ever thought possible. With Qualtrics XM™, organizations can manage the four core experiences of business—customer, employee, product, and brand experience. Organizations can be at every meaningful touchpoint, for every experience, and predict what will resonate most with customers and employees.

iQ Directory is what drives the Qualtrics XM™ Platform. It provides a live, organized chronicle that captures the emotions, sentiments, beliefs, and preferences of an audience. iQ Directory contains all experience data, collected over time, creating a system of record of all interactions and opinions each person has of an organization. iQ Directory enables a company to take a person-centric view, helping companies gain a better understanding of an individual person's unique journey with the company. Each new interaction builds upon past information, so this rich collection of experience data makes new interactions smarter over time, allowing a brand to customize future touch points for each group based on past preferences — improving the experience.

iQ Directory engineering team (a.k.a Rolodex) builds highly performant scalable solutions varying from data storage systems to computation and serving solutions. We utilize a plethora of open source and industry accepted technologies for our big data problems such as ElasticSearch, AWS DynamoDB, AWS Kinesis, Apache Kafka, Apache TinkerPop (Neptune), etc. Our human interface is built using the latest Angular framework with TypeScript language.

As a Senior Engineer in the Rolodex team, you will be applying your distributed systems knowledge, familiarity with frontend development, databases, and leading edge ML algorithms to create world class software.
building simple solutions to solve hard customer problems. Designing systems in an agile environment to withstand hyper growth.

title: Software Development Engineer in Test - Summer Intern
content:
About Qualtrics

At Qualtrics, our mission is to close experience gaps — the costly differences between what customers and employees expect, and what they’re receiving. 

10,000+ organizations worldwide and more than 80% of the Fortune 100 rely on the Qualtrics Experience Management Platform™ to collect, analyze, and act on feedback — more feedback than they ever thought possible. With Qualtrics XM, organizations can manage the four core experiences of business—customer, employee, product, and brand experience. Organizations can be at every meaningful touchpoint, for every experience, and predict what will resonate most with customers and employees. We create software to help turn customers into fanatics, products into obsessions, employees into ambassadors, and brands into religions. 

Qualtrics Engineering 

Our Engineering team is a group of deeply passionate engineers who are breaking new ground in cloud computing and web scalability. We organize and sort terabytes of data and develop solutions used by millions of users every single day. We design products that make sophisticated research simple. Engineering focuses on these tenets; Platform-oriented, API First, Secure, One Product (Our customers shouldn’t have to learn two different ways of solving the same problem), and Quality (
Our customers rely on our products to drive their businesses. Our software must work. If a feature is buggy, don’t release it (if it hasn’t been released yet), fix it or take it out.)

Quality Engineering Challenge

Our Quality Engineering organization’s mission is to build a quality culture championing a delightful customer experience while enabling teams to efficiently bring high quality software to all markets. We do this by engaging early to ensure customer use cases are tested AND fully automated. We also automate the release process to save human effort, reduce mistakes, and speed overall delivery. Our environment is primarily Selenium, Protractor, Mocha, Chai, Java, JavaScript, TypeScript, Node.js, Jira, TestRail, Python, Jenkins, Nomad and Docker. In our collaborative culture, you find plenty of opportunities to improve the quality of our software.

Responsibilities

Design and develop test frameworks, test tools, and automation for complex, distributed SaaS systems for STEs, SDET, and SDE to use.

Ensure code is tested at the appropriate level (unit vs functional, or API vs UI), reducing unnecessary test cases, intermittent failures, and increased execution time.

Define, implement, and analyze metrics to determine test effectiveness and the overall quality of software.

Research, share, and recommend new technologies, best practices, and trends

Help your team evolve by actively participating in the code review process, design discussions, planning, and post-mortem reviews.

Requirements

Currently studying for a degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering

Available for a 12-16 week internship during upcoming summer

Experience with modern programming languages (Java, PHP, Scala)

Web-related technologies including HTML/CSS and JavaScript

JavaScript frameworks including angular or node

Experience or interest in learning test automation frameworks and tools 

Understanding a broad range of data structures, algorithms, and design patterns; knowing when it is appropriate to use them (and when it is not).

Basic knowledge or interest in learning software testing techniques, such as equivalence class partitioning, boundary value testing, pairwise testing, etc.

Strong level of curiosity

You mentor and develop your other team members.

Coding experience with any programming language (Prefer experience in Perl/Python/JavaScript)

Strong testing aptitude

Strong level of curiosity

title: Experience Management Scientist, Research Core
content: At Qualtrics, our mission is to close experience gaps—the costly differences between what customers and employees expect, and what they’re receiving.

8,500+ organizations worldwide and more than 3/4 of the Fortune 100 rely on the Qualtrics Experience Management Platform™ to collect, analyze, and act on feedback—more feedback than they ever thought possible. With Qualtrics XM, organizations can manage the four core experiences of business—customer, employee, product, and brand experience. Organizations can be at every meaningful touchpoint, for every experience, and predict what will resonate most with customers and employees.

This position is a senior role that will focus on creating the next generation of research and building artificial intelligence and machine learning into the world of market research. Specifically, you will be creating scalable in-product recommendations and insights to enable users improve the quality of their research. You will use machine learning and research methodology techniques and work with the Product teams to design the right solutions. The initiatives led by you will directly contribute to growing revenue for the Research Core and establish Qualtrics as the leader in applying AI to Survey Research.

You will have a keen understanding of researcher’s needs in the world of market research. You will have experience designing surveys with best practice methodologies and be able to communicate to senior level stakeholders of Qualtrics clients on trends in survey research methodology.

You will roll up your sleeves and dive into analyzing billions of Qualtrics anonymized datasets. You will be comfortable building machine learning models that seek patterns on what impacts our users research quality and recommend ways to improve the quality using best practice methodologies.
You will influence Qualtrics customers and help them design high quality research programs to help them make sound business decisions.
You will understand the significant industry shifts taking place in market research and how artificial intelligence can help address the problems facing market research.
Finally, You will be inspired by and believe in our
. You will believe in making work a positive experience for yourself and your co-workers, and be willing to strap in and enjoy the ride!
Develop and validate machine learning models that can find patterns and correlations between survey methods used by Qualtrics customers and the impact to data quality
Develop thought leadership content on a frequent basis, including academic and practitioner articles, joint publications, podcasts, conference presentations or webinars
Working with the Product team, help to develop new platform features such as automated recommendations to improve quality of the research as users build out their survey
Provide post-sale consulting support to customers, this may include survey/assessment design, post-survey data analysis and interpretation and executive presentations
Conduct, write and present on global research that aligns to the Qualtrics value proposition, at industry conferences, academic journals and collaboration with Universities and research institutes.
Where needed, contribute to product and business development activities
7+ years experience working with clients on their survey programs, or Data Science function
Advanced degree (Ph.D. preferred) in research methodology and/or data science
Proficient with building data science and statistics models using R, Python or SPSS
Have a strong understanding of good research methodology; item design and data collection
A blend of agency-side experience as well as internal-client experience is ideal, although candidates from either side will be considered
Experience working with large and complex enterprises
Consultative and relationship builder who can quickly understand client needs and requirements
What differentiates us from other companies
Work life integration is deeply important to us - we have frequent office events, team outings, and happy hours
We take pride in our offices design aiming at cultivating creativity from our rooftop views to an open and collaborative work spacee
On top of standard benefits package (medical, dental, vision, life insurance, etc) we provide snacks, drinks, and free lunches in our office
We believe in sharing Qualtrics success which is part of the compensation for all employees

title: XMD Platform Support Engineer
content:
iQ Directory is a live, organized chronicle that captures the emotions, sentiments, beliefs, and preferences of an audience. iQ Directory contains all experience data, collected over time, creating a system of record of all interactions and opinions each person has of an organization.

iQ Directory enables a company to take a person-centric view, helping companies gain a better understanding of an individual person’s unique journey with the company. Each new interaction builds upon past information, so this rich collection of experience data makes new interactions smarter over time, allowing a brand to customize future touch points for each group based on past preferences — improving the experience.

iQ Directory enables companies to interact with people at the right moment, with the right message, via the best channels. Now interactions feel like an ongoing conversation rather than transactional pings along a customer or employee journey.

Job Responsibilities:

Work on operations and maintenance-driven coding projects

Build systems to audit and measure reliability of services

Fine tune services to reduce latency, conduct operational readiness reviews and automate continuous delivery of software changes

Maintain service level agreements, and build systems to support it

Manage the health of a number of distributed specialized server fleets and the software stacks that run on them

Execute regular maintenance activities for services including outage handling, ticket resolution and root cause fixes

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in a hard science or Information Systems

Solid understanding of the UNIX/Linux operating system

Demonstrated software development/technical operations experience

Experience in a Unix/Linux platform

A high degree of organization and very detail-oriented

Excellent leadership, verbal, and written communication skills

Preferred Qualifications:

Proven ability to troubleshoot and identify the root cause of issues

Demonstrated skill and passion for operational excellence

Experience in a 24/7 production environment is a plus

Ability to retain composure under stressful conditions, communicate effectively with wide array of individuals at Qualtrics, and get the right things done

Proven ability to understand large systems, drilling down to code level

Over 9,000 enterprises worldwide, including more than 75 percent of the Fortune 100 and 99 of the top 100 U.S. business schools, rely on Qualtrics to consistently build products that people love, create more loyal customers, develop a phenomenal employee culture, and build iconic brands. title: Application Security Engineer
content:
Why Qualtrics?

Qualtrics is the technology platform that organizations use to collect, manage, and act on experience data, also called X-data™. The Qualtrics XM Platform™ is a system of action, used by teams, departments, and entire organizations to manage the four core experiences of business—customer, product, employee and brand—on one platform. Over 10,000 enterprises worldwide, including more than 75 percent of the Fortune 100 and 99 of the top 100 U.S. business schools, rely on Qualtrics to consistently build products that people love, create more loyal customers, develop a phenomenal employee culture, and build iconic brands. Qualtrics was recently acquired by SAP, and together we will accelerate XM and power the experience economy. Join us on this adventure that can open many doors! Join a company that is dedicated to your ideas and growth, recognizes your unique contribution, fills you with purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment.

The Challenge

As Qualtrics continues to extend the Experience Management (XM) platform, we must ensure that we’re protecting our customers and their data by delivering and operating secure systems. Hundreds of software engineers contribute to Qualtrics XM every day. We require an outstanding application security program which enables developers to deliver secure code, effectively identifies and remediates security vulnerabilities, and keeps up with our growing scale. Qualtrics is looking for an expert software developer with a passion for security who is ready to bring our appsec program to the next level.

A Day in the Life

Review source code & software/system designs, and consult with software engineers across the organization to identify and/or avoid security issues through alignment to security standards.

Document and improve secure SDL processes and standards

Deliver training and provide mentoring to software engineers on security topics

Facilitate threat modeling exercises to ensure accurate security design decisions are being made

Coordinate with security champions and other software engineers to ensure successful and timely remediation of vulnerabilities

Automate redundant tasks related to detection and reporting of vulnerabilities, suspicious application activity, coordination of response activities, etc.

Implement security testing tools and methodologies (e.g., SAST, DAST) in collaboration with other engineering teams

Participate in on-call rotation for security operations responsibilities, including security incident response

Use penetration testing techniques to identify or validate vulnerabilities in Qualtrics products

The Expectation for Success

You will work effectively with the Qualtrics engineering organization, providing reliable technical security expertise on application security issues and applying a team-based approach to solving problems and prioritizing security work. You will seek to streamline and automate processes in order to deliver maximum results with minimal effort.

Skills That Will Lead to Success

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field

At least four years developing web or backend applications

Sound understanding of app security vulnerabilities, defense techniques and security best practices, including language-specific security measures and present-day threats

Experience with modern application development languages and frameworks

title: UX Data Scientist
content: As the Data Scientist on the Experience Research Team you will bring the power of our data to Qualtrics, itself.

You will help analyze our own product data to build and grow a deeply impactful XM product line and platform. The analytics you deliver will strategically advance how Qualtrics ideates, builds, measures, and improves its own products. You will use your quantitative skills to analyze disparate customer feedback data sources (e.g., NPS, Social Media, Call/Case Volumes, Product feedback) to present comprehensive views of customer experience. You will continue to build models and look for opportunities to leverage EX, BX and PX data as we build XM.
What Success Looks Like in the Role

You inspire those around you to be obsessed with data and the stories you can tell. You love turning data into insights. You thrive when people take action on the insights you provide. You have Qualtrics internal stakeholders craving more. You understand the importance of mining our own data with the goal of providing input to our case studies and suggestions for improvements to our own products.

You work effectively cross-team and you understand the importance of building strong relationships and earning trust and credibility. You have successfully helped this organization harness the power to tell our own stories with our own data.

Designs, develops and programs methods, processes, and systems to consolidate and analyze unstructured, diverse “big data” sources to generate actionable insights and solutions to support our own programs and XM platform product enhancement.
Interacts with product and teams to identify questions and issues for data analysis and experiments.
Develops and codes software programs, algorithms and automated processes to cleanse, integrate and evaluate large datasets from multiple disparate sources.
Identifies meaningful insights from large data and metadata sources; interprets and communicates insights and findings from analysis and experiments.
Be an internal leader in basic statistics including descriptive statistics, correlation and regression.

You are a big data junkie and you tell stories with big data and can demonstrate how you have used data to change thoughts about how things work. You care about understanding the customer and want to impact better customer experiences that align strategically with business goals.
You want to join a dynamic, rapidly scaling, organization. You know how to mine data and turn it into measurable outputs that push understanding and action.
Master’s Degree in Business Analytics, Data Analytics, or Data Science, with a BA/BS in Economics, Finance, Management, Marketing or Social Science
Strong quantitative analytical skills; with statistical analysis competence in techniques such as correlation, regression, KPI metric development, segmentation modeling and algorithms
Fluent in either Python or R, able to query data using SQL, has experience working with cloud based computing platforms and big data tools.
Experience in data mining, advanced data manipulation, machine learning and statistical analysis.
Experience with data visualization and communication projects using software like Tableau
Strong verbal and written communication skills to present analysis and insights including trends and opportunities to stakeholders and the business
Believes in eating one's own dog food and using that experience to drive the creation of exceptional customer facing products
High standard of detail, excellence, professionalism, and role model behavior
Familiarity with survey scripting and data reporting platforms (e.g. Qualtrics, etc.) is desired. Ability to script surveys in these platforms is a plus.

As a Software Development Engineer on our core technology team, you will be applying your distributed systems knowledge, are familiar with databases and various storage engines, and have experience in web service design and implementation. You should have a sound understanding of Internet protocols (HTTP, DNS, TCP/IP) and experience implementing client/server architecture using Java in a Linux/Unix environment.

Strong level of curiosity and interest to learn

Experience with web infrastructure and distributed systems

Experience with software engineering standard methodologies (e.g. unit testing, code reviews, design document

As a software engineer at Qualtrics, you should love building simple solutions to solve hard customer problems. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and growth, recognizes your unique contribution, fills you with purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment - apply now!

The Team

The Developer Tooling team is a cornerstone of the Qualtrics engineering organization. We are responsible for the systems that drive the entire software development lifecycle. We help Qualtrics Software developers innovate faster by eliminating wasted effort in the software delivery process. We hire world-class talent, which demands world-class leadership.

The Challenge

As the leader of the Developer Tooling organization, your customers will be the developers inside Qualtrics. They are some of the most demanding and appreciative customers, driven to innovate on behalf of our customers. Success means delivering real value during a time of explosive growth.

Primary Responsibilities

As the manager of Developer Tooling you will lead a team responsible for the research, development and operation of our developer services. You will take charge of the operation and delivery of a framework that spans from development environment utilities like source code control and build services, through to container deployment, orchestration, elastic compute infrastructure and service discovery and consumption in production. You will be responsible for developing and growing a team of engineers. You will have the autonomy to define a roadmap that meets the short and long-term needs of your customers.

We are seeking someone who is comfortable with high degrees of ambiguity, who is proficient at operating mission-critical services at scale, mentoring engineers, and acting as a technical leader to set the direction and vision for the Qualtrics developer platform.

Preferred Requirements

BA/BS degree in computer science or related field

5+ years experience of owning a customer-facing, highly-available, large scale web-based service.

5+ years of perfection in operating this service.

Deep understanding of web application architecture, including TCP/IP and HTTP

Experience and knowledge of load balancing, caching, CDNs, and clustering technologies.

Experience with common monitoring tools such as Nagios, AppDynamics, Graphite and statsd

Development experience in a high level language like Java, PHP, Ruby, Go or Python. Ideally you are a systems engineer with developer experience or a developer with strong systems engineering knowledge. No IDE-only developers.

Experience with software development lifecycle technologies (ex. Rundeck, Git, Jenkins, artifactory services, etc)

Knowledge of SQL (MySQL) tuning and optimization is important. Experience with memcached, Redis and Elasticsearch is a bonus.

Worked with or implemented configuration management using tools like Puppet or Chef

Excited about learning new technologies

A mentality of 'Automate everything!'

A great teammate and go-getter, with a focus on getting stuff done

What differentiates us from other companies

Work life integration is deeply important to us - we have frequent office events, team outings, and happy hours.

We take pride in our offices design aiming at cultivating creativity from our rooftop views to an open and collaborative work space.

On top of standard benefits package (medical, dental, vision, life insurance, etc) we provide snacks, drinks, and free lunches in our office.

We believe in sharing Qualtrics success which is part of the compensation for all employees.

title: Software Development Engineer in Test
content:
About Qualtrics

At Qualtrics, our mission is to close experience gaps — the costly differences between what customers and employees expect, and what they’re receiving. 

10,000+ organizations worldwide and more than 80% of the Fortune 100 rely on the Qualtrics Experience Management Platform™ to collect, analyze, and act on feedback — more feedback than they ever thought possible. With Qualtrics XM, organizations can manage the four core experiences of business—customer, employee, product, and brand experience. Organizations can be at every meaningful touchpoint, for every experience, and predict what will resonate most with customers and employees. We create software to help turn customers into fanatics, products into obsessions, employees into ambassadors, and brands into religions. 

Qualtrics Engineering 

Our Engineering team is a group of deeply passionate engineers who are breaking new ground in cloud computing and web scalability. We organize and sort terabytes of data and develop solutions used by millions of users every single day. We design products that make sophisticated research simple. Engineering focuses on these tenets; Platform-oriented, API First, Secure, One Product (Our customers shouldn’t have to learn two different ways of solving the same problem), and Quality (
Our customers rely on our products to drive their businesses. Our software must work. If a feature is buggy, don’t release it (if it hasn’t been released yet), fix it or take it out.)

Quality Engineering Challenge

Our Quality Engineering organization’s mission is to build a quality culture championing a delightful customer experience while enabling teams to efficiently bring high quality software to all markets. We do this by engaging early to ensure customer use cases are tested AND fully automated. We also automate the release process to save human effort, reduce mistakes, and speed overall delivery. Our environment is primarily Selenium, Protractor, Mocha, Chai, Java, JavaScript, TypeScript, Node.js, Jira, TestRail, Python, Jenkins, Nomad and Docker. In our collaborative culture, you find plenty of opportunities to improve the quality of our software.

Responsibilities

Design test plans and test cases for mobile and web applications

You convert manual tests cases into automated test cases.

You develop and design test frameworks, test tools, and automation for complex, distributed SaaS systems for other STEs, SDETs, and SDEs to use.

You ensure the product is tested at the appropriate level (unit vs integration vs end to end, API vs UI), reducing unnecessary test cases, intermittent failures, and decreasing execution time.

You define, implement, and analyze metrics to resolve test effectiveness and the overall quality of software.

You research, share, recommend, and drive adoption of new technologies, standard methodologies, and trends.

You help your team evolve by actively participating in the code review process, design discussions, planning, and post-mortems.

You mentor and develop your other team members.

Requirements

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field.

4+ years professional coding experience in a programming language like C#, or C++, knowledge of Java, JavaScript or Python preferred.

1+ years professional experience building test automation frameworks and tools from scratch.

Proficiency with a broad range of data structures, algorithms, and design patterns, and knowing when it's appropriate to use them (and when it's not).

Experience applying different software testing techniques, such as equivalence class partitioning, boundary value testing, pairwise testing, etc.

Experience with SOA and distributed systems.

Experience testing web services is a plus.

Experience with Performance / Scalability / reliability testing is also preferred.

What Differentiates Qualtrics from Other Companies

Work–life integration is deeply important to us - we have regular office events, team outings, and happy hours.

We take pride in our offices’ design aiming at cultivating creativity from our rooftop views to an open and collaborative work space.

On top of standard benefits package (medical, dental, vision, life insurance, etc) we provide snacks, drinks, and free lunches in our office.

Qualtrics continues amazing growth; from 2,300 to 8,000 employees by 2023 across the Globe.

Qualtrics Experience Program - $1,500 for an experience of your choosing (eligible after a year)

If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and growth, recognizes your unique contribution, fills you with purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment - apply now!

About Digital Experience Team

The Digital Experience team at Qualtrics builds and maintains a scalable system with billions of pageviews a week, to bridge the experience gap on every device. We currently provide customers with tools to enable them to make on-the-fly changes, including customized questions and messages, on their company’s websites and mobile apps, so they can listen and engage with a targeted segment of users.

We are looking for senior full stack engineer and leader who finds meaning in her\his work and is looking to build innovative product features or scalable systems that make a real felt impact on the business. You will be working across all layers, including web and mobile front ends, caching layers in browser, CDN and memory, message queues, file system and relational and NoSql databases.

The DX team currently uses the following technologies: JavaScript, Node.js, Angular, PHP, Java, Scala, docker, Memcache, MySql, beanstalk, S3, Consul, Galera, rundeck, jenkins2, puppet, and hiera. That said, at Qualtrics, each team has the freedom and flexibility to choose their tech stack, so as we architect and build new services and features, there will be a lot of opportunity to pick latest technologies that are most appropriate for the problem at hand (ex: react, redis, serverless).

Preliminary Qualifications

BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent

7+ years of software development experience at major technology companies and/or software startups

Experience with web infrastructure and distributed systems

Experience with software engineering best practices (e.g. unit testing, code reviews, design, continuous delivery, git, test automation and build\deploy systems)

Ability to work in a fast-paced and agile development environment and to learn new frameworks/stacks

Passionate about building products that help customers easily and effectively get their job done

Enthusiastic person, who communicates effectively and is easy to work with

Curious and constantly learning on your own and from others

You get satisfaction from helping others succeed, and you constantly seek ways to improve

You can identify gaps, propose solutions to important problems, then take it to resolution

Test Driven Development with attention for details

Preferred Qualifications

2+ years of leadership experience

Expertise in mentoring and developing junior developers. You get satisfaction from helping others succeed, and you constantly seek ways to improve.

Desire to guide engineering vision and drive engineering excellence across teams

Able to design and implement well-crafted, scalable, and maintainable code

Ability to make reasonable trade-offs based on time and resource constraints in the interest of the business and customers

Comfortable with designing APIs, SDKs, and data models

Experience building large-scale web applications and microservices

Experience building fast, accessible, world ready and responsive user experiences

Proficiency using modern web development technologies and techniques, including JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and one or more modern front end frameworks

Experience building Android and iOS applications

Be highly creative, flexible, self-directed and resilient

A Day in the Life

Develop scalable, fast, robust, and rich web and mobile solutions to solve complex business problems

Commit to sprint goals, attend daily stand-up meetings, prioritize and estimate features

Lead a team of software engineers responsible for the design, development, testing, deployment, and operations of features.

Work across disciplines and teams to collect requirements, describe features, build technical designs, and drive product strategy

Demonstrate knowledge of professional software engineering best practices for the entire SDLC, including coding standards, code reviews, source code management, build processes, and testing

Drive operational excellence by investigating production issues, driving root cause analysis and follow-up actions for mitigation

Improve performance, availability, reliability, scale, throughput and latency

Advise management on software development priorities, risks, and required effort level.

As an engineer at Qualtrics, you are more than a developer. In addition to building, you test to make sure your work does not introduce customer pain, you put mechanisms in place to make sure the team knows if features aren’t behaving as expected, and you own delivering what you build to customers

title: Senior Business Planner
content:
Why Qualtrics?

Qualtrics is the technology platform that organizations use to collect, manage, and act on experience data, also called X-data™. The Qualtrics XM Platform™ is a system of action, used by teams, departments, and entire organizations to manage the four core experiences of business—customer, product, employee and brand—on one platform. Over 9,000 enterprises worldwide, including more than 75 percent of the Fortune 100 and 99 of the top 100 U.S. business schools, rely on Qualtrics to consistently build products that people love, create more loyal customers, develop a phenomenal employee culture, and build iconic brands. Qualtrics was recently acquired by SAP, and together we will accelerate XM and power the experience economy. Join us on this adventure that can open many doors! If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and growth, recognizes your unique contribution, fills you with purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment - apply now!

The Challenge

Qualtrics is looking for talented leaders as our product and business model portfolio grows. The Business Planning team plays a central role in developing multi-year strategic plans in conjunction with business units, defining business models across the company, and executing critical long-term growth initiatives.

As a leader in the Business Planning team, you will drive critical strategic initiatives requiring strong leadership, cross-team collaboration, creativity, analytics, and the ability to be a leader amongst peers. You will work across all organizations to co-develop our future company and product strategy, determine product offerings, drive profitability, and guide strategic pricing. You will be viewed as a leader, enabling and helping others to understand our strategy and product offerings. You will also identify, propose, and drive new initiatives to accelerate our business strategy across a diverse set of businesses. You will have a strong understanding of Qualtrics product offerings and be a key contributor in a fast growing environment. 

This role requires advanced business strategy acumen as well as thought leadership, strong partnering ability, and execution skills to ensure we develop the right strategy, and business models to enable the commercial success of Qualtrics more broadly. You will also work with executives across the company to finalize and approve product strategy in order to build out the company’s vision.

Responsibilities

As a business planner you will be responsible for developing strategy, business models, and the product portfolio while balancing short-term and long-term goals of the business:

Work as a member of the leadership team to define, launch and execute our strategy

Develop business strategy and product offerings that will accelerate growth for Qualtrics in conjunction with the product and marketing owners

Manage business model and commercialization initiatives in order to enable marketing, sales, and customer success

Regularly assess the efficacy of product and business initiatives, and recommend adjustments as needed

Identify and develop accelerators to growth and adoption, including M&A & strategic partnerships

Leverage and develop financial, customer research, and usage insights to deliver informed decision making

Example project types include: white space opportunity sizing, business model analysis, disruptive initiative ideation, new product commercialization, pricing strategy, and competitive analysis

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in a technical field or equivalent experience.

Master's in Business Administration or graduate degree in management, economics, technical or engineering field desired

5+ years of work experience in consulting and/or tech; at least 2 years of experience in a top tier management consulting or investment banking, or equivalent strategy/project management experience in a line role for a technology firm.

A track record of ownership and being a self-starter, able to independently drive and lead cross-company initiatives

Excellent written/verbal communication, problem solving, financial analysis, and interpersonal skills

Experience in structuring complex analyses in a fast-paced environment

Proficiency with analytical tools and techniques (SQL, spreadsheet software, statistics and predictive modeling)

What differentiates us from other companies

Work life integration is deeply important to us - we have frequent office events, team outings, and happy hours.

We take pride in our offices design aiming at cultivating creativity from our rooftop views to an open and collaborative work space.

On top of standard benefits package (medical, dental, vision, life insurance, etc) we provide snacks, drinks, and free lunches in our office.

Functionally decompose complex problems into simple, straight-forward solutions.

Experience with Agile Management (SCRUM, RUP, XP), Data Modeling, API design, Containerization, Networking, UNIX, and database or other storage and compute related projects

Experience working in a complex, service oriented software development.
2+ years of hands-on experience as a Principal-level software engineer.

You will work with individual teams to ensure that all systems can scale to meet the ever-increasing demands of our rapidly growing business. title: iQ Research and Development Leader
content:
About Qualtrics

Qualtrics is the technology platform that organizations use to collect, manage, and act on experience data, also called X-data™. The Qualtrics XM Platform™ is a system of action, used by teams, departments, and entire organizations to manage the four core experiences of business—customer, product, employee and brand—on one platform. Over 9,000 enterprises worldwide, including more than 75 percent of the Fortune 100 and 99 of the top 100 U.S. business schools, rely on Qualtrics to consistently build products that people love, create more loyal customers, develop a phenomenal employee culture, and build iconic brands. Qualtrics was recently acquired by SAP, and together we will accelerate XM and power the experience economy. Join us on this adventure that can open many doors! If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and growth, recognizes your unique contribution, fills you with purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment - apply now!

About the Role

We are looking for a leader to develop and execute a Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence R&D and productization strategy. Our goal is to personalize the Qualtrics experience using ML and AI features showcasing Qualtrics data as a core value proposition and competitive advantage.

As the leader of this team you will hire, develop, mentor, and coach both Research Scientists and ML Engineers to ideate and implement new platform features leveraging state-of-the-art techniques in natural language understanding, image classification, statistical modeling, and other forms of ML and AI technology. You will balance significant long-term R&D investments with short-term product deliverables, and partner with product management and company leadership to ensure alignment against strategic and tactical goals.

Working in with senior leaders, you will evangelize ML and AI technology capabilities, and develop a process for consulting, educating, evaluating, and implementing across the larger organization. You will provide thought leadership about proper use of ML and AI, and lead the strategy, design, and implementation of scalable processes for model development, validation, and implementation.

You will partner with other senior leaders to build an efficient organization strategy and make key investment and prioritization decisions to execute against our multi-year product and company vision. You will serve as an external voice of the company, clearly articulating the company’s vision to technical and business audiences, helping to establish the company as a market leader.

Preferred Qualifications

Advanced degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, or Engineering with 7+ years of industrial experience in at least one of the following fields:

Natural language processing: text labeling and classification, text understanding, question answering, dialogue systems, entity extraction and reasoning, knowledge graph, etc.

Machine learning: deep learning, distributed machine learning, large-scale optimization, Bayesian probabilistic inference

Data mining: information extraction, recommender systems, knowledge/pattern discovery, anomaly/churn detection

Computer vision: image classification, object detection, segmentation

Consistent record of progressive data science and ML/AI experience, with 3+ years in a leadership position leading teams that designed, developed, and launched complex AI solutions

Demonstrated track record of successfully hiring, motivating, growing, and retaining talented Research Scientists and ML Engineers

Experience in developing new algorithms with a track record in top journals or conferences

Expert in conducting state-of-the-art research, system design, and applying novel techniques to live production systems

Familiar with one or more deep learning frameworks: e.g Tensorflow, PyTorch, MXNet

Experience with large-scale computing platforms, e.g Spark, Hadoop

Strong verbal and written communication skills

content:

As a Developer Evangelist for Qualtrics, you will be unusually positioned to accelerate our XM vision by driving the development and adoption of our Qualtrics API. You'll engage with our current and prospective developers. In this role, you'll be tapping into your passion about technology and trends to evangelize our developer communities. You will be accountable for proof of concepts, scalable and reusable end-to-end architecture design, and providing technical mentorship throughout the app development, testing and delivery to market.

Expectations for Success

Evangelize to prospective developers by helping them understand Qualtrics XM platform APIs, technologies, capabilities and benefits

Bring to bear a deep understanding of how we design APIs and products influencing next-generation platform technologies, features, and tools in partnership with internal product R&D teams

Develop standard methodologies for the Qualtrics platform and operates with a high degree of autonomy, energy, flexibility and the dedication to build real and measurable business results

Deliver articulate, effective, and audience-appropriate presentations/demonstrations with technically oriented content in public forums and external events for developers building Qualtrics XM platform

Qualifications

Bsc/Msc Graduate with an engineering degree

5+ years work experience as a software developer, architect, technology evangelist, consultant, or product manager for meaningful web technologies

Experience analyzing data while developing solutions to problems

Development experience, in one or more of the following languages: JavaScript/NodeJS, Java, Python and PHP

Validated technical expertise in crafting, building and supporting commercial web platforms

Able to build and manage relationships, acting as a trusted advisor, and to lead teams of peers

Passionate and knowledgeable about exploring and experimenting with the latest technologies

Excellent presentation, demonstration, and interpersonal communication skills, experienced inspiring leader and speaker at company events

Strong analytical skills enabling comprehension and development of complex business and technical issues, topics and plans

Ability to maintain a high level of productivity, manage multiple competing priorities, and work effectively under the pressure of time constraints in a dynamic, complex, collaborative, and team environment

title: DATA ENGINEERING MANAGER
content:
Adswerve is looking for an aspiring Data Engineering Manager to join the Technical Services team. The ideal candidate for this key team management position will possess a natural tendency toward analytical thinking, combined with strong client-facing consultative communication, presentation, training and coaching skills. They will be naturally curious about data purity, big data analysis, machine learning, and product development, and have demonstrated strengths in data engineering. In addition, this candidate will have a desire to mentor and encourage growth in others.

Responsibilities

Align with Director and other Managers on team goals

Guide team to implement best practices in solution development and client relationships

Clearly defines performance expectations

Ensure accountability and provides ongoing informal feedback, coaching and mentoring

Conducts formal performance evaluations 

Promotes professional development opportunities 

Develops and fosters supportive working relationships, motivation and engagement

Prioritize direct report workload based on customer and business priorities

Oversee work completed by team from a high level to ensure timely delivery and quality of work

Work to improve general Technical Services and company processes

Actively engages in recruiting and hiring new employees

Work to improve onboarding process

Other duties as assigned

Requirements

College degree, preferably in Computer Science, Information Science - OR - equivalent experience in Data Analysis, Data Science, and/or Data Engineering

Demonstrated success in coaching and mentoring others

Proficient communication and presentation skills, including leading group training

Experience with SQL, Python, and/or Google Cloud Platform with a desire to learn more

Ability to work on a team and manage individual prioritized workload


As a leading Google Marketing and Cloud partner, Adswerve is a team of media and analytics veterans who believe smart marketing is built on data discovery. Formerly two separate entities, Adswerve acquired Analytics Pros in August of 2018 and is now able to provide unparalleled expertise across the entire Google Marketing and Cloud Platforms. With offices in Denver, Seattle and New York, Adswerve helps thousands of digital marketers, data analysts and agencies make stronger connections with their customers through successful data-driven strategies.

Our top-tier partnership with Google provides accelerated growth opportunities and a positive, rewarding environment for employees. We have a vibrant, partnership-oriented corporate culture where employees are respected for their experience, contributions and teamwork. We provide excellent benefits, a fun workplace and promote a fantastic and healthy work-life balance.

Adswerve is an Equal Opportunity and E-Verify Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, protected veteran status, or disability. Adswerve will provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) with information from each new employee's Form I-9 to confirm work authorization.

title: WEB ANALYTICS TRAINER
content:
The Web Analytics Trainer will work in the Services Training Department as a knowledge facilitator and technical educator of our client base of agencies and digital marketers. The Web Analytics Trainer develops and delivers content related to the Google Marketing Platform, providing users with basic to advanced knowledge on a variety of concepts, topics and features. The goal is to educate our customer base in pursuit of increased use and platform enablement.

We are looking for a professional who has familiarity with web analytics implementations and is eager to share their expertise for analytics and training. This team member will help to pioneer this new service offering and will have the autonomy to help shape processes, including the adoption and roll-out of a Learning Management System (LMS) and client portal. 

A key part of this role will be maintaining and evolving content for Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Google BigQuery, and Analytics 360 courses. You will help develop our core set of modules tied to the above, ensuring content is fresh and relevant to our users. You will assist with agenda planning and adjust the content delivery to be relevant to the client’s implementation as you deliver face-to-face and/or remote training.

This Role:


Reports to the Vice President of Platform Implementation



Strives for excellence in terms of training delivery and delegate feedback scores



Seeks opportunity for upselling and platform adoption through education



Has a general understanding of how to implement and use tools including Google Analytics, Google BigQuery and Google Tag Manager, and understands how Google Analytics works with the rest of the Google Marketing Platform stack



Will be encouraged to lead or consult on analytics projects to ensure your skills remain hands-on and up-to-date, however, you will not maintain a book of clients



Up to 30% travel is required


Essential Duties and Responsibilities:


Maintains and updates relevant training content so it’s kept current and reflects our position as a market-leading analytics provider for Google Analytics 360 and related platforms



Delivers training, both scheduled and private courses for the following subjects: Google Analytics, Analytics 360 and Google Tag Manager 



Collaborates with the Client Services teams to understand the specific training goal, and delivers them a post-training summary with insight as to how the Client Services team may further engage the client and any related follow-up items



Attends planning calls with clients and works with the  Training Coordinator to solidify agenda and travel logistics



Mentors others who would like to lead a training session or become involved with training efforts


Required Qualifications:


Extremely comfortable presenting, training and public speaking in both in-person classroom settings and online training facilitation



Strong communication and interpersonal skills



Can clearly communicate processes, strategies and general requirements to both internal and external stakeholders



Results orientated and can deliver projects to tight timelines



Experience with training clients on how to utilize paid analytics solutions correctly



Ability to travel up to 30% of the time


Preferred Qualifications:


A minimum of 1 years’ experience working with analytics solutions, ranging from conducting audits to managing implementation projects, to presenting to large audiences and delivering training



Bachelor’s degree, preferably in teaching or technology, and/or equivalent combination of education and experience



Has strong knowledge of the Google Analytics and Analytics 360 integrations with products including (but not limited to) Display & Video 360, Campaign Manager, Search Ads 360 & BigQuery



Technical background with expertise in Javascript / jQuery / SQL a plus



Familiar with Learning Management Systems (LMS) is a plus



Assumes a high level of enthusiasm and has an interest in furthering a career at Adswerve



As a leading Google Marketing and Cloud partner, Adswerve is a team of media and analytics veterans who believe smart marketing is built on data discovery. title: DIGITAL ANALYST
content:
This job posting represents an ongoing hiring need but may not represent an immediate opening. We will review all new applications and contact qualified applicants with the current status of the position.

Adswerve is looking for an aspiring Digital Analyst. The ideal candidate for this key position will possess a natural tendency toward analytical thinking, combined with client-facing consultative communication skills.
