title: Database Administrator
content:
Description


About us:  

Limeade is a software company that elevates the employee experience and helps build great places to work. The Limeade ONE platform offers employee well-being, engagement, inclusion and communications solutions in one seamless user experience. Recognized for its own award-winning culture, Limeade helps every employee know their company cares.

We’re committed to creating a mission-driven, positive culture of improvement made up of the best and brightest people in the business. And we’ve got the awards to back it up: Puget Sound Business Journal ranked us #1 Best Workplace in Washington, and Seattle Business ranked us one of the top three Best Companies to Work for in Washington State. We’re one of the fastest-growing companies in North America (Deloitte’s Technology Fast 500™), and Fortune magazine recognized us as a Best Workplace for Women. Learn more at 
www.limeade.com


About the role:

Limeade is looking for an experienced Database Administrator or Sr. Database Administrator to join Limeade’s production operations team. This position will be supporting our production database environments while working alongside our development teams. The Database Administrator will support Azure and AWS data stores of all kinds and should already have public cloud experience. Expertise in performance tuning and root cause analysis for production outages should be a strong skill set.

 

Responsibilities:

On-call rotation of database environments for global SaaS engagement product used 24x7x365.

Administer all aspects of database servers, including upgrading or migrating, planning for appropriate capacity, and monitoring

Ability to find and make recommendations for improving performance in code, database and server configuration, and indexing

Monitor, maintain, troubleshoot, and performance tune SQL processes

Expertise in database server internals and best practices for database architecture and physical data modeling

Maintain service level agreements for performance and reliability requirements for new and existing applications

Assist the team in deciding which database platform(s) or new features to utilize

Ability to code and review complex SQL code

Experience supporting Kimball data warehouse techniques.

Support experience in big data environment or desire to learn that includes cloud infrastructure running on Linux

Experience working in Agile development environment with source control and multiple environments

Develop and maintain a high proficiency in written and verbal communication skills

Able to work independently and as a team-player, meeting deadlines and expectations

Review existing processes and recommend changes or institute new processes

Generate high-quality project documentation, such as data models, implementation plans, design documents, support documents, etc.

Provide technical escalation and be on call via pager during designated periods

Stay abreast of industry best practices and new methods and technologies, and constantly update our own practices to take advantage of these new methods and technologies


Requirements:

Have a passion for data and desire to mentor others learn more about database systems

Ability to demonstrate our 
values
 in an on-going and consistent way

1-3 years of experience supporting BI tools like Tableau Server or PowerBI

3-5 years of experience implementing, maintaining and architecting database solutions

Experience automating repetitive tasks with SQL, PowerShell, C#, and/or Python, Bash, etc. Must be proficient at the command line

Experience designing, implementing, and maintaining SQL databases in a SaaS or e-Commerce environment

Expertise in MS SQL Server with some exposure to 2012+ versions, including typical DBA operations and query optimization via code refactoring, indexing, and partitioning

Server configuration and tuning, backup and recovery, index maintenance, performance tuning, and indexes

Solid understanding of security concepts, principles and practices in a HIPAA or other equally stringent environment

OLTP and OLAP support and design experience

Experience with cloud-based big-data warehouse services such as Redshift and Azure data lake a plus

Experience with distributed columnar databases a plus


Limeade provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, Limeade will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

title: Manager, Salesforce Architect
content:
Convoy, one of the fastest growing startups in the U.S., is transforming the $800 billion trucking industry. Convoy offers the world's largest companies the best option for moving their freight through its network of thousands of technology-connected trucking companies. Shippers get instant quotes, real-time GPS tracking on all shipments, and actionable business analytics to improve their supply chain. Trucking companies get access to free tools and resources that allow them to find loads they want, drive fuller trucks, and get paid quickly. Convoy is growing quickly and hiring in every area. Come join a company that is literally moving the world forward! 

Founded in 2015, Convoy is backed by this century's leading disruptors, including the founders and CEOs of Amazon, Salesforce, eBay, Linkedin, Expedia, Dropbox, KKR, Starbucks, and others.

About you:

We are looking for a talented Salesforce Architect to join our growing Enterprise Applications team. In this role, you will act as the lead architect in our sales systems design as well as own the implementation, maintenance, integrations, and improvement of those systems. You will drive user engagement and best practices across teams utilizing Salesforce.com and associated systems to ensure reporting requirements are met, workflow is scalable and the number of systems employees work in day to day is minimized. 

In this role, you will be involved with multiple business functional groups including Sales & Marketing, Finance, Operations, IT and manage multiple projects. You will drive and manage people and projects end to end by defining tasks, planning, configurations, conducting gap analysis, customizations, user testing, reporting metrics to sales leaders and orchestrate go-live. You will work to meet the needs of business users considering functionality, scalability, costs, time-to-implement, international growth possibilities and general systems compliance.

You Will:

Own the architecture of the current SFDC environment as well as related sales systems to ensure scalable growth and user engagement.

Work with business users, elicit requirements via interaction design sessions, business process descriptions, cases, scenarios, data analysis, and a task workflow analysis.

Own end to end implementation planning including issue management, communication and change management.

Provide thought leadership, business analysis, creative solutions with leadership buy-in and real-time execution on strategic initiatives.

Analyze departmental performance and pro-actively report findings.

Ensure data flow between systems is uninterrupted and key data points are captured in order to provide all levels of reporting across the business.

Build change control management and processes with all sales systems.

Proactively communicate project opportunities and risks to upper management.

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills in order to interface directly with business, leadership and technical staff.

You Have:

4+ years of experience on the Salesforce Platform using Sales Cloud core modules.

Preferred: 2+ years architecting solutions in large scale SFDC environment

Experience with SFDC data integrations in SQL data warehouse (Snowflake)

Lightning experience (1+ year)

Experience creating Lightning Components and coding in JavaScript and Apex

Experience creating and maintaining Triggers and Visualforce pages

Experience managing a SFDC integrated Tech Stack and AppExchange applications (Talk Desk, Outreach, LinkedIn, Marketo)

Extensive experience and knowledge of sales operations and enterprise sales models, including multi-channel distribution.

Detail-oriented but can also see the big picture. You can crunch the numbers and articulate the key takeaways in an executive summary.

Advanced data manipulation skills using Excel/Sheets and other tools. 

Worked with middleware (like Celigo, Mulesoft, Boomi) and integrating with systems 

Ability to be flexible about project changes and dynamically mitigate risks at the moment with mid-course corrective action.

Ability to manage and prioritize multiple, complex projects simultaneously and manage customer expectations regarding scope, schedule, and budgetary parameters.

Demonstrated knowledge in CRM related functional modules: Lead Management, Opportunity Management, Forecasting, and Dashboards & Reports

Working SQL knowledge and reporting/data analytics.

Preferred Certifications:

Platform Developer 2

Integration Architecture Developer

Data Architecture and Management Designer

title: Senior Data Scientist - Marketplace Pricing
content: Convoy, one of the fastest growing startups in the U.S., is transforming the $800 billion trucking industry. Convoy offers the world's largest companies the best option for moving their freight through its network of thousands of technology-connected trucking companies. Shippers get instant quotes, real-time GPS tracking on all shipments, and actionable business analytics to improve their supply chain. Trucking companies get access to free tools and resources that allow them to find loads they want, drive fuller trucks, and get paid quickly. Convoy is growing quickly and hiring in every area. Come join a company that is literally moving the world forward!
Founded in 2015, Convoy is backed by this century's leading disruptors, including the founders and CEOs of Amazon, Salesforce, eBay, Linkedin, Expedia, Dropbox, KKR, Starbucks, and others.

We are looking for experienced Data Scientists to join the Pricing Team in Convoy’s Marketplace organization. The Pricing Team owns Convoy’s core models for pricing to both shippers and carriers. You will collaborate with Research Scientists, Product Managers, Economist and Engineers across the Product organization and interact with stakeholders across the company. You will be responsible for defining core business logic in our data warehouse, developing insights to drive product decisions, building data models, and developing and analyzing experiments.
Extract insight from internal and external data sources to drive product strategy and inform modeling requirements
Own key parts of Convoy weekly business review (WBR) reporting, analysis, and deep dive
Define key business metrics that inform decisions for the broader organization
Key contributor to Convoy forecasting models and analysis
BS or MS degree in Mathematics, Statistics, or a highly quantitative discipline
At least one year of industry experience with data querying, manipulation and analysis using Python/R and SQL
Taking care of your health comes first. Convoy covers 100% of your medical, dental, and vision premiums, and 85% for your family. We also provide access to the gym and showers in our building.
Enjoy catered meals multiple times through the week, and fully stocked fridges and pantries to keep you running full.

We transport the world; the least we can do is help get you to work. Every employee receives a fully paid Orca Card to get you around on the bus, light rail, or water taxi. We also provide locked bike storage if you prefer to pedal in.

Life outside of work matters! Convoy has a flexible vacation policy, so take the time off you need- we don’t track vacation or sick time. We also offer generous parental leave for those expecting new additions to their family.
We offer market competitive compensation, including stock options and a 401k plan to help save for retirement.

Convoy is an equal-opportunity employer and we welcome applicants from all backgrounds. If you’re a passionate team player who wants to have an outsized impact on a diverse and dynamic team, we’d love to hear from you!

title: Senior Data Scientist - Shipment Acquisition & Growth
content: Convoy, one of the fastest growing startups in the U.S., is transforming the $800 billion trucking industry. We offer the world's largest companies the best option for moving their freight through our network of thousands of technology-connected trucking companies.

The Data Science team is at the core of Convoy’s business. We build the models that power freight pricing, shipment offer relevance, auction bidding strategy, and other core services. The breadth of the problems space is huge, spanning machine learning, optimization, metric definition, econometrics, and prediction domains. And we have only begun to dig into the difficult and diverse problems in our two-sided marketplace.

At Convoy you will be expected to work autonomously and own your domain end-to-end. You will collaborate with Research Scientists, Product Managers, and Engineers across the Product organization and interact with stakeholders across the company. You will be responsible for defining core business logic in our data warehouse, developing insights to drive product decisions, and building data science models.

The Shipment Acquisition and Growth team is responsible for connecting Convoy to our shippers. We build the tools, design the programs, and develop the strategies for addressing shipper's pain points and inefficiencies in the freight procurement process. By collaborating with stakeholders across the company, we unlock the ability to scale the business and be trusted partners to our shippers.
You have the following skills and experience
Minimum of 5+ years of industry experience at top-tier companies in Consulting, Business Intelligence, Data Scientist, or Analytics roles
Experience with scientific/statistical languages such as R or Python
Ability to break down high level business problems into concrete analytical solutions
Strong communication and keen attention to detail
MS in economics, statistics, computer science, operations research, engineering, a natural science or equivalent quantitative subject
Experienced in Data Visualization theory and creating narratives from data using Tableau or similar software (Looker, PowerBI, Shiny, Python, D3, etc)
Strong examples of your outputs influencing a product or engineering road-map
Taking care of your health comes first. Convoy covers 100% of your medical, dental, and vision premiums, and 85% for your family. We also provide access to the gym and showers in our building.
Enjoy catered meals multiple times through the week, and fully stocked fridges and pantries to keep you running full.

We transport the world; the least we can do is help get you to work. Every employee receives a fully paid Orca Card to get you around on the bus, light rail, or water taxi. We also provide locked bike storage if you prefer to pedal in.

Life outside of work matters! Convoy has a flexible vacation policy, so take the time off you need- we don’t track vacation or sick time. We also offer generous parental leave for those expecting new additions to their family.
We offer market competitive compensation, including stock options and a 401k plan to help save for retirement.
Candidates must be eligible to work in the U.S. at our Seattle HQ.

Convoy is an equal-opportunity employer and we welcome applicants from all backgrounds. If you’re a passionate team player who wants to have an outsized impact on a diverse and dynamic team, we’d love to hear from you!

title: Data Visualization Engineer - Shipper Insights

You get excited about creating the perfect visualization to disseminate information to clients. You are passionate and excited about getting in on the ground floor of developing a big idea and bringing it from concept to final product and demonstrating a strong sense of ownership. You love the solving the problem of deploying impactful visuals more than you are attached to any one particular solution in order to achieve that goal.

An undergraduate or Master's degree in a quantitative field (e.g. science, engineering, economics, quantitative finance, operations research, statistics, or similar) or demonstrable experience within data science and analytics.
Strong visualization skills in a variety of environments such as D3.JS, Plotly, Tableau, Django, Flask, Chart.js, etc.
Experience writing and deploying Python, Node, or Java code.
Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges and implement data solutions which scale to meet future needs.
Experience with architecting and evolving dimensional data models & schema designs to structure data for business-relevant analytics.
Experience working in very large data warehouse environments.
Strong written, verbal, and visual communication skills to concisely communicate in a way that provides context, offers insights, and minimizes misinterpretation.
The skills to work cross-functionally and push business partners to focus on realistic goals and projects.
You will design and develop data visualizations that help us extract key insights from our data, which might otherwise go unnoticed.
Create compelling, clear, and powerful visualizations of our data.
Dive into Convoy’s internal and third party data (think SQL, Python, R, Tableau) to develop solutions that will help move the business forward and enable better decisions to be made in less time.
Figure out what's important to the business, to specific partners, and intuit core needs from people before they even realize they need it.
Develop a common language and approach to analyzing and communicating information and insights across analytics teams

title: Senior Manager, Data Science - Shipper Experience
content: Convoy, one of the fastest growing startups in the U.S., is transforming the $800 billion trucking industry. Convoy offers the world's largest companies the best option for moving their freight through its network of thousands of technology-connected trucking companies. Shippers get instant quotes, real-time GPS tracking on all shipments, and actionable business analytics to improve their supply chain. Trucking companies get access to free tools and resources that allow them to find loads they want, drive fuller trucks, and get paid quickly. Convoy is growing quickly and hiring in every area. Come join a company that is literally moving the world forward!
Founded in 2015, Convoy is backed by this century's leading disruptors, including the founders and CEOs of Amazon, Salesforce, eBay, Linkedin, Expedia, Dropbox, KKR, Starbucks, and others.

Economists, Analysts, and Data Scientists are at the core of Convoy’s platform. We build the models that power freight pricing, shipment offer relevance, auction bidding strategy, and other core services. We also forecast business metrics, evaluate the causal impact of business decisions, design experiments to optimize our product, and leverage our data to generate insights for our customers. The breadth of the problems space is huge, spanning machine learning, optimization, causal inference, experimental design, econometrics, and prediction domains. We have only begun to dig into the difficult and diverse problems in our two-sided marketplace.

As we scale our data teams, we need experienced managers and technical leaders to mentor and develop our talent. We also need thought leaders with a vision for leveraging data science to optimize every aspect of our business. We are looking for player-coaches who can transition effortlessly between owning their projects end-to-end and team management.

At Convoy, we are a highly aligned team that operates in a fast-paced environment and pivots where needed to focus on what matters most. You will work with high signal-to-noise data to power your deep dive research, modeling, and experimentation projects. If you are interested in joining a company that is integrating economic insights and data science into the core of its business, while leveraging technology to drive efficiencies in a critical sector of the economy, let’s talk.
In this role, you will do the following:
Partner Deeply with PMs to help them understand their key drivers.
Be a key voice and advocate for data-driven decision making
Recruit, Retain, Develop, and Motivate our talent
Build a diverse and empowered analytics culture
Be in the trenches, doing the dirty work, alongside your direct reports
Create and maintain systems to elevate best practices and walk the walk in your own contributions.
You have the following skills & experience:
BS or Advanced Degree in Economics, Finance, Statistics, Computer Science, Operations Research, a natural science or equivalent quantitative subject
10+ years of experience leveraging quantitative analysis, analytics, and data science to solve business problems
5+ years of experience managing data scientists/analysts/economists
Experience with scientific/statistical languages such as R or Python
Intelligent but practical; you want to get things done and love simplicity
You are a leader and will speak up where needed
You have a habit of bias-to-action
Experience with two-sided markets (platforms) and other economic theory
Experience in bidding and pricing (e.g., quant experience)
Experience in Data Visualization with Tableau or similar software
Taking care of your health comes first. Convoy covers 100% of your medical, dental, and vision premiums, and 85% for your family. We also provide access to the gym and showers in our building.
Enjoy catered meals multiple times through the week, and fully stocked fridges and pantries to keep you running full.

We transport the world; the least we can do is help get you to work. Every employee receives a fully paid Orca Card to get you around on the bus, light rail, or water taxi. We also provide locked bike storage if you prefer to pedal in.

title: Sr. Manager, Research Science - Marketplace Matching
content: Convoy, one of the fastest growing startups in the U.S., is transforming the $800 billion trucking industry. Convoy offers the world's largest companies the best option for moving their freight through its network of thousands of technology-connected trucking companies. Shippers get instant quotes, real-time GPS tracking on all shipments, and actionable business analytics to improve their supply chain. Trucking companies get access to free tools and resources that allow them to find loads they want, fully utilize their trucks, and get paid quickly. Convoy is growing rapidly and hiring in every area. Come join a company that is literally moving the world forward!

Founded in 2015, Convoy is backed by this century's leading disruptors, including Google's CapitalG and the founders and CEOs of Amazon, Salesforce, eBay, Linkedin, Expedia, Dropbox, KKR, Starbucks, and others.

Research Science is at the core of Convoy’s platform. We build the models that power freight pricing, shipment offer relevance, auction bidding strategy, and other core services. We also forecast business metrics, evaluate the causal impact of business decisions, design experiments to optimize our product, and leverage our data to generate insights for our customers. The breadth of the problems space is huge, spanning machine learning, optimization, causal inference, experimental design, economics, and prediction domains. We have only begun to dig into the difficult and diverse problems in our two-sided marketplace.

We are looking for an experienced Research Science Manager to join the Matching Team in Convoy’s Marketplace organization. The Matching Team owns Convoy’s core models for matching carriers and freight, including dynamic brokerage and automated reloads. This role has the potential to unlock significant value for the company by scaling a team of talented Research and Data Scientists as we double-down on the core algorithms that drive our business.

If you are interested in joining a company that is integrating economic insights and data science into the core of its business, while leveraging technology to drive efficiencies in a critical sector of the economy, let’s talk.

PhD in Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Electrical Engineering, Operations Research, a natural science, or equivalent quantitative subject

Intelligent but practical; you want to get things done and love simplicity

title: Engineering Manager - Demand and Revenue
content:
Convoy is transforming the $800 billion trucking industry. Our mission is to transport the world with endless capacity and zero waste. The industry is huge and so is the opportunity to fundamentally change the way freight moves across America and beyond for the better.

We are passionate about thinking big and solving really complex problems to make the lives of truck drivers, shippers and other people in freight industry easier through our innovation and technology. There will always be a better, more efficient way to transport goods, and we won’t ever stop inventing it.

Founded in 2015, we’re a mission-driven, well-funded, fast-growing startup, backed by world-class investors, including CapitalG, the growth equity investment fund of Google, and leading industry disruptors, including the founders and CEOs of Amazon, Salesforce, eBay, Linkedin, Expedia, Dropbox, KKR, Starbucks, and others. We were named one of Washington State’s top places to work, a LinkedIn Top Startup and were the recipient of the GeekWire Next Tech Titan in 2018.

If working with smart, values-driven people to transform an entire industry sounds like something you’re into, come join Convoy, and help literally move the world forward!

The Demand and Revenue teams own all the shipper-related products and projects of Convoy’s Marketplace. We are focused on working with large enterprise shippers, and also the long tail of small and medium businesses that use Convoy’s marketplace to handle their transportation needs. This entails working on innovative new products, such as Convoy Go, or introducing creative new ways for enterprises to work with technology, such as Dynamic Backup. As the gatekeeper of all incoming revenue for Convoy, the team works closely with business and finance teams to help growth. At the same time, the team is also responsible for building scalable platforms that help us create innovative new offerings for our shippers that integrate into their existing workflows. We’re focused on maintaining a high quality, robust, and industry leading user experience, while also having the flexibility to innovate and make bets that might help shape the way transportation works. Convoy is experiencing significant growth, and we are looking for leaders to help us shepherd us through this phase of hyper-growth.

Now is the perfect time for you to come be a part of our high-caliber engineering team as we work to realize this massive vision.

Who you are:

Ideal candidates will be driven, empathetic leaders with experience building and managing world-class teams of diverse engineers. They will also have a passion for understanding the needs of our customers, our business and our engineers, to determine the strategic path forward for our team. They will enjoy leading the careers of extraordinary software developers, collaborating with diverse stakeholders, and will bring a growth mindset and strong learning orientation. Additionally, they will be part of the engineering leadership team @ Convoy, and help shape the growth of the broader engineering organization.

You will own:

Manage a software platform engineering team within Convoy’s Demand and Revenue organization

Develop and deliver on customer focused, high impact roadmaps for your team that will delight internal and external customers

Help your team build and manage foundational frameworks, patterns, and technologies that help our company create the best app experiences at scale

Contribute to a culture of technical excellence at Convoy

Build trust with various stakeholders and tackle cross-org problems

Mentor and provide career growth for your engineers

You have the following experience:

4+ years managing software engineering teams that operate at scale

Excellent project management skills to help teams deliver on time

Strong people management skills to recruit, manage and develop talent

BS degree or higher in Computer Science/Engineering or equivalent experience

Strong communication skills to interface with technical and non-technical stakeholders

Ability to create an inclusive environment to help all members on your team thrive.


Convoy is an equal-opportunity employer and we welcome applicants from all backgrounds. If you’re a passionate team player who wants to have an outsized impact on a diverse and dynamic team, we’d love to hear from you!

content:
Convoy is transforming the $800 billion trucking industry. Our mission is to transport the world with endless capacity and zero waste. The industry is huge and so is the opportunity to fundamentally change the way freight moves across America and beyond for the better.

The Engineering Security team is responsible for the overall application and data security of Convoy’s services. We are focused on finding, fixing, and preventing application vulnerabilities as well as continually improving the secure software development lifecycle followed by all of Engineering at Convoy.

What you'll do:

Instill and empower a culture of secure development and deployment across Engineering through static and dynamic code review, threat modeling, and penetration testing.

Supply subject matter expertise during system design and implementation on topics like encryption in transit and at rest, least privilege access control, and secure-by-default configuration.

Develop automation, tooling, and tests to validate best practices.

Respond to security incidents and responsible disclosures.

Work side-by-side with every development and operations team inside the company.

Desired skills and experience:

3+ years of industry experience in a security or software engineering role.

Web or mobile application penetration testing.

Broad security domain knowledge in common application vulnerabilities (OWASP Top 10) and their mitigations.

Proficient in any common scripting language.

An understanding and continued interest in common attacker techniques, tools, and behaviors.

The ability to dive deep into new technologies and learn quickly.

Strong written and verbal communication skills to communicate with all levels of the organization.


Convoy is an equal-opportunity employer and we welcome applicants from all backgrounds. If you’re a passionate team player who wants to have an outsized impact on a diverse and dynamic team, we’d love to hear from you!

Candidates must be eligible to work at Convoy HQ in Seattle.

title: Data Scientist- Analytics, Quality & Compliance
content:
Convoy, one of the fastest growing startups in the U.S., is transforming the $800 billion trucking industry. Convoy offers the world’s largest companies the best option for moving their freight through its network of thousands of technology-connected trucking companies. Shippers get instant quotes, real-time GPS tracking on all shipments, and actionable business analytics to improve their supply chain. Trucking companies get access to free tools and resources that allow them to find loads they want, drive fuller trucks, and get paid quickly. Convoy is growing quickly and hiring in every area. Come join a company that is literally moving the world forward! 

Founded in 2015, Convoy is backed by this century’s leading disruptors, including the founders and CEOs of Amazon, Salesforce, eBay, Linkedin, Expedia, Dropbox, KKR, Starbucks, and others.

About Quality and Compliance:

Quality and Compliance is critical to Convoy's success, playing a role in every Convoy operational team. The Q&C team maintains and fosters a high-quality network of tens of thousands of trucking companies and helps to mitigate risk to Convoy and its customers. We provide analysis, research and guidance for Convoy as it expands into new geographies, services, and equipment types, and as trucking regulations change. The team comprises of people from diverse backgrounds and ways of thinking, pulling from the transportation industry, software, startups, and retail. We hire people who fit the attributes and values that we hold in high regard such as creative problem solving, outcome orientation, teamwork, humility, and great communication.

About You:

You thrive on solving problems and are skilled and experienced in analytics. You are curious, detail-oriented, and have high-quality standards. Seeing tangible results from your hard work is important for you. You are a problem solver and a generalist who is equally as comfortable talking to a truck driver as you are analyzing trends in a spreadsheet. You are good at process improvement and cross-team collaboration. You are a confident and skilled communicator. You understand why Convoy is the future of freight and are excited to take us to the next level!

You'll take ownership of:

Analysis and research projects to inform quality efforts/supply performance (i.e. on time, load completion, technology use), carrier engagement, and compliance (i.e. insurance, operating authority, safety scores).

Design, execute, and measure experiments to improve supply performance and scale experiments into automated features.

Identify trends across quantitative and qualitative data.

Create and administer audits of our internal processes.

Analysis and administration of carrier performance assessment program.

Track company compliance and performance metrics and report weekly.

Carrier outreach about performance and safety.

Provide support and guidance to internal operations and sales team members.

Responding to real-time load issues as they arise.

You have the following skills and experience:

Bachelor's degree and/or 4+ years in the military.

Minimum 2-5 years of data analysis and reporting experience.

Demonstrated ability to design and implement iterative data-and-customer-feedback based experiments.

Advanced ability to write SQL queries.

Advanced Excel user.

Moderate to advanced knowledge of statistics concepts - and demonstrated ability to put them into practice.

Experience with R and/or Python programing languages is a plus.

Demonstrated ability to identify problems, formulate strategies and tactics to solve problems, execute on those strategies and tactics, and measure the results.

Transportation operations/startup/tech experience a plus.

Excellent written and cross-functional communication skills.

A positive, tenacious and proactive attitude. Every individual on the team contributes to the team roadmap and mission.


Convoy is an equal-opportunity employer and we welcome applicants from all backgrounds. If you’re a passionate team player who wants to have an outsized impact on a diverse and dynamic team, we’d love to hear from you!

Convoy’s Data Science team is looking for a talented data engineering leader with a strong background in ETL, data warehousing, data architecture, and interest in collaborating with Data Scientists to evolve the data foundation for our business. The ideal candidate will have built and led teams of Data Engineers in dynamic business environments.
In this role you will own the following:
Thought leadership around the effective management, operation, innovation, and evolution of our data warehouse and data platform.
Architecture design and implementation of next generation data platform and model deployment solutions.
Building robust and scalable data integration (ETL) pipelines using SQL, EMR, Python, and Spark.
Hiring, mentoring, and developing other Data Engineers.
Building and delivering high quality data architecture to support data analysts, data scientists, and customer reporting needs.
Interfacing with other technology teams to extract, transform, and load data from a wide variety of data sources.
Continually improving reporting and analysis processes, automating or simplifying self-service support for customers
You have the following skills & experience:
Bachelor's degree or higher in an engineering or technical field such as Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, or Statistics.
5+ years of experience managing and developing teams of Data Engineers.
5+ years of relevant IC experience in one of the following areas: data engineering, database engineering, business intelligence, or business analytics.
10+ years of hands-on experience in writing and optimizing SQL queries for a production environment.
Extensive experience in scripting languages like Python.
Experience with data modeling, ETL development, and Data warehousing.
Experience with Snowflake, Redshift, or similar.
Experience with AWS services such as ECS, S3, and RDS.
Experience with Big Data Technologies (e.g. Spark, Hadoop, Hive, etc.)
You have experience with working and delivering end-to-end projects independently.
Knowledge of distributed systems as it pertains to data storage and computing.
Taking care of your health comes first. Convoy covers 100% of your medical, dental, and vision premiums, and 85% for your family. We also provide access to the gym and showers in our building.
Enjoy catered meals multiple times through the week, and fully stocked fridges and pantries to keep you running full.

We transport the world; the least we can do is help get you to work. Every employee receives a fully paid Orca Card to get you around on the bus, light rail, or water taxi. We also provide locked bike storage if you prefer to pedal in.

Life outside of work matters! Convoy has a flexible vacation policy, so take the time off you need- we don’t track vacation or sick time. We also offer generous parental leave for those expecting new additions to their family.
We offer market competitive compensation, including stock options and a 401k plan to help save for retirement.
Candidates must be eligible to work at Convoy HQ in Seattle.

Convoy is an equal-opportunity employer and we welcome applicants from all backgrounds. If you’re a passionate team player who wants to have an outsized impact on a diverse and dynamic team, we’d love to hear from you!

title: Program Manager - Data Science and Design
content: Convoy, one of the fastest growing startups in the U.S., is transforming the $800 billion trucking industry. We offer the world's largest companies the best option for moving their freight through our network of thousands of technology-connected trucking companies.

The Data Science team is at the core of Convoy’s platform. We build the models that power freight pricing, shipment offer relevance, auction bidding strategy, and other core services. The breadth of the problems space is huge, spanning machine learning, optimization, metric definition, econometrics, and analytics domains. And we have only begun to dig into the difficult and diverse problems in our two-sided marketplace.

As Program Manager for Convoy's Data Science and Design teams, you will develop and manage programs that support the growth of the teams and our team members. This will include partnering with stakeholders to roll-out best-in-class programs for the career evolution of the team members, such as recruitment and career development process optimization, and programming our events schedule from lunch & learns and knowledge shares to internal and external data science conferences. You will also work with the team's leadership to set and track goals and pursue projects that benefit the entire Data Science and Design teams.
You are an expert program manager able to influence stakeholders and drive programs quickly and efficiently to completion
You are open-minded, thoughtful and curious
You are an excellent communicator, able to utilize and identify the most appropriate communication channels and to adjust your style based on your audience
You are outgoing and communicate effectively in front of small and large groups
You believe in the power of a diverse team and you love to make others feel welcome

You have extensive experience building and running successful community outreach and professional development programs for data scientists and/or designers
You have built strong, impactful internal and external people networks
You have 3+ years experience in project and program management roles
Enhance the external visibility of Convoy's Data Science and Design teams as exciting and supportive
Design and manage programs for Convoy's Data Science and Design teams that foster collaboration, efficiency, and innovation

Partner with business stakeholders to develop, optimize, and maintain career-lifecycle frameworks and processes such as on-boarding new-hires, developing training programs/materials, and managing the career development process
Manage communications and media programs for Convoy's Data Science and Design teams, such as websites, apps, videos, and blogs

title: Head of Shipper Insights
content:
Convoy, one of the fastest growing startups in the U.S., is transforming the $800 billion trucking industry. Founded in 2015, Convoy is backed by this century's leading disruptors, including the founders and CEOs of Amazon, Salesforce, eBay, Linkedin, Expedia, Dropbox, KKR, Starbucks, and others. Convoy offers the world's largest companies the best option for moving their freight through its network of via thousands of technology-connected trucking companies.

Shippers get instant quotes, real-time GPS tracking on all shipments, and actionable business analytics to improve their supply chain. Trucking companies get access to free tools and resources that allow them to find loads they want, drive fuller trucks, and get paid quickly. Convoy is growing quickly and hiring in every area. Come join a company that is literally moving the world forward! 

As the Head of Shipper Insights, you’ll define the vision and build the foundation for Convoy’s Shipper insights program. You’ll collaborate with our Sales and Account Management teams to develop and deliver world-class supply-chain / transportation insights that solve meaningful customer problems. You’ll collaborate with our Data and Product teams to build the necessary infrastructure - data tools, visualization, customer reports, etc. to build and deliver these insights at scale. You’ll collaborate with our Marketplace and marketing teams to develop and publish our POV on market trends and the industry as such and reinforce Convoy’s position as a thought leader in this space. Build a team from the ground-up - attract, retain and develop world-class insights team

 You have the following skills and experience:

BS or Advanced Degree in Economics, Finance, Statistics, Computer Science, Operations Research, a natural science or equivalent quantitative subject

10+ years of experience leveraging quantitative analysis, analytics, and data science to solve business problems, preferably in a customer-facing role

5+ years of experience managing teams of both technical and non-technical resources 

Experience building and scaling large-scale strategic and cross-functional programs from the ground-up

Comfortable crafting customer stories / strategy from data and influencing business decisions 

Excellent written and oral communication skills; able to drive collaboration and commitment across disparate groups with competing priorities

Intelligent but practical; you want to get things done and love simplicity

You are a leader and will speak up where needed

You have a habit of bias-to-action

Bonus skills and experience:

Experience with scientific/statistical languages such as R or Python

Experience with two-sided markets (platforms) and other economic theory

Experience working with / influencing and presenting to external VP-level / C-Suite stakeholders


Convoy is an equal-opportunity employer and we are actively seeking a diverse team. If you're a collaborative team player who wants to have an outsized impact with a small, tight-knit team, we'd love to hear from you!

title: Graphics Engineer Intern
content: As an Environment Engineering Graphics Intern, you will help build future generations of graphics technology. You will learn our engine’s capabilities, and help us expand the Environment and Terrain system to empower Unity game developers to craft incredible visual experiences. Most importantly, you will work with an exciting and high-energy team to create the best and most technologically-impressive real-time experiences and games in the world.
Invent, and extend terrain and environment features, workflows, and tools
Develop production-quality code and public documentation
Design powerful and extensible public APIs
Collaborate with a cross-discipline team and work closely with technical artists to create highly productive and effective art and content workflows
Experience working with C# or C++
Knowledge of shading languages such as HLSL, Metal, or GLSL
Familiarity with Unity’s engine and tools
Experience developing tools or user interfaces
Projects using terrain or particle systems

Unity is the creator of the world’s most widely-used real-time 3D (RT3D) development platform, providing content creators around the world with the tools they need to build rich, interactive 2D, 3D, VR and AR experiences. In fact, apps made with Unity reach 2.7 billion devices worldwide,
and were installed more than 24 billion times in the last 12 months.
The global engineering team keeps Unity at the forefront of technology and — working
alongside partners like Magic Leap, Google, Facebook, Oculus and Microsoft — ensures optimized support for the latest technology and platforms.
Unity is powering the real-time revolution, expanding beyond games and breaking into other industries including automotive, film, architecture, engineering, construction and more.

Unity is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. If there are preparations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.

Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this Web site or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.

title: Senior Gameplay Engineer
content: Do you love both games and code? Do you enjoy collaborating closely with creative talent?

As a gameplay engineer at Unity, you will work on productions to drive forward the development of cutting edge features and workflows making it easier for creators to design new worlds, gameplay, and characters. You will learn our engine’s capabilities, then help us expand them by building compelling gameplay that showcases the best way to use new features and pipelines so other Unity users can easily craft incredible visual experiences. You will work closely with Unity developers to really push the boundaries of what is possible in Unity. You will implement new Unity features, or optimize current features in conjunction with our development team. You will be involved in prototyping new game mechanics, architecting new gameplay systems, researching game technology and workflows - whatever it takes to create amazing game experiences. Most importantly, you will work with an exciting and high-energy team and use the best and most technologically-impressive real-time experiences and games in the world.
Experience the excitement of Unity real-time graphics by exploring samples from our projects from
Baymax Dreams of Too Many Baymaxes
You can also learn about the latest in Unity Graphics from our keynotes from
Real or rendered? Real-time ray tracing
Introduction to the Universal Render Pipeline
Creating your own shaders with Shader Graph
Fast particle rendering with VFX Graph
Stay tuned for even more amazing graphics coming in the near future!
Work directly with engineers, artists, and designers to create fun gameplay that feels good
Own integrating the full stack of Unity technologies to enable the development of new productions
Write software within a diverse set of systems: weapons sandbox, player controls, UI, online services, player progression, etc, on as needed per-project basis

Proficient in C#, C/C++ is also a bonus

Data is the foundation of our business in AI @ Unity. We are looking for a Data Scientist to join our centralized data science team that supports multiple products and teams at Unity. As a member of our team, you will be responsible for understanding and analyzing large volumes of data and developing models to solve business problems across Unity. Our team develops and implements machine learning models to production and intuitively makes decisions around what approaches to take in solving hard problems.

 Among some of the problems we solve are player and developer profiling, improving Unity developer retention, personalizing developer experiences, pricing optimization, and overall improving use of the Unity engine!

If you have experience working in industry as a data scientist, building and implementing machine learning models, and are excited about impacting the gaming industry then we want to talk with you!


Responsibilities


Develop and implement machine learning models

Collaborate closely with product, business, and engineering teams to identify data science opportunities and solutions

Conduct in-depth statistical analyses, including A/B testing

Effectively communicate (both written and verbally) technical concepts across multiple teams

Think creatively and be able to test out new ideas and iterate rapidly

Requirements

2 years of professional experience as a Data Scientist or Machine Learning Engineer working on developing, optimizing, and implementing machine learning models for at least 2 projects

Professional experience with machine learning libraries such as scikit-learn or mllib

Professional experience implementing multiple machine learning models in a production environment

Bachelor’s in Data Science, Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Economics, Computer Science or equivalent experience

Deep understanding of statistical concepts and applying them to real-world problems

Bonus points

Master’s degree or PhD in Data Science, Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Economics, Computer Science or another quantitative discipline

Experience with petabytes of data

Experience with deep learning frameworks such as tensorflow or keras

title: SOC Analyst
content: The Unity Security Operations Center is seeking an experienced SOC Analyst. We are building our SOC from the ground up, and as one of the first Analysts in our first location, the successful applicant will have the opportunity to drive decisions and help create the processes that we will use moving forward around the globe.

This position requires the ability and interest to investigate incidents from end-to-end, starting with an alert or notification and working backwards to root cause, creating a timeline, inventory of affected systems, explanation of methods used by the attacker, etc. Support from another Analyst in the same time zone will be available, as well as experts from other Security teams, such as Infrastructure Security and Application Security.

Our roadmap calls for achieving around-the-clock coverage by having analysts located in different timezones. However, as with all Security positions at Unity, occasional off-hours work will be necessary in critical situations.
Investigate alerts, perform root cause analysis
Forensic investigation, such as log and PCAP analysis
Evaluate potential tools for use in SOC
Author tools and scripts as needed
Experience monitoring and responding to events in a SOC
Experience with one or more cloud platforms
Ability to understand and make use of vulnerability data (CVEs, OWASP, etc.)
Proficiency with Linux system administration, including networks, and software
Proficiency with one or more scripting languages, such as Python or Ruby
Working knowledge of fundamental Internet protocols (TCP/IP, HTTP, DNS, etc.)

title: Software Engineer, Backend
content: As a Software Engineer at Unity Technologies, you will work with other engineers closely to push the boundaries of what is possible in Unity. You will have the opportunity to implement new features in Unity Engine and Services or optimize current features in conjunction with our partners. As part of a complex, geographically distributed company you will have the opportunity to work with many different teams, in many different regions so it’s important that you enjoy meeting new people and are open to the possibility of traveling to visit our many office locations.

The Unity Genesis team provides the backend platform support for many teams throughout all of Unity Technologies. We have built and maintain the Subscription System, Asset Store, Licenses and Activation, the Connect Community, Unity Learn, etc. While the Licenses and Activation system is our immediate focus for the role you will potentially have the opportunity to work with all of our systems. Qualified candidates will have a passion for backend and full-stack development and will have experience working with modern server-side technologies (e.g., Java, Node.js) to help build and/or maintain revenue earning systems.

title: Software Developer Intern, Data @ Unity
content: Data on a massive scale is at the “heart” of Unity. It is data that allows our developers to critique and improve their games, and it is data that allows our developers to monetize all their hard work.

Our Data Platform Team empowers customers internal and external through data - data about the games and the hundreds of millions of people who play them. Our team aims to provide a highly scalable data collection and processing system, track relevant metadata and statistics, and provide multiple consumption modes tailored to customer use cases.

We work closely with machine learning experts and data scientists to extract as much value as possible from our data. You will be working on some of the most interesting and bold problems with a team that is dedicated to providing our customers with the data they need to succeed.
We’re looking for exceptional interns to join the
team to help us build a world-class Data Platform.

Design, implement, test, and maintain Unity’s Data Platform and associated services that are capable of handling real-time and batch processing for petabytes of data over events on the order of billions daily
Writing high-quality, clean code that is production-grade
Proven hands-on software engineering experience in Java, Scala, or similar languages
Strong foundation in data structures, algorithms, and software design
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Experience with Kubernetes, Terraform, Salt etc
Experience with at least one public cloud platform like AWS, GCP, Azure

title: Senior Software Engineer, Empowerment
content:
Unity’s Engineering Productivity team helps developers across the entire company quickly build high-quality systems that in turn help game developers around the world create great interactive experiences.

We’re looking for a Senior Software Engineer for this team, which supports the development pipeline within all of Unity. You will design, review, and implement software solutions for critical parts of our infrastructure ecosystem. You will partner closely with multiple stakeholders to support new features and manage capacity and uptime. You'll also be driving opportunities for new technologies, cost savings, and operational transparency. System reliability and efficiency should be top of mind. You'll achieve this by implementing better monitoring for fault detection and performance degradation throughout our entire infrastructure.

Work on deployment pipeline including but not limited to GitLab, artifactory, terraform, and Salt

Develop software and systems to increase engineering software quality and velocity

Optimize existing deployment infrastructure

Participate in on-call rotations to ensure system uptime

Knowledge of cloud computing

Preference for simplicity and quality when delivering software

title: Senior Software Developer, Professional Services
content: Unity's Professional Services team is looking for developers to collaboratively develop innovative software with Unity's largest customers across a variety of different industries, including gaming, defense, automotive, and architecture.

This role will focus on building cutting-edge AR applications using Unity that can thrive in a highly mobile, low connectivity environment. You’ll partner with industry veterans to work on critical performance-sensitive components that demonstrate Unity best practices. In addition, we’ll rely on your direct feedback working with our top partners to help shape the road map for future versions of the Unity Engine.
If you're technically skilled, customer-focused, and an excellent communicator, this job is for you.
Deliver high-quality code components that will power the client and frontend AR experiences
Partner with industry-leading engineers, artists, producers and designers to engineer solutions on state-of-the-art next-generation hardware, sensors, and software
Profile, isolate, then resolve performance bottlenecks to help applications reach target resolution / FPS goals
Incorporate the latest AI, machine learning, and computer vision capabilities as needed
Create prototypes to demonstrate new Unity features and potential solutions
Analyze the Unity Engine source code to keep your skills and knowledge up-to-date
Experience of using Unity in AAA games or other commercial products
Strong C# and C++ coding background
Debugging ability across different technology stacks, in multithreaded environments
Strong understanding of 3D math, and working knowledge of the 3D rendering pipeline, as it pertains to computer graphics

title: Unity Game Developer (Contract)
content: Today more than ever, successful games need to leverage cloud services. From indie titles with light social features to massively multiplayer games with millions of concurrent users, the majority of highly successful games require integration with online services.

Our vision is to enable new kinds of games and make online experiences accessible to more developers by reducing technical barriers. Our solutions are built to scale to hundreds of millions of users and provide the extreme levels of customization that today’s most creative games require.

We are in search of an experienced Unity engineer to help design and build sample games and tutorials that showcase Unity’s new cloud technologies. These samples will introduce developers to our online services and demonstrate the best way to make modern, online experiences in a full-featured vertical slice.

Join a small multidisciplinary team focused on rapid development utilizing exciting technologies for matchmaking, game server hosting, live content updates, player challenges and more. The ideal candidate is a well-rounded engineer experienced in Unity game development, rapid prototyping, and collaborating with a team of artists, engineers, and producers.
Develop core gameplay systems for sample game vertical slices
Integrate Connected Games and other bleeding-edge online service offerings
Ensure that the projects structure, assets, and pipelines meet the high standards that an example project should demonstrate
Be ready to roll up your sleeves and do anything within your power to ensure the samples are the highest quality possible
Built and released a complete game or experience using Unity
Networking experience with multiplayer and/or services integrations
Broad programming skillset areas such as UI, gameplay, AI, and basic graphics
Experience working on a multidisciplinary team

title: Software Developer, Collaboration Team Merge Tools (New Grad)
content: Game creation is a collaborative process that involves groups of contributors. Having the right tools and workflows is essential to making a successful game.

Our Collaboration Team is responsible for products involving multi-user workflow within the Unity Editor. We build tools that empower creators to work on the same scenes and assets without conflicting with each other.

As a Software Developer on the Collaboration Team working on Merge Tools you will work with a small group of other developers, product managers, and user experience (UX) experts to provide quality work flow for merging Unity Assets. You will build intuitive UI on top of a merge tool sdk that lets artists and designers put together work from multiple contributors. This is a key technology in enabling customers to easily collaborate in their development efforts.
Collaboratively design and implement quality merge workflows within the Unity Editor.
Work closely with UX Designers and Product Managers to provide the best possible workflows for our customers.
Passion for creating intuitive, efficient tool workflows to solve complex problems
Ability to adapt to new technologies and tasks
Ability to accept tasks and work independently to accomplish those tasks
Ability to work in a collaborative, team environment
Experience working in a cross-disciplinary team
Strong initiative and ability to work independently

title: Senior Graphics Engineer, Mobile
content:
Every person at Unity is enabled to work on exciting and challenging projects. After all, democratizing game development is no easy feat, but it is fun - and overall, incredibly rewarding. Our teams around the world focus on a common question: how do we continuously improve the tools and technology for our community of customers?

We work with developers, artists, and entrepreneurs worldwide to bring a visually-stunning, easily-deployable, and powerful development platform to its users.

We are looking for an experienced Mobile Graphics Engineer to join the Unity Mobile game engine R&D team. You will be working on the most widely used games engine available and helping to extend the foundation for high fidelity mobile graphics which will be deployed to billions of devices around the world.

You have worked on high-performance graphics rendering and engine level tech on mobile or console platforms in the past and you know the importance of writing fast and maintainable code. If you are also looking to put these skills in the hands of millions of developers using Unity around the world you have come to the right place.

 Responsibilities

Design and implement high-quality software products and services for games used by hundreds of millions of players every day

Develop and optimize graphics features on mobile devices, extend integration of platform-specific APIs

Collaborate in architectural decisions

Interface with multiple internal teams to ensure all company and product needs are met within the timelines and budgets outlined

Requirements

Deep understanding and experience with at least one modern graphics API (12, Vulkan, Metal, OpenGL ES)

Native game development experience (e.g. Consoles/PC/Mobile)

Strong skills working with low-level C++, C or Objective C code

Cross-platform development experience and familiar with platform-specific graphics debugging and profiling tools

Performance-minded development, code profiling, and optimization skills

Bonus points

Professional mobile graphics software development experience (native Android or iOS)

Knowledge of mobile CPU and GPU architectures

Experience using the Unity engine and tools

Ability to quickly adapt to new technologies and tasks

Experience with shader authoring and optimization

Native embedded systems development

Strong initiative and ability to work independently

Ability to travel to visit partners or other Unity offices

Who we are

Unity is the creator of the world’s most widely-used real-time 3D (RT3D) development platform, providing content creators around the world with the tools they need to build rich, interactive 2D, 3D, VR and AR experiences. title: Graphics Engineer (Shader Graph)
content: Do you enjoy empowering creative talent with cutting-edge graphics tools, workflows, and features? Would you like to enable content creators to harness the ever growing power of graphics hardware on current and future platforms? Are you excited to engage directly with development customers to gather requirements, obtain feedback, and iterate new systems to a polished sheen? Would you like to work on daring visuals that inspire generations to come, sitting next to top industry talent, at a company that cares deeply about work-life balance?

Imagine a tiny team of developers creating amazing AAA-quality content all by themselves! Imagine being freed from the tedium of repetitive tasks, unconstrained by manual processes, driven only by their creativity to fulfill their vision! That is the world we at Unity want to create. And we need your help to create it. By leveraging the latest research in real-time rendering, our Graphics team wants to empower developers and artists to create high-quality content with ease and intuitiveness without any repetitious drudgery.

As a Graphics Engineer at Unity working on shader systems such as Shader Graph, you will help build future generations of graphics technology. You will learn our engine’s capabilities, then help us expand them to empower Unity game developers to craft incredible visual experiences through our shader and material systems. Most importantly, you will work with an exciting and high-energy team to create the best and most technologically-impressive real-time experiences and games in the world.
Experience the excitement of Unity real-time graphics by exploring samples from our projects from
Baymax Dreams of Too Many Baymaxes
You can also learn about the latest in Unity Graphics from our keynotes from GDC 2019, Unite LA 2018, Unite Berlin 2018, GDC 2018.
Real or renderered? Real-time ray tracing
Introduction to the Lightweight Render Pipeline
Creating your own shaders with Shader Graph
Fast particle rendering with VFX Graph
Stay tuned for even more amazing graphics coming in the near future!
Invent, extend, and maintain shading features, workflows, and tools
Develop and maintain production-quality code, public documentation and tests
Design powerful and extensible public APIs
Extend and improve project architecture with modular system designs
Collaborate with a cross-discipline team and work closely with technical artists to create highly productive and effective art and content workflows
Experience with C# and modern graphics shading languages (HLSL/GLSL/Metal/SPIR-V) on PC, mobile platforms or recent console architectures
Computer Science degree and/or a degree in a relevant field, or equivalent experience
You’ve worked on AAA games as a graphics or tools programmer
Modern graphics API knowledge (i.e. DX12, Vulkan, Metal)
Experience with developing artist-facing tools and workflows, especially a shading system or node graph-based UI
Data-driven design, architecture and cross-platform development experience (i.e. console, PC, mobile)
Experience using Unity’s engine and tools
Detailed knowledge of one or more modern CPU and GPU architectures

We are product-driven, curious, and creative. We aggressively re-invest in development to keep Unity moving and evolving - from expanding usability and power, to platform reach. With over a billion installs per month, Unity touches gamers and non-gamers alike. As well as video games, our software is used in industries as diverse as medicine, visualization and shopping - democratizing game development while solving hard problems and enabling success for a huge range of developers worldwide.

Today, Unity has expanded to over 15 international offices and has employees in 23 countries. Every person at Unity Technologies has an inherent passion and driven spirit and it isn’t enough to be able to do the job- we’re looking for people that color outside the lines, are looking to be freed from the process tangle, and can dream big!

title: Infrastructure Security Manager
content: Unity is growing rapidly and is seeking a Manager of the Infrastructure Security team. This is a key role in ensuring Unity’s Cloud infrastructure meets and exceeds solid security standards. The role requires collaboration with other teams and business units across Unity’s global business.
In this role you will be a hands-on leader of a team of InfraSec professionals and will collaborate with teams in the US, Asia, UK & Europe to develop and maintain our infrastructure.
You will lead a team of InfraSec specialists to
partner with engineering and service teams. Your team will provide guidance and best practices, automate security at scale, and make secure development and deployment easier.
Develop security documentation, training, and guidance for internal infrastructure and development teams
Develop technical security guidance documents and standards for engineers
Identify and implement security technical and process improvements
Architect, build, automate, and operate automated security controls and review capabilities
Design and develop security tooling automation to enable the security team to operate at scale
Consult with internal teams and assist with architecture, threat modeling, and reviewing systems and infrastructure
Participate in the Security Leadership team and assure that InfraSec’s work is properly prioritized per Security roadmap, identify and justify key elements for the InfraSec roadmap
Assure that InfraSec resources are well-trained and have a clear understanding of their assignments and expectations
Proven leadership skills and team management
Knowledge of security issues and threat landscape
Understanding of cloud computing platforms and cloud-based infrastructure design and operation
Understanding of container technologies, security, and tooling (such as Docker, Kubernetes, Helm)
Understanding of networking, routing, and web related protocols
Experience scripting/coding with one or more languages (such as Python, Ruby, Golang)
Container security platforms (such as Twistlock, Aquasec)
Infrastructure and configuration management tooling (such as Terraform, Chef, InSpec)
Continuous integration and delivery tooling (CI/CD) (such as GitLab CI, Jenkins, Travis CI)

title: Senior Software Developer, Professional Services
content: Unity's Professional Services team is looking for developers to collaboratively develop innovative software with Unity's largest customers across a variety of different industries, including gaming, defense, automotive, and architecture.

This role will focus on building cutting-edge AR applications using Unity that can thrive in a highly mobile, low connectivity environment. You’ll partner with industry veterans to work on critical performance-sensitive components that demonstrate Unity best practices. In addition, we’ll rely on your direct feedback working with our top partners to help shape the road map for future versions of the Unity Engine.
If you're technically skilled, customer-focused, and an excellent communicator, this job is for you.
Deliver high-quality code components that will power the client and frontend AR experiences
Partner with industry-leading engineers, artists, producers and designers to engineer solutions on state-of-the-art next-generation hardware, sensors, and software
Profile, isolate, then resolve performance bottlenecks to help applications reach target resolution / FPS goals
Incorporate the latest AI, machine learning, and computer vision capabilities as needed
Create prototypes to demonstrate new Unity features and potential solutions
Analyze the Unity Engine source code to keep your skills and knowledge up-to-date
Experience of using Unity in AAA games or other commercial products
Strong C# and C++ coding background
Debugging ability across different technology stacks, in multithreaded environments
Strong understanding of 3D math, and working knowledge of the 3D rendering pipeline, as it pertains to computer graphics
Familiarity with how to profile, analyze, and improve performance, from low-level limitations to high-level architectural decisions
Fluency in written and spoken English, and able to communicate ideas and technical knowledge clearly
Fluency in different shader languages (e.g., HLSL or GLSL)

title: Engineering Manager
content: Unity is the editor and ubiquitous engine that runs real-time content everywhere seamlessly and performant. We serve our users by making Unity the best way to get real-time content on any device or form factor. The mobile platforms team executes on this mission for our users wanting to take their content to mobile, doing the core engineering to enable the deployment of Unity content to iOS and Android. Today these are the most important platforms for millions of Unity creators’ success.

To help the teams to achieve this mission we are looking for an experienced engineering leader to help the mobile runtime team define the goals and drive execution with them. As a leader at Unity you are a great communicator, an active listener, and a builder of relationships. You apply and receive direct and honest feedback within those relationships and drive for alignment across the entire organization. Also….we support the creation of games.our culture is about having fun !

You empower, form and support a distributed, multicultural engineering team making sure they are always challenged and engaged, matching their abilities. You are able to construct clear growth path for individuals as well as the engineering group.

You structure and grow teams with clear missions and make sure they have the skills, abilities and tools to create our Mobile product and solve the challenges at hand. You help leaders and individual contributors in your team grow their abilities, influence and ownership.
Accountable for the continuous development, delivery, release and engineering progression of Unity’s mobile runtime platform targets product.
Accountable as engineering manager for our global mobile runtime engineering group.
Responsible for driving, growing and supporting an empowered global engineering team (US & Europe) with clear missions, ownership and accountability.
You report to and work closely with the Director of Development of Mobile and your peer leaders in the Mobile teams to make sure we have a consistent, reliable experience across mobile platforms.
You are an advocate and thought leader for the mobile platforms within Unity. You make connections and ensure that across the board, mobile is a first class citizen.
3+ years of senior technical leadership experience.
Ability to travel to remote teams frequently
Broad knowledge of mobile platforms, devices and ecosystems.
Collaborative skills and team focused attitude
Strong skills working with low-level C++, C or Objective C code
Native Android development experience (NDK, JNI, etc) and/or native iOS development experience
Strong technical knowledge and experience working in the mobile space.
Experience working in a global, diverse and multicultural environment

title: UX Tools Engineer, Mobile
content: Unity is seeking a software engineer with a passion for UX and tool creation to join our Mobile team to help the most widely used game engine on mobile evolve to its next generation. In this role, you will be working with a multidisciplinary team to implement workflows and innovate tools to take the pain out of mobile development.

Mobile has never been a more exciting gaming platform with titles expanding from the casual genres to full-scale, AAA, MMOs. With hardware approaching that of modern consoles and a user base in the billions, the potential is boundless. At Unity, we are seeking to remove the limitations of conventional thinking about mobile games and unlock their full potential. We strive to make every use of the hardware available while weaving through the complexity of thermal limits, throttling, and battery life.
As developers, we push the limits of mobile. Now more than ever our tools and workflows must evolve to enable a developers’ success.
Join us in empowering millions of Unity developers to create successful games played by billions.
Design and implement high-quality software products and services for games used by millions every day
Improving UX process and alignment within a broader organization
Re-imagining features and a more intuitive UI system
Partner efficiently with cross disciplinary resources
Work closely with UX Designers and Researchers to turn UX vision into production
Re-imagining features and UI concepts for a more approachable system
Professional software development experience (preferably in the game industry)
Experience applying UX design/vision into production code
Passion for creating intuitive and efficient tool workflows to solve complex problems
Strong initiative and ability to work independently
Ability to quickly adapt to new technologies and tasks
Proven track record of delivering results in agile development environments
Experience with building and using game engine tools
