title: Senior DevOps Engineer
content:
Zipwhip is a Seattle-based SaaS (Software-as-a-Service) company providing text messaging to businesses across North America through cloud-based software and a best-in-class API solution. One of the fastest growing tech companies in North America as ranked by Deloitte Fast 500 2017 and 2018, Zipwhip invented the technology that enables businesses to text using their existing landline, VoIP or toll-free phone number and communicate with consumers the modern way. 

Zipwhip is aggressively investing in our people, product offerings and processes. We are backed by Goldman Sachs, Microsoft Ventures, OpenView, Voyager Capital and a host of other investors, and are seeing rapid growth in both employees and revenue. Zipwhip is the only business-texting provider with direct connections to all Tier 1 and 2 wireless operators in the U.S., and we've delivered billions of texts to consumers nationwide. 

Zipwhip employees come to work every day inspired and ready to live out our DIRECT values: Determination, Innovation, Respect, Enthusiasm, Collaboration and Trust. If you want to be part of an organization where highly motivated thinkers are empowered to change the way we communicate with the world around us, then we'd like to hear from you. 

What we're looking for: 

Zipwhip is rapidly transforming text messaging and we are looking for a Senior DevOps Engineer to help take our software to the next level. Zipwhip is continuing to lead the way in business texting software using the power of technology and cloud computing to bring scale, reliability, and efficiency to our platform which powers over 20,000 businesses. The Senior Infrastructure Engineer will work closely with operations engineers, solution architects, and development teams to deliver new product features and ensure platform reliability and uptime for customers.

What's the job really? 

Opportunity to leverage cutting edge cloud services to solve complex problems relating to scale and performance

Collaborate with development and operations teams to build and maintain automated tools for deployment and monitoring

Continually analyze and improve the processes/tools supporting the CI/CD pipeline

A collaborative team player that can support and mentor other platform engineers

Support development team for deployment of hotfixes and new features in our platform

Work closely with solution architects to take proof of concept design to production

What you bring to the table: 

Bachelor’s degree in an associated area, or equivalent experience, is required

5+ years of relevant work experience

Familiarity working in a small but rapidly growing team of engineers with variety of skills/experience

Experience operating a SaaS application at scale with multiple channels of delivery (web, mobile, desktop)

Experience working with highly distributed complex systems

Proven collaboration skills in highly technical engineering teams, with excellent communication skills

Experience participating in an on-call rotation and excellent troubleshooting skills are a requirement

Strong experience with Continuous Integration tools (Jenkins, CodeBuild, CodePipline, etc.)

Strong experience with version control systems (Git)

Hands-on experience working with build tools (Maven, Gradle, SBT, NPM)

Experience building and running Docker containers in a production environment

Familiar with container orchestration systems (Kubernetes, Rancher)

Experience with TSDB based monitoring systems (Prometheus)

Prior experience managing Linux systems in a production environment

Strong scripting proficiency (Bash, Python, GoLang, Java, etc.)

Experience with large scale cloud deployments (AWS, Azure, GCP) and hybrid infrastructure.

Track issues and follow them to resolution by engaging other engineering teams

Understanding of what is required to have a successful and secure CI/CD pipeline

Passionate about cloud-based and open source automation technologies

Startup experience and working on projects in a great SaaS/Cloud company a plus

Experience with multiple types of databases (MySQL, DynamoDB, Cassandra)

Strong automation background (Terraform, Ansible)

Experience managing large clusters of messaging brokers (Kafka, ActiveMQ, RabbitMQ)

What we offer:

A fun, lively startup culture and one of Seattle's coolest offices. 

Core values-based leadership. 

A culture of employee engagement-lively weekly company updates as 1 example. 

Competitive salary and stock options. 

Complimentary access to a fitness center. 

Stipend for transportation and cell phone usage.

One of the fastest growing tech companies in North America as ranked by Deloitte Fast 500 2017 and 2018, Zipwhip invented the technology that enables businesses to text using their existing landline, VoIP or toll-free phone number and communicate with consumers the modern way. 

Zipwhip is aggressively investing in our people, product offerings and processes. Zipwhip is the only business-texting provider with direct connections to all Tier 1 and 2 wireless operators in the U.S., and we've delivered billions of texts to consumers nationwide. 

Zipwhip employees come to work every day (to one of Seattle's coolest offices) inspired and ready to live out our DIRECT values: Determination, Innovation, Respect, Enthusiasm, Collaboration and Trust. title: Senior iOS Developer
content:
Shiftboard is looking for an experienced, full-time iOS developer to join our team in our Seattle office location.

We are working to add and extend features to our native iOS experience and enhance our applications to drive continued growth. You will have opportunities to work closely with our small teams of Android, Responsive Web, API and back-end platform developers. 

If you're looking to create great user experiences, using the best technology for the job, this is the position for you. 

Requirements 

3+ years of professional development experience developing iOS applications 

A deep familiarity with Swift (understanding of Objective-C also useful) 

Experience with iOS ecosystem including HIG & Apple Connect

Experience using API's and working with a variety of third-party libraries 

Experience using build & deployment tooling like Bitrise or Fastlane 

Desired Qualities

Passionate and opinionated about mobile development

Desire to be part of a team and work with other smart engineers 

Independent, self-motivated, and an avid technologist 

Flexibility and willingness to jump in wherever needed

Understanding of Agile implementations such as kanban & scrum

History of improving SDLC methods & tooling 

Engineering Culture 

We could never give back as much as we've received from the open source community, but we try.

We practice iterative development.

We hire smart people and empower them to make a difference.

We occasionally make mistakes but we learn from them rather than being paralyzed by them.

We believe in hammers for nails and screwdrivers for screws. Find the right tool and use it.

We learn. Then we cement that knowledge by teaching what we've learned to others.

What We Offer 

Competitive Salary 

Ownership Opportunity: Employee Stock Option Program 

Healthcare: Medical/Dental/Vision Benefits 

401(k) 

Commuter Perks: Puget Sound Transit Pass (Orca) 

About Shiftboard 

Shiftboard is a leading SaaS provider of on-demand dynamic workforce management software that includes integrated scheduling, reporting and communications tools. We help a wide range of companies around the world simply and easily streamline the complexities of staff scheduling and people management.

All of our team members are charged with bringing creativity, logic, and intellectual rigor to their responsibilities in a never-ending quest to serve our customers. We have high expectations of each other and work as a team to build a platform we are all proud of. That mindset, along with our execution, has allowed Shiftboard to create a revolutionary product and grow into the profitable business it is today.

Employees feel appreciated at Shiftboard and engaged by our fast-paced environment. We offer competitive salary and benefits package, employee stock option program, unlimited paid time off, a casual dress code, and an open communication policy. The resulting atmosphere is professional and productive, yet comfortable and fun.

Local candidates only. Limited work location flexibility, not a remote work position. We cannot provide work sponsorship at this time.

title: Senior iOS & Android Mobile Developer
content:
Shiftboard is looking for an experienced, full-time mobile developer to join our team in our Seattle office location.

We are working to add features to our native iOS & Android experiences and enhance our applications to drive continued growth. You will have opportunities to work closely with our small teams of iOS, Android, Responsive Web, API and back-end platform developers. 

If you're looking to create great user experiences, using the best technology for the job, this is the position for you. 

Requirements 

3+ years of professional development experience developing iOS apps in Swift

3+ years of professional development experience developing Android apps in Kotlin & Java

Solid understanding of the respective SDK's & lifecycle methods

Strong knowledge of respective ecosystems including HIG & Material Design

Strong API experience

Experience working with a variety of third-party libraries 

Experience using build & deployment tooling like Bitrise, Fastlane, Google Console and Apple Connect

Desired Qualities

Passionate and opinionated about mobile development

Desire to be part of a team and work with other smart engineers 

Independent, self-motivated, and an avid technologist 

Flexibility and willingness to jump in wherever needed

Understanding of Agile implementations such as kanban & scrum

History of improving SDLC methods & tooling such as Atlassian, Github & Crashlytics 

Engineering Culture 

We could never give back as much as we've received from the open source community, but we try.

We practice iterative development.

We hire smart people and empower them to make a difference.

We occasionally make mistakes but we learn from them rather than being paralyzed by them.

We believe in hammers for nails and screwdrivers for screws. Find the right tool and use it.

We learn. Then we cement that knowledge by teaching what we've learned to others.

What We Offer 

Competitive Salary 

Ownership Opportunity: Employee Stock Option Program 

Healthcare: Medical/Dental/Vision Benefits 

401(k) 

Commuter Perks: Puget Sound Transit Pass (Orca) 

About Shiftboard 

Shiftboard is a leading SaaS provider of on-demand dynamic workforce management software that includes integrated scheduling, reporting and communications tools. We help a wide range of companies around the world simply and easily streamline the complexities of staff scheduling and people management.

All of our team members are charged with bringing creativity, logic, and intellectual rigor to their responsibilities in a never-ending quest to serve our customers. We have high expectations of each other and work as a team to build a platform we are all proud of. That mindset, along with our execution, has allowed Shiftboard to create a revolutionary product and grow into the profitable business it is today.

Employees feel appreciated at Shiftboard and engaged by our fast-paced environment. We offer competitive salary and benefits package, employee stock option program, unlimited paid time off, a casual dress code, and an open communication policy. The resulting atmosphere is professional and productive, yet comfortable and fun.

Local candidates only. Limited work location flexibility, not a remote work position. No work sponsorship at this time.

title: Analytics Manager, Lodging Product Analytics
content:
Expedia
Expedia is striving to revolutionize the way people search and book their trips. For this mission, the Lodging organization is the pioneer in changing how people around the world shop and purchase travel. We're looking for an Analytics Manager with strong technical skills and a product mindset to join our Lodging Product Analytics team. This position will team up with Lodging Partner Service (LPS) Product and Lodging Shopping Product teams to drive Vacation Rentals and multi-source inventory sales on our sites and apps, and also to deliver best rate plan competitiveness and inventory availability coverage for customers.

You will work with one of the strongest data sets in the travel industry, cutting edge technology, and the ability to see your insights turned into real products. This role will challenge you to understand and contribute to many aspects of development of Lodging business, including product innovation, test and learn, strategy, business opportunity recommendation, and problem investigation.

A real passion for analytics and product development & innovation is a prerequisite. Your primary focus will extend well beyond pulling the data and crunching the numbers. You will tackle complex business problems by converting raw data into relevant and actionable business insights. This is a full-time position based in Expedia’s headquarters in Bellevue, Washington.

What You’ll Do

You will present customer behavior insights, identify customer issues and business opportunities to the Product, Engineering, Marketing and Design teams to collaboratively build the best in class site for customers around the globe looking for a place to stay.

You will apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, predictive modeling, data mining, and the presentation of data with a singular goal of profit maximization and with a focus on actionable analytics.

You will conduct A/B test design, implementation and analysis on the website in order to figure out the effectiveness of product optimization efforts.

You will define key product metrics to monitor, and understand root causes of changes in metrics

You will collaborate with the Product team; you will propose what to build in the next roadmap

You will build understanding around the traveler ecosystem, capturing insights into user behaviors, and long-term trends

You will identify new levers to help move key product metrics

You will build models of user behaviors for analysis or to power production systems

You will influence product teams through presentation of data-based recommendations

You will communicate state of business and experiment result to product teams

You will collaborate across Product, Marketing & Retail Analytics teams spreading standard methodologies for wide adoption

You will work with Business Intelligence tools such as Adobe Omniture, and authoring queries in Hadoop, Hive, and Spark primarily

You will be automating analyses and authoring pipelines via SQL and python based ETL framework

Who You Are:

You have at least 3 years of hands-on experience in data analysis and providing insights.

Experience with SQL, and R or Python

Experience with Excel or other data manipulation tools.

Experience with reporting tools such as Tableau or Qlikview.

Ability to make decisions and act when faced with ambiguity as well as being able to operate without explicit direction

You have the willingness to exceed expectations and challenge business goals

Knowledge of experimentation techniques such as A/B tests

Knowledge of modelling techniques such as linear regression, time series modelling, decision tree

Experience with Web Analytics tool such as Omniture or Google Analytics

You are experienced at collaborating with teams in different time zones.

Advanced degree (M.Sc., Ph.D. preferred) in statistics, math, computer science, economics, or related quantitative field.

Why join us:

Expedia Group recognizes our success is dependent on the success of our people. We are the world's travel platform, made up of the most knowledgeable, passionate, and creative people in our business. Our brands recognize the power of travel to break down barriers and make people's lives better – that responsibility inspires us to be the place where exceptional people want to do their best work, and to provide them to tools to do so.

Whether you're applying to work in engineering or customer support, marketing or lodging supply, at Expedia Group we act as one team, working towards a common goal; to bring the world within reach. We relentlessly strive for better, but not at the cost of the customer. We act with humility and optimism, respecting ideas big and small. We value diversity and voices of all volumes. Our teams also have the chance to give back on a local level and make a difference through our corporate social responsibility program, Expedia Cares.

title: Software Dev Engineer I
content:
Expedia
Do you have a passion for travel and e-Commerce? Do you have a passion for operating globally in a high growth, energizing environment? Expedia’s eCommerce Platform (eCP) team has an opening for a Software Development Engineer as part of our Financial Systems and Core Transactional Services (FCTS) team. The online travel market is a $2 trillion industry that never stands still. This 400-person organization operating between Expedia’s Global Brands, Supply Offerings, and Finance Teams, is the transactional heartbeat of Expedia Group. FCTS is composed of two key platform components – Financial Systems, primarily based on the Oracle E-Business Suite (EBS); and the Core Transaction Platform that comprises Order and Fulfillment Orchestration, Trip Management, Tax Services and Incentive Services. Through our technology and operations infrastructure, we handle billions of dollars of bookings, collections, and payments every month. This role will primarily focus on the Core Transaction Platform, one of the platforms operated by FCTS. 

What you’ll do: 

Assume an active role in the evolution of the Core Transaction Platform, including design, development

Be a part of the development team and actively participate in all phases of implementation, including requirements gathering, functional and technical design, systems design and development, testing and roll-out, and support

Monitor and support daily operations

Utilize disciplined development methodology for continuous evolution and optimization for the assigned projects

Teach and mentor junior developers in project implementation methodology

Who you are:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Computing related discipline

5+ years Software Development work experience (Java experience strongly preferred)

Prior background in high volume e-Commerce solutions or other transactional processing systems.

Strong technical proficiency in Java, Spring MVC, JSON/XML, Web Services and object-oriented design.

Experience working in with AWS/Cloud infrastructure, NoSQL databases

You write clean and elegant technical designs are part of your DNA and you have the ability to instill the same drive in others, have critical thinking and communicate them to your peers

title: Sr. Network Engineer
content:
Expedia
Sr Network Engineer

Expedia's e-Commerce Platform team is at the heart of Expedia's business. Our technology and operations platforms power Expedia's online travel brands worldwide. The platform teams are diverse - we build and maintain foundational systems and infrastructure like data centers, transaction platforms, financial systems and the cloud computing such as infrastructure and software as a service. Are you ready for an exciting experience in this dynamically changing industry? The networking team follows a DevOps model where you will be able to design and develop network solutions, operate your product and collaborate with many fun people along the way.

What you’ll do: 

The Senior Network Engineer is responsible for developing, maintaining, and supporting data center and cloud network Infrastructure.

You will provide level 2 and level 3 network support including operation, change management and request fulfillment for network devices such as routers, switches, firewalls and load balances.

Your role, you will monitor and support global network, IP and related security services, resolve complex system and network issues and outages. This will involve maintenance and administration of all production IP communications equipment.

You will directly engage with the network operations center and with customers to consult with them and handle their requests.

Preparing network diagrams and maintaining equipment lists using automation where possible to ensure accuracy and completeness. Industry watching, both direct or through a third party, to ensure the company is aware and educated on new technologies.

Team members will look to you to mentor, coach and be their focal point for technical network issues. You should be able to communicate well with vendors and partners to build relationships and work through technical scenarios.

You will work independently and exercise reasonable judgment with little supervision while providing clear documentation of activities and accomplishments.

You will be involved in network automation and orchestration to increase speed and preserve consistency in our network connectivity solutions. This could involve automation of network circuit provisioning, switch baselines, routing protocol convergence improvements and network overlay technologies.

Who you are: 

You’ll fit this role if you have:

Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related technical field or equivalent understanding and capability.

10+ years of experience in network engineering.

Experience with Cisco and Juniper service provider routers.

CCNP Routing and Switching or similar practical proficiency.

Proficient in configuring and troubleshooting networking protocols - OSPF, MPBGP, ISIS, MPLS.

Background in operating and maintaining Clos-based fabrics (e.g., FabricPath, VXLAN).

Hands-on experience with Cisco ASR9K and Juniper MX routers.

In-depth knowledge of SNMP, Netflow, IPFIX, Netconf or Restconf models.

Experience reviewing system configuration settings/policies.

Proficiency working with third party vendors and technologies.

Ability to review and improve processes and procedures.

Experience working with operational environments following ITIL, industry standards, frameworks and reference architectures.

Excellent troubleshooting skills (technical and non-technical).

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

Ability to multi-task and manage competing and conflicting priorities.

Strong communication skills in both verbal and written.

Ability to work overtime to include nights and weekends.

Practical application skills in deployment of QoS on various platforms.

Knowledge of Multicast Routing.

Software defined network and WAN experience

Preferred if additional skills:

Hands-on development background with network orchestration engines

AWS Network Stack – VPC, Direct Connect, Transit Gateways, AWS VPN

Expert-level certifications a plus (e.g., JNCIE-SP, CCIE-RS, CCIE-SP)

Experience with Internet and Cloud Exchange Peering.

Network scripting background using languages such as Python/Perl/JavaScript

Software Dev Engineer II (Big Data)

Expedia’s Global Customer Operations (GCO) Technology team is dedicated to driving technology innovation to build effortless customer experiences worldwide in Expedia Group apps, web sites, support channels, and contact centers via our Virtual Agent Platform. title: Sr Software Dev Engineer
content:
Expedia
The Expedia Lodging Platform team is the business powerhouse for the Expedia group and contributes the largest share of our company’s revenue. The Lodging Platform teams power two main lines of business, Lodging Shopping and Lodging Supply, and covers ten+ major Product areas. Our Lodging Platform operations are global, with representation in 8 countries and 17 offices. Our platforms are unique, supporting multiple Expedia group. brands - Brand Expedia Group; including Brand Expedia, Orbitz, Travelocity, Wotif and ebookers; and our sister brands Hotels.com, Expedia Affiliate Network, trivago and most recently HomeAway. We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to be part of our team.

What makes Lodging unique?

ML platform and self-service model deployment took for data scientists delivering over 5000 tps under 10ms; enabling our teams to provide the best rates

Driving pricing computations supporting approximately 60 thousand requests per second; arguably one of the top 10 search systems in the world

Building a best in class geography system returning 7.5 thousand requests per second; enabling travelers to find the best locations to stay

Continuously growing a vast inventory system supporting 50 million updates/day; with rooms, rates, dates and types

Service over half a million hotels across 240 countries in 26 languages; Real time news feed, photo upload, reviews

Deep and broad content system enabling 10 million updates/day; which includes 38TB of images, alone

What about Lodging Technology?

Our teams have flexibility to make the technology choices that best provide customer value to partners. As a member of the team, you’ll be involved in these choices.

As an example, most teams build RESTful services, typically with simple APIs using JSON. These are usually built on the JVM with Java but some pick Scala, Clojure and Kotlin. Some teams use node.js.

Many teams are decomposing their services into microsystems to make things easier to maintain and continually deploy. When appropriate, teams build event-driven, streaming architectures and we also have teams working on front-end solutions, generally using React.js.

Your team will be cloud-native or moving enthusiastically to AWS.

We organize for feature velocity, so wherever appropriate, your teams will leverage AWS services like Lambda, Kinesis, ElastiCache, Aurora, DynamoDB and of course EC2, ECS and S3. To further help speed things up, you’ll look to build on top of open source systems and libraries like Redis, GRPC, Akka, Cassandra, and MongoDB.

The question is; Do you believe in being Different, can you Lead Humbly, act as One Team, leverage the Scientific Method, Organize for Speed while remaining Transparent?

If you answered yes, you might just have what it takes to help us continue our mission to revolutionize travel through the power of technology - apply here!

title: Senior Business Analyst
content:
Expedia
Senior Business Analyst

The Senior Business Analyst is a key member of the Expedia Retail eCommerce team, which defines and executes on strategy for our Expedia brand. The Business Analyst is primarily responsible for analytics, reporting, and strategic insights and initiatives. This role will have broad exposure to several functional groups within the organization and candidates need a proven track record of effectively communicating to cross-functional stakeholders.

Responsibilities:

Manage the distribution and creation of standard and ad-hoc analyses to help track and communicate all aspects of performance and assist in critical business decision support

Track and understand the key macro trends that impact our businesses on a day to day basis

Daily monitoring of key site metrics and recommend improvement plans as necessary

Provide analytics, sizing and input into business cases for new strategic initiatives

Provide weekly performance analysis and insights at both the line of business and market level for North America

Look at market-level performance data to identify trends and uncover underlying issues

Work cross-functionally with stakeholders to automate reports as well as develop the business requirements needed for alerts and automation

Develop and present materials for senior leadership around business performance and revenue generating opportunities

Gather complex data, analyze trends, identify opportunities and quantify the potential value of these opportunities

Serve as a first point of contact for various stakeholders around the organization in terms of uncovering and correcting business performance issues

Function independently with minimal supervision and proactively deliver key analytical projects

Work closely with teams throughout the company, including Technology, Product, Business Operations, Finance, Supply, and Marketing to coordinate and execute against the business plan

Other adhoc projects and analyses as need

Qualifications:

Highly analytical with the ability to work independently and manage several simultaneous projects

Expert proficiency in Excel, Tableau, Omniture, Quobole and SQL (preferred), ability and desire to attack complex data sets with minimal training

Excellent communication skills - written, verbal and presentation - to effectively deliver strategy to various individuals across the organization and senior leadership

Ability to take large data sets and summarize down to actionable levels, turning analysis into answers

Results-driven with the willingness to dive deep into details while still grasping the big picture

Proven ability to influence stakeholders and drive projects forward

Structured in your problem-solving approach with a high level understanding of technology

Professional, "get it done" attitude and “help the team win” work ethic with an ability to take projects and run with them

Self-directed, comfort with ambiguity, must have a problem solving mindset

Bachelor's degree required

2-5 years of relevant experience

title: Senior Software Engineer
content:
Expedia
Welcome!

Do you like writing code? Are you passionate about trying new technologies? Do you want to work with people who love what they do? The Lodging Partner Services team is looking for a passionate software design engineer to join one of our teams. If you are passionate about building global high volume web applications (website and backend) for global customers, this is the job for you! We're looking for highly motivated full stack engineer who is passionate about working with Java back-end services, and/or front end UI web interfaces. In this role you will lead, design, and implement web applications and service, work with other engineers to solve business and technology problems at hand.

Responsibilities: 

We need you to write clean code

You will identify design and coding problems, and bring on technology innovation to existing systems if needed

You will gather and implement technical requirements, such as test harnesses, logging, and operation facilitations

You will define development and test environments, including build, configuration, and deployment

You will support urgent live-site operations as needed

You will facilitate design review, code review, test review, and operation procedure review meetings

You will write scalable code and unit tests for Continuous Delivery pipeline

You will development in cloud and web page performance tuning

You will lead and mentor junior developers on the team

Qualifications: 

For Front End Developer: Strong knowledge of Java, JSP, JavaScript, jQuery, CSS, AJAX, ReactJS, experience with MVC or component-based UI frameworks, Spring MVC

For Back End developer: CPU and memory usage, debug real time multi-threading application and perform JVM tuning, deep understanding of Micro Service Oriented Architectures, Domain Driven Design concept

Nice to have Data Pipeline / Streaming, and Real-Time Data Analytics

Experience with cloud development

Previous experience working experience in Agile development process

Experience working with geographically distributed team

Work Experience and Education Guidelines

Bachelors degree in Computer Science or Professional certifications in computer technology

7+ years in software development with a track record of shipping highly scalable cross-functional projects

title: Software Development Engineer II
content:
Expedia
What is the first thing you do when planning your next trip? Think about where you want to go, right? So come work for our team that helps travelers like you go places and makes our world more connected! Expedia Flights team is the traffic powerhouse for the Expedia group and our Flights Shopping Platform is one of the largest in the world serving over 150 million queries a day and powering some of the strongest brands in the industry like Orbitz, Expedia, Travelocity, Wotif, Hotwire, and Ebookers. Our technology operations are global, with representation in the US, Mexico, Australia, and India.

What makes Flights technology unique?

Expedia is one of the few companies in the world that own a proprietary flight search engine (called Best Fare Search) which is used by millions of users daily.

And we are moving flights platform to AWS.

We handle several 100 thousand booking transactions every day and connect with all major GDS partners you can think of.

We collect TeraBytes of Flights Data and actively look to use Machine Learning to show the right content to our customers.

Our teams have the flexibility to make the technology choices that best add value to our beloved travelers and partners. As a member of our team, you will be involved in these choices. We are in the middle of evolving our platform and are actively decomposing our services into micro-systems to make things easier to maintain and continually deploy. As part of this evolution, you and the team will be cloud-native or be moving enthusiastically to AWS. We organize for feature velocity, so wherever appropriate, our teams will leverage AWS services like Lambda, Kinesis, ElastiCache, Aurora, DynamoDB and of course EC2, ECS and S3. To further help speed things up, you’ll look to build on top of open source systems and libraries like Redis, GRPC, Akka, Cassandra, and MongoDB.

Job Responsibilities: 

This position focuses not only on implementing software solutions for state of the art e-commerce processing systems but also on being a role model to your fellow engineers. You will get to expand your skills in building highly scalable solutions while influencing others and raising the bar on the overall level of excellence within the team. You will also get the opportunity to serve as a domain guru in multi-functional feature delivery. Whether you choose to move ahead in your career to a Senior Developer or become a manager, this is the role for you to learn how to move to the next stage.

Required: 

You have impeccable coding skills

First class communication skills in written and verbal form

Strong Object Oriented Programming concepts, data structure, algorithms, and system level programming (including multi-threaded programming)

You are a critical thinker, who speaks out and defends views.

Experience developing web services

Experience delivering and supporting highly available and scalable solutions with large transaction volume on a 24x7 operational cycle

Thorough understanding of Software Development Lifecycle and methodologies

Be a voracious learner, especially in the areas of technology, service design patterns, and system architecture.

Knowledge of performance testing, application tuning, and load testing

Preferred: 

Knowledge and working experience with Agile Software Development mechanics

Prior background in high volume e-Commerce solutions or other transaction processing systems

Working knowledge of Global Distribution System (GDS) solutions

Background in Service Oriented Architecture implementation, service versioning, and backward compatibility

Experience:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Computing related discipline

6+ years Software Development work experience (Java experience strongly preferred)

2+ years creating and supporting Web Services in a high transactional environment

content:

Do you want to transform the experience of millions of travelers the world over? Do you love working with a creative engineering team in building an intelligent, scalable and personalized travel assistance platform? Do you want to work with state of the art technologies such as real-time streaming, Natural Language Processing (NLP), Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning? Our goal is to build the best conversational bot platform that can meet customers on any channel (social, sms, web, or voice), use AI/ML to understand/anticipate their needs and deliver unparalleled service.

As a Senior Software Development Engineer, you propose, prototype, design and implement various core components of the bot platform in collaboration with teams world over. 7+ years of experience leading technical designs, mentoring developers and helping to drive engineering maturity.

title: Software Development Engineer-1
content:
Expedia
At Expedia we are revolutionizing travel through the power of technology. Every second of every day, we send two travelers on a trip. We sell enough tickets to fill nearly six hundred 737 airplanes every day, and our mobile apps have been downloaded more than 10 million times across 180 countries. We work in a fast-paced environment to keep up with the ever changing travel landscape. The opportunities to inspire travel for the global customer are endless.

We want you to bring your techie skills to our agile environment as we move from revolutionizing the web to redefining the mobile travel experience. From the back-end supply and database functions, to new user-interfaces for our more than 140 branded travel sites, there is no shortage of technical innovation.

What’s in it for you? Beyond travel perks and other competitive benefits, you can walk away from work each day knowing you truly made an impact. You can create a new feature that goes on the live site. You can build programs that streamline our backend search and supply processes. You can help localize content and systems globally. And you can do this all while working alongside smart, passionate techies who love travel to their core.

What are you waiting for? Join our team this summer and apply today!

General Responsibilities:

Design, develop, debug, and modify components of software applications and tools.

Drive technical implementation at the application/product level for small to mid-sized projects.

Work in a team to design, spec, and schedule a component or feature of 1-4 weeks of duration.

Provide quality implementation of a component or feature (typically 1-4 weeks in duration) with peer and manager support.

Provide improvements to solutions for a given problem.

Resolve problems and roadblocks as they occur with help from peers or managers. Follow through on details and drive issues to closure with help from peers or managers.

Support development of documentation and procedures for installation and maintenance.

Actively participate in group technology reviews to critique work of self and others.

Approach technical staff for help and training when necessary.

Collaborate with and learn from all members of technical staff.

Learn to contribute to requirement definition process.

Assist with judgment calls with peer and manager input/assistance.

Requirements

Anticipated graduation of December 2017 or May/June 2018 with a BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.

Programming experience in one or more of the following languages: C, C++, Java, HTML5

Experience in systems software and algorithms.

Experience in network programming and/or developing/designing large software systems

Strong verbal and written communication skills.

title: Senior Software Development Engineer
content:
Expedia
Are you a seasoned developer looking for an exciting opportunity at the world’s largest travel company? Do you enjoy a fast-paced Agile environment where your hard work is destined to go to Production as often as every 2 weeks? Do you take pride in having a direct impact on the revenue generation capabilities of your company? If you answered, “Yes,” then we are eager to hear from you. 

Expedia Global Payments (EGP) is looking for top engineering talent to help drive the development of our payments platform, seamlessly roll out new payments methods, and to continuously raise the bar on our operational excellence and engineering practices. Our services are the nexus of a globally distributed system that spans many organizations. Our roadmap is deep and contains several innovative programs designed to make our services fault tolerant, reduce the cost of payment processing, and improve customer experience. This includes compensating for downstream services that are not in Expedia's control. We are also looking to use cloud computing (AWS) to further solidify our infrastructure. This opportunity presents you with great technical challenges and the ability to have a tremendous business impact. We do this accurately and at scale, processing over $80 billion payments in 55+ currencies in over 155 countries every year across diverse payment options.

What you'll do

This position focuses not only on implementing software solutions for state of the art e-commerce processing systems but also on being a role model and mentor to your fellow engineers. You will get to expand your skills in building highly scalable solutions while influencing others and raising the bar on the overall level of excellence within the team. You will also get the opportunity to hone your skills in influencing decisions across the technology ecosystem within Expedia Inc. by being a key subject matter expert in cross-functional feature delivery. Your input will be critical to the selection of new hires on the team. Whether you choose to move ahead in your career to a Principal Engineer role or manage people, this is the perfect position to learn how to move to the next stage of your career.

Who you are

8+ years Software Development work experience (Java experience strongly preferred)

5+ years creating and supporting Web Services in a high transactional environment

3+ years developing software using Dependency Injection Frameworks.

First class communication skills in written and verbal form

Proven record in technical mentoring of Software Engineers

Critical thinking skills and the ability to produce across your team and beyond

Rock solid coding skills

Strong Object-Oriented Programming concepts, data structure, algorithms, and system level programming (including multi-threaded programming)

Track record of building your own automation and reporting tools to provide capabilities around your service

Ability to lead code reviews and technical design meetings

Proven record in successfully delivering highly available and scalable solutions with large transaction volume on a 24x7 operational cycle

Architectural knowledge of designing and developing software in distributed architecture for multi-tier applications

Thorough understanding of Software Development Lifecycle and methodologies

Ability to articulate technical design decisions and software implementation in technical forums

Knowledge of performance testing, application tuning and load testing

A degree in computer science or equivalent experience.

Prior experience with e-Commerce systems, Payments Solutions and Providers is a big plus.

Experience developing fault tolerant distributed systems is highly desirable.

Working knowledge of Agile Software Development mechanics.

Background in Service Oriented Architecture implementation, service versioning, and backward compatibility

title: Salesforce Developer I - Media Solutions
content:
Expedia
Expedia Media Solutions, the advertising arm of Expedia Inc., offers industry expertise and digital marketing solutions that allow brands to reach, engage and influence its qualified audience of travelers around the world. Through its network of leading travel brands and global points of sale, we provide partners with insights about traveler behaviors during every stage of the purchase journey, along with dynamic advertising solutions, to deliver strategic campaigns and measurable results. For more information, visit advertising.expedia.com.

There are two distinct instances of Salesforce in Media Solutions and we are re-imagining, re-designing, and re-engineering the way 
Salesforce
 is evolving within our Brand. We are looking for a passionate, tech-savvy and well-rounded person who loves code and integrations to join our crusade. As a smaller team within Expedia there is a lot of room for creativity in this role; you will wear many hats and have a very visible role in our organization. You will be a champion for scalable solutions and help minimize technical debt.

Are you a self-starter who can manage multiple tasks and projects at a time?

Do you enjoy leading the work you're doing end to end, prioritizing quickly and effectively, and you thrive in a dynamic but a variable environment?

Are you able to perform under stress, and meet ongoing and overlapping deadlines within short time constraints?

Do you have a flexible attitude with an eagerness to learn and grow from the team around you? If you are a Salesforce Developer with 5+ years of experience with Salesforce or another leading CRM application - consider a career with Expedia.

What you will do:

Specializing in force.com development and hands-on programming, you will have the opportunity to develop new solutions and integrations and responsible for bug fixes on existing functionality. You will support a diverse group of business partners in all phases of Salesforce development: planning, development, integration, delivery and support.

Design, develop, debug, and modify components of existing SFDC applications and supporting technologies

Collaborate with the Technology Lead to understand and translate the complex business requirements into logical, component-based technical development, and you will help drive resolution of bugs/issues/hot-fixes

Solve integration issues and apply new solutions to the existing integrations

Supply technical insight to daily support issues

Continuously strive to learn new development methodologies and technologies and show a clear passion to grow within and beyond the role

Who you are:

You have a minimum of 2 to 3 years of Object orientated programming experience, with at least one year of Salesforce Development experience

You have experience in Lightning or Visualforce development, APEX, Force.com platform, SOQL, SOSL and understanding of Salesforce Governor Limits

You have some proficiency with web-services, APIs, integration patterns and tools

You have some experience carrying out ETL data jobs using standard data-loader tools or developing batch jobs

You are flexible and work well within a team and autonomously, with the ability to work well under pressure and handle evolving deadlines

You don't shy away seeking development guidance from more senior team members and you enjoy coaching less experienced team members to help them grow.

What is helpful, but not essential:

You have working knowledge and/or some proficiency using some of the tools of the trade as below:

Programming languages (JavaScript, HTML5, CSS, PHP, jQuery)

Web development tools (Eclipse IDE, APEX Data Loader, Git, Salesforce DX or Intelli/Sublime)

Experience with one or more middle-ware technologies and integration tools (Boomi, Informatica, MuleSoft)

Working knowledge of AWS storage services and app development tools (S3, EC2, .NET, Python, etc.)

Salesforce Platform Developer I and/or II Certification(s)

title: Systems Engineer II - eIT Voice and Video
content:
Expedia
Systems Engineer II

Expedia Group IT provide a world class technology experience by building and integrating a variety of employee focused tech services. Within Expedia IT, the Digital Workplace team are hiring a Systems Engineer who will help to further develop and deliver our premier platform of products, services and agile framework. We're a team with worldwide presence that maintains the user facing technology throughout 2000+ conference rooms and meeting spaces. You will have at least 5+ years of experience in Audio-Visual, Videoconferencing or like IT collaboration tools and technology.

Why build your career with us? We offer the opportunity to join more than 20 thousand of the brightest minds in the travel business in an ambitious and international work environment passionate about innovation, creative problem-solving and collaboration.

Responsibilities of this engineering role include:

Tier 2/3 Support (escalation point for Global Service Desk/Field Services) – conference room tech and VTC, Room Booking (devices/backend software), Digital Signage, Wayfinding.

ITRE Project Support (AV and VTC Refresh/rooms under pre-defined standards) and deployment.

Drive proof of concepts using cutting edge technology with the intention of implementing in production.

Partner with neighboring teams (voice, network, real estate, systems and IT engineering), in designing, testing, deploying meeting space technology globally.

Function as technical, engineering and operational guide for overall digital workplace technology platform.

Identifies potential areas where existing capabilities and processes require change and where new ones need to be developed

Perform high level system performance analysis and tuning optimizations.

What you bring to this job:

Working knowledge of protocols/low voltage AV signaling as it relates to control systems.

Strong ability to gather and interpret data and information from different sources, and use technical skills to resolve complex problems.

Experience with SAAS based technologies and services.

5+ years of experience in combination information technology, audio-visual or unified communications – certifications preferred.

Advanced diagnostics and analysis of AV and supporting systems (ability to interpret network data, and perimeter infrastructure outputs – VCS).

Understanding of standards and protocols as they relate to security of media data – storage and transmission.

Strong knowledge and experience deploying/supporting industry standards – cabling, acoustics, resolution.

Ability to closely work with and manage external vendors, provide instruction and access when required.

Experience in Network Design and Management is helpful.

Understanding of scrum/agile engineering and development practices is a plus.

Passion for using new technology to support interesting problems.

Self-starter that enjoys leading by example and mentoring other team members.

Ability to thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.

title: Sr. Software Development Engineer
content:
Expedia
Do you want to play a pivotal role in transforming experience of travelers the world over? Do you want to work in an extraordinary engineering team building an intelligent, scalable and personalized travel assistance platform. You will work with state of the art technologies such as real-time Kafka streaming, GraphQL, Natural Language Processing (NLP), AI & Machine Learning. You will craft an unparalleled Bot platform that can meet the customer on social, text, web, or voice channels, servicing their support needs and delivering unparalleled customer engagement.

The primary function of the role is to help design and implement components for the core analytics engine of our platform. You will work alongside engineers, leads, and product owners to plan, scope, and execute and, as a senior member of the team, will be looked towards as a thought leader and technical advocate. Your solutions will provide the ultimate customer experience needed to anticipate and resolve customer's questions using an automated assistant. You will have the opportunity to build a ‘V1’ platform from the ground-up by collaborating with product and engineering leadership.

Roles and Responsibilities

Design and develop API library/Interfaces for publishing/ consuming & streaming data to and from the platform.

Influence and contribute to the overall architecture and design of the intelligent conversational platform.

Call out appropriate risks and issues in a timely manner to enable re-prioritization and stakeholder management if needed.

Write your program as if you’re speaking to the person who will maintain your code.

Own every task you undertake as if the future of the company depends upon it.

Who you are

7+ years of experience leading technical designs, mentoring developers and helping driving Engineering Maturity.

An avid problem solver and an excellent coder with deep understanding of algorithms, data structures, and OO concepts as well as data modeling.

As someone passionate about quality of their work, you are persistent and uncompromising.

As someone who has prototypes AI/ML models, you are interested in creating recommendation engines.

title: Senior Software Development Engineer
content:
Expedia
Are you a seasoned developer looking for an exciting opportunity at the world’s largest travel company? Do you enjoy a fast-paced Agile environment where your hard work is destined to go to Production as often as every 2 weeks? Do you take pride in having a direct impact on the revenue generation capabilities of your company? 
If you answered
“Yes
” then we are eager to hear from you. 


Expedia Global Payments (EGP) is looking for top engineering talent to help drive the development of our payments platform, seamlessly roll out new payments methods, and to continuously raise the bar on our operational excellence and engineering practices. Our services are the nexus of a globally distributed system that spans many organizations. Our roadmap is deep and contains several innovative programs designed to make our services fault tolerant, reduce the cost of payment processing, and improve customer experience. This includes compensating for downstream services that are not in Expedia's control. We are also looking to use cloud computing (AWS) to further solidify our infrastructure.
This opportunity presents you with great technical challenges and the ability to have a tremendous business impact.
We do t
his
accurately
and
at scale, processing over $80
billion
paym
ents in 55+ currencies in over 155
countries
every year across diverse payment options.


Responsibilities

This position focuses not only on implementing software solutions for state of the art e-commerce processing systems but also on being a role model and mentor to your fellow engineers. You will get to expand your skills in building highly scalable solutions while influencing others and raising the bar on the overall level of excellence within the team. You will also get the opportunity to hone your skills in influencing decisions across the technology ecosystem within Expedia Inc. by being a key subject matter expert in cross-functional feature delivery. Your input will be critical to the selection of new hires on the team. Whether you choose to move ahead in your career to a Principal Engineer role or manage people, this is the perfect position to learn how to move t
o the next stage of your career

Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: 


8+ years Software Development work experience (Java experience strongly preferred) 



5+ years creating and supporting Web Services in a high transactional environment



3+ years developing software using Dependency Injection Frameworks



First class communication skills in written and verbal form



Proven record in technical mentoring of Software Engineers



Critical thinking skills and the ability to produce across your team and beyond



Rock solid coding skills



Strong
Object-Oriented
Programming concepts, data structure, algorithms, and system level programming (including multi-threaded programming)



Track record of building your own automation and reporting tools to provide capabilities around your service



Ability to lead code reviews and technical design meetings



Proven record in successfully delivering highly available and scalable solutions with large transaction volume on a 24x7 operational cycle



Architectural knowledge of designing and developing software in distributed architecture for multi-tier applications



Thorough understanding of Software Development Lifecycle and methodologies



Ability to articulate technical design decisions and software implementation in technical forums



Knowledge of performance testing, application tuning and load testing



A degree in computer science or equivalent experience.



Preferred Knowledge, Skills and Abilities


Prior experience with e-Commerce systems, Payments Solutions and Providers is a big plus. 



Experience developing fault tolerant distributed systems is highly desirable



Working knowledge of Agile Software Development mechanics



Background in Service Oriented Architecture implementation, service versioning, and backward compatibility



ECP, EGP

title: Senior Software Development Engineer
content:
Expedia
DSP – Data Services and Platforms

Our mission is to power reliable, trustworthy and scalable data products, that fuel decision-making and give a competitive advantage to Expedia Group.

We use a blend of open source, custom development, and commercial tools to deliver and operate petabyte-scale data platforms used across the business. Our ecosystem includes multiple cloud providers, massive Hadoop clusters, parallel databases and a broad mix of leading data management and analytics tools.

Who You Are:

We are looking for a talented Senior Software Development Engineer to design and build systems and services to tackle increasingly complex data engineering challenges.

Ideal candidates:

Have a deep understanding of software engineering principles, algorithms, data structures, and distributed systems concepts.

Have 7+ years of experience leading or working on complex software projects using Java, Scala, Python or similar.

Have hands on experience and knowledge of the fundamentals of cloud computing (including virtualization, multi-tenant cloud infrastructures, storage systems and content delivery networks).

Are fluent in modern architectures and concepts, able to speak at every level of the organization.

Have experience with distributed data processing (Hadoop, Spark, Pig, Hive) and open source software (Cassandra, MongoDB, RabbitMQ, NGINX, Redis, Elasticsearch) along with data processing algorithms (MapReduce, Flume).

Have diverse data platform experience including NoSQL, MongoDB, Hadoop, Spark, SparkML, Tensorflow.

What You Will Do:

You will architect, build and support a modern, multi-tenant cloud-based enterprise data platform for both transactions and analytics and share your knowledge with your teammates, as well as the larger tech community.

You will drive innovation with technologies and solutions in the large-scale distributed cloud services and petabyte-scale data processing space.

You'll work to identify new product features and close feature gaps in new and existing products.

Collaborating across our team, you'll deliver rapid, iterative designs and/or new technology proof-of-concepts.

You will provide technical leadership and participate in development efforts.

You'll provide technical insight to the team, delivering recommendations, tutorials, blog articles and technical presentations, adapting to different levels of technical partners.

You'll collaborate across a diverse team of internal and external partners.

Why Join Us:

title: Sr. Software Dev Engineer
content:
Expedia
Expedia Group Media Solutions is dedicated to building creative media partnerships for travel advertisers enabling them to use Expedia's network of leading travel brands and global sites. We have revolutionized the way brands reach and connect with online travel consumers, emerging as a leader in online advertising among travel and e-commerce brands. With a growing product portfolio offering a multitude of advertising and sponsorship opportunities, our Media Solutions team at Expedia has created a viable marketing platform for advertising partners to reach the 144+ million worldwide monthly unique visitors that visit Expedia Group sites.

The advertising team at Expedia is looking for engineers to build new platforms that flawlessly serve our content to millions of users. We value rigor and creativity in our development process and believe in the power of a motivated & empowered development team. There is so much we want to do and we need strong engineers who can navigate distributed systems, solve challenging problems, and jump into new projects. Your work will touch systems at scale that reach people all around the world, while having a significant impact on our business. We connect travelers with meaningful destinations. Expedia Group has revolutionized the travel industry by applying technology and we are committed to enabling travelers through continued innovation. We are focused on building relevant experiences and our products aren't just about monetization, they align with our passion for travel. We help customize the shopping experience for each user and bring them closer to their next big adventure.

We are looking for a Sr. Full Stack Developer who will find new ways to delight our users & help conceptualize and build the next generation of our advertising products. We work in small teams with the freedom to creatively define and solve problems. Our platform is diverse and you will have the opportunity to learn, innovate, and own new technologies & direction as we rapidly iterate on our services for users and developers.

Responsibilities:

Take a leadership role on a medium-sized team of developers

Collaborate with product and engineering teams to leverage the latest technologies, define new platform features and build the technical product backlog

Engineer scalable, fault tolerant software components for serving ads across all Expediagroup.com pages

Implement custom advertising solutions on web pages owned by other teams within the company

Contribute and collaborate in creation and consumption of open, standards-based solutions, while working with existing Expedia technologies and infrastructure.

Identify opportunities for process and tool improvements and drive those from concept to implementation

Required Skills:

Strong technical background with 7+ years of relevant experience in technical development

7+ years experience in JavaScript development, with a deep understanding of the language

7+ years experience in Java (or similar) development

Solid understanding of HTML5 and CSS, and the standards for each, including working with all major modern browsers

Proven track record of shipping high quality products in high load production environments, world-class enterprise and/or ecommerce systems

Structured approach to development (measuring, monitoring, and testing) and a deep understanding of object oriented design

Ability to ramp up quickly on new technologies

Dedication to writing and maintaining high quality code

Strong verbal and written communication skills

BS, MS, or PhD in Computer Science or equivalent experience

Desired Skills:

Experience with web application frameworks, such as Spring MVC

Experience with online advertising

Knowledge of JavaScript frameworks such as jQuery or Handlebars

Experience investigating and optimizing web performance

Experience with web analytics tools or processes

title: Brand Analytics Data Scientist II
content:
Expedia
Brand Analytics Data Scientist II 

We are looking for a business facing Data Scientist to join our Brand marketing measurement function. You will deliver optimization and ROAS measurement tools for the Global Brand Marketing (GBM) team at Expedia.

We structure problems, extract and analyze data and present the findings to our internal clients. In addition, our analysts handle the communication and relationships with internal customers across Expedia Worldwide. We are an award-winning team of analysts resolved to push the boundaries of analytics and embrace new technologies. The Analytics and Revenue Management team is essential to the company’s mission of becoming the world’s most intelligent travel marketplace.

Do you have a hunger to make a difference with one of the most loved consumer brands in the world? If so, this is the job for you!

What you will do:

Develop methodologies and tools to optimize our existing Brand marketing performance, actively identify use-cases to apply data science techniques

Enhance and automate our existing ROAS methodologies for TV and other media, both online and offline

Work directly with internal engineering and external vendor resources where appropriate to ensure optimization findings are scalable and repeatable

Interact directly with multiple departments across the organization. Identify key analytical opportunities that deliver valuable business insight

Who you are:

You have at least 4-5 years’ experience in a data science role, preferably in a marketing measurement context

You have a deep understanding of advanced statistical modeling and/or machine learning techniques and have frequently applied these to drive business value

You have a high level of proficiency in building data science tools in either R or Python, especially with large data sets. Experience working directly within or alongside engineering teams is highly desirable

You have knowledge of and real passion for Big Data. Experience with SQL & Hadoop required. Experience with unstructured data is highly preferred

You have demonstrated the ability to work through complex business problems, identify opportunities to apply data science techniques, and partner with internal clients with a consultative approach

You have well-rounded commercial knowledge covering product and marketing. Experience of ecommerce strongly preferred

title: Senior Director, Security Compliance
content:
Expedia
Senior Director Security Compliance

The Enterprise Information Security team is seeking a leader who will ensure that we provide the technology and business teams of Expedia Group with world class governance, regulatory adherence and compliance with our security policies across our systems and environments. The GRC team will be charged with cultivating an organization that provides PCI certification, IT security controls and policy compliance and creation for on-prem and cloud based environment, SOC2 attestation, privacy requirements (e.g. GDPR), partner and consumer support of security documentation, and security oversight of EI contracts. This leader will partner and engage with our technology and business teams, manage long-term relationship, and large-scale compliance and certifications in support of our security posture.

What you’ll do: 

Lead and drive a team of Security Analyst and Compliance Experts

Foster a team culture of continuous improvement, mentoring and learning, data driven decisions, and accountability for delivery of key metrics and deliverables

Partner and collaborate with business and technology teams to develop actionable solutions for security compliance, certifications, and governance

Oversight for the creation, revisions and compliance of security policies and controls

Work closely with product management to prioritize and establish roadmap for the team

Who you are: 

Hands on experience with the compliance (e.g. auditing, control testing, certifications, and attestations)

Knowledge of current security controls and landscape including traditional data center and cloud computing platforms

Self motivated and able to effectively lead a large and diverse team

Must have well developed change management skills; be effective in working across organizational boundaries to build a case for changes, and to execute on the change plan from strategy through to ongoing operation and continuous process improvement

Experienced in, and able to formulate, the effectiveness and benefits of security compliance and certification initiatives in the context of overall business risk mitigation, security posture, and the company’s operational objectives

Demonstrated knowledge of security industry standards, privacy regulations, compliance testing and leading practices (e.g. PCI, OWASP, NIST, CIS, GDPR)

Experience in leading diverse security teams, and ability to present to senior management and large groups

Must be able to simplify security and technical concepts for laypersons within our business and technology teams

Demonstrated ability to work autonomously and manage a wide variety of work streams simultaneously, and under deadline

Exposure to security systems and process with a background in travel industry a plus

Minimum ten (10) years of information security experience, auditing and/or compliance in increasing responsible roles required

Professional certification in information security or compliance (for example, CISSP, CISM, or CISA) a plus

title: Senior Security Architect, Application Security
content:
Expedia
Expedia Group’s Enterprise Risk & Security team (ERS) is seeking a hardworking and highly motivated Senior Security Architect. This individual will shape the future of our security practices and technologies as Expedia Group's travel platform evolves and uses new technologies to provide the best travel experience for our customers. Our ERS team is one of the best risk and security organizations in the world. We create and use the best technology solutions to continuously protect our data and systems for the benefit of our customers.

Who you are

We are seeking an individual who is passionate about and capable of solving complex security challenges, at scale. You should possess or have confirmed experience with:

10 years of experience in IT security or security engineering, and a Bachelor’s degree in related area or equivalent

Producing and implementing security design patterns, standards, specifications procedures, and in developing and running security projects/programs in a complex, multi-matrixed organization

Extensive knowledge of security industry methodologies, standards, and policies and confirmed experience as a leader, operating in a critical role that has great impact to team success

Skilled at carrying out regulatory controls, policies, and standards with business owners; leading by influence

Experience developing and applying secure coding standards, designing and operating static and dynamic code analysis tools, auditing and identifying vulnerabilities in code, and developing code in an enterprise environment

Deep understanding of and experience with securing applications and services in public cloud infrastructures, cryptography, and architecting and securing CI/CD pipelines

Preferred: Master's degree in technical/related area; security certifications (e.g., CISSP, GIAC, CEH, etc.); experience building application security lifecycle programs, scorecards, reporting and metric tracking systems; demonstrated reduction of application vulnerabilities at an enterprise level

What you will do

Lead the development of security requirements, conduct security design, compliance and risk assessments, review and document information security policies and procedures, and evaluate security vendors, services and technologies.

Your work and influence spans Expedia Group, as you partner with technology and security leads from our divisions to understand their environments and identify strategic plans and solutions that deliver the highest levels of security. You develop and deliver on security programs and processes that span Expedia Group.

You translate security/business requirements into designs that engineering teams consume to successfully deliver. You evangelize teams' efforts with partners, finding opportunities for engineers to excel. You mentor junior members and participate in their goals and objectives to accelerating their growth.

You engage with internal teams and external vendors to identify where existing investments may be used and to drive enhancements and understand how roadmaps align with our security and technology needs.

You stay in the know about emerging threats and effectively convey to business partners and leadership, at all levels of the company. You have a passion for protecting the confidentiality and integrity of company assets, including employee, customer, supplier and partner data.

Why join us

title: Manager, Software Development
content:
Expedia
Do you want to transform the experience of millions of travelers the world over? Do you love working with a creative engineering team in building an intelligent, scalable and personalized travel assistance platform? Do you want to work with state of the art technologies such as real-time streaming, Natural Language Processing (NLP), Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning? Our goal is to build the best conversational bot platform that can meet customers on any channel (social, sms, web, or voice), use AI/ML to understand/anticipate their needs and deliver unparalleled service.

As a Development Manager, you propose, prototype, design various core components of the bot platform in collaboration with teams world over. In this role, will provide the thought leadership and technical expertise needed to overcome hard problems. By now, you would have built and supported critical components of products/platforms at scale.

Technologies we use:

Java, AWS, Kafka, GraphQL, Node.js, Kotlin, React, Elasticsearch, DynamoDB, S3, Lambda, Docker, Dropwizard, Data Dog, Looker.

Design, and develop new platform services to expand capabilities of our Virtual Agent platform

You will be responsible for coaching and mentoring an incredible, hardworking team around their goals, delivery, and career development.

Own and deliver tested and optimized high-performance code for a distributed messaging environment.

Participate in resolution of production issues and lead efforts toward solutions.

Contribute to vigilantly rewriting, refactoring, and perfecting code.

Work with QA, Product management and Operations in an agile environment to accomplish team goals

10+ years of experience leading teams of 5+, mentoring developers and helping to drive engineering maturity.

Hires top engineering talent and keep his/her team members challenged

Problem solver and an excellent coder with deep understanding of algorithms, data structures, distributed applications, and data modeling.

Passionate about quality of work, you are persistent and uncompromising.

title: Machine Learning Engineer II
content:
Expedia
Job Description

Are you passionate about Machine Learning? Do you love building creative, high-scale distributed systems using a diverse set of state-of-the-art technologies? You have an ambitious spirit, are deeply technical and analytical, and look for the opportunity to build AI solutions to problems that directly impact the company's bottom line. Our team wants to talk to you!

Expedia Enterprise Risk & Security (ERS) group is focused on a single mission to protect Expedia Group from financial loss and brand damage. We work on key risk problems associated with merchant and supplier fraud, account takeover, and more. As a Software Engineer, you will collaborate with highly skilled engineers, data scientists, and program managers to build a wide range of machine learning models. This requires the use of sophisticated distributed systems, real-time scoring environment, and the application of advanced statistical techniques. As part of your job, you will handle large amounts of training data, rapidly prototype new models that meet stringent performance requirements, perform offline and online testing and push these models to production.

What you’ll do

Build scalable, high-performance software/system for productionalizing scoring models

Establish scalable, efficient, automated processes for large scale data analyses, model development, validation and, implementation.

Provide accurate time estimates for your scope of work, turn it into code, and deliver on schedule.

Work closely with scientists and engineering teams to create and deploy new features.

Advocate for quality coding. Write secure, stable, testable, maintainable code with minimal defects.

Who you are

4+ years of software development experience

Coding proficiency in at least one modern programming language (Java, Scala, Python etc.). Strong background in data structures and algorithms

Experience working in Big Data and AWS Technologies (S3, EC2, EMR, lambda function, etc.).

Experience with automated testing, including unit, functional, and integration testing

Excellent organizational and communication skills

​Bachelor’s or master’s degree in CS or equivalent

Experience with machine learning techniques and technologies (Spark, Kafka, highly distributed and multi-sourced data pipelines, etc.) is preferred

title: Principal Architect - Enterprise Risk & Security
content:
Expedia
Principal Architect, Enterprise Risk & Security

We are looking for a highly enthusiastic, collaborative and resourceful architect to be part of Expedia’s eCommerce Platform Risk and Security (ERS) team. As the principal architect, you will be driving the application and technology stack that protect Expedia, Inc and its brands from financial losses and brand reputation by securing its most valuable assets across all channels.

You will have the opportunity to work on both a diverse range of strategic initiatives and projects as well as to take the lead on high visibility tactical objectives. You will bring your innate sense of curiosity and ability to absorb complex concepts to communicate to both technical and non-technical audiences. You will come with a breadth of full-stack experiences including scalable micro-services architecture, front-end frameworks, and cloud, and will have an ability to quickly ramp and assess new technologies.

You enjoy driving the development of prototype and proof-of-concepts, mentoring the engineering team, reviewing and guiding design choices, and dive into incidents when necessary.

What you’ll do: 

Translate the desired business outcome to technical solutions that meet operational and business needs

Design and architect solutions to build and extend upon our new distributed services

Guide the overall design and architecture of our platform and its components including the APIs

Identify new technologies and techniques that can improve the value proposition of the platform

Mentor members of the development team to help build effective engineering practices

Communicate effectively up and down the organization including to CTOs and executives across the company

Who you are: 

10+ years of experience crafting and architecting services and solution in a distributed environment for the enterprise

Define and communicate a longer-term technical vision for both engineers and senior leadership

Collaborate with architects across different brands and recommend areas of re-use for our organization

Experience with varied technologies such as Java, JavaScript, React, PHP, and AWS offerings such as Elastic Beanstalk, DynamoDB, and Lambda

Working knowledge of/with micro-services architecture, design patterns, and standard methodologies with an eye towards scale, automation, resiliency, high availability and user experience

Comfortable and experienced within agile/scrum software delivery practices

Solid working relationships with non-technical peers and a proven ability to understand the workings of the overall business

History of technical depth and recognition within previous teams as a domain authority

BS or MS in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent demonstrable hands-on experience
