title: Manager, Engineering
content:
Expedia
Expedia Group Media Solutions is dedicated to building creative media partnerships for travel advertisers enabling them to use Expedia's network of leading travel brands and global sites. We have revolutionized the way brands reach and connect with online travel consumers, emerging as a leader in online advertising among travel and e-commerce brands. With a growing product portfolio offering a multitude of advertising and sponsorship opportunities, our Media Solutions team at Expedia has created an expansive marketing platform for advertising partners to reach the 144+ million worldwide monthly unique visitors that visit Expedia Group sites.

Are you passionate about data and the technology needed to drive a multi-million-dollar business? Do you love building creative, high-scale data products using a diverse set of state-of-the-art technologies? Does leading a global, dynamic, and growing engineering organization energize you?

We are looking for an Engineering Manager who will drive the innovation and scale of the advertising products for Expedia Group Media Solutions. The mission will be to leverage data technology to power a vibrant advertising marketplace, an insight driven sales and marketing workforce, and personalized and targeted ad content for our customers. From strategy, to technical design, to execution, and optimization, – your role is to deliver a premier suite of products & services that will delight our advertisers and customers, while creating a working environment where top technical talent will thrive.

Successful team members in Media Solutions are fully accountable for themselves, their teams, and project delivery in a fast-paced and high-reaching environment. We understand and embody the 'One Team' philosophy and always strive to model the Expedia Group principles. We find creative ways to implement learning from ideas like Agile, Lean, Continuous Delivery and the Scientific Method in many aspects of leadership, management, delivery and operations. We are committed to a growth mindset and learning.

Responsibilities:

Manage a medium-sized team of software developers and software engineers in test to deliver software

Collaborate with product and engineering teams to leverage the latest technologies, define new platform features and build the technical product backlog

Engineer scalable, fault tolerant software components for serving ads

Prototype creative solutions quickly and be able to collaborate with others in crafting and implementing your technical vision.

Contribute and collaborate in creation and consumption of open, standards-based solutions, while working with existing Expedia technologies and infrastructure.

Identify opportunities for process and tool improvements and drive those from concept to implementation.

Requirements:

Strong technical background with 7+ years of relevant experience in technical development and 2+ years of technical leadership role as a Lead/Manager for a major feature or product

Technical skills: HTML, CSS, Angular and other front end (UI) technologies

Proven track record of shipping high quality products in high load production environments, world-class enterprise and/or ecommerce systems

Structured approach to development (measuring, monitoring, and testing) and a deep understanding of object-oriented design

Ability to ramp up quickly on new technologies

Excellent understanding of development concepts and SDLC methodologies

Strong verbal and written communication skills

BS, MS, or PhD in Computer Science or equivalent experience

Desired:

GitHub profile and/or contributions to the open source community

Knowledge of operating system internals, file systems, compilers

Experience with online advertising

Do you want to play a pivotal role in transforming experience of travelers the world over? Do you want to work in an extraordinary engineering team building an intelligent, scalable and personalized travel assistance platform. You will work with state of the art technologies such as real-time Kafka streaming, GraphQL, Natural Language Processing (NLP), AI & Machine Learning. Design and develop API library/Interfaces for publishing/ consuming & streaming data to and from the platform.

Influence and contribute to the overall architecture and design of the intelligent conversational platform.

Write your program as if you’re speaking to the person who will maintain your code.

Own every task you undertake as if the future of the company depends upon it.

7+ years of experience leading technical designs, mentoring developers and helping driving Engineering Maturity.

title: Director, Vulnerability Reduction
content: Looking to join our exciting Security team at Expedia Group, securing our company to continue to be at the forefront of travel technology? That is what we do within Enterprise Risk & Security (ERS). Our job is to ensure that our employees, consumers, and partners have a safe and secure experience while operating our services and brands. You can be a part of this!

to set the strategic direction for managing risk and securing IT across data center and cloud-based environments. The security wing of ERS designs, engineers and operates technical solutions that when coupled with documented processes and capable people, delivers enterprise-wide security services inside of service level objectives. People, technology, process and innovation are at the heart of our organization.

This role will be reporting into the Senior Director of Security Operations. As Director of Vulnerability Reduction you will drive long-term operational security thought leadership throughout Expedia Group and its internal and external partners. You will engage with direct reports, security team engineers, external partners and product team strategists to define, document and operate vulnerability reduction services that identify security gaps, prescribe fix actions and thereby elevate our enterprise security posture. Additionally, by leading penetration tests and red teams you will assess, prioritize and report on breaks in our security defenses. This position will require personnel and technical leadership, communication, collaboration and influencing skills.
You have earned a BA/BS in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Security, or Information Systems with a minimum of 12 years of computer and network security experience
You hold a CISSP, CISM, CISA, Security+, CEH, GCIA, GCIH or related certification
You have built or transformed highly effective vulnerability management programs within a global enterprise
You have demonstrated experience developing and leading a technically advanced security team in a global environment

You have advanced knowledge and of common communications protocols and attack techniques and embrace an ongoing pursuit of following new developments in this dynamic space and sharing them with othersy

You possess broad and deep understanding of technical security concepts and familiarity with related technologies and infrastructure, as well as a solid conceptual knowledge of enterprise IT system operations

You are fluent in common cybersecurity domains such as data protection, access control, encryption, identify management, security operations, application security, penetration tests, endpoint security, vulnerability management, threat intelligence, risk assessments
You easily collaborate across a large, matrixed organization utilizing strong written and verbal communication skills
You will deliver world-class vulnerability reduction services for Expedia Group across disparate brands and geographic locations
You will build, lead and direct penetration testing and red-team activities to identify and reduce vulnerabilities and elevate cybersecurity posture across the company
You will formulate and maintain the vulnerability reduction roadmap in close coordination with product strategy and security engineering

You will lead scalable and effective remediation at all layers of the organization, infrastructure and application stack by applying appropriate risk-based prioritization, simplifying requests and collaborating with business partners
You will recruit, coach, train, lead, and inspire a global team that strives for continual improvement

You will ensure the development, testing and implementation of appropriate security plans, products and control techniques to ensure a defense in depth security program is established across the enterprise
You will disseminate standards, policies, and develop business metrics for measuring and monitoring cyber & IT vulnerabilities on a continuous basis

title: Software Development Engineer II
content:
Expedia
Are you a seasoned developer looking for an exciting opportunity at the world’s largest travel company? Do you enjoy a fast-paced Agile environment where your hard work is destined to go to Production as often as every 2 weeks? Do you take pride in having a direct impact on the revenue generation capabilities of your company? If you answered, “Yes,” then we are eager to hear from you. 

Expedia Global Payments (EGP) is looking for top engineering talent to help drive the development of our payments platform, seamlessly roll out new payments methods, and to continuously raise the bar on our operational excellence and engineering practices. Our services are the nexus of a globally distributed system that spans many 
organizations. Our
 roadmap is deep and contains several innovative programs designed to make our services fault tolerant, reduce the cost of payment processing, and improve customer experience. This includes compensating for downstream services that are not in Expedia's control. We are also looking to use cloud computing (AWS) to further solidify our infrastructure. This opportunity presents you with great technical challenges and the ability to have a tremendous business impact. We do this accurately and at scale, processing over $30 billion payments in 45+ currencies in over 155 countries every year across diverse payment options.

What you'll do

This position focuses not only on implementing software solutions for state of the art e-commerce processing systems but also on being a role model and mentor to your fellow engineers. You will get to expand your skills in building highly scalable solutions while influencing others and raising the bar on the overall level of excellence within the team. You will also get the opportunity to hone your skills in influencing decisions across the technology ecosystem within Expedia Inc. by being a key subject matter expert in cross-functional feature delivery. Your input will be critical to the selection of new hires on the team. Whether you choose to move ahead in your career to a Principal Engineer role or manage people, this is the perfect position to learn how to move to the next stage of your career.

Who you are

5+ years Software Development work experience (Java experience strongly preferred)

5+ years creating and supporting Web Services in a high transactional environment

3+ years developing software using Dependency Injection Frameworks.

First class communication skills in written and verbal form

Proven record in technical mentoring of Software Engineers

Critical thinking skills and the ability to produce across your team and beyond

Rock solid coding skills

Strong Object Oriented Programming concepts, data structure, algorithms, and system level programming (including multi-threaded programming)

Track record of building your own automation and reporting tools to provide capabilities around your service

Ability to lead code reviews and technical design meetings

Proven record in successfully delivering highly available and scalable solutions with large transaction volume on a 24x7 operational cycle

Architectural knowledge of designing and developing software in distributed architecture for multi-tier applications

Thorough understanding of Software Development Lifecycle and methodologies

Ability to articulate technical design decisions and software implementation in technical forums

Knowledge of performance testing, application tuning and load testing

A degree in computer science or equivalent experience.

Prior experience with e-Commerce systems, Payments Solutions and Providers is a big plus.

Experience developing fault tolerant distributed systems is highly desirable.

Working knowledge of Agile Software Development mechanics.

Background in Service Oriented Architecture implementation, service versioning, and backward compatibility

Why join us

Expedia Group recognizes our success is dependent on the success of our people. We are the world's travel platform, made up of the most knowledgeable, passionate, and creative people in our business. Our brands recognize the power of travel to break down barriers and make people's lives better – that responsibility inspires us to be the place where exceptional people want to do their best work, and to provide them to tools to do so.

title: Senior Software Engineering
content:
Expedia
Do you care about helping customers find what they are looking for? Are you passionate about scalable, full-stack development? Are you interested in helping people make new memories? The Omni Communication Channels team is responsible for the Customer Communications from Expedia. Our platform supports millions of travel Emails, SMS and Push notifications for multiple Expedia Group Inc. brands. We are looking for a Senior Engineer who is self-starter to help build the next generation of our Communication platform. Bring your passion for software engineering, engineering excellence, and technical leadership and be part of our success!

Responsibilities:

Owns the end-to-end development life cycle for mid to large size projects: Design, development, testing, deployment, and providing operational excellence and support

You find and advocate for Industry standards and standard methodologies in development methodologies, techniques, and technologies

You contribute to advancing the team's design methodology and quality programming practices and mentor junior team members to adapt standard methodologies

Innovate and implement new ideas to solve complex software problems and prototype creative solutions to enable product MVP's

Independently understand scheduling, cost constraints, and impact to other teams; and make resource and architectural trade-offs

Based on those factors;

Anticipate and prevent problems and roadblocks, before they occur, and present technical issues and their impact to leadership

Lead, coordinate, and collaborate on multiple concurrent and complex cross-organizational initiatives

Effectively build and maintain a network of key contacts across company, and use these contacts to achieve results

Communicate and work effectively with geographically distributed multi-functional teams

Commit to continuous improvement in software and development process within an agile development team

Showed strength in most areas of the professional function, and in-depth specialization in some

7 -10 + years of experience in the field of Software Engineering

title: Principal Software Architect
content:
Expedia
Do you thrive in an environment focused on innovation, continuous delivery and platform services? Interested in defining and designing the next generation of transactional systems for Expedia Group? 

The Transactional Services team at Expedia is looking for an Architect to lead the platform vision, definition and solution design for eCommerce within FCTS. You will be instrumental in defining architecture, technical requirements and deliverables necessary for the team to execute on the vision. Bring your relentless drive for results and help us deliver.

Who you are:

You have a deep background developing enterprise middleware with progressive experience as a leader. You have designed, built and maintained high volume mission-critical systems and have a firm grasp of cloud and hybrid cloud solutions. You are comfortable functioning with an emphasis on solutions architect or software architect depending on the need.

What you will do:

You bring 10+ years’ full stack software experience across multiple technologies, languages and frameworks, 2+ years in an architect role

Draw on experience to lead technical designs and implementation of highly scalable and adaptable systems

Collaborate with senior engineers and technical product/program managers to plan and deliver solutions

Leverage past experience to quickly and efficiently define common data structures and contracts meeting the needs of clients upstream and downstream of the eCommerce platform, including finance and accounting

Leverage your experience designing scalable, resilient and secure systems

Leverage past-experience with Agile software development to help improve team execution

Quickly learn and become a subject matter expert for the eCommerce domain within Expedia based on similar past experience

Help design and organize solutions to maximize DevOps

Preferred Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Experience designing and building eCommerce systems

Experience designing and building orchestration layers

Diverse background with data storage and messaging technologies (RDBMS, NoSql, Document Store, in memory key/value, search systems)

Cloud experience designing and delivering Hybrid Cloud

Experience with native AWS database and messaging solutions

title: Principal Data Scientist
content:
Expedia
Principal Data Scientist 

What you'll do:

Build, deploy and optimize machine learning models to improve traveler experience:

Build Cross-sell recommendation function for visitors based on user segmentation /destination /Amenities /seasonality, etc

Build Text mining on UGC (user generated content) such as review/feedback to quantify customers’ pain points to help product/engineering to add/change features to improve customer experience

Democratize/standardize customer analytics (repeat rate, CLTV etc) by building cohort/longitudinal data service

Work in close partnership with Product/engineering/Marketing/Data platform teams to identify new opportunities to leverage Data Science and ensure that key projects are delivered in a timely fashion.

Develop a deep understanding of our data infrastructure and champion infrastructure development needs which will help the whole team work more effectively.

Be a technical leader on use, adoption and implementation of machine learning and modelling techniques

Provide mentorship, peer review, and thought leadership across the business in the areas of statistical methods, experimentation, and tools

Who you are:

Advanced Degree (PhD and/or Master’s) in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Machine Learning / AI

8+ years of hands-on experience with data science and analytics in business context

Able to frame business problems into scalable solutions and adapt existing and invent new techniques for solutions

Intellectual curiosity and desire to learn new things, techniques and technologies.

Advanced knowledge of at least one of the following programming languages: Python, Scala;

Knowledge of machine-learning/computational packages (numpy, scipy, pandas, scikit-learn)

Knowledge of test design, implementation and evaluation, with website A/B testing experience a plus

Excellent interpersonal skills, ability to present and write reports, strong partnership and collaboration skills

title: Manager, Product and Business Strategy
content: Do you want a highly impactful role within a team that is growing fast?
Are you passionate about driving business value with products that deliver an awesome customer experience? Then this opportunity might be for you.

The Insurance Commercial, Strategy and Services (CSS) team is responsible for managing the Insurance business P&L and driving strategy for products across the Expedia Group globally. Insurance delivers millions of dollars of incremental revenue making a direct and meaningful impact to the company's bottom-line.

While travel is fun, inspiring, and educational, the process of shopping for your dream trip and sometimes the journey itself brings notes of stress. The Assurance team sits within CSS Insurance but goes beyond traditional insurance to craft benefits that will provide travelers with peace of mind. We have proven the potential of these products, and we are continuing to invest in this business. As a part of our growth strategy, we are looking for a talented business development and analysis manager.

Come join this high performing entrepreneurial team to help formulate our Assurance strategy. If you enjoy using data and observations to build sound business cases, you will fit right in. In this role, you will use your skills to inspire product, engineering, finance and customer support teams to prioritize and implement our product ideas.
Use analytics and UX data and research to identify and define customer problems we can solve through Assurance.
Use data and analytics to glean insights, then use those insights to model the business landscape from the customer, business/ financial, and competitive analysis standpoints.
Articulate and communicate a business opportunity based on data, observations, and analysis, and utilizing a framework that tells a comprehensive story.
Help define strategy and prioritize opportunities in collaboration with the product and technology teams.
Propose new ideas that address common travel pains and build evidence backed business cases to support those ideas.
Deliver opportunity sizing of product ideas by combining analytical skills as well as creative use of sources to validate assumptions.
Serve as the expert on the product from a pricing, availability, terms and conditions, and overall vision perspective.
Develop effective relationships with the extended inter-disciplinary team comprised of product management, engineering, customer support, finance and legal.
Balance the needs and requirements of different teams to build consensus on a common strategy.
Develop a keen understanding of the competitive landscape by keeping abreast of market trends.
field or related discipline required - MBA a plus.
Proven ability to deliver revenue growth by identifying and leading high growth initiatives.
Experience within consulting or strategy roles is highly preferred.
Proven skills in business analysis, market research, and presentation creation.
Experience communicating with senior leadership, influencing decisions across multiple and matrixed teams within Expedia Group.
Experience identifying, negotiating and partnering with external business partners preferred.
Experience working in an e-commerce environment or within travel industry is helpful.
Ability and willingness to travel up to 25% of the time.

title: Sr. Business Intelligence Analyst
content:
Expedia
The online travel market is a $2 trillion industry that never stands still. Expedia Global Payments team (EGP) providers and operates software solutions that enable payment processing between Expedia and its network of customers and partners. This includes payment methods that Expedia brands offer to customers around the world and the payment options that Expedia uses to support effective relationships with partners and suppliers. We process billions of dollars in customer and partner transactions every month.

Why build your career with the EGP group? We offer a chance to work with the brightest minds in the travel business in an energetic and international work environment focused on innovation, creative problem-solving and collaboration.

In this role you will a part of the Payments Business Intelligence team and play a significant role in advancing Expedia’s analytics capabilities. As an important part of the EGP division, the Payments Business Intelligence team is responsible for building and maintaining the EGP data warehouse as well as delivering analytic insights, reports and self-service tools to global stakeholders.

Your mission will be to deliver quantitative analysis, decision support and reporting artifacts on a broad range of topics within the EGP domain. This requires the ability to identify the appropriate data sources, assess their usefulness, consolidate the required attributes, and derive meaningful information and insights. The focus goes beyond creating reports and pulling data – it is to tackle complex business problems, build compelling data-driven stories and become a trusted business advisor to a variety of cross functional BI consumers.

The ideal candidate will:

Be able to synthesize business scenarios into meaningful actionable Analytics and Reporting requirements

Use technical skills and knowledge to identify, collect and evaluate data, required for analyses

Have strong practical experience building and delivering (via reporting solutions, storytelling and formal presentations) quantitative research and business reporting solutions

Be self-motivated, able to deal with ambiguity, and work well under pressure to meet deadlines within short time constraints

Key Responsibilities include, but not limited to:

Deliver accurate and impactful analysis based on solid understanding of data sources and business needs, including economic, financial, and statistical analysis

Translate business questions into, analytic hypotheses, data needs and reporting requirements

Define data collection requirements (attributes, format, structure) and represent them during the data warehouse and software engineering projects

Clearly and concisely present strategic and tactical recommendations; develop compelling presentations for both internal and external customers

Partner with senior business leaders on solving complex business challenges and provide relevant data-driven insights

Develop analytical models to estimate the impact of different scenarios, assisting in the business decision making process

Design, develop and maintain compelling, accurate, and reliable analytical reports

Become a trusted advisor to key BI stakeholders and provide ad-hoc reporting, data extracts, and analyses

Education:

Bachelor's or Master’s degree in a business or technology field or related discipline

Qualifications:

Passion for improving business outcomes through data and analytics solutions

Proven experience in a reporting and analytics role, including experience with large data set processing and Data Warehousing

Background in data mining and statistics

Deep knowledge of analytical tools, including Tableau, R, Qlik, MS Reporting Services, PowerPivot, etc

Solid practical experience with relational databases and proven expertise in SQL

Strong working knowledge of ETL principles. Practical experience with SSIS or Informatica preferred.

Team oriented with a collaborative approach and attitude

Excellent written and oral communication skills; outstanding presentation and PowerPoint skills

Familiarity with Analytic tools and solutions in the cloud (AWS, Azure) is preferred

Background in payment technology and processes with an understanding of payment data analysis is strongly preferred

title: Senior Analyst, Pricing & Yield
content:
Expedia
About Expedia Group Media Solutions

Expedia Group Media Solutions is dedicated to building creative media partnerships for travel advertisers enabling them to use Expedia's network of leading travel brands and global sites. We have revolutionized the way brands reach and connect with online travel consumers, emerging as a leader in online advertising among travel and e-commerce brands. With a growing product portfolio offering a multitude of advertising and sponsorship opportunities, our Media Solutions team at Expedia has created a viable marketing platform for advertising partners to reach the 144+ million worldwide monthly unique visitors that visit Expedia Group sites.

The Media Solutions' Pricing & Yield team is looking for a senior data analyst to analyze price and inventory data resulting from serving our content to millions of users. We value rigor and creativity in our analysis and believe in the power of a motivated & empowered team. There is so much we want to do and we need strong analysts who can navigate massive data sets, solve challenging problems, and jump into new projects. Your work will touch systems at scale that reach people all around the world, while having a significant impact on our business. We connect travelers with meaningful destinations. Expedia Group has revolutionized the travel industry by applying technology and we are committed to enabling travelers through continued innovation. We are focused on building relevant experiences and our products aren't just about monetization, they align with our passion for travel. We help customize the shopping experience for each user and bring them closer to their next big adventure.

Senior Yield Analyst (Digital Advertising)

Do you enjoy tackling complex problems? Do large data sets excite you? Do you like math? Do you find yourself thinking “I should make a spreadsheet to analyze that” in your personal life? If so, read on, we might have the job for you.

The Pricing & Yield team in Expedia Group’s Media Solutions business think numbers make the world go around, or at least in the part of the world that we work in. We believe the bigger the data the better. There is also a strong correlation between the complexity of a problem and the level of happiness we feel when we solve it.

You will be a key team member and play a critical role in our work to drive the business forward, faster and farther by solving problems and trying unheard-of things in our industry.

Buzzwords that you’ll get to put on your resume include: revenue and yield management, dynamic pricing models, SQL, Excel spreadsheets, digital advertising, inventory forecasting and whatever you can convince us is worthwhile to work on. You’ll apply your skills across the Expedia Group network of websites including Expedia, Hotels.com, Hotwire, Travelocity, Orbitz, CheapTickets, Wotif and others. We operate more than 100 branded points of sale in more than 60 countries and this is where big data, scale and problem complexity come into play.

If your experience and interests align and you’ve been referred to as highly analytical, meticulous, and a strong communicator, we have an opportunity for you. Please apply.

You will:

Develop and deploy KPI reporting suite to inform Sales team about product inventory availability

Build and maintain management/dashboard reporting, identifying key performance trends and drivers of sold volume, supply, ad product mix, pricing, and sell-through for partners

Analyze KPI drivers to optimize pricing, improve products, and add customer value

Become a power user and subject matter expert for our yield management system (YieldEx), providing support and training to promote the usage of data insights

Respond to ad hoc data requests and analyses to provide actionable insights to partner teams including Sales, Product, Operations and Finance

Communicate and work effectively with many internal partners

Qualifications:

BA/BS in Business, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or similar analytic field

Consultative, analytical approach towards delivering business results and process improvements

4+ years of work experience; hands-on experience in online advertising pricing and yield management is helpful.

Capacity to provide high level of customer service to partners at all levels of an organization.

Excellent written and verbal interpersonal skills.

Strong analytical experience and business insight.

Advanced Excel skills.

Working knowledge of SQL and/ or relational databases

Experience working with online advertising platforms such as DFP, YieldEx, Omniture, etc.

Python, R or VBA programming skills are helpful

About Expedia Group

Our mission is to revolutionize travel through the power of technology.

Collectively, the Expedia Group brands cover virtually every aspect of researching, planning, and booking travel, from choosing the best airplane seat, to reading personal travel reviews of hotels, to planning what to do in a destination once you arrive. The Expedia Group portfolio serves both leisure and business travelers with tastes and budgets ranging from modest to luxury. Expedia delivers consumer travel demand from nearly every continent to nearly 149,000 hotels and hundreds of airlines, tour operators, car rental companies and destination services supply partners. Please visit http://bit.ly/expediabrands to learn more about our travel brands.

title: Senior Cloud Data Security Engineer
content:
Expedia
DSP – Data Services and Platforms

Our mission is to power reliable, trustworthy and scalable data products, that fuel decision-making and give a competitive advantage to Expedia Group.

We use a blend of open source, custom development, and commercial tools to deliver and operate petabyte-scale data platforms used across the business. Our ecosystem includes multiple cloud providers, massive Hadoop clusters, parallel databases, and a broad mix of leading data management and analytics tools.

Who You Are:

We are looking for an experienced Cloud Security Engineer who is passionate about maintaining a high-quality bar for software and is deeply committed to supporting decision-making through data analysis and driving security compliance through automation.

Ideal candidates:

Are fluent in modern software architectures and concepts, able to speak at every level of the organization and across technology stacks

Are familiar with modern enterprise cloud security patterns

Have strong experience in Python, or equivalent language, and proficient with Linux

Have 7+ years of experience with securing cloud infrastructure in AWS

Have 7+ years of experience in deploying and managing large scale distributed systems

Have 5+ years of experience building automation to deploy and manage AWS infrastructure

What You Will Do:

You will architect, build and support a modern, multi-tenant cloud-based enterprise data platform for both transactions and analytics and share your knowledge with your teammates, as well as the larger tech community. Principally responsible for the security architecture and tooling, ensuring our compliance with security policies as well as driving the organization in continuously improving our security posture.

Principally responsible for the security design of DSP’s enterprise data strategy

Design, implement and maintain network topology and security policies for our data environments, both cloud and on-premise

Innovate on multi-tenant cloud data sharing with an emphasis on distributed access

Collaborate with infrastructure, network, database, application, and business analytics teams to ensure data quality, durability and availability

Support development, QA, and operations teams

Evaluate and propose new tools and technologies to meet the needs of the organization

Ensure all platform architectures comply with Expedia Group’s security policies

Why Join Us:

Expedia Group recognizes our success is dependent on the success of our people. We are the world's travel platform, made up of the most knowledgeable, passionate, and creative people in our business. title: Senior Technology Lead
content:
Expedia
DSP – Data Services and Platforms

Our mission is to power reliable, trustworthy and scalable data products, that fuel decision-making and give a competitive advantage to Expedia Group.

We use a blend of open source, custom development, and commercial tools to deliver and operate petabyte-scale data platforms used across the business. Our ecosystem includes multiple cloud providers, massive Hadoop clusters, parallel databases and a broad mix of leading data management and analytics tools.

Who You Are:

We are looking for a Senior Technology Lead who is passionate about maintaining a high-quality bar for software and is deeply committed to supporting decision-making through data analysis.

Ideal candidates:

Have a deep understanding of software engineering principles, algorithms, data structures, and distributed systems concepts.

Have 7+ years of experience leading or working on complex software projects using Java, Scala, Python or similar.

Have hands on experience and knowledge of the fundamentals of cloud computing (including virtualization, multi-tenant cloud infrastructures, storage systems and content delivery networks).

Are fluent in modern architectures and concepts, able to speak at every level of the organization.

Have experience with distributed data processing (Hadoop, Spark, Pig, Hive) and open source software (Cassandra, MongoDB, RabbitMQ, NGINX, Redis, Elasticsearch) along with data processing algorithms (MapReduce, Flume).

Have diverse data platform experience including NoSQL, MongoDB, Hadoop, Spark, SparkML, Tensorflow.

What You Will Do:

You will architect, build and support a modern, multi-tenant cloud-based enterprise data platform for both transactions and analytics and share your knowledge with your teammates, as well as the larger tech community.

You will drive innovation with technologies and solutions in the large-scale distributed cloud services and petabyte-scale data processing space.

You'll work to identify new product features and close feature gaps in new and existing products.

Collaborating across our team, you'll deliver rapid, iterative designs and/or new technology proof-of-concepts.

You will provide technical leadership and participate in development efforts.

You'll provide technical insight to the team, delivering recommendations, tutorials, blog articles and technical presentations, adapting to different levels of technical partners.

You'll collaborate across a diverse team of internal and external partners.

title: Senior Software Engineer (Data Science)
content:
Expedia
Do you care about understanding what customers are looking for? Are you interested in unlocking key insights to power personalization for a global travel platform? The Customer Insights team is responsible for Brand Expedia’s systems to classify customer intent and identify content that best serves the customer need. By knowing our customers, we drive richer experiences and realize greater value for the company. We ware looking for a Senior Engineer with a background in data science to help build the next generation of this customer insights platform. Bring your passion for software engineering, engineering excellence, data science and technical leadership and be part of our success!

Responsibilities:

Be instrumental in the performance of our team to ensure that we meet the global needs of our business while minimizing technical debt.

Utilize and advance your skills in building highly scalable solutions while influencing others, being a role model to the team members and raising the bar on the overall level of excellence within the team.

Architect, design, develop, document, and maintain full stack projects of various scope within a cloud native, data streaming, real time processing system.

You will operate as technical lead, driver and architect for the team’s products, anticipate and prevent problems and know when to ask for help.

Design machine-learning systems as well as selecting appropriate datasets and data representation methods.

Embrace change and navigate it effectively while producing valuable results along the way.

You are unafraid of ambiguous situations and always be open to replacing what you built yesterday with something better today.

Find and advocate industry standards and best practices in development methodologies, techniques, and technologies.

Innovate, simplify and creatively implement new ideas to solve ambiguous and complex software problems.

You will make the right judgment calls to deliver features in time, with the highest possible level of quality, in the best interest of the customer by collaborating across disciplines, teams and organizations seamlessly.

Qualifications:

7+ years of experience in object-oriented programming concepts, data structure, algorithms, and system level programming (including multi-threaded programming).

Proven experience with model building for classification and ranking problems - particularly to support personalised experiences.

Experience with data management practices to optimally source and publish information about customers to drive learning and insights.

Strong knowledge and working experience of event driven systems and APIs to support analytics and real time personalization.

Experience with AWS Cloud Computing, NoSQL databases, GIT and utilizing Spring frameworks.

Bachelors or Master’s degree in computer science, information technology.

A strong drive and passion to learn new software design patterns, tools and technologies.

First class communication skills in written and verbal form.

Ability to lead and influence code reviews as well as technical design and architecture.

Strong expertise with high volume, fault tolerant, tier 1 systems, microservice design, and data processing pipelines (Docker, Kafka, Kinesis, Spark, EMR, Graph QL, Kotlin, Kubernetes or similar).

The ability to apply critical thinking to solve problems at a team and group level.

Staunch proponent of continuous delivery, automated deployments, and related engineering practices.

Strong judgment on building in-house vs. using open source or package solutions

title: Senior Software Dev Engineer
content:

Do you care about helping customers find what they are looking for? Are you passionate about scalable, full-stack development? Are you interested in helping people make new memories? The Partner Central Onboarding Team is responsible for Brand Expedia's expansion and growth of travel destinations. We help hotels reach millions more potential travelers every day. We are looking for a Senior Engineer who is self-starter to help build the next generation of our Onboarding platform. Bring your passion for software engineering, engineering excellence, and technical leadership and be part of our success!

Responsibilities:

Owns the end-to-end product life cycle for mid to large size projects: Design, development, testing, deployment, and providing operational excellence and support

You find and advocate for Industry standards and standard methodologies in development methodologies, techniques, and technologies

Showed strength in most areas of the professional function, and in-depth specialization in some

content:

title: Application Engineer II (Dev Ops)
content:
Expedia
Are you looking to join a team that builds infrastructure and tools at a large scale? Are you passionate about security, scalability, and availability? Do you want to be a part of an emerging DevOps culture that values quality and speed?

Within the Transactional Services Operations Team, we’re all about inspiration, challenge, collaboration, innovation, and having a say in what you do. Through our energy and passion for delivering highly reliable systems to our customers, we empower Expedia’s brands to deliver best-in-class experiences for booking travel.

We’re looking for an Application Engineer II who can help us build and extend our platform of foundational tools and services. The right individual embraces the opportunity to tackle challenging problems and drives continual improvement. They will work with the cutting edge of technology, including Amazon Web Services, Kong, Docker, Jenkins, Chef, Splunk, Python, Java, and more.

What you’ll do:

Develop innovative solutions that solve complex infrastructure problems at scale.

Build foundational tools that enable us to operate services safely and securely, focusing on performance, reliability, and scalability.

Help our team grow with good judgment, sound decision making, and spreading knowledge.

Develop best practices that ensure operational excellence across software teams.

Provide support and consultation for service/network architectures, production incidents, and operational activities.

Who you are:

To thrive in this role, you must have…

4+ years of relevant work experience.

A record of continued growth with ever-increasing responsibilities in previous roles.

Strong written and verbal communication skills.

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.

A collaborative spirit with the ability to work across disciplines to influence, learn and deliver.

A strong understanding of computer science and software development principles

Practical experience with security and networking technologies and principles.

Extensive experience with Linux administration and engineering.

Demonstrated experience with scripting languages, such as Python, Bash, Perl, JavaScript, etc.

Experience building Continuous Delivery solutions with tools such as Jenkins, Chef, etc.

Demonstrated experience building solutions with Amazon Web Services (AWS) and/or other relevant Cloud Infrastructure solutions like Microsoft Azure or Google Cloud.

Travel and/or other e-commerce experience is a plus.

title: Manager, Product and Business Strategy
content:
Expedia
Do you want a highly impactful role within a team that is growing fast?

Are you passionate about driving business value with products that deliver an awesome customer experience?

Are you ready to help people go places?

Then this opportunity might be for you.

The Insurance Commercial Strategy and Services (CSS) team is responsible for managing the Insurance business P&L and driving its strategy and business development efforts across the Expedia Group globally. Insurance delivers millions of dollars of incremental revenue making a direct and meaningful impact the company's bottom-line.

While travel is fun, inspiring and educational, the process of shopping for your dream trip and sometimes the journey itself brings notes of stress. The CSS Insurance looks across traditional & creative insurance products to craft benefits that will provide travelers with peace of mind. We have successfully demonstrated the potential of these products, and we are continuing to invest in this business. As a part of our growth strategy, we are looking for a hardworking
 Manager, Product and Business Strategy

Come join this high performing entrepreneurial team to help formulate our Insurance strategy. If you enjoy using data and observations to build sounds business cases, solve business problems, improve on-going business activities and work on a team that functions as the “business owner” you will fit right in. In this role, you will use your analytical and business skills to inspire product, engineering, finance and customer support, and our strategic partners to prioritize, implement and scale our product ideas.

What you'll do with us:

Define product vision, strategy and initiatives based on keen understanding of customer needs, the competitive landscape and market opportunity ($), including assessing competitive advantage and the company’s capacity to meet the opportunity. ​

Prioritize & execute on business opportunities in collaboration with the product management and technology teams.

Enrich the team with business, product, revenue, growth and/or customer insights that address common travel pains and build evidence backed business cases to create better products, initiatives, customer experiences, and business initiatives

Deliver opportunity sizing of product ideas by combining analytical abilities as well as creative use of sources to validate assumptions.

Be a Customer Advocate. Support creation of new product experiences & service solutions that solve current and future customer problems above and beyond expectations, inspiring customer delight and advocacy. Develop a keen understanding of consumer expectations & pain-points, and the competitive landscape by keeping abreast of market trends

Serve in the business manager role supporting the growth vision and/or revenue optimization opportunity from inception to launch. Take lead on identifying, prioritizing and solving issues across varied business activities, such as PnL management, management reporting, customer experience, etc.

Lead strategic partner account management on assigned project and initiatives, independently leading partner discussions, alignment on business goals, business negotiations. Perform vendor Contract Review. Demonstrate exceptional relationship management abilities for successful business partnership

Lead projects independently, and balance the needs and requirements of different teams to build consensus on a common strategy and project execution

Develop effective relationships with the extended inter-disciplinary team of product management, engineering, customer support, finance and legal.

Who you are:

Bachelor’s degree in a Business/economics/math/technical field or related discipline required, with minimum 5 years full-time, professional industry experience, or Master’s degree in similar fields with minimum 3 years experience. MBA a plus.

Proven ability to deliver revenue growth by identifying and leading high growth initiatives.

Experience within consulting, internal strategy or product management roles is highly preferred.

Experience working in an e-commerce environment, or insurance/financial services or within travel industry is helpful.

Proven skills in business analysis, must be independent with data sourcing & synthesis, and presentation creation to make concise business case

Proven skills in project execution with multi-disciplinary teams

Proven skills in customer, competitor and/or industry research

Experience communicating with senior leadership, influencing decisions across multiple and matrixed teams

Experience in strategic partner/vendor management i.e. identifying, negotiating and partnering with external business partners preferred

Expertise with MS Suite required.

Knowledge of SQL preferred.

Ability and willingness to travel up to 10% of the time.

title: BI Platform Engineer
content:
Expedia
Data Services & Platforms - DSP

Expedia Group is a leader in using technology to drive business results, and that's where we come in. Our mission in DSP is to make access to data undeniably easy through technology and solutions that unleash the creativity of our people to unlock the power of the world’s best travel platform.

Our products are used by engineers, analysts and data scientists to process data in real-time, powering algorithms, delivering complex analytics, and helping our customers find their dream holiday or trip. Add to that our integrated, value-led partner approach and we’re able to bring forward solutions that drive decisions faster and innovation further, keeping Expedia Group at the forefront of technology and travel.

Join our team and help us create an exciting set of products and services for data at the center of Expedia Group's global travel platform. We're building and running a next generation, multi-tenant managed data platform and services to scale with the business and unlock value from data for applications, algorithms and analytics.

Are you data driven, focused and pragmatic? Do you have a passion for turning data into meaningful insights? Do you find the prospect of working on a best-in-class analytics platform backed by a cutting-edge data platform scaling to hundreds of terabytes exciting? If you do, we would love you to join us.

What you’ll do

​​You will work closely with Product and Operation teams, along with a wide array of partners, to design and build world-class data & BI platform on prem and Cloud environment. You will make meaningful dashboards out of usage data of various tools.

​You will design, develop and implement BI platforms across a variety of tools (Tableau, Qlik, SAP BO, MicroStrategy, etc)

​You will solve complex engineering challenges related to delivering a set of scalable, flexible and reliable multi-tenant BI platforms

​You will partner with DSP Operations teams to ensure effective end to end support of tier 3 support issues

You'll participate in the review and project work to ensure that objectives, expectations and standards are met

​You will commit to ongoing improvement in the ecosystem to delivering features including monitoring, instrumentation, deployment capabilities enabling platform reliability, scalability and resiliency

​You ensure the ongoing relevance of the platform by enabling and delivering a rapid upgrade and refresh cadence

​Deliver proof of concepts, pilots and product evaluations to accelerate the onboarding of new BI capabilities in partnership with DSP Product Management

​Collaborate and mentor with junior team member to grow the skills within the team and across brand partners.

Who are you

​BS in Computer Science or a related engineering field, MS preferred

​5+ years Software & Platform and Application Development experience with a focus on business intelligence and analytics tools

​Hand’s on experience across variety of BI platform eco system including BI in the cloud and vendor SaaS BI implementations

​Experience across multiple server operating system, hardware and virtualization platforms & hands on Linux scripting is preferred.

​Experience working in a diverse multi-vendor commercial and open source data management stack (including Hadoop, Teradata, EMR, Redshift, Qubole, etc)

​Good communication and presentation skills and the ability to explain technical details and challenges to a wide variety of .

​Demonstrated ability to look at solutions in creative and unconventional ways, recognize opportunities to innovate, and engage partners

​Ability to navigate a diverse organization with global, decentralized teams working across multiple locations

Why join us:

Expedia Group recognizes our success is dependent on the success of our people. We are the world's travel platform, made up of the most knowledgeable, passionate, and creative people in our business. Our brands recognize the power of travel to break down barriers and make people's lives better – that responsibility inspires us to be the place where exceptional people want to do their best work, and to provide them the tools to do so.

Whether you're applying to work in engineering or customer support, marketing or lodging supply, at Expedia Group we act as one team, working towards a common goal; to bring the world within reach. We relentlessly strive for better, but not at the cost of the customer. We act with humility and optimism, respecting ideas big and small. We value diversity and voices of all volumes. We are a global organization but keep our feet on the ground, so we can act fast and stay simple. Our teams also have the chance to give back on a local level and make a difference through our corporate social responsibility program, Expedia Cares.

If you have a hunger to make a difference with one of the most loved consumer brands in the world and to work in the dynamic travel industry, this is the job for you.

Our family of travel brands includes: Brand Expedia®, Hotels.com®, Expedia® Partner Solutions, Egencia®, trivago®, HomeAway®, Orbitz®, Travelocity®, Wotif®, lastminute.com.au®, ebookers®, CheapTickets®, Hotwire®, Classic Vacations®, Expedia® Media Solutions, CarRentals.com™, Expedia Local Expert®, Expedia® CruiseShipCenters®, SilverRail Technologies, Inc., ALICE and Traveldoo®.

title: Software Development Engineer (Data Engineering Team)
content:
Expedia
As a Software Development visionary, are you working on new technologies, surrounded by disruptive problem solvers, or working with game-changers? We are. At Expedia, our team is leading the way in delivering Big Data solutions. The only question is; “will you come along for the ride?”

Description:

The Expedia Data Products and Platforms team is currently looking for talented and highly motivated Software Development Engineers with a heavy programming and analysis background. As part of this team, you will be responsible for the delivery of solutions on top of the Big Data platforms implementation and will be playing a key role in this huge technology pivot. You will not only help train our existing staff making the leap over to our new technologies, but you will also empower the team to approach problems differently. These solutions drive business value from powering the most critical business decisions to powering how the site behaves through various avenues of personalization. This entails working with the delivery team and business partners to flesh out requirements, complete solution design, development and ultimate delivery to the end consumers.

Responsibilities:

You will understand business rules; define and develop applications/ architecture, perform source to target data mapping, design, review, implement and optimize Data Engineering and ETL processes.

You will actively be involved in reviews on development and test specifications. Perform data analysis, provide development/QA support for existing systems, and troubleshoot data and/or system issues within the Data Warehouse environment as well as upstream systems, as needed.

You will drive investigations across the organizations and deliver resolution of technical, procedural, and/or operational issues to completion and ensure customer satisfaction.

You will develop test plans/cases, conditions and scenarios in support of ongoing business system applications and infrastructure.

You will provide timely and appropriate communication to business owners, business partners, and users on issue status and resolution.

Qualifications:

Strong Background in Data warehousing principles, architecture and its implementation in large environments.

Experience in data engineering applications and products in AWS or any cloud provider.

Data engineering/ETL Design and Development knowledge using Hadoop or Spark

Experience with AWS (Dynamo DB, Lambda, or S3).

Hands-on experience on programming (Java, Python, or Scala), and to perform data/file manipulation using Shell scripting.

Experience using no-SQL technologies and Big Data platforms such as HBASE or Cassandra; strong development skills around Hadoop, Hive, Map Reduce.

Hands-on experience using Database procedural languages such as SQL, PL/SQL, T-SQL; database scripting in Oracle or Teradata.

Hands-on experience with test practices and processes; test automation, test coverage and user acceptance testing.

Exposure to Object-oriented design, distributed computing, performance/scalability tuning, advanced data structures and algorithms, real time analytics and large scale data processing.

Exposure to ETL Development tools such as Informatica, Stonebranch, Airflow, SSIS, SSRS, DataServices.

Experience working in Agile/SCRUM model.

Core Competencies:

Ability to design multi­-platform solutions.

Excellent collaboration with customers, including crisp and compelling verbal and written communication.

Excellent problem solving and analytical skills.

Ability and desire to work in a fast-paced environment and stay motivated/flexible.

Ability to work cross functionally to resolve technical, procedural, and operational issues.

Education and Work Experience:

MS/ME/BS/BE/B Tech degree in Computer Science, related technical field, or equivalent work experience.

5+ years of experience in data warehouse technologies.

title: Software Development Engineer II
content: Expedia’s GCO Customer Intelligence and Data team is seeking a skilled Software Development Engineer to design, develop, and implement data visualizations and self-service tools that will put key information at the fingertips of our decision makers. This role will interact with all facets and levels of the organization to define requirements, develop solutions, and drive value using an agile development process. You'll be both technically and functionally building a business intelligence platform from the ground up. Collaboration with and contribution to a multi-functional team will be key to successful delivery of business requirements. This role requires an energetic attitude, creative problem solving, a passion for technology and data, superb communication, relationship building skills, as well as flexibility in approach and design.

Accountable for partnering with business stakeholders to provide them the ability to make decisions and gain insights through data visualization and reporting. This would include requirements gathering, iterations, visualization best-practices, design, deployment, and on-going enhancements.
Drive value with innovative solutions, and delivering improved upon methods of data presentation by focusing on the business need and the business value of the solution.
Autonomously write SQL at an expert level to mine data that and then can be communicated or translated to peer ETL developers for database development.
: Expert with report development, dashboard development, SQL queries, and meta-data layers. Experience with Agile development methodology is required.
Lead peers and partners as a SME through troubleshooting, analysis of results, Production Support, and identification of opportunities to solve Business problems through BI.

Solve Business challenges by leading the translation of data, impact of that data, and be able to effectively communicate the story that the deliverable tells or the problem that the deliverable solves.
Inspire team members by being a visionary leader, providing peer support, and constantly challenging the team for the best results.
Experience with Agile development methodology. The ability to work under stress, to fixed deadlines and a flexible approach to working hours (when required) to meet deadlines.
Understand data visualization concepts and methodologies. Methodical, accurate and with attention to detail.
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Computer Science, Information Systems or equivalent degree/experience. 5-8 years’ experience with Business
and Data Warehousing with 4+ years’ experience in data visualization tools.
Expert level knowledge on relational databases (e.g., MySQL, SQL Server, Snowflake) as well as experience with Qubole Data Services or Elastic Map Reduce.
Experience with Cloud technology (AWS or similar).
Proficiency in a development language (Python or similar). Skills in Machine Learning, Predictive Analytics, R and Statistical Analysis is preferred.

title: Senior Software Developer-UI
content:
Expedia
Are you passionate about data and the technology needed to drive a multi-billion-dollar business? Do you love building creative, high-scale data products using a diverse set of state-of-the-art technologies?

Expedia’s Global Customer Operations Technology team is dedicated to driving technology innovation to create effortless customer experiences worldwide in Expedia apps, web sites, support channels, and contact centers. We support over 15 thousand agents and over 100 million customer interactions a year – with a global brand portfolio and workforce.

We are looking for software UI Engineers with a real passion for data. We are responsible for building accelerators, products and processes that power the data pipelines at Expedia, enable self-service capabilities and accelerate solution delivery. In this role, you will build and mature the UI for Expedia’s on-premises and cloud-based data platforms, collaborating to solve big challenges in the data ecosystem: data replication, providing cloud agnostic data services, intelligent monitoring/alerting of location agnostic data platforms, federated processing etc.

If you have strong web development skills and enjoy building web-based UI’s on a modern web stack, this is the place for you. Add a healthy passion for wrestling with large datasets and a desire to build automation tools, and you'll be set apart from the crowd.

If teamwork, respect, ownership, recognition, trust, simplification, and test-and-learn speaks to you - and the thought of joining a growing team excites you - we want to talk to you.

What You'll Do

You will lead the design, analysis, development and deployment efforts for multiple enterprise application projects to tackle complex business problems.

You'll produce scalable, flexible, efficient and supportable solutions using appropriate technologies.

You'll support and follow the Expedia Software Development Lifecycle.

You will collaborate with Developers, Program Managers, Testers and Production Support Engineers in an agile development environment.

You will work with the product team to quickly prototype and iterate on new ideas - and you'll create fast, easy-to-use, and intuitive applications.

Who you are

+5 years of experience leading technical designs, mentoring developers and helping driving Engineering Maturity.

Experience building full-stack applications with Java, Node.js, React, etc.

Deep understanding of software design principles, algorithms, data structures, and multithreading concepts.

Experience with JavaScript testing frameworks (Jasmine, Mocha, Jest, etc.).

Self-starter that enjoys and takes pride in the development work of their team.

A strong passion for solving complex software engineering puzzles.

Ability to thrive in a dynamic, collaborative and exciting environment.

title: Database Site Reliability Engineer II
content:
Expedia
Are you looking to join a team that builds foundational infrastructure, automation, and tools at a large scale? Are you knowledgeable of different database technologies and passionate about ensuring the security, scalability, and availability of these resources? 

Within the Transactional Services Site Reliability Engineering team, we’re all about inspiration, challenge, collaboration, innovation, and having a say in what you do. Through our energy and passion for delivering highly reliable systems to our customers, we empower Expedia’s brands to deliver best-in-class experiences for booking travel. We are looking for someone to come and help us increase our efficiency with database technologies to achieve our goals. 

Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) is a discipline that combines software and systems engineering to build and run large-scale, distributed, fault-tolerant systems. SRE ensures that Expedia’s critical systems have the stability and reliability required to meet the needs of our users. SRE is also a set of engineering approaches to running better production systems and building solutions to solve operations problems. As part, or database systems are essential to our systems and capabilities to effectively scale and grow our transaction-based systems effectively and reliably. Much of our software development focuses on optimizing existing systems, building infrastructure, and eliminating manual work through automation. 

As a Site Reliability Engineer, focusing on our database systems, you will be a builder and not a maintainer. You will design, build and refine database systems to improve the availability, latency, scalability and performance aspects of our services.

WHAT YOU’LL DO

- Engage early in the service lifecycle by contributing to system design, developing software platforms and frameworks, capacity planning, and production readiness reviews.

- Enable reliability and scalability by developing infrastructure, automation and tooling.

- Build solutions for auto-mitigation, auto-healing, and fault tolerance to reduce blast radius and prevent re-occurrence of issues.

- Create visibility by measuring and monitoring availability, latency, and overall system health.

- Continually evolve systems by developing and advocating for changes that improve stability and reliability.

- Practice sustainable incident response and blameless postmortems.

WHO YOU ARE

To thrive in this role, you must have…

- Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related technical field involving coding or systems engineering, or equivalent practical experience

- Strong communication skills and the ability to influence others

- Strong database system design focusing on both SQL and No-SQL technologies

- Strong debugging, troubleshooting, and problem-solving skills

- Programming skills, preferably in Python, Java, Ruby, Go, Perl, C, C++, or Shell

- Experience with object-oriented design, data structures, algorithms, and software design

- Experience with Unix/Linux operating system internals and administration

- Understanding of networking and Internet protocols, such as routing, network topologies, HTTP, DNS, TCP, and UDP

- Experience building and operating large scale distributed systems

WHY JOIN US

Expedia Group recognizes our success is dependent on the success of our people. We are the world's travel platform, made up of the most knowledgeable, passionate, and creative people in our business. Our brands recognize the power of travel to break down barriers and make people's lives better – that responsibility inspires us to be the place where exceptional people want to do their best work, and to provide them to tools to do so.

title: Senior Data Scientist, Customer Insights
content:
Expedia
Senior Data Scientist, Customer Insights

Are you curious and passionate about data and how it can be used to solve real world customer problems and drive value? If you’re looking to join a team that is at the forefront of data science and analytics, Expedia Group is laser-focused in nailing the numbers game with access to the best in class techniques and technology. We are looking for extraordinary talent who bring technical expertise, act as business owners, can execute on complex projects and deliver results

What you'll do:

Drive customer insights to action as part of a core cross functional team that includes marketing, product and technology

Develop techniques to build segments/audiences which can be used for targeting and improved customer profitability

Build, assess, and iteratively improve predictive models using best-in-class machine learning methods and best practices within customer lifetime value (CLV) predictions, purchase propensity, traveler preferences and across a variety of other business problems

Become the trusted authority on measurement and identification of customer long-term profitability as well as its key drivers

Develop a deep understanding of our data infrastructure. Applying that knowledge not only to implement your solutions, but also to champion infrastructure development needs which will help the whole team deliver frictionless, action-orientated customer insight.

Be a technical leader on use, adoption and implementation of machine learning and modelling techniques

Provide mentorship, peer review, and thought leadership across the business in the areas of statistical methods, experimentation, and tools

Who you are:

Hands on experience in machine learning, building datasets, selecting and engineering features, building and optimizing algorithms. Experience with packages such as R, Python, etc.

Strong SQL/data manipulation skills required including cleaning and managing data.

Ability to apply a wide variety of statistical methods and data science models to effectively solve business problems

Advanced Degree (PhD and/or Master’s) in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Machine Learning / AI

Knowledge of test design, implementation and evaluation of A/B Testing

Real world experience with Internet scale data on a Hadoop or similar platform highly preferred.

Experience with data visualization tools and packages a plus.

Willingness to work with unstructured, messy data.

Self-starter and results orientated, able to work under minimal guidance.

Intellectual curiosity and desire to learn new things, techniques and technologies.

Our mission is to revolutionize travel through the power of technology. Collectively, the Expedia Group cover virtually every aspect of researching, planning, and booking travel, from choosing the best airplane seat, to reading personal travel reviews of hotels, to planning what to do in a destination once you arrive. Expedia Group portfolio serves both leisure and business travelers with tastes and budgets ranging from modest to luxury. Expedia delivers consumer travel demand from nearly every continent to thousands of hotels and vacation rentals, hundreds of airlines, thousands of activities, and dozens of car rental companies and cruise lines.

title: Sr. Software Engineer
content:
Expedia
Are you passionate about Big data and the insights it provides? Do you love building creative, high-scale distributed systems using a diverse set of state-of-the-art technologies? If you have an ambitious spirit, are deeply technical and analytical, and long for chance to create solutions to problems that directly impact the company's bottom-line, we want to talk to you! We are searching for a Sr. Software Development Engineer who will drive key initiatives from conception all the way through requirements definition, analysis, technical specifications, development and delivery. This is a highly visible role that requires both business insight for working with senior management and technical depth for removing development road blocks.

Expedia Enterprise Risk & Security (ERS) group is focused on a single mission to protect Expedia Group from financial loss and brand damage. We work on key risk problems associated with merchant and supplier fraud, account takeover, and more. Joining our group provides you an unrivaled challenge and the opportunity to use the newest technology to protect our business, our customers and our business partners, empowering millions of travelers to enjoy their perfect trip. In this role, you will be a leader, influencer, and contributor across our entire technology team. You will set the technical direction for your team, provide career mentorship to the people you lead and collaborate with various business partners.

What you'll do

Lead the end-to-end product lifecycle: design, development, testing, deployment, and providing operational excellence and support

Collaborate with business and technical teams to solve complex software problems

Advocate for Industry standards and in development methodologies, techniques, and technologies. Provide architecture definition and product vision

Translate business requirements into technical requirements, provide effort estimates, understand scheduling, cost constraints, and impact to other teams

Anticipate and prevent problems and roadblocks, before they occur, and present technical issues and their impact to leadership

Review pull requests, and lead by example on code refactoring for readability, extensibility, and testability

Mentor and grow junior team members

Who you are

You have proven experience with Big Data technologies (Hadoop, HDFS, Map-Reduce, Hive, Spark, Kafka etc.)

Prior experience in architecting complex, highly distributed, multi-sourced data pipelines and stream processing solutions (Hadoop, HDFS, Map-Reduce, Hive, Spark, Kafka etc.)

Data Warehousing experience with one of Redshift, Snowflake, Teradata etc.

You built applications with AWS technologies – S3, EC2, EMR etc.

You tuned and optimized the performance of business-critical queries and taking care of ETL job related issues

Working understanding of relational databases including SQL and NoSql

title: Data Scientist II
content:
Expedia
Are you passionate about the technology needed to drive a multi-billion dollar business? Do you love building creative, highly-scalable and expansible AI frameworks and solutions? Is working on the next-gen intelligent travel platforms to revolutionize the travel experience using AI/ML challenging and attractive to you?

We are the AI Labs team, a new team set to deliver an Artificial Intelligence (AI) Platform, advanced automation and, AI solutions. We work in start-up fashion, think deep, and code fast. We innovate incrementally, yet relentlessly. AI Labs collaborates with many teams to automate and build intelligence into our travel platforms, through Standards, Open Source, and expandable technology solutions. Our goal is to improve eCommerce platform availability and provide the best travel experience through using AI/ML.

What You'll Do:

As a Data Scientist within AI Labs you will work with a dynamic teams of product managers and engineers across multiple organizations to deliver sophisticated, next-gen AI/ML solutions. Your vigorous STEM training and problem-solving skills are particularly important for this job function. You will contribute and make our young team become the industry-leading center of excellence for eCommerce AI and Automation.

You will apply solid coding skills, strong analytical and innovative thinking, AI/ML experience, quickly learn and turn new ideas into working solutions, drive proof of concepts and pilots to accelerate the on boarding of new technologies and solutions.

You will partner with multi-teams for end-to-end transactions, booking, payment, security, operation, data services engineering teams to implement platform intelligence; provide the exciting experience for our global travelers and AI-powered supply/demand engine.

You will grow professionally; expand your skills and curiosity; be creative; also help others become their best.

Who You Are:

A Ph.D. with 3+ year relevant experience is preferred. Your degree will be in Computer Science or a related quantitative science & engineering field such as Artificial Intelligence, Image Processing, Mathematics, Operation Research, Statistics, Electrical Engineering, Engineering Science, System Engineering, Physics, and Bio-informatics.

Work Experience with real-world large data sets, from domain-specific problem understanding, data preparation, travel related data processing, data integration, data structures for ML, data pipelining, data modeling, and AI/ML algorithms; strong software engineering and data science knowledge and skills.

Strong knowledge and experience in database technologies, including SQL and other relational databases, non-SQL, and Time Series database.

Three or more years of work experience with one of the following languages: Java, Python, Scala, and PySpark.

Solid knowledge and practice in DL with various Neural Networks approaches, applied to areas of NLP, Computer Vision, prediction, and recommendation.

Solid knowledge of ML techniques such as Bayesian methods, clustering, decision trees, random forests, NLP, etc., excellent grasp of statistical concepts and methods.

Understanding of distributed file systems, scalable datastores, distributed computing and related technologies (Spark, Hadoop, etc.); implementation experience of MapReduce techniques, in-memory data processing, etc.

Why Join Us:

Expedia Group recognizes our success is dependent on the success of our people. We are the world's travel platform, made up of the most knowledgeable, passionate, and creative people in our business. Our brands recognize the power of travel to break down barriers and make people's lives better – that responsibility inspires us to be the place where exceptional people want to do their best work, and to provide them the tools to do so.
