title: Director, Technology - Cars Platform
content:
Expedia
Expedia Group is one of the largest providers of cars rentals globally. The Expedia Car team builds the experience and platform that powers the Car rental business for multiple brands within Expedia Group which includes Brand Expedia Group (BEXG) and Egencia.

The Cars platform supports millions of users every year in finding a suitable rental car using technologies such as ReactJS, Spring, MSSQL, DynamoDB, Redis at scale powered by AWS. We encourage experiments in new technologies while keeping a healthy balance between short term and long-term goals. We deeply care about building a great customer experience using technologies in which we expect team to explore and innovate solutions to the problems at hand.

We are looking for a passionate, results-oriented and hands-on technical leader to deliver on our product and technology roadmap as we look to drive double digit growth for the Cars business while ensuring operating stability of the Cars platform. As the Director Technology, you will collaborate closely with business, product leaders and engineering leaders to deliver products that provide the best experience and value for our customers. You will be responsible for building industry leading consumer facing products that are cohesively aligned with all products that BEXG supports as well as supplier API, Tools and partner connectivity that enables an optimal supply demand loop.

You will partner with our product management and supply teams to envision, create and build a shop and supply platform that will operate with a high degree of operational excellence, wow our suppliers and inspire our industry peers. You will also be the go-to-person for questions, anticipate developers' needs, lead architecture, be a tie-breaker and evangelize the platform. You will be expected to independently identify problems that no one has seen and drive solutions. In this role, you are someone who stays up to date with tools, trends, technologies and frameworks both industry-wide as well as within Expedia and then share that knowledge in a meaningful way with your team and peers.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES –

You'll lead a team of hardworking engineering managers and senior engineers who enjoy working on creative solutions, building large scale systems and who thrive in a fast paced, fun environment

You will lead technical discussions, be a subject matter expert and make difficult technical decisions.

You'll deliver results on complex projects involving cross functional teams across the company

Problem solve and explore solutions to current tools, processes and systems

Foster a culture of continuous engineering improvement through mentoring, feedback, and metrics

Own and champion engineering and operational excellence through establishment of group-wide metrics for measurement with a consistent, regular process for assessment and improvement

Set clear, measurable productivity quality goals for the organization

Influence a diverse stakeholder base - business leaders, product development counterparts and partner technology organizations

Passionate to drive a better customer experience for Expedia

Basic Qualifications - 

A consistent track record as a software development leader, including 10+ years of technical experience as a software developer, software development manager, director or related role

Over 5 years of experience managing diverse and global 15+ person teams that design deliver and operate a software product that is complex and highly reliable.

Driven Player/Coach who's been successful hiring and developing software engineers to become high performing engineers

Hands-on technical management, people management and mentoring experience

Ability to communicate and influence at all levels, from the new college hire engineer to an executive audience

Able to balance technical leadership with sound business judgment

Expertise in Java and knowledge of a secondary language like kotlin/go/scala is a plus

BS/MS in Computer Science (In lieu of degree, relevant work experience)

History of teamwork and willingness to roll up sleeves to get the job done

Preferred Qualifications – 

Ability to think strategically and execute methodically and tactically.

Experience taking a leading role in building complex web software systems that have been successfully delivered to customers

Hands-on expertise in many disparate technologies, typically ranging from front-end user interfaces through to back-end systems and all points in between

Has passion and convictions and the innate ability to inspire passion in others

Do you believe in being Different, can you Lead Humbly, act as One Team, use the Scientific Method, Organize for Speed while remaining Transparent?

If you answered yes, you might just have what it takes to help us continue our mission to revolutionize travel through the power of technology - apply here!

title: Product Analytics Manager
content:
Expedia
As Product Analytics Manager you will play a vital role in the future of our white-label solutions. You will be part of the Partner Analytics team, guiding analytical thinking, contributing to the strategic direction, sizing revenue opportunities, and quantifying risks.

You will help shape our strategy and understanding of success drivers for our Product, evaluate commercial impact of features, and lead analysis on traffic optimization with detailed understanding of our partners’ business model, hotel and air supply, market trends and the industry. You will work closely with partners across the company including Sales, Technology, Product, Finance and Analytics.

You will have the opportunity to own and develop new insights, drive new ways of working, create something new and join a global team.

What you’ll do

You will own analysis, evaluate revenue opportunities and build business cases to ensure future growth of the business

You will work with Product and Sales teams representing analytics

You will perform deep-dive analysis and statistical tests to get to the bottom of performance drivers for our partners, provide recommendation for improvements and quantify results

You will create dashboards and recommend metrics to monitor performance and visualize insights

Communicate analysis findings and recommendations to various levels including organization leadership

You will represent the team in meetings, ensuring perspectives of the broader Analytics team are incorporated

Who you are

You’ll fit this role if you have:

Bachelor’s in IT, Business, or quantitative discipline, Graduate degree preferred

3+ years experience and knowledge of Web Analytics tools (Omniture & Google Analytics)

Successfully managing partners and projects in a matrixed environment

Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with a strong ability to interact with and influence senior stakeholders & organisation leadership teams

Ability to explain complex concepts in a clear manner tailored to the audience

Strong analytical mindset and skills, specifically demonstrate excellent problem solving skills

Knowledge of web basics such as tagging, HTML, JavaScript, and URL structures

Good SQL skills with ability to write SQL from scratch

Self-starter mind set and willingness to challenge assumptions/status-quo

Experience in data visualization of large data sets (Tableau or other similar tool)

About Expedia Partner Solutions (EPS) 

The travel market never stands still. At Expedia Partner Solutions (EPS), we’re smack in the middle of it. We unlock the power of Expedia Group for thousands of travel partners around the world and create the tools & technologies that help millions of travelers find the perfect accommodation, car hire, & flights for their next trip. We offer the chance to work with the brightest minds in the industry in an energetic, collaborative and truly international work environment. We are passionate about innovation, creative problem-solving and –making sure we have fun while we’re doing it!

Why build your career at EPS?

We're re-inventing travel, one day at a time -- it's an exciting challenge. We're super-motivated and setting the pace.

We've got the scope and the freedom to make a difference. We don't do ordinary.

We work with some really smart partners - from loyalty marketing whiz kids to the world's leading airlines and travel agents.

We're a team of passionate, hard-working travel enthusiasts. We just love what we do.

We define the questions, not the answers, for an industry that changes every day. Isn't that cool?

We want everyone on our team to have the resources to succeed in their career

We get to do all of this in beautifully designed offices around the world

title: Software Development Engineer II
content:
Expedia
Are you passionate about data and the technology needed to drive a multi-billion dollar business? Do you love building creative, high-scale data products using a diverse set of state of the art technologies?

We are looking for a Software Development Engineer with a real passion for data. We are responsible for building accelerators, products and processes that power the data pipelines at Expedia, enable self-service capabilities and accelerate solution delivery.

In this role, you will build & mature Expedias' on-premise and cloud-based data platform. You will collaborate and partner with us to solve big challenges in the data ecosystem: data replication, providing cloud agnostic data services, intelligent monitoring/alerting of location agnostic data platforms, federated processing etc.

If you have development skills on a data platform and you are awesome at programming in Java, JavaScript or similar languages, then you will fit right in. A healthy passion for wrestling with large datasets and a desire to build automation tools will set you apart from the crowd. If teamwork, respect, ownership, recognition, trust, simplification, test & learn speak to you, and the thought of being part of a growing team excites you, then we definitely want to talk to you.

What you'll do:

You will be an integral member in the design, analysis, development and deployment efforts for multiple enterprise application projects to solve complex business problems

You will produce scalable, flexible, efficient and supportable solutions using appropriate technologies, including Java, JavaScript, Python, Hive, etc.

You will support and follow Expedia Software Development Lifecycle

You will collaborate with Developers, Program Managers, Testers and Production Support Engineers in an agile development environment

You will improve the enterprise systems by integrating existing solutions and building new technology

Who you are:

Bachelors or Master’s degree in information science, computer science or equivalent work experience

4 – 6+ years of experience in Java, JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS and etc. Preferably full-stack for front and back-end web development

Hands-on experience using big data technologies, such as Hadoop, Hive, Kafka, Teradata, etc.

You have worked in the Cloud computing arena and have professional exposure to the Amazon Web Services offerings.

Understanding and implementation of security and data protection.

Deep understanding of software design principles, algorithms, data structures, and multithreading concepts

Strong verbal and written communication skills

Why join us:

title: Technical Partner Manager (Data Platform Solution Engineer)
content:
Expedia
Data Services & Platforms

Expedia Group is a leader in using technology to drive business, and that’s where we come in. Our mission in DSP is to make access to data undeniably easy through technology and solutions that unleash the innovation for our people to unlock the power of the world’s best travel platform.

Our products are used by engineers, analysts and data scientists to process date in real-time powering algorithms, deliver complex analytics, and helping our customers find their dream holiday or trip. Add to that our integrated, value-led partner approach and we’re able to bring forward solutions that drive decisions faster and innovation further, keeping Expedia at the forefront of technology and travel.

Partner Services provides platform support and integration leadership for our Partner Brands. We are technical consultants that help our Brands optimize the use of our platform. We make data access, data management, data movement, and analytics easier to access and comprehend. Partner Services is part of the overall DSP Product Team, connecting customer needs to new platform products.

As a Technical Partner Manager, you are an extraordinary, customer oriented individual, support to Expedia Group’s brands, as the Technical lead for DSP Partner Services. You will be responsible for supporting day to day technical support solutions, platform tuning, training, and standard methodology implementation, to help our partners take full advantage of our data ecosystem. Your responsibilities will span a large data size, hybrid-cloud ecosystem including technologies like Hadoop, Teradata, Snowflake, and others.

Join the team and help us create an exciting set of products and services for data at the center of Expedia Group’s global travel platform. We’re building and running a next-generation, multi-tenant led data platform and services to scale with the business and unlock value from data for applications, algorithms, and analytics.

What you'll do:

You will conduct technical sessions with users to understand business problems and translate to technical solutions.

You will provide service support for Analysts and Developers from customer groups to solve and optimize platform usage and implement standard methodologies into their workflows.

You communicate and work directly with Partners to identify customer problems, collecting requirements and recommending solutions.

You will lead POC’s for platform integration, directly working with Brands to identify use cases for platform use.

You will partner with DSP Product Group to design new products and solutions for our platform, based on the needs of our customers.

You will contribute to the DSP training framework, blogs and information sharing of platform standard methodologies and integration materials.

Who you are:

You are a self-starter and natural problem-solver; love working with Customers; intrinsically motivated and technology savvy. Strong problem solving/ break-fix abilities.

You're an effective communicator, comfortable sharing highly technical information with users across all levels of an organization.

You’re able to work cross functionally across Product manager, architects, engineers, Dev Ops teams, to resolve technical, procedural, and operational issues

You like to keep pace with the latest technology and our platform service offering, evangelizing standard methodologies to customers.

A bachelor’s degree in analytics, data science, or engineering discipline is preferred. An advanced degree is a plus.

Experience working on large datasets & Analytics centric multi-platform environments across technologies.

Hands-on experience with technologies like AWS services, Hadoop, Kafka, HIVE, SQL, Spark, R, etc. Familiarity with Qubole, Snowflake, Teradata/SQL framework and a modern general scripting language such as Python

Why join us:

Expedia Group recognizes our success is dependent on the success of our people. We are the world's travel platform, made up of the most knowledgeable, passionate, and creative people in our business. Our brands recognize the power of travel to break down barriers and make people's lives better – that responsibility inspires us to be the place where exceptional people want to do their best work and to provide them the tools to do so.

Whether you're applying to work in engineering or customer support, marketing or lodging supply, at Expedia Group we act as one team, working towards a common goal; to bring the world within reach. We relentlessly strive for better, but not at the cost of the customer. We act with humility and optimism, respecting ideas big and small. We value diversity and voices of all volumes. We are a global organization but keep our feet on the ground, so we can act fast and stay simple. Our teams also have the chance to give back on a local level and make a difference through our corporate social responsibility program, Expedia Cares.

If you have a hunger to make a difference with one of the most loved consumer brands in the world and to work in the dynamic travel industry, this is the job for you.

title: Sr. Product Manager - Data Science & Algorithms
content:
Expedia
Job Description:

We are seeking a Senior product manager - Data Science and Algorithms to lead the efforts in defining and delivering a unified experience for scientists and engineers working on Machine Learning algorithms/products to significantly grow our business. You will have solid analytical skills and technical know-how to deliver processes and tools that help drive business growth via Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence algorithms. You will work with applied researchers/data scientists, product management, business stakeholders, engineering teams, and leadership teams across the organization to ensure timely project delivery. You will work in an agile framework and help improve the process continuously. You will also have opportunities to influence people and teams in the larger organization as part of your collaborative effort to deliver data science projects. You must have strong drive, attention to detail, a collaborative work style, and flexibility to adapt to new situations.

Role and Responsibility

Work with applied researchers/data scientists and business leaders to develop a coherent and coordinated strategy to leverage data science algorithms/products in growing our business across Global Marketing Organization and Expedia Group

Lead the development of the ML scientist experience (work flow / infrastructure) and interface with ML Platform Services offerings

Set the strategy for improving and maintaining the day-to-day operations of all Applied Research algorithms/products

Anticipate and product manage features for our data platform, that will help accelerate data science efforts 

Proactively identify and resolve operational issues that may impair the science team’s ability to meet goals

Manage prioritization and trade-offs among customer experience, performance and operational support load

Ensure coherent communication and pro-active information dissemination of all Applied Research algorithms/products across Global Marketing Organization and Expedia Group.

Required Qualifications

7 years+ of work experience

4+ years of software platform or SaaS product management experience

Experience working with ML scientists, preferably in an eCommerce setting.

Experience working on at least one of: distributed systems, big data systems, ML tools, or cloud services.

Strong executive-level written and verbal communications

Experience leading cross-functional teams to deliver products and projects on tight deadlines

Preferred Qualifications

Educational (and/or work) background in software engineering/computer science preferred

Broad technical breadth and depth including familiarity with Machine Learning, streaming big data and back-end application infrastructure

Demonstrated record of successfully delivering results in a fast-paced, dynamic environment

Strong strategic thinking and operational acumen

title: Senior Software Engineer
content:
Expedia
Trover believes travel is good for human kind. We want to see more and more people travel and believe the way to do that is to help people share their travel experiences from any corner of the globe to any individual on it. We aspire to do this is through a platform that helps people share and discover experiences that fit their point of view.

We’re here to inspire people to experience new places and we need some help doing it. If you are a hardworking Senior Software Engineer who can help us build our content platform that makes a difference in the world and help strengthen an engineering team every company would want to hire.

The platform combines photography, geo-location, and social interaction in a unique experience that enables users to explore the world through the eyes of other travelers. The team has over 100 passport stamps, deep experience in Android, iOS, and full stack technologies. We’re also a start-up inside of the largest travel company in the world. We get our cake and eat it too! Sound interesting? We’d love to talk!

As a Sr. Software Development Engineering with Trover, you will work together with product leaders and other experienced engineers to execute our combined product vision. The position requires the ability to work collaboratively in a product-focused environment. You'll be driven by the challenge of solving unique problems in the consumer engagement space. The role requires someone who can handle some ambiguity and can thrive in a rapidly evolving environment. You will be responsible for designing and implementing highly scalable, performant, and maintainable code across our entire AWS-based development stack. As an integral member of the team, you’ll work to deliver value to our Trover consumers and creators and deliver an exceptional product. We're looking for you to be willing to learn from everyone, communicate well and strive to be an effective team member.

What you'll do with us:

Architect, develop, maintain and scale solutions/features/applications on a fully modern, tech stack

Maintain an open dialog with the product team about roadmap, technical debt, and proposed solutions for features.

Mentor and guide junior engineers, provide constructive feedback and guidance where needed.

Facilitate design, code and test reviews among a team of developers

Lead small-to-medium technical projects. Work with and under the direction of the product manager and with marketing partners

Help define and drive the latest test, development, and deployment standard methodologies, guidelines and standards for a fast-growing product.

Provide technical leadership on specific integration activities

Who you are today:

BS/MS in Computer Science or comparable degree

5+ years’ full stack software experience across multiple technologies, languages and frameworks

Led technical designs and implementation of highly scalable and adaptable systems

Demonstrated skill in object-oriented design and development

Proficient oral and written communications skills. Collaborate well in a team environment.

Able to work independently, and effectively collaborate with partners in product, content moderators, marketing and engineers.

Have extensive front-end development experience

Bonus: Experience in the following technologies: Ruby on Rails, JavaScript, REST APIs, NoSQL and Redis

Bonus: History of success in a DevOps environment

Bonus: Experience with CI/CD frameworks.

These things excite you:

Joining a driven, bold and motivated, start-up like team at Expedia

“Lead without authority”, growing other team members in their development skills

Leaving your mark and making an impact for travelers across the world

title: Software Development Engineer II
content:
Expedia
At Expedia our mission is to revolutionize travel through the power of technology. Our E-Commerce Checkout team is looking for an experienced, energetic and self-motivated Software Development Engineer to help us do just that.

Sitting at the sharp end of the conversion funnel our Checkout platform processes millions of bookings a week from customers across the globe using any one of our 40+ localized websites or our award-winning mobile app. It’s an exciting time to join the team as we’re setting about building the next generation of our platform using modern frameworks such as React and GraphQL and a microservices based architecture.

Join us and you’ll be helping build a market leading customer facing web application, solving hard problems at scale and contributing to mission-critical software with a direct impact on the bottom line. All of this and you'll get to experience the dynamic, diverse and collaborative agile working environment we are so proud to provide.

Position Summary: 

As a Full Stack Software Engineer working on Expedia’s critical production checkout applications, your mission will be to ensure Expedia Checkout is always fast, available, scalable and engineered to withstand unparalleled demand. You will be in the thick of solving the [often unexpected] problems of systems at scale in a way most engineers never experience. You will have strong analytical and troubleshooting skills, fluency in coding and systems design, solid communication skills and a desire to tackle the complex problems of scale. You are a collaborative and creative individual and you thrive in a dynamic and agile environment. You adapt to new technologies, and enjoy working on complex problems. Every day, we at Expedia get to innovate on web applications that millions of travellers use to plan, book and experience trips they will remember forever.

Responsibilities: 

Architect, design, and create solutions on the web tier, server-side using Java

Write optimal front-end code using JS, CSS and HTML

Write unit tests and automated integration tests

Perform Code Reviews and ensure the team adheres to best practices

Mentor junior software developers

Investigate, debug and resolve live site issues.

Skills and Responsibilities:

B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science or related field.

3-5 years of professional experience in full stack Java software development

Experience in HTML, CSS and strong JavaScript experience

Experience with React and Scala is a bonus

Solid experience with agile project methodologies and of working with distributed teams

Committed to producing high quality code with a strong attention to detail

Excellent understanding of server side design patterns and practical application.

Able to work closely with and incorporate feedback from specialists and product owner

Strong customer focus, excellent problem solving and analytical skills

Strong verbal and written communication skills

Be a Clean Code practitioner

A self-starter, who is driven and takes initiative.

title: Analytics Manager, Media Solutions
content:
Expedia
Expedia Group Media Solutions is dedicated to building creative media partnerships for travel advertisers enabling them to use Expedia's network of leading travel brands and global sites. We have revolutionized the way brands reach and connect with online travel consumers, emerging as a leader in online advertising among travel and e-commerce brands. With a growing product portfolio offering a multitude of advertising and sponsorship opportunities, our Media Solutions team at Expedia has created a viable marketing platform for advertising partners to reach the 144+ million worldwide monthly unique visitors that visit Expedia Group sites.

Expedia Group Media Solutions is experiencing tremendous growth and we need a data junkie to join our Analytics team to held build, develop and grow our analytical capabilities to support our marketing efforts from the ground up. Are you a builder? Do you like to roll up your sleeves and build reporting from the ground-up to support the success of active, engaged marketing teams? Do you love measuring and testing marketing campaigns against critical metrics to ensure objectives are met and exceeded? Are you willing to go deep, navigate through ambiguity, and work in an environment where partnering with multiple leaders is essential to achieve success? Your deep experience in building out sustainable B2B marketing analytics and reporting will be critical to ensuring the entire Marketing team’s visibility into key measures needed to meet their business goals.

We are a global organization and you will work across most functions and channels on the team. You will support the team to help execute on marketing initiatives, whether through data or implementing business processes. You will mine our various data sources and be responsible to build and maintain our dashboards and report cards as well as communicate actionable findings. We work in a number of today's technologies including AWS, Snowflake and Salesforce while using skills in SQL, Excel, Tableau, Looker and Python.

Key responsibilities include owning discrete pieces of Marketing’s internal systems and analysis—working with partners, marketing managers and internal teams to ensure data-integrity and develop actionable reporting & recommendations. We seek to hire only the best of the best, so in this analytics role, you will partner with a team of especially creative, dedicated and passionate, world-class B2B marketers.

Responsibilities:
Develop the decision support capabilities for the Marketing team

Lead marketing analytics functions including data integration, designing, building and maintaining dashboards, reports and customer segmentation to inform marketing activities

Own day-to-day activities for critical marketing analytics systems and be responsive to ever-changing business needs

Support all marketing reporting, forecasting and budgeting including developing analyses driving marketing strategy and business decisions Project manage the technical analytics initiatives

Identify, implement, and manage tools, systems and processes to automate reporting that supports decision-making

Be comfortable doing focused tear-downs to rethink business executions

Execute on analytics related business initiatives providing critical project and analytical support, and managing needs with key technical support team

Communicate effectively with internal partners

Develop into the go-to Marketing Analytics person for the entire marketing team

Work with channel marketing managers to drive more effective execution of B2B marketing initiatives

Present findings to leaders across marketing, sales, product, and executive teams

Core skills and work experience:

Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative or business field such as Mathematics, Business Administration, Economics, Finance, Marketing or related field

4+ years of professional experience in data analysis and reporting in one or more of the following fields: digital advertising, e-commerce, B2B marketing, and online travel

Driven for results with strong Excel, analytical and problem-solving skills; and the ability to translate data into actionable insights

Demonstrated success producing analytics for database marketing, CRM segmentation, and marketing automation

Experience with developing, owning, and maintaining business intelligence, database mining, statistical analysis tools and data visualization platforms.

Ability to simplify data into easily-consumed visuals using tools like Tableau to communicate complex findings in a structured and clear manner to a non-technical audience

General marketing knowledge

Extraordinarily strong attention to detail and communication skills

Experience in defining and executing key analyses with minimal supervision

B2B and digital marketing experience a plus

Be detail-oriented and believe that details matter greatly to the success of the team

title: Product Manager, Global Data Platform
content:
Egencia
Egencia is one of the leading corporate travel management companies in the world and part of the Expedia Group family of brands. We are looking for a Product Manager to drive our global data platform roadmap.

Our business intelligence and data platform provides support for reporting and analytics for our global customers and new product initiatives. You will bring innovation, a strategic perspective, a passionate voice, and an ability to prioritize and execute on a fast-moving set of product priorities, competitive pressures, and market opportunities.

What You Will Do:

You will drive the strategy for our data platform through a deep understanding of our external and internal customer needs in the Americas, EMEA and APAC

Be responsible on delivering for the product vision, roadmap, product scenarios, user stories, and backlog for the product areas

You will be the subject matter expert for data quality, data integration, data availability and how internal customers can use data to support their business needs across all lines of business (air, hotel, car, etc.) and countries

Work closely with the agile development teams to ensure the global data platform provides consistent, clean, data and support analytics and reporting teams

Present Egencia product capabilities, vision, value propositions, and roadmap briefings to internal customers, internal analytics teams (Sales, Supply, etc.) and to Leadership team

Who You Are:

You are a data geek at heart and understand the power of data and the value in data modelling, data integration and data quality

You have a passion for working with both legacy and new database technologies, both in the Cloud and On Premise

You are passionate about travel and have lots of ideas about how to redefine the business travel experience

What You Bring:

Strong knowledge and understanding of data warehousing and data integration, including data modelling, ETL strategies, and data architecture

Strong analytical skills with a high attention to detail. Ability to ramp up quickly on data and become an expert across our different lines of business

Enthusiastic and awesome leadership skills with the ability to influence across the organization at senior levels

You have the ability to push back or challenge partners in the organization while maintaining great relationships

You are able to articulate a vision and improvise and communicate ideas/positions on an ad hoc basis

Passion for customer interaction and desire to exceed what our customers demand of us

5+ years of program or product management experience

A track record of innovation: you embrace creativity and have delivered innovative products in your career

Bachelor’s degree required, an MBA a plus

title: Analytics Manager
content:
Expedia
At Expedia Group, we are passionate about using Data and Analytics to create an amazing travel experience and bring the world within reach. We are looking for an extraordinary individual to join the Expedia Retail Analytics team and generate powerful insights that will shape business growth. This is an opportunity to be a part of a fun, exciting and data-driven company and partner with global strategy and supply teams to design inspiring and actionable business plans, powered by quantitative insight.

Your primary focus will extend well beyond pulling the data and crunching the numbers. You will tackle complex business problems by converting raw data into relevant and actionable business insights. You will work with one of the strongest data sets in the travel industry, state of the art technology, and the ability to see your insights turned into real products.

If you’re passionate about using data to drive positive change as part of an all-star analytics team, this may be the role for you. Are you ready to embark on the journey?

What you'll do:

You can distill large business questions into technical requirements and find answers in the data

You will apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, predictive modeling, data mining, and the presentation of data with a focus on actionable analytics.

You will be comfortable combining varied big datasets from different sources to output insights, using SQL/R/Python/Excel/ Tableau or similar as appropriate

You have excellent collaboration abilities with multiple departments across the wider business, including other Expedia Group brands, supply teams and strategy functions

A trusted business partner who looks after numerous senior internal clients; prioritizing requests and handling expectations

Use your strong communication and presentation skills to explain complex topics to non-technical audiences

You will collaborate across multiple analytics teams (Product, Marketing, Retail, Supply, and other brands) across multiple locations and time-zones

Be an active member of the analytics / data science community across Expedia Group – continuing to ensure Analytics is an excellent place to work

Who you are:

You have extensive experience working in a role focused on business analytics, statistical modelling, data science or similar

Experience translating big data into strategic and actionable business recommendations; driving end-to-end process through data extraction, analysis, insight, implementation and evaluation

You are highly proficient in querying big data (SQL) and relating datasets through multiple tools (Hadoop, Qubole, Teradata, etc.)

Programming: capability in R or Python is preferred

You have a deep understanding of statistical methods and how to apply them

You can appropriately visualize quantitative analyses for both presentations (e.g. PowerPoint) and reporting purposes (e.g. Tableau)

You have experience in experimental design and A/B testing

You possess a relevant degree in a quantitative discipline such as Mathematics, Data Science, Engineering or similar is preferred

title: Software Development Engineer II, Machine Learning
content:
Expedia
Expedia’s Global Customer Operations (GCO) Technology team is dedicated to driving technology innovation to create effortless customer experiences worldwide in Expedia Group apps, web sites, support channels, and contact centers via our Virtual Agent Platform. We support over 80 million customer interactions a year and over 12 thousand agents – across a global brand portfolio and workforce. GCO's Data and Intelligence team is looking for a thoughtful and dedicated Software Development Engineer II with experiences and skillsets that demonstrate a capability for delivering high quality, customer-facing features that meet platform and product needs. Our team is building out learning and intelligence services that power Expedia Group's Virtual Agents to make an amazing impact on customer needs in an optimal manner without needing human intervention. title: Senior Business Analyst
content:
Expedia
Senior Business Analyst, Marketing Analytics

Are you curious and passionate about data and how it can be used to solve real world customer problems and drive value? If you’re looking to join a team that is at the forefront of data science and analytics, Expedia Group is laser-focused in nailing the numbers game with access to the best in class techniques and technology. Function independently with limited supervision, proactively taking ownership of key analytical projects.

Experienced in modeling, statistical analysis, data visualization and business intelligence

Ability to professionally present and articulate the business value of complicated analysis to a diverse group of internal business partners

Comfortable with mining data and working with large data sets

Strong analytical/modeling skills with ability to convert raw data into actionable business insights

Understanding of advanced statistical/predictive modeling, operation research and optimization techniques is highly preferred, as well as proficiency with tools such as R or Python

title: Principal Software Dev Engineer
content:
Expedia
Do you want to influence the experience of millions of customers? Do you want to work in a collaborative environment that impacts products and software from across the company? Are you passionate about architecture and the technology needed to drive a multi-million-dollar business?

Have you seen the text - “You can book or manage a trip on the go! How can we help?” on Facebook Messenger?

Have you seen the SEM “ads” when you search for your travel on Search Engines?

The NLP Technologies team is building the platform to engage our users in a natural language and semantic search – both on Expedia assets as well as search engines. Users can now search for travel products in a more human way and get highly relevant results. They can also have conversations via voice or text across multiple emerging channels such as messaging applications, digital assistants, Website or mobile App.

Do you want to be part of this transition - travel powered by AI? Join us to build the next generation of NLP technologies which would transform the travel industry into a new era!

As a Principal Software Development Engineer on the team, you will play a key role in defining a ML-based architectural strategy. You will work with a dynamic group of product managers, architects and engineers to deliver a sophisticated, next-generation platform at scale. You will provide thought leadership and hand’s on engineering as we build an innovative suite of products and services, integrating seamlessly within our broad ecosystem.

Functions and Responsibilities:

You will design and implement high performance, scalable, robust and reliable sever applications that support key Expedia initiatives.

You will translate functional specifications into logical, component-based technical designs.

You will partner with Systems Engineering and Operations teams to define platform operational features and ensure effective delivery of platform availability, quality and performance

You will prototype creative solutions quickly by developing minimum viable products and work with others in crafting, accelerate the onboarding of new technologies and implementing the technical vision.

You will provide code reviews to assess overcall code quality and flexibility, and the application of good object oriented programming techniques.

You will drive continuous improvement and continuous delivery in our software development process within an agile development team.

You will work closely with other developers both local and in various other Expedia offices around the world to ensure code quality, appropriate testing and design to ensure excellent product quality.

You will support live-site operations as needed as part of our DevOps approach.

You will serve as a technical leader within the organization.

Requirements / Qualifications:

BS or MS Degree in Computer Science or related engineering discipline.

3+ years of lead architecture and design experience in an engineering, development or technology role

10+ years of experience in full stack software development with shipping large, multi-functional projects in a global internet service environment.

Relevant industry experience developing in Java and its associated technology stacks such as Spring.

Experience in NLP/ML technologies.

Experience building web services in the cloud, particularly with AWS solutions.

Proficient with algorithms and data structures, design patterns, service oriented architecture, domain driven design, multi-threading, concurrency, caching and distributed systems

Working knowledge of SQL databases and other NoSQL solutions.

Verbal and written communication skills with the ability to present complex technical information in a clear and concise manner.

Solid understanding of the software development process, architecture and design, software craftsmanship and test strategies.

Effective mentoring and leadership skills and an ability to successfully drive design and implementation of software projects

title: Senior Data Engineer
content: ’s business travel company. In the same spirit, we are pioneers in the industry. Always solutions oriented, we value human contact. Egencia's teams collaborate globally to provide business travelers with the best possible user experience every single day.

As a Senior Data Engineer in the Business Intelligence team, you are an authority, familiar with all the data warehousing technical components, infrastructure, and their integration. You’ll analyze large amounts of data, discover and solve real world problems. You are responsible for high level design/architecture - with extensive experience with Star Schemas, Data Cubes and Dimensional Models.

We expect our data engineers to build durable data pipelines with the ability to scale elegantly with data volume growth. The code you write must enable our users to get data in a timely manner. You'll work on a variety of tools and systems, most of which are Cloud-based applications or data-platform components (e.g., data pipelines, processing, Visualization, reporting, etc.). In this role, you will be working in Agile development method for faster, quick-wins with the caliber of design, development and operating BI components you develop.
Design, architect, implement, and support key datasets that provide structured and timely access to actionable business information with the needs of the end customer always in view
Retrieve and analyze data using SQL, Excel, and other data management systems.
Create ETLs/ELTs to take data from various operational systems and create a unified dimensional or star schema data model for analytics and reporting
Develop a deep understanding of vast data sources (existing on the cloud) and know exactly how, when, and which data to use to solve particular business problems
Experience developing and operating large scale analytical databases/platforms/data warehouses and performing ETL across various operating systems (Microsoft and Linux)
Experience working with Cloud BI Production implementation
Knowledge of Agile, DevOps, CICD frameworks
Experience with multi-terabyte data sets using relational databases (RDBMS) and SQL
Agile/Scrum methodologies to iterate quickly on product changes, developing user stories and working through backlogs.
7+ years' experience with detailed knowledge of data warehouse technical architectures, ETL/ ELT, reporting/analytic tools, and data security
5+ years of experience in designing data warehouse solutions and integrating technical components
2+ yrs of scripting language (Ruby, python, etc.) experience
1+ yr experience with production BI implementation in Cloud
Exposure in at least one reporting tool like Qlikview, Tableau, Power BI etc.
Capable of investigating, familiarizing and mastering new data sets quickly
Experience with building data platform on cloud (AWS)
Experience with Hadoop, MPP DB platform, other NoSQL (Mongo, Cassandra) technologies is a big plus
Bachelor, or Masters, of Science Degree in Computer Science or related field

title: Principal Software Development Engineer
content:
Expedia
Do you want to transform the experience of millions of travelers the world over? Do you love working with a creative engineering team in building an intelligent, scalable and personalized travel assistance platform? Do you want to work with state of the art technologies such as real-time streaming, Natural Language Processing (NLP), Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning? Our goal is to build the best conversational bot platform that can meet customers on any channel (social, sms, web, or voice), use AI/ML to understand/anticipate their needs and deliver unparalleled service.

As a Senior Software Engineer, you propose, prototype, design and implement various core components of the bot platform in collaboration with teams world over. As a senior member of the team, you will provide the thought leadership and technical expertise needed to overcome hard problems. By now, you would have built and supported critical components of products/platforms at scale.

Architect, design, and develop new platform services to build our technology platform.

Own and deliver tested and optimized high-performance code for a distributed messaging environment.

Participate in resolution of production issues and lead efforts toward solutions.

Contribute to vigilantly rewriting, refactoring, and perfecting code.

Work with QA, product management and operations in an agile environment.

Technologies we use:

Java, AWS, Kafka, GraphQL, Node.js, Kotlin, React, Elasticsearch, DynamoDB, S3, Lambda, Docker, Dropwizard, Data Dog, Looker.

Who you are:

7+ years of experience leading technical designs, mentoring developers and helping to drive engineering maturity.

Problem solver and an excellent coder with deep understanding of algorithms, data structures, distributed applications, and data modeling.

Passionate about quality of work, you are persistent and uncompromising.

Builder of AI/ML models for recommendation engines, you have dabbled/shown interest in creating applications that use AI/ML.

Experienced in solving distributed computing problems, you have worked with on real time streaming, distributed messaging platforms and have helped operationalize it.

title: Senior DevOps Engineer
content:
Expedia
Are you interested in DevOps? In using new technologies for accelerating the development, automating the deployment, and improving the operations of world-class cloud services which power travel across the globe? If you are looking for an opportunity to make an impact and think team spirit is the key, then Expedia Global Payments (EGP) is the place for you. We are looking for candidates who are passionate about new technology, bringing a world class continuous delivery system to a critical component of the core technology of Expedia Group (EG).

EGP’s platform processes over $80 billion in 55+ currencies from over 155 countries every year, across diverse payment options.

What you’ll do: 

As a Sr DevOps engineer, you will lead the DevOps and SRE efforts for our EGP organization to modernize, standardize, and constantly improve the build, deployment, and operations systems our engineering teams depend on for the creation and operations of Expedia Global Payments microservices in the cloud. Your knowledge of java systems development and technology will be instrumental to organize the standardization and technical debt reduction of the existing services which power Expedia Group’s payment platform.

Work closely with multiple teams within the organization to partner in design and delivery

Provide technical expertise to build and improve EGP’s tools (in particular our CICD platform) in alignment with the company’s common platform & tools group decisions

Work collaboratively across the organization to define and evangelize the standard for OS / SDK / Libraries

Evangelize new solutions and tools and help development teams adopting them

Identify common problems among dev teams and drive standardization of the solutions

Participate in planning work and identify areas of improvement

Interact with other engineers to build and influence cloud design decisions

Develop and maintain internal documentation

Who you are: 

To be successful in this role, you will need:

A passion for online services development and operations at scale and for helping people working better together

7+ years of experience in a role which mixes Software Development, System Operations and Automation

High degree of proficiency within all phases of Build, Release and DevOps methodologies

You understand the challenges around Technical Debt reduction, SDK and Open Source libraries upgrade and have experience addressing them

Proficiency in at least one scripting language: Bash, Python, Ruby, GoLang

Experience in at least one modern software development language such as java or C#

Self-motivated, able to work independently as well as within a team, and work well to meet deadlines within short time constraints

BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent work experience

The following competences would be a plus:

Experience using deployment technologies such as Terraform, Cloud Formation, or Chef

Experience in java/Spring on Linux platforms

Experience with any of Splunk, Jenkins, GitHub, InfluxDB, Grafana, New Relic, AppD, Haysdtack/Zipkin

title: Solution Architect
content: The Expedia LPS Salesforce team is seeking a Solutions Architect with in-depth experience in Salesforce to join us in transforming our environment into a world-class CRM platform. We are looking for someone who will be a part of the CRM Architecture team and be responsible for partnering with various business partner teams to translate business requirements into innovative technology solutions. You are a Salesforce.com technical domain expert, have the experience and vision to deliver solutions inclined to clicks over code and proven ability to develop solutions to complex business problems utilizing standard methodologies based on real-world experiences. You have exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills, are comfortable interacting with business and technical resources, and can perform professionally in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Own the Salesforce Platform Architecture and contribute towards the overall Enterprise Architecture vision
Build Proof of Concepts, devise strategy, and evaluate new technology and features that would be beneficial to the business (includes AI, ML, Monitoring etc.)
Incorporate analytical insights for new and existing solutions by continuously measuring and monitoring
Build Architectural frameworks that can be consistently demonstrated across different teams and initiatives.
Extend advanced technical and/or business consultative services during inception as well as post-implementation
Perform at highly varying levels of abstraction encompassing business strategy, product strategy, technical design and execution
Create design documents that ensure consistency in development across the organization
Partner with our Product Management and Engineering teams along with other partners to technical direction and architectural input into product development roadmaps
Work cohesively with a complementary team of engineers, integrating closely across LPS and Expedia’s brand engineering teams
Be an insight as a technical voice, fostering an environment of innovation, collaboration, and inclusion
Drive towards an architecture that optimizes flexibility, re-use, scalability, performance, and availability, using lesser complexities
Lead improvements of core software infrastructure and implementation standards
5+ years of Salesforce experience as a Senior or Lead Developer.
BS or MS in Computer Science or related engineering field or 3 or more years of experience in a similar Salesforce role
1+ years of architecture and design experience in an engineering, development or technology role
3+ years of experience working through the design, development, release cycle for enterprise applications
Demonstrate a deep knowledge of all Salesforce product offerings and recommend new features and modifications
You have working knowledge of solving complex and large-scale software problems and successfully delivering large scale projects, as an individual and team leader
Effective mentoring and leadership skills and an ability to successfully drive the lifecycle of software projects
Excellent communication, presentation, and influencing skills, with the ability to explain technical details and challenges to a wide variety of audiences (including executive leadership)
Aptitude to look at solutions in creative and unconventional ways, recognize opportunities to innovate, and engage partners in vision and strategy
Ability to thrive in a dynamic, team oriented and fast paced environment
Expertise utilizing cloud technologies and services with Amazon AWS is a plus
Experience working on microservices architecture preferred
Salesforce Platform Developer II Certification preferred
Salesforce certified System Architect or Application Architect desired

title: Sr. Commercial Analytics Manager
content: At Expedia Group, we are passionate about using Data and Analytics to create an amazing travel experience and help people go places. We are looking for an extraordinary individual to join Expedia Group Commercial Strategy and Services team to lead our commercial analytics and deal modeling efforts. This is an opportunity to be a part of a fun, exciting and data-driven company and partner with global strategy and supply teams to design inspiring and actionable business plans, powered by quantitative insight. If you’re passionate about using data to drive positive change as part of a high-performing Analytics and Insights team, this may be the role for you.

In this role you will be the commercial analytics and finance lead for airline partnerships. You will be leveraging strong stakeholder relationships, using data and business judgement to provide robust decision support and guidance to the commercial team for various partnership initiatives, performance objectives and key milestones. More specifically, you will:

Be the analytics lead for negotiations; create financial models to assess the opportunity size, determine most suitable commercial structure, carry out sensitivity analysis to advise on risk and opportunity, review contracts

Support the account management team with setting short, medium and long-term strategy and forecast for the partnership, identify and communicate risks and opportunities; build and maintain financial models to support this process
Analyze and assess business performance (macro and micro level) and provide account management team with actionable insights and recommendations for use in setting and realizing profit objectives
Analyze performance against contractual commitments, proactively highlight risks and suggest mitigation strategies
Perform ad-hoc analysis to evaluate the impact of implementation restrictions and changes and provide decision support to commercial and product teams accordingly
Provide input into weekly, monthly and quarterly partnership updates and create presentation slides, as necessary
Some travel may be required to support commercial negotiations
Proven ability to lead/act as analytics/finance business partner with demonstrable experience and success in supporting commercial negotiations
Proven ability to analyze data effectively, interpret and present data in a compelling format to drive actions
Proven ability to juggle multiple projects simultaneously, prioritize effectively and meet deadlines
Ability to build effective relationships with various stakeholders, e.g. account management, finance, strategy, product, operations and external partners
Advanced knowledge of Excel with experience of manipulating large datasets and financial modelling
Hyperion Planning/Essbase and SQL experience desired, but not essential.
Highly analytical with strong numerical skills
Experienced and enthusiastic working in dynamic, entrepreneurial environments
Someone who thrives in large, global, fast moving organizations
Experience with analysis, forecasting, budgeting and management reporting including proven success in streamlining processes
Experience working in travel industry, ideally in a finance or revenue management role
Proven experience working with cross functional teams across multiple time zones

title: Sr. Business Analyst
content:
Expedia
Expedia, Inc. is revolutionizing travel through the power of technology, and the eCP team is at the heart of that mission. eCP provides a premier platform of eCommerce technologies and services operating at global scale to support our rapidly growing family of brands.

Together, we enable each of our customer transactions to flow seamlessly from the click of the 'book' button on one of our brand sites all the way through to a magnificent travel experience. By bringing together product, technology and operations, we accelerate innovation, enable test and learn, and constantly push ourselves to evolve and innovate for the business.

Are you looking to join a strong team of Security technology professionals? We are the Security Business Office within Expedia - a team of Program Managers and Business Analysts with a passion for Security, Quality, and Teamwork.

You have strong analytical and critical thinking skills

You are highly organized and detail oriented

You produce quality business process workflow models

You can provide examples of how you produce and manage project schedules, within a concise and timely status

You are a creative thinker, analytical, and possess excellent problem-solving skills

Expressive and articulate, you effectively communicate to multiple levels of an organization in a clear and concise manner

You will successfully work with multiple levels in the organization to gather the information required to produce high quality project documentation

Effectively and efficiently produce, track and manage quality deliverables under compressed timelines

title: Senior Manager, Online Marketing Analytics
content:
Expedia
Are you excited about making a difference in the dynamic travel industry? We are looking for a Sr. Analytics Manager to join the marketing team for one of the most loved consumer brands in the world. The focus of your role will be developing measurement methodologies, and analytical techniques to power various aspects of highly complex global marketing campaigns. We invest hundreds of millions of dollars a year in highly dynamic and competitive auctions in travel Metasearch (TripAdvisor, Kayak, Trivago) and SEM (Google, Bing, Yahoo) as well as social media (Facebook). Each of these marketing channels centers around deriving value from sparse data to auction theory and game theory. We have deep and rich data sets, many still untapped, and your passion for the craft of statistics has the power to unlock tangible growth for our business.

Your primary focus will extend well beyond pulling the data and crunching the numbers. You will tackle complex business problems by converting raw data into relevant and actionable business insights. You'll work with one of the strongest data sets in the travel industry, cutting edge technology, and the ability to see your insights turned into real products.

This is a full-time position based in Expedia’s headquarters in Seattle, Washington.

Responsibilities

You will apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, predictive modeling, data mining, and the presentation of data with a singular goal of profit maximization and with a focus on actionable analytics

You will lead a team of analysts to provide statistical support on experimental design, exploratory data analysis and modeling

You will collaborate with data scientists, operations staff, account managers, product and engineering.

You will review research study plans to ensure that designs are consistent with objectives, and make recommendations regarding experimental design, statistical analysis, and data management

You will automate analyses and author pipelines via SQL and python based ETL framework

You will conduct A/B test design, implementation and analysis in order to figure out the effectiveness of bidding algorithms

You will influence product teams through presentation of data-based recommendations

You will work with Business Intelligence tools such as Adobe Omniture, Tableau, and author queries in Hadoop, Hive, and Spark primarily

You Should Have

6+ years hands-on experience in data analytics and providing insights

Broad experience in applying statistics, exploratory analytics techniques to real-world data including sampling approaches, experiment design, causal modeling

Solid statistical programming skills in at least one statistical language (SAS, R, Python) and demonstrated ability to learn new ones

Experience designing, developing, and implementing data visualization dashboards utilizing Tableau or other advanced visualization tools that provide real-time visibility into performance results.

Knowledge of modeling techniques such as linear regression, time series modeling, decision tree

Demonstrated strong leadership capabilities, including developing and motivating high-performing teams, experience taking initiative and driving teams to deliver effective results

Strong communication skills both written and oral

Experience with ecommerce, online marketing, advertising, CRM, loyalty programs a strong plus

Advanced degree (M.Sc., Ph.D. preferred) in statistics, math, computer science, economics, or related quantitative field.

title: Security Compliance Manager
content:
Expedia
Are you a highly motivated, collaborative and technically experienced Security Compliance Manager ready to join Expedia Group's Enterprise Risk & Security (ERS) group? Do you understand cloud operational and security processes, effectively build, establish and communicate security controls, and support changes within the organization through effective development and testing?

Consider Expedia Group!

To be successful, you'll be organized, inventive, possess domain knowledge on security compliance and have a “can-do” attitude. You will be a key member of our GRC team and play a key role in building controls adherence to the security and Payment Card Industry (PCI) requirements. In this role, you will demonstrate ability to analyze hard problems, think out-of-box and provide pragmatic solutions and recommendations. Along with your knowledge of PCI, your experience in NIST CSF, ISO 27001, ISO 27018, FedRAMP, PCI, SSAE 18, or SOC 2 will be an asset!

What you'll do

Evaluate the design efficiency of common controls based upon industry standard methodology models (e.g. COBIT, ITIL) in accordance with compliance requirements

Participate in external certification and drive our partner audit events, including preparation, sample delivery, and onsite facilitation

Assist in the analysis and definition of security requirements and help with ongoing maintenance and support of security controls

Act as internal resource and authority on Expedia Security policy & standards

Lead and own the development of medium to complex multi-functional compliance and audit related projects

Aid in defining audit scope and objectives, involving all relevant partners

Drive appropriate meeting cadence required to achieve and maintain for a successful internal/external third-party audit

Facilitate efficient communication across all levels of an audit to ensure consistency in reaching the audit's goals, and to help in the recognition of any potential opportunities, risks, or complications

Hold business partners accountable for timely and quality execution of objectives

Perform risk management to minimize audit risks: identify, track, mitigate, and resolve risks and issues

Present recommendations, options, opportunities, and assumptions to leadership

Who you are

A minimum of 6 years job related experience in compliance or technical engineering field

Worked in a regulated environment, preferably dealing with PCI, SOX, SOC 2 or other federally regulated examinations

Demonstrated expertise managing a compliance audit and partners

Information Security Certification(s) with demonstrated work experience preferred. Desired certifications include: CISA, CISP, PCI

Knowledge and familiarity related to coordinating and securing operating systems, database platforms, endpoint security and network infrastructure is preferred

Experience with methodologies related to network architecture & security controls (Routers, Firewalls, networking protocols, etc)

Ability to recognize/analyze/and document deficiencies and articulate those to both technical and non-technical key management personnel

Experience using a risk-based audit approach in evaluations of and recommendations for management processes

An understanding of Information Security frameworks, processes, technologies, and practices, including NIST and ISO27xxx standards

Why join us

title: Sr. Business Analyst - Commerce Operations
content: The Commerce Operations Analyst will play a meaningful role in providing payments solutions for the travel market. Expedia Group is responsible for enabling $90 Billion of customer and supplier payment services for a portfolio of global online travel brands under Expedia Group. To date our transactional capabilities are clearly leading the travel industry. And while our technology and products have initially been built to power some of the industry’s leading brands, their ambitious strengths represent a compelling opportunity to broaden Expedia Group’s reach in the ecosystem of travel providers. Join a nimble and mighty team at the forefront of travel plus payments technology development and experience this transformational journey.

This position will be responsible for supporting the operations functions of our commercial payments business throughout the customer lifecycle – sales & contracting, onboarding, ongoing operations and offboarding.

As a key member of the eCommerce Platform (eCP) Commercial Products group, your role will be critical to building, improving and scaling payments related operations functions to power the $2T travel industry. You will work collaboratively across the Sales, Product, Technology, Risk Underwriting, Risk / Fraud Operations, Payment Operations, Back Office Operations, Compliance Operations and Customer Support teams to ensure high quality, scalable and compliant operational capabilities for this global fraud and payment solution provider. This role will report to the Commerce Business Operations Manager.
Support multiple operational functions across our new organization, including:

Onboarding, compliance, merchant due diligence / risk underwriting, risk (fraud), payments, settlements, reconciliation, payouts, chargebacks, invoicing, collections and write offs, accounts payables, escheatments and customer support operations.
Define, prioritize, and implement our requirements to run, improve, automate and scale for end to end business operations processes (volume related scaling, but also international expansion)
Perform daily operational duties within SLA (and help define those SLA’s) while managing process improvements
Create and update clear process documentation and standard operating procedures
Create eye catching and easy to understand ad hoc reporting solutions and operations dashboards
Comfortable and excited to communicate key data and findings to audiences of all levels (front line, supervisory, management)
Collaborate and develop partnerships with many cross functional and external teams including:
Sales Operations, Product Management, Partner Management, Risk (Fraud), Sanctions, Payments (including payment processing & payout partners), Accounting, Chargebacks, Customer Service and Technology
Influence other stakeholders to adopt your defined improvements in processes and standards
Work with an inspired and passionate team
Significant experience as a business analyst within an operations setting
Demonstrated problem solving skills and a customer centric mindset
Demonstrated ability to thrive in a fast paced, constantly changing, highly visible, and ambiguous environment - Think “startup” within a large organization
Have a great balance of hard skills and soft skills
Exhibit extraordinary organizational skills and attention to detail
Ability to prioritize tasks with varying degrees of importance and urgency, and act decisively
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel, experience creating data visualizations
Self-starter, sees what needs to be done and takes initiative
Experience with the following is preferred
Leadership or supervisory experience - You will be one of the first members of this fast-growing, multi-faceted Commercial Operations team
Experience with Sales Operations, Merchant Onboarding, Risk (Fraud) Operations, Payment Processing and Customer Service
Visio (or other process mapping tools), Salesforce or Zendesk
Data visualization tools (Qlik, Tableau, Power BI, Excel Dashboards). Our org utilizes Tableau.
But you do not need BI level experience!
Diverse background working in small to large organizations
You will fit this role if you have:

Maintain high standards for the individual, team and organizational accomplishment. Tenaciously work to meet or exceed challenging goals. Derive satisfaction from goal achievement and continuous improvement.

Clearly and succinctly convey information and ideas to individuals and groups; communicate in a focused and compelling way that draws and holds others’ attention. Create and execute influencing strategies that persuade key partners to take action towards advancing shared interests and business goals. Balance results with relationship.

Secure and compare information from multiple sources to identify core issues. Commit to an action-plan after weighing alternative solutions against decision criteria. Enthusiastically and quickly make sense of complex issues. Respond effectively to complex and ambiguous situations.

Demonstrate a keen understanding of basic business operations and the organizational levers (systems, processes, departments and functions) that drive profitable growth. Draw from personal experience to quickly evaluate business plans and processes to identify data or recommendations that need further investigation.

Use a factual approach to decision-making by systematically collecting valid and reliable data. Rely on the data rather than on emotions. Have the backbone to disagree and commit to the decisions towards better business outcomes.
Bachelor’s Degree, or in lieu of, relevant and applicable experience

title: Sr. Vendor Engagement Analyst
content:
Expedia
Sr. Vendor Engagement Analyst 

Expedia Group revolutionizes travel through the power of technology. Across the globe, our brands make travel easier for millions of people who want to step out of their homes and into the world. Expedia Global Procurement supports the brands and business units of Expedia Group worldwide. Joining our team represents an opportunity to work in an exciting, fast-paced and dynamic environment that is plugged in to internal and external partnerships all over the globe.

What You’ll Do:

Establish and maintain strong relationships with business stakeholders through communication and information sharing.

Ensure vendors remain focused on our mutual goals and can scale to support our changing requirements.

Work with key internal stakeholders to collect and maintain detailed business requirements for their technology needs. 

Communicate with and make recommendations to all levels of management

Help ensure schedules are met and formal reporting and invoicing are timely and accurate

Identify, evangelize and train internal and external organizations on processes

Maintain relationships with internal departments to maintain policies and practices

Actively contribute to our team’s culture of having fun together, embracing change and delivering.

Who You Are:

Minimum 3-5 years of professional experience in procurement or vendor management role, preferably at a large, global organization

Bachelors’ degree in business, financial management or equivalent

Project management experience in a complex, multi layered environment

Passion and conviction. You drive to deliver exceptional results and inspire the same passion in others.

“Whatever it takes” attitude. You have a track record for always going the extra mile; you are self-directed and resourceful.

Excellent communication skills. You are a people person and a relationship builder. You know what to say and more importantly, how to say it to anyone from peer to senior executive. 

Attention to detail. You don’t let anything fall through the cracks.

Customer focus. You deliver customer support like you expect to receive it: with excellence and positivity. You have the ability to identify and solve problems independently and demonstrate good judgment when escalating issues.

Multi-tasking skills. You have mastered the art of juggling multiple tasks at once, and can respond quickly to changing priorities in a dynamic environment. 

Solid presentation skills. You craft engaging and compelling presentation material and present it with confidence and enthusiasm.

Travel may be required.

title: Salesforce Software Development Engineer I
content:
Expedia
We are looking for an experienced Salesforce Software Developer to join our team. This is a hands-on programming role responsible for developing new solutions in and around Salesforce.

As part of the Expedia Salesforce team, you are a self-starter, able to handle various tasks and projects at a time, own deliverables end-to-end, prioritize effectively, and thrive in a dynamic environment. You also work well under pressure to meet ongoing and overlapping deadlines within short time constraints. You will work closely with various business teams to build functional operational support through the Salesforce.com application. Supporting a diverse partner group in all phases of Salesforce development: planning/grooming, delivery, support

Translating business requirements into logical, component-based technical designs

Participation in daily stand-ups to provide updates and maintain transparency within the group and across business partners

Driving resolution of bugs/issues

2+ years previous development experience with Salesforce.com

Experience with Visualforce, APEX, SOQL, SOSL

Detailed knowledge of Salesforce.com architecture

Experience using SFDC-related tools (Eclipse IDE, Apex Data Loader, Workbench)

title: Manager, Strategy and Analytics
content: Do you want a highly impactful role within a team that is growing fast? Are you passionate about driving business value with products that deliver an awesome customer experience? Then this opportunity might be for you.

The Insurance Commercial Strategy and Services (CSS) team is responsible for managing the Insurance P&L and driving its strategy and business development efforts across the Expedia Group globally. We deliver millions of dollars of incremental revenue making a direct and meaningful impact the company's bottom-line. At the same time, we increase customers’ confidence to book travel and make difference in their lives.

While travel is fun, inspiring and educational, the process of shopping for your dream trip and sometimes the journey itself brings notes of stress. The CSS Insurance looks across traditional & creative insurance products to craft benefits that will provide travelers with peace of mind.

Come join this high performing entrepreneurial team to help formulate our Insurance strategy. If you enjoy using data and observations to build sounds business cases, solve business problems, improve on-going business activities and work on a team that functions as the “business owner” you will fit right in. In this role, you will use your analytical and business skills to inspire product, engineering, finance and customer support, and our strategic partners to prioritize, implement and scale our product ideas.
Provide strategic analysis and insights for the insurance business, while actively looking for opportunities to grow the business
Report and analyze business performance from a product, marketing, and customer perspective
Deep-dive into product tests for insurance team to deliver additional insights
Analyze business opportunities across different brands in our portfolio
Help building machine learning algorithms to provide site visitors with highly-relevant custom experiences while maximizing revenue opportunities
Deliver impactful analysis based on robust economic, financial, and statistical analysis
Function independently, assessing existing and upcoming business needs
At least 5 years of experience in analytics area
Demonstrated ability to work through complex business problems and partner with internal clients using consultative approach
Strong analytical/modeling skills with ability to convert raw data into actionable insights
Web analytics (Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, etc.) experience is preferred
