title: IT Systems Engineer
content:
Auth0 is a pre-IPO unicorn. We are growing rapidly and looking for exceptional new team members to add to our teams and will help take us to the next level. One team, one score. 

We never compromise on identity. You should never compromise yours either. We want you to bring your whole self to Auth0. If you’re passionate, practice radical transparency to build trust and respect, and thrive when you’re collaborating, experimenting and learning – this may be your ideal work environment. We are looking for team members that want to help us build upon what we have accomplished so far and make it better every day. N+1 > N.

Auth0 is looking for an IT Systems Engineer to join the IT Team and empower all Auth0 employees to do their best work. You will develop creative solutions to new challenges and build new tools and systems for teams across the company. 

You will be the first member of the new IT Systems team, and will have the opportunity to design this new function as we build it. The IT Team is a flexible and agile team, responsible for a wide variety of services and processes, and those responsibilities are constantly expanding - that’s where you come in! IT is primarily focused on support, and you will take us beyond support and into proactive solutions. 

Task automation and tool creation are a big part of Auth0's culture, and must also be a key component of our IT solutions. You will be responsible for IT automation, and will also work with other teams throughout the company to automate processes and integrate various systems to drive productivity and efficiency. There are many, many opportunities for automation! 

You will own components of our internal architecture (like VPN and DNS services) and will work closely with our Security, Identity, and Compliance teams on various initiatives. And you will of course work with the IT Support team to improve our own processes and solutions! You will be the primary technical resource for the rest of the team.

This is an exciting time to join Auth0 as we are growing quickly and there are plenty of opportunities to learn and implement new technologies. We will invest in your development and support your growth with the company. Auth0 has a distributed, international workforce with an inclusive culture that we are proud of. 

In this role you will:

Automate processes and workflows across Auth0, utilizing integrations, scripts, Slack bots, standalone apps, and any other solutions you can think of

Develop creative solutions to unexpected problems, working with different teams throughout the company

Design (and redesign) our internal tool infrastructure as we grow and our requirements change - what worked at 200 employees may not be the right solution anymore!

Enhance our employees’ IT Support experience through better tools, processes, and automation (are you noticing a pattern yet?) 

Build applications and tools to support the rest of the IT Support team

Administer a wide variety of external cloud services 

Troubleshoot all kinds of applications, systems, and services as needed

Provide excellent customer service with a timely response and resolution to IT requests as needed

Help create and grow the new IT Systems function within IT @ Auth0

Our ideal candidate:

You are a problem-solver and are not intimidated by uncertainty - you will be thinking on your feet and researching problems on the fly

You are highly organized. With many people doing a variety of things in a dynamic company, strong organizational skills—both for yourself and for the team—will be required

You have 3 years minimum experience in automation and scripting

You have proven experience automating processes and utilizing APIs 

You have strong knowledge of Bash, Python, and/or Node.js

You have some exposure to AWS 

You have an in-depth knowledge of macOS 

You have experience with SSO tools and technologies, like Auth0, SAML, and OAuth

You have experience with device management solutions such as JAMF and Google MDM

You enjoy sharing your knowledge and experience with others and enjoy teaching your teammates things you know

You use your great people, communication, and customer service skills to resolve issues

You have excellent English speaking and writing skills

Bonus points for any of the following:

Relevant technical certifications, specifically for AWS and JAMF 

CS degree, or similar engineering certificate 

Experience working with a remote workforce and in a fast-paced startup environment 

Experience with Google G Suite, Atlassian Jira and Confluence, SumoLogic, Slack, Zoom, Github, and other applicable cloud tools

Understanding of secure networking best practices and infrastructure concepts 

Experience building and maintaining a corporate VPN 

Experience managing DNS records and domains 

Experience managing an endpoint protection platform like Crowdstrike or Carbon Black


Auth0 values diversity and inclusion and is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Auth0’s mission is to help developers innovate faster. Every company is becoming a software company and developers are at the center of this shift. They need better tools and building blocks so they can stay focused on innovating. One of these building blocks is identity: authentication and authorization. That’s what we do. Our platform handles 2.5B logins per month for thousands of customers around the world. From indie makers to Fortune 500 companies, we can handle any use case. 

We like to think that we are helping make the internet safer. We have raised $210M to date and are growing quickly. Our team is spread across more than 35 countries and we are proud to continually be recognized as a great place to work. Culture is critical to us, and we are transparent about our vision and principles. 

Join us on this journey to make developers more productive while making the internet safer!

title: Full Stack Software Engineer, IAM Login
content:
Auth0 is a pre-IPO unicorn. We are growing rapidly and looking for exceptional new team members to add to our teams and will help take us to the next level. One team, one score. 

We never compromise on identity. You should never compromise yours either. We want you to bring your whole self to Auth0. If you’re passionate, practice radical transparency to build trust and respect, and thrive when you’re collaborating, experimenting and learning – this may be your ideal work environment. We are looking for team members that want to help us build upon what we have accomplished so far and make it better every day. N+1 > N.

We're growing fast here at Auth0 and are looking for experienced full stack developers for our Identity & Access Management (IAM) Login team. IAM delivers a simple, extensible identity platform that is easy for our customers to integrate into their applications and effortless to operate.

The mission of the team is to provide a simple, secure, standards-compliant and delightful login experience for both end users and developers.

We are open about technology choices and like to contribute to OSS projects. Our current stack focuses on Node, ElasticSearch, MongoDB, and React, but we like to focus on picking the right tools for the job.

You will:

Join a small (10 person), cohesive team comprised of engineers, a product manager, and designer to own our products from top to bottom.

Collaborate with other engineers and teams to develop new features, APIs, improvements, and fixes to handle our current and future scale.

Help our customers have an awesome experience with our products.

Collaborate with our support team as the last level of escalation for tickets.

You are a good fit if you:

Have excellent communication and collaboration skills.

Love to be on top of edge technologies.

Have experience creating public, or internal, APIs.

Have experience using NodeJS (or JavaScript), Java, or any other concurrency-friendly language.

Have strong experience with at least one modern front-end framework like React, Angular, Vue, etc.

Passionate about user experience.

Are autonomous and have a continuous improvement mindset.

Pay attention to details and keep user experience a top priority.

Enjoy being part of a highly collaborative, remote friendly environment.

You might work on:

Collaborating with the team to craft user facing interfaces from design to implementation.

Creating or enhance management API endpoints.

Creating new configuration screens on our dashboard.

Building automated tests for our features.

Participating on our on-call rotations troubleshooting production issues.

#US; #CA; #AR;

content:

We are a Security company and Auth0's Security team is in the privileged position of supporting a Security-first culture for a company that wants to make the internet safer.

We are looking for a technical and hands-on Detection & Response Engineer who is passionate about protecting Auth0’s customers, employees and brand. The successful candidate will have a mix of deep technical knowledge, and a demonstrated background in information security.

In this role you will: 

Respond to security incidents, and proactively consider how to prevent the same type of incidents from occurring in the future.

Build automation workflows for common response scenarios.

Act as an escalation point after automated triage of alerts.

Perform variant analysis and root cause analysis to find systematic bugs.

Develop creative solutions to complex security problems which balance business needs and risk.

Keep knowledge and skills current to keep up with the rapidly changing threat landscape.

Fulfill regular on-call responsibilities

Our ideal candidate will have: 

Excellent analytical thinking, time management and coordination skills and excellent command in English (both written and verbal).

Strong demonstrable knowledge of common attack vectors.

Familiarity/experience with AWS services and security concepts.

Experience with common security monitoring, log analysis and forensic tools.

Ability to work with a high degree of autonomy.

Have a passion to learn and thrive in a dynamic and constantly changing environment.

Bachelor’s/Master’s in Computer Science or equivalent OR 3-5 years working in a high-demand security team.

Bonus Points:

Experience working as part of a Computer Security Incident Response Team (CSIRT) or Security Operations Team.

Experience working on-call.

content:

Auth0 continues to grow and so does the volume and complexity of the needs of our prospective customers. Security and identity management are now core concerns of every business. As a result we are building a dedicated pre-sales engineering team that will be the primary technical resource for all of our account executives. We will help engage the prospect where they have the greatest need and then fill that need through education and guidance to the best solution. Successful candidates will be located in North America.

Responsibilities:

Deliver interactive presentations and product demos.

Lead Q&A sessions to prospective customers in order to understand their requirements.

Present to all levels of the organization - from practitioner to C-level.

Engage with multiple business units including software engineering, operations, product management and business stakeholders.

Whiteboard Auth0 solutions with customer architectures.

Execute well defined, outcome focused PoCs for prospects.

Maintain a broad and deep technical understanding of the Auth0 product line and the underlying technologies and protocols.

Stay up to date on industry trends through self study, research, online courses.

Proactive engagement in local and regional events evangelizing Auth0 as a presenter and attendee.

Work from home with up to 50% travel within region.

Requirements:

A love for our primary customer profile: the software developer and architect.

A passion to serve the customer, which has played out in some customer-facing role like consulting or support, ideally sales engineering.

An ability to quickly communicate complex ideas around a technical topic, ideally on the fly at a whiteboard.

Strong presentation skills.

Expert in building relationships, listening and managing time.

A desire to engage with the larger community by contributing to open source projects and participating in local events.

Experience with JavaScript.

Experience with SaaS and Cloud platforms (AWS, Azure)

Experience with at least one backend stack (eg. node, java, .NET).

Experience with a popular frontend stack (eg. react, angular).

Desired:

Experience with at least one standard network security protocol (eg. OAuth, OAuth2, SAML, LDAP).

An understanding of core security concerns within a typical application (password hashing, SSL/TLS, encryption at rest, XSS, XSRF).

Solid experience with HTTP, with both HTML apps as well as REST services. This includes the ability to use the dev tools in a browser to explain HTTP traffic and an HTTP client (like curl or Postman) to interact with an HTTP service.

5+ years experience in pre-sales engineering.

2+ years experience in pre-sales engineering.

Preferred Locations:

(MA); (CT): (RI): (NY): (PA); (NJ); (MA); (VA); (NC); (GA); (FL); (TN); (OH); (MI); (IN); (IL); (WI); (MN); (TX);


Auth0’s mission is to help developers innovate faster. Every company is becoming a software company and developers are at the center of this shift. They need better tools and building blocks so they can stay focused on innovating. One of these building blocks is identity: authentication and authorization. That’s what we do. Our platform handles 2.5B logins per month for thousands of customers around the world. From indie makers to Fortune 500 companies, we can handle any use case. 

We like to think that we are helping make the internet safer. We have raised $210M to date and are growing quickly. Our team is spread across more than 35 countries and we are proud to continually be recognized as a great place to work. Culture is critical to us, and we are transparent about our vision and principles. 

Join us on this journey to make developers more productive while making the internet safer!

to join Service Management - Administration Experience Team. Are you passionate about working in a remote, multi-functional, multicultural team together with other software engineers, product designer and product owner - all living in different timezones?

Our current technology stack is node.js on the backend and React on the frontend, MongoDB and PostgreSQL for storing data and RabbitMQ as message queue.

Have experience solving problems connected with subscription management, teams access management and access auditing in SaaS products.
Like to mentor and coach other engineers.
Have experience in developing services that integrates with Salesforce.
Have knowledge in the identity and access management space.

title: Release Engineer
content:
Auth0 is a pre-IPO unicorn. We are growing rapidly and looking for exceptional new team members to add to our teams and will help take us to the next level. One team, one score. 

We never compromise on identity. You should never compromise yours either. We want you to bring your whole self to Auth0. If you’re passionate, practice radical transparency to build trust and respect, and thrive when you’re collaborating, experimenting and learning – this may be your ideal work environment. We are looking for team members that want to help us build upon what we have accomplished so far and make it better every day. N+1 > N.

Auth0 has a dedicated 
Release 
team, which is responsible for providing continuous integration (CI) and continuous deployment (CD) services for other teams inside Auth0. The team also owns Release Management tooling (such as feature flags libraries and components) that allow teams to perform reliable launches while maintaining agility.

We aim to guide teams on how to integrate and deliver their services to production going through the entire Delivery Pipeline, from development to deployment. We provide tools and building blocks to ensure every release is tested, analyzed and measured before delivering it to our production environments.

We are looking for curious, engaging and passionate engineers that will help us build an innovative team with a strong focus on continuously improving and optimizing our release infrastructure. Among the projects this team will be working on:

- Provide a "self-service" provisioning of Continuous Integration (CI) and Delivery (CD) infrastructure for teams

- Develop tools that enable teams to scale their own CI and CD workflows

- Run and operate this infrastructure

- Provide advice, guidance and tooling on using "CI as Code" for every team

- Collect metrics, logging, and perform reporting about our CI and CD infrastructure

- Keep traceability for every piece of code delivered to production

Responsibilities:

Develop new tools to improve our release and test pipeline

Design, develop and maintain release pipelines for our products

Engage with every other engineering team at Auth0 to understand their needs and lead them to improve their integration and release experience

Create guidelines for recommended release management practices and evangelize them among teams at Auth0

Automate and scale our CI and CD infrastructure

Enhance engineering operations by providing support and guidance to deliver new services to production

Participate in 24x7 on-call rotation

Requirements:

Design and build scalable services

Write clean, readable, and maintainable code (Python, Go, Node)

Prototype and build proof of concepts with different technologies to understand tradeoffs

Have experience with patterns and techniques for software integration and delivery

Enjoy being part of a highly collaborative, remote first environment

Invested in high code quality, automated testing, and other engineering best practices

Strong written and verbal communication skills

Extra points:

Have the ability to influence development teams and evangelize best practices

Have passion for infrastructure as code and config management tools

Are familiar with AWS, Terraform, Jenkins, Spinnaker and Salt

Are familiar with Docker and Kubernetes

Experience with Linux

Preferred Locations:

North & South America;#US-W; #CA; #AR;

In order to succeed in this team, this individual must have the passion and energy to work in an entrepreneurial and fast paced environment.

Work as part of our extended support team in a startup atmosphere, doing whatever it takes to exceed customer expectations.

Strong analytical and problem solving skills.

Self-starter — able to come up to speed on complex, difficult concepts with minimal assistance.

Customer-obsessed attitude — a customer advocate, always going the extra mile

Proactivity — identify opportunities and take preemptive action against potential problems.

Knowledge of software development fundamentals and common architectures.

Knowledge of HTTP, encryption, basic security concepts.

Understanding of authentication and authorization concepts.

Proficient in at least one programming language; ideally JavaScript.

Experience & Education:

Min 2 years of technical support and/or software development.

OR 2-5 years of solid experience in a business or technical analyst role for medium to large scale business software implementation projects.

Shifts

There may be a requirement to join a rotation for weekend shifts, in order to ensure we can deliver outstanding service, 24x7.

title: Senior Full Stack Software Engineer
content: Our mission at Suplari is to shine the light on waste so that companies can invest in growth, innovation and their people. Suplari’s software leverages machine learning and AI technologies to deliver actionable insights from a company’s spend and procurement data and easily visualizes these tailored recommendations and data trends in a clean, user-friendly interface. Customers realize hard dollar cost savings and effectively manage supplier risk that is often hidden within millions of data points and takes hours of manpower and clunky spreadsheets to uncover.

Suplari is truly making an impact for clients such as Nordstrom, 21st Century Fox, and Sonos, (just to name a few) and we’re just getting started. We’re aiming to “share the wealth” by providing businesses with the tools to reduce spend, mitigate risk and increase compliance, and we need your help!
to join us at our downtown Seattle HQ.

Do you like focusing on challenging problems and finding creative solutions? Would you like to help create something that makes a difference? Do you like to be part of a fast-growing company and be able to put your mark on something early?
As an integral member of an engineering team, you will:
Work with other cloud service engineers as well as web application developers to build the Suplari platform and application suite.
Design, build, and implement a cloud native, distributed system delivered as a SaaS application which forms the core of the Suplari service.
We are looking for passionate engineers that want to be part of a company that’s going to change the way enterprise businesses interact with their suppliers.

While you don’t need to have experience in every technology we use, as a startup, we do expect you to be comfortable contributing anywhere throughout the stack. Here are some of the heavy-hitters that we rely on daily: Golang, PostgreSQL, Javascript/Typescript as well as AWS technologies like RDS, ECS and Kubernetes.
Experience in any of the following languages: Go, Python, Javascript/NodeJS, Java
Experience with cloud configuration and deployment technologies
Experience with multi-tenant architecture for enterprises
Experience in infrastructure-as-code such as Terraform, DevOps, Docker, build management.
Deep understanding of RESTful web services design and implementation
Rigor in engineering best practices such as automated testing, continuous integration and DevOps
Willingness to jump into a broad range of projects
BS or MS in computer science or a related field
Experience working with data science and machine learning toolkits like NLTKand the Stanford CoreNLP
We’d love to hear from you if:
You love being a part of a small, dynamic, and agile organization that encourages you to learn and grow
You love finding solutions to interesting problems
You welcome having autonomy with complex tasks
You are passionate about using your experience and expertise to inspire the team
Comprehensive, company-paid medical, dental, and vision benefits
Been there, done that team: Our management team has a track record of success at companies such as HP, Amazon, Apptio, Skytap, iConclude, Trulia, and Zillow
Suplari is backed by top tier venture capital investors Madrona Venture Group, Shasta Ventures, Amplify Partners, Two Sigma Ventures and Workday Ventures
Ability to make a critical impact at an early stage company
This position will be located in the Seattle area
We are not interviewing remote employees at this time
Suplari is an equal opportunity employer!

title: Benchmarking Specialist
content: Paying the right way, getting paid what you’re worth — it’s complicated, and it matters. Compensation used to be a dark art. Not anymore. PayScale helps employers and their employees understand the right pay for every position and effectively communicate about compensation.

PayScale pioneered the use of big data and unique matching algorithms to power the world’s most advanced compensation platform and continues to be the compensation market leader, featured in G2 Crowd's

The Benchmarking team plays a key role in getting our customers to value. We are specialists in transferring their data accurately into our system, matching their jobs to our benchmarked titles, and facilitating their use of our tools for a friction-less experience.

The Benchmarking team studies and analyzes assigned benchmark jobs by utilizing a defined market pricing methodology. We perform audits of client accounts to determine whether benchmarked jobs have changed significantly from the original evaluation. We work with confidential client data every day while we complete our work, so following data security protocols is a top concern. On occasion we participate in special projects to improve system and services. We support the entire Client Services organization by occasionally helping to balance workload across teams.
As a Benchmarking Specialist, a typical day may include the following…
Analyze job descriptions and translate key tasks, duties, and responsibilities into benchmark jobs
Use PayScale standard methodologies to match jobs by title alone
Assist clients via email regarding job matching process
Assist clients over the phone by reviewing jobs live with the client
Provide feedback to PayScale internal teams to improve product and processes.
Within 3 months, you will have completed training as a Benchmarking Specialist and will be working on client projects.
Within 6 months, you will have completed match review training and will be troubleshooting with clients live on the phone.

Within 12 months, you will have mastered Benchmarking and Client troubleshooting and will be working on process improvement projects and/or product improvement. Between 6 and 12 months you will also be helping to train any new hires.
This is an entry to mid-level position where we have found success with candidates from a variety of backgrounds. A post-secondary education or 2 years of experience working with clients is helpful.
Strong problems solving and troubleshooting skills
Experience with relational databases is helpful
Experience using Salesforce is a plus.

My name is Maggie Redd. I came to PayScale so that I could continue to work with my best friend. I stayed for the incredible company culture, meaningful work, and the ownership I have in my position. I have been on the Benchmarking Team for all my five years with PayScale, and became Team Lead in 2018. As a team lead, I believe that is my job to ensure that my team has the tools and support needed to provide our clients with the best possible experience. I do this by having twice monthly 1:1's, active communication across multiple channels (mostly email and slack), and cultivating a supportive environment. I do my best to work with each of my employees on their professional goals, encourage work/life balance, and ensure that while you work for PayScale, PayScale works for you!

“Change is the only constant in life (and PayScale)” – Heraclites (okay, so we paraphrased a bit). The hiring process outlined below is a rough overview, and is subject to change based on business priority, interviewer availability, etc.
Interview with Team Lead and 1-2 members of the Benchmarking Team
10 paid holidays AND Summer office closure the entire week of July 4th
Amazing Medical/Vision/Dental/Prescription coverage: 100% company-paid premiums for employees; 50% for eligible partners and dependents
Flexible Spending Account (FSA) options for pre-tax employee allocations towards: Medical, Dependent Care, Parking, and Transit
Long Term Disability, Short Term Disability, and Company-paid Life Insurance
Competitive Maternity and Paternity Leave, and onsite Mother’s Room
401k which vests immediately, complete with company match
Onsite bike storage, lockers, showers, and clothes dryer
Ergo friendly chairs and sitting-standing desks
Company-hosted happy hours every Friday afternoon
Fido Fridays (our canine colleagues join us the first Friday of every month. WOOF!)

PayScale provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. PayScale complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.

title: Senior Data Analyst, Research
content:
Company Description

PayScale is the world leader in modern compensation software. We believe data-informed discussions about compensation benefit both employers and employees and that greater pay transparency promotes equity, engagement and employee retention. We are bringing the dark art of compensation into the light by helping individuals understand the right pay for their position and more than 7,000 businesses retain and manage their largest investment: their people.

We’re transforming the compensation industry and are looking to bring on talented professionals like you with diverse perspectives. At PayScale, we acknowledge and value our differences as well as our combined strengths. We want all employees, regardless of their background, to feel respected personally and professionally. We foster a working environment that generates new ideas, promotes ownership and experimentation and encourages highly motivated individuals to be truly creative. Are you forward-thinking, tenacious, and inventive? If so, PayScale may be the perfect place for you to grow your career.

Job Description

Are you enthralled with topics like gender and racial pay equity, macroeconomic pay trends, and what engages employees? We are looking for a self-motivated Senior Data Analyst with a passion for solving analytical problems and communicating nuanced findings to non-technical audiences to be an integral member of our Data Analytics research team. While data is our lifeblood, making compensation more fair, modern and transparent is at the heart of what we do, and we want someone to join us who shares this passion!

What you’ll do

Participate in crafting innovative and highly visible analyses of work trends and compensation, like PayScale's Gender Pay Gap Package.

Select and analyze subsets of the PayScale database of over 65 million profiles, using our real-time data analysis system.

Work with internal and external partners to understand their information requirements and provide the needed data or analysis.

Find trends, stories, and highlights in a large, multivariate dataset.

Partner with PayScale’s marketing team to brainstorm concepts, craft research questions for the PayScale salary survey, and generate original content powered by data.

Contribute to initiatives driving traffic to our website and awareness of our brand, as well as further solidify our place as visionaries in the compensation space.

Develop analytical and statistical approaches to answer research questions, examine data validity, and report on interesting data subjects.

Qualifications

A masters degree with significant course work in a quantitative field, such as economics, statistics, econometrics, physical sciences, or applied mathematics.

3-5 years of relevant work experience.

Ability and desire to work with a team of people solving complex problems that often require independent research.

Proficiency with Python or R is a requirement.

Excellent problem solving, critical thinking and communication (both written and oral) skills.

Attention to detail with a good sense of organization and time management.

An obsession with cleaning, structuring and analyzing data.

Experience answering complex questions quantitatively.

Able to work independently in a dynamic, fast-paced, start-up environment.

Additional Information

PayScale provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. PayScale complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.

Benefits We Offer:

Unlimited Paid Time Off policy

100% company paid medical/vision/dental/prescription premiums for employees (50% for eligible dependents and partners)

Four Flexible Spending Account (FSA) options for pre-tax employee allocations towards:

Medical

Dependent Care (can be used towards day care costs)

Parking

Transit

Long Term Disability, Short Term Disability, and Company-paid Life Insurance

Maternity and Paternity Leave

10 paid holidays

Summer office closure, entire week of July 4th

401k with company match, vests immediately

Perks:

Casual dress code (JSS - Jeans, shorts, and sandals welcome)

Onsite lockers, showers, and clothes dryer

Bike storage

Coworkers you actually like...

Gender neutral bathrooms on most floors

Mothers' Room

Sitting-Standing ergo friendly desks

Weekly company sponsored happy hours

Fido Fridays (our canine colleagues join us the first Friday of every month. WOOF!)

Do you want to make a huge impact while working on hard technical problems? We are looking for a manager to help us lead the way and would love to welcome you to the team!
You will inspire, motivate and lead a team of 4-6 back-end engineers to ensure efficient delivery of high quality product features.

content:

Paying the right way, getting paid what you’re worth — it’s complicated, and it matters. Compensation used to be a dark art. Not anymore. PayScale helps employers and their employees understand the right pay for every position and effectively communicate about compensation.

PayScale pioneered the use of rich data and unique matching algorithms to power the world’s most advanced compensation platform and continues to be the compensation market leader, featured in G2 Crowd's 100 Best Software Companies for 2018, based on user reviews.

Job Description

Do you want to make a huge impact while working on hard technical problems? If so we look forward to talking with you! The leader in this role will manage a growing agile software development team that builds our platform and applications. The PayScale platform ingests crowdsourced data from visitors to payscale.com, as well as company-sourced data from B2B customers and compensation survey data from third-party providers. Data is ingested through a variety of means, including third-party API integrations as well as friendly consumer-facing and B2B web user interfaces. Data science and machine learning algorithms operate on the platform to build models for matching company jobs to the market and for making pay recommendations. Applications on our platform include PayScale Team which enables people managers to make better decisions and communicate with employees about pay.

What You'll Do

As a people manager, you will recruit, encourage, mentor, and coach agile teams to deliver quality software and grow in their careers. You will meet for regular one-on-ones to provide feedback and optimize performance, and identify and groom engineering leaders.

Unblock your teams and keep things moving through technical mentorship, helping them connect with the people and resources that can help, and leading changes to architecture, tools, processes and the organization itself to make engineering more efficient and effective.

Promote technical vitality of engineering teams by recommending conference and training opportunities, helping to coordinate team events like quarterly hack days, and facilitating sharing across teams.

Serve as a technical conscience, partnering with DevOps and Security teams, to ensure customer data is secure, applications have robust monitoring and disaster recovery, and technical debt is paid down in a responsible manner.

Work closely with product managers to influence the product roadmap, ensure alignment between engineering and other teams, and balance technology initiatives with business priorities across teams.

Qualifications

6+ years experience in a management or team lead role.

8+ years experience developing and designing software, preferably multi-tenant SAAS.

Experience with C# or other OOP languages.

Experience launching high performance and scalable services and applications into cloud platforms.

Working knowledge of relational and no-SQL databases.

Familiarity/experience with unit testing and crafting testable code.

Able to explain technical concepts to developers, project managers, and technical managers.

Experience working in an Agile environment.

Technologies We're Using

Back end REST APIs using C#, Python and Typescript.

Front end using React.

Data layer includes SQL databases, Spark, Elasticsearch, Redis and Snowflake.

We use Azure and AWS services including event hub, functions, blob storage, databases and more.

We build and deploy to containers (Docker and Kubernetes) using TeamCity and Octopus for build and deploy pipeline.

Jira and Bitbucket.

Additional Information

Benefits & Perks – The Highlights:

Unlimited Paid Time Off policy

10 paid holidays AND Summer office closure the entire week of July 4th

Excellent Medical/Vision/Dental/Prescription coverage: 100% company-paid premiums for employees; 50% for eligible partners and dependents

Flexible Spending Account (FSA) options for pre-tax employee allocations towards: Medical, Dependent Care, Parking, and Transit

Long Term Disability, Short Term Disability, and Company-paid Life Insurance

Maternity and Paternity Leave, and onsite Mother’s Room

401k which vests immediately, complete with company match

Onsite bike storage, lockers, showers, and clothes dryer

Ergo friendly chairs and sitting-standing desks

Company-hosted happy hours

Fido Fridays (our canine colleagues join us the first Friday of every month. WOOF!)

title: Sales Business Intelligence Analyst
content: Paying the right way, getting paid what you’re worth — it’s complicated, and it matters. Compensation used to be a dark art. Not anymore. PayScale helps employers and their employees understand the right pay for every position and effectively communicate about compensation.

PayScale pioneered the use of big data and unique matching algorithms to power the world’s most advanced compensation platform and continues to be the compensation market leader, featured in G2 Crowd's

We foster a working environment that generates new ideas, promotes ownership and experimentation and encourages highly motivated individuals to be truly creative. Are you forward-thinking, tenacious, and inventive? If so, PayScale may be the perfect place for you to grow your career!
Do you have that curious analytical mind with the sniffer for finding additional revenue & operational efficiencies? If so, we have the perfect role for you.

We are seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst who will join our Sales Operations team to provide Strategic Insights in support of a wide-range of Sales operational functions, including; forecasting, strategy & planning, compensation design & support, sales technology investments, process improvements, and PayScale’s go-to-market strategy. You bring strong Technical acumen with data and an intuition for business to help inform & influence our Sales team’s continued growth and evolution.

You are an expert in sales automation, process and productivity. You're analytical with the ability to make data sing for purpose and truly see around corners. You are experienced in ground breaking change during critical junctions of company growth -- Think process innovation meets clean-through-the-clutter. You will be responsible for bringing order to the organics without making it feel too rules based. You have an excellent understanding of sales incentives plans and sales enablement techniques. You currently lead operations for a large inside sales team with thousands of marketing qualified leads coming in every month.
We are growing quickly, with eyes on further expansion into new markets and new sales channels. There couldn't be a better time for you to come join our Sales Ops team and make a noticeable impact!
In this role, you will support a blend of Sales Business Intelligence and Sales Strategy & Planning needs:
Sales Business Intelligence - Data, Insights, Analytics, and Forecasting
Drive the strategy, design, and implementation of reporting and analytical solutions that enable the end-to-end sales cycle and go-to-market design and execution
Improve our forecasting processes through data, analytics, and predictive models
Evaluate, develop and implement new, significant methods for data analysis to inform the sales organization about its performance
Build, Launch, and maintain predictive data models to help Sales team better identify target prospect accounts and plan their territories.
Lead conversations around definition and ongoing monitoring of Sales Metrics at all levels of the organization from CSO to Sales rep
Provide thoughtful analysis and provide recommendations to executives and department leaders
Grow our organizational maturity around reporting quality, data hygiene, and data governance
Develop Territory Planning & headcount Coverage Models for our Sales Teams
Help set equitable quotas that vary based on segment & level
Research & validate individual and team quota attainment
Design, Drive and Lead execution of strategic Data projects in close partnership with other internal departments including Finance, Legal, Marketing, etc.
The ideal individual for this opportunity brings the following to the table:
You are a highly analytical self-starter with sound decision-making capabilities.
You provide trusted and timely insights that drive sales productivity, revenue growth and support the implementation of go-to-market strategy.
You bring the technical ability to pull and stage data from multiple system and the statistical chops to interpret data in a meaningful way.
You tell insightful stories through data visualizations that speak to all audiences ranging from clients to Sales Reps to C-level leadership.
You have a Masters Degree or above with specialty in finance, computer science, or other quantitative discipline
You possess 3+ years Sales Operations/Business Analysis experience
Your skills BI Tools & data manipulation are strong (Tableau, Salesforce Einstein Analytics, PowerBI, etc)
Your track record of surfacing key insights to drive positive business change speaks for itself
You are proficient in Writing SQL and are familiar with data warehousing Techniques
An uncanny ability to communicate complex concepts in a clear and concise manner to audiences from staff to senior executive level
10 paid holidays AND Summer office closure the entire week of July 4th
Amazing Medical/Vision/Dental/Prescription coverage: 100% company-paid premiums for employees; 50% for eligible partners and dependents
Flexible Spending Account (FSA) options for pre-tax employee allocations towards: Medical, Dependent Care, Parking, and Transit

title: Software Engineer I
content:
Company Description

Job Description

The Growth team supports the millions of users that visit our site every month. Our mission is to grow the company in traffic, data and revenue by focusing on SEO, improving data and lead conversion via A/B testing, and an e-commerce experience. Our team is metrics driven and projects are prioritized based on how much they can impact our company wide goals.

Do you want to make a huge impact while working on hard technical problems? We are looking for a software engineer (back-end or full-stack) to help us lead the way and would love to welcome you to the team!

What You'll Do

You will analyze and improve site performance visited by millions of users every month.

You will build microservices and coordinate closely with your front-end peers.

You will maintain strong engineering practices by writing unit and integration tests.

You will collaborate with product owners and engineering managers to develop the feature set, schedule, and roadmap.

Qualifications

1+ years experience developing and designing software

Previous experience with C# or other OOP languages.

Working knowledge of relational and no-SQL databases.

Familiarity/experience with unit testing and crafting testable code.

Able to explain technical concepts to developers, project managers, and technical managers.

Experience working in an Agile environment.

Technologies We're Using

We write primarily use C# on the back-end and JavaScript and React on the front-end.

We work in Azure utilizing technologies such as Functions, Blob Storage, SQL and more.

We use TeamCity and Octopus for our build and deploy pipeline.

We track all our work in Jira and store all our git repositories in Bitbucket.

title: Data Scientist
content:
Company Description

PayScale is the world leader in modern compensation software. We believe data-informed discussions about compensation benefit both employers and employees and that greater pay transparency promotes equity, engagement and employee retention. We are bringing the dark art of compensation into the light by helping individuals understand the right pay for their position and more than 7,000 businesses retain and manage their largest investment: their people.

We’re transforming the compensation industry and are looking to bring on talented data professionals like you with diverse perspectives. At PayScale, we acknowledge and value our differences as well as our combined strengths. We want all employees, regardless of their background, to feel respected personally and professionally. We foster a working environment that generates new ideas, promotes ownership and experimentation, and encourages highly motivated individuals to be truly creative.

Job Description

Does empowering a company to make data driven decisions excite you? We are looking for a Data Scientist to do just that. We are a small team working on high impact projects that drive innovation in our customer facing products and across the organization. The Data Science team partners closely with data engineers, product managers, and other external partners to design and develop the machine learning applications that power our compensation tools.

In this role you will focus on building and improving algorithms around salary prediction, record matching, recommendations/search, client retention, and lead scoring. We train models on a range of data sources, including but not limited to structured and unstructured text (read Natural Language Processing) and event based data. If you enjoy seeing a project all the way from concept to production this is a phenomenal opportunity within a collaborative SaaS company.

Technologies We're Using:

Python (pandas, scikit-learn, NumPy, SpaCy), SQL, Elasticsearch, Tensorflow, Snowflake, Postgres, Spark, Azure, AWS, Git, and Docker

Qualifications

We'd love to hear from you if:

You have 2+ years experience building machine learning models/services

You are thoughtful in the evaluation of your models, improving them over time as they interact with real users

You have excellent coding skills, especially in Python or R

You care about the reliability and maintainability of your code.

You have a working understanding of database systems and experience writing SQL queries.

You have some experience with cloud providers (AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud).

You can effectively communicate and share results with both technical and non-technical partners.

You have the ability and desire to work with a team of people solving complex problems that often require independent research with minimal supervision.

You have strong critical thinking and communication skills.

Additional Information

PayScale provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. PayScale complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.

Benefits:

Unlimited Paid Time Off policy

100% company paid medical/vision/dental/prescription premiums for employees (50% for eligible dependents and partners)

Four Flexible Spending Account (FSA) options for pre-tax employee allocations towards:

Medical

Dependent Care (can be used towards day care costs!)

Parking

Transit

Long Term Disability, Short Term Disability, and Company-paid Life Insurance

10 paid holidays!

Summer Office Closure, entire week of July 4th

title: Software Engineering Project Manager
content:
About the Role

Do you want to join our team of talented, collaborative, and fun engineers? Does the idea of building a groundbreaking, next generation AI marketing platform used by name brand companies sound exciting?

New Engen is looking for a Software Engineering Project Manager with demonstrated experience. Our team and software services are growing rapidly, and this role will partner with our Engineering Managers to help our engineers efficiently and consistently deliver business value . Our Project Manager will work with our Senior Project Manager to run our sprints, coordinate across teams, provide metrics and analysis, and help with longer term planning.

We'd love to hear from you if

You are passionate about keeping teams on track and working efficiently

You have drive, an excellent work ethic, can self-manage and are resourceful

You're comfortable asking why things aren't going as planned

You are positive, energetic, and can motivate a team

You love dynamic, fast paced environments

You can follow up on action items and hold people accountable

You are highly organized and can drive multiple projects at once

Qualifications

At least 2 years of professional experience in project management

Ability to manage projects, sprints, and across multiple teams

Ability to collaborate with Product and Engineering Managers

Ability to prioritize, sequence, and balance workloads

Ability to run daily stand ups to get status from team members

Experience creating timelines and tracking progress via workflow tools

Ability to drive the team towards their commitments and mitigate risks

Ability to ask questions and dig in to find the root of the problem

Ability to ensure team members are clear on their priorities and current assignments

Ability to identify risks and help managers resolve them

Ability to analyze and report on data related to team and individual contributor performance

Extras that Will Give you an Edge

You are Scrum Master certified

You are a Jira and/or Excel power user

You have marketing and/or advertising agency experience

title: Senior Software Development Engineer 129-1
content:
RESPONSIBILITIES

Responsible for developing or testing computer software applications, systems or services.

Evaluate requirements, estimate development costs, design and implement the software, review the design and implementation, improve the development process, perform unit testing, communicate status, analyze risks and compromises, integrate software into a larger system, or diagnose and resolve issues.

Work autonomously on specific software feature areas or components, contributing broadly to product development.

Deploy successful product releases, from early product definition and scoping to detailed specification, implementation and roll-out phases.

QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor’s or foreign equivalent degree in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, or a related field.

Four years of software development experience including: Analyzing software and customer requirements, and preparing a development plan, including estimation, risks, analytics, unit test, functional test, and code design; Working in a GNU Linux/Unix environment; Utilizing high-level programming languages including Java; Unix; Agile Development methodologies; Java Run Time; and Designing, developing, and implementing automated test scripts and test reporting. 

Position at New Engen, Inc. in Seattle, WA

40 hours per week, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m., M-F

title: Senior Front End Developer (React, Javascript)
content:
Description: 

We are looking for a Senior Front End Developer to work on technology that brings marketing + technology + creative together. In this meaningful role, you will be responsible for building and implementing fast, responsive, user-friendly web apps. This position would assist with our internal product development as well as create our ground breaking SaaS product as it evolves. Join our team of talented, collaborative and fun engineers! At New Engen we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our partners, and our community.

Responsibilities: 

Write clean front-end code to build amazing features across both mobile web and desktop

Work with Product/Marketing/Technology partners and colleagues to define the user experience of a customer-facing marketing technology platform

Improve the performance, functionality, and user experience for our customers

Strive to provide a lightning-fast experience to our users

Blend pixel-perfect sensibilities with responsive-minded problem solving to bring marketing page designs to life with exceptional web development

Qualifications:

5+ years of front-end development: including JavaScript, Typescript, HTML5, CSS3, React, Redux

Tools: Git, Gulp, SASS/LESS, Stylus

Operating systems: Mac, Linux, Windows

Experience developing and working with complex web, software applications

Experience with front-end web development throughout the planning, design and development lifecycle for many unique and innovative user experience projects

Experience working on optimization techniques for web applications, performance and SEO optimization a plus

Experience with architectural patterns, frameworks, API design and building large-scale, applications

Plus: Exposure to full-stack technologies (Node.js, Python and SQL)

title: Software Development Engineer
content:
New Engen helps companies and marketing teams perform at their peak. Our powerful machine learning and AI technology solution fuels growth at companies across industries, geographies and levels of maturity.

We are focused on helping our partners achieve massive scale of new customer value across all digital marketing platforms. We are results driven, committed, iterative and transparent. Our teams of expert Marketers, Application Developers and Data Scientists help tackle some of the most complex digital marketing challenges.

At New Engen we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we embrace it for the benefit of our employees, our partners, and our community. We are committed to equal employment opportunity and diversity.

About the Role

Do you want to join our team of talented, collaborative, and fun engineers? Does the idea of building a groundbreaking, next generation AI marketing platform used by name brand companies sound exciting?

New Engen is looking for a Software Development Engineer with demonstrated experience. You'll help drive the evolution and scalability of our powerful digital marketing platform from an internal tool to a customer facing enterprise SaaS system. This is an exciting and meaningful role and is ideal for someone with enthusiasm, dedication, excellent technical and communication abilities and a real passion for growing our company in to its next phase.

We'd love to hear from you if

You've programmed in Java and have a solid grasp of Java fundamentals

You are passionate about new technology and mastering new skills

You're committed to building enterprise grade SaaS solutions

You're passionate about cloud architecture, design and documentation

You have a passion to build software in the cloud (AWS)

You love complex multi-tier and distributed systems

You want a chance to create something new in a rapidly growing company

You are comfortable collaborating with people inside and outside our organization

You have dedication to your customers and want to make a difference

You do not have an ego and enjoy working on a team

Qualifications

Problem-solving skills and creative thinking

2 or more years of experience in Java development

Experience persisting data (SQL, NoSQL, caches, etc)

A passion for building RESTful web services

Commitment to high quality code and architecture

Desire to work in a fast-paced agile environment

A desire to be challenged and create something new

Extras that Will Give you an Edge

You have experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS)

You're familiar with tools like Spring, Git, and Gradle

You have worked with large data sets

You've solved scalability challenges before

content:

New Engen is seeking a Senior Automation Engineer to work with our engineering teams to build infrastructure and tooling. You will be working with AWS Services, our network, various tools and cloud providers to build reliable infrastructure for fast-growing teams. You will be helping to provide platform tools and infrastructure to enable engineers to build, maintain, monitor and troubleshoot services. Along with the other team members, you will be enabling others to manage and use infrastructure easily and swiftly to reach their specific goals.

We'd love to hear from you if

You are passionate about new technology 

You enjoy crafting and implementing cloud infrastructure to enable teams to easily build out applications

You can quickly learn and integrate with new tools and technologies

You excel with the knowledge and ability to administer Unix/Linux based operating systems

You are comfortable collaborating with people inside and outside our organization 

You love working with complex multi-tier and distributed systems 

You have dedication to your customers and want to make a difference

You do not have an ego and enjoy working on a team 

Qualifications

AWS Certification or equivalent experience

title: Data Engineering Team Lead
content:
Our mission is to deliver high-quality primary care that is accessible, convenient and affordable for all. Every single day you’ll be working on challenging problems with exceptional people to profoundly transform primary care and improve people’s quality of life.

Your Role and Impact

As Data Engineering Team Lead, you’ll design and implement systems to analyze large amounts of data, discover and solve real world problems and define metrics. You’ll be an integral part of creating a better experience for our patients, clinical operators and doctors. The data engineering team at 98point6 is central to empowering our business in data-informed decision making. In this role you will be responsible for architecting, operating and maintaining our data warehouse and ETL platform as we continue to grow.

Responsibilities:

Mentor and collaborate with a diverse group of software and data engineers at all levels

Participate in data engineering work stream including design, architect, implement and support datasets that provide structured and timely access to actionable information about all aspects of our business

Own quality, efficiency, availability and performance for the ETL platform and data warehouse including defining metrics and objectives plus working with business customers and team to ensure they are met

Conduct research and investigation to deep-dive on key technical topics and stay educated on the state-of-the-art

Proactively evolve and share data engineering best practices across the engineering team

Develop expertise in the security implications of data warehouse and ETL platform work

Define and curate the process by which security reviews occur through the course of active development

Qualifications:

3+ years experience as a senior data engineer or lead data engineer

5+ years development experience with SQL for data warehousing or analytics applications, creating and managing data tables and optimizing queries

5+ years experience coding or scripting for automation or ETL processes in Java, Python or a similar language

Experience supporting Tableau workbook development and distribution through work on data warehouse and ETL platform

Proficient written and oral communication skills, including collaboration with cross-functional teams (including technical and business)

title: VP Engineering
content:
Our mission is to deliver high-quality primary care that is accessible, convenient and affordable for all. Every single day you’ll be working on challenging problems with exceptional people to profoundly transform primary care and improve people’s quality of life.


Your Role and Impact


You’ll lead a team of software development, mobile and quality assurance engineers responsible for implementing and operating all aspects of 98point6’s patient experience. From patient acquisition to the visit and post-visit experience, you will partner with cross-functional product, clinical and user experience teams to build out our patient-facing native and web apps. You and your team will bring our product designs to life as high quality and reliable mobile applications with beautiful user interfaces.

This is an opportunity to change the way primary care is delivered worldwide, increasing access while dramatically lowering costs.


Responsibilities

Work closely with your peer in Product Management to make informed trade-offs on prioritization of feature and sustaining work

Build and promote a culture of Operational Excellence to meet a high bar for the quality and availability of our patient applications

Maintain a culture of security through best practices, review and validation processes to protect our patients’ health information

Effectively apply our quality assurance capability to deliver high quality implementations on time

Deliver transparency to your stakeholders on implementation, delivery, and operational excellence

Collaborate with Machine Learning experts to integrate our automation capabilities

Collaborate with UX research for continuous learning around the patient experience

Manage, hire, and develop a team of software engineers and scale for future growth

Achieve goals for Net Promoter Score and other KPIs related to patient experience


Requirements


10+ years of experience building consumer-facing products that have scaled to millions of users across web and native mobile

5+ years experience building and managing a team of 15 or more engineers at all levels of seniority

Experience working with products that apply machine learning or predictive analytics

Ability to thrive in a fast-moving, iterative environment

Capable of driving product enhancement initiatives from conception to launch

A passion to positively impact the availability, cost and patient experience of primary healthcare

Creates and delivers efficient process without compromising quality or service standards

Keen ability to mentor, develop and motivate team across a variety of dimensions

Outstanding communication and presentation skills

Bachelor's in computer science or a related field required, with a master’s or MBA preferred

title: DevOps Engineer
content:
We are looking for a seasoned DevOps Engineer to support MediaAlpha's ad serving infrastructure hosted on AWS. The DevOps Engineer will process and be responsible for design and implementation of applications build, release, deployment, and configuration activities. Other responsibilities include working with internal business partners and engineering team to gather requirements, architecting, implementing/updating solutions, building and executing test plans, performing quality reviews, managing operations, and fixing operational issues. The engineer must be able to adjust to constant business changes including new requirements, evolving goals and strategies, and emerging technologies. The engineer must be able to interact, develop and communicate collaboratively at the highest level with internal stakeholders and external clients and partners at all levels of a professional organization.
Responsibilities

In this role, you will be developing and maintaining the infrastructure of our AWS cloud service alongside a team of other engineers to provide high availability and cost-conscious solutions for MediaAlpha's ad serving platform and Exchange management system.

You will be maintaining and enhancing the build and deployment workflows and processes for MediaAlpha's applications.

You will be writing and managing scripts for various build and installation procedures.

You will work with a team of developers to accomplish daily tasks, ensure code management and builds following existing guidelines, and schedule releases.


Basic Qualifications

B.S. in Computer Science or a related field.

5 or more years experience with Linux and using Linux tools.

2 or more years experience with Amazon Web Services (e. g. EC2, Management Console, CloudWatch, VPC, RDS, Route53, Application/Elastic Load Balancing, ElastiCache, S3).

Experience with Shell scripting/programming (e. g. Bash, PowerShell, Python, Perl).

Experience with revision control systems (e. g. Perforce, Git/GitHub).

Experience with software build and release.

Must be able to demonstrate ability to analyze and interpret complex problems and processes, identify and understand requirements, and develop alternate solutions.

Strong troubleshooting and problem solving skills. Experience with designing, developing, testing, and deploying applications/systems using proven or emerging technologies in a variety of technologies and environments.

A self-starter, comfortable with ambiguity and ability to problem solve, while paying careful attention to detail.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience in automation tools and workflow scripting.

Experience in implementation of workflow procedures and policies.

Familiarity with Jira/Atlassian plugin development.

Experience managing Amazon RDS instances running MySQL.

Experience with Apache/mod_perl (LAMP Stack).

Experience with Amazon Linux/CentOS/Fedora.

Experience with networking (e. g. TCP/IP Stack, IPv4, IPv6, Subnetting).

Experience in relational database architecture and perform SQL queries.

title: Sr. Data Engineer/Scientist
content: We are looking for a seasoned, result-driven, analytical and creative Data Engineer/Scientist to join our technology team. This individual should be an innovative problem solver, self-motivated and highly organized with prior experience building and deploying predictive models that can make real-time low-latency predictions.

As a Sr. Data Engineer/Scientist at MediaAlpha, you will take part in all aspects of the software development lifecycle. This includes working with stakeholders in defining the problems, identifying possible solutions, and implementing and iterating through solutions. You will get to run statistical analysis on large data sets, and prepare and deploy predictive models at scale. The ideal candidate will enjoy designing, problem solving and implementing production-ready solutions that process and analyze hundreds of thousands of ad transactions a day.

Own the full development lifecycle of implementing several high-performance real-time predictive engines that enable ad serving decisioning from data management to model training and evaluation to deployment and monitoring.
Develop robust and scalable code to analyze ad performance data for optimization.
Support and lead specific ad-hoc projects across our five product verticals.
Work within a Perl development environment on a Linux platform.
Be part of a team that maintains and supports our live MediaAlpha Exchange platform.
Experience implementing statistical models, machine learning, and analysis (Prediction, Classification, Clustering, time series forecasting, regression models, etc.) using R or Python.
Working knowledge of relational data modeling and SQL.
Strong programming skills including software engineering methodologies and best practices. Experience with Perl a plus.
Experience with Hadoop v2, MapReduce, HDFS.
Ability to articulate and communicate clearly, concisely, and thoughtfully.
Ability to handle-multiple and simultaneous tasks while meeting aggressive deadlines.
A self-starter, comfortable with ambiguity and ability to problem solve, while paying careful attention to detail.
Experience working with engineers and non-technical stakeholders.
Be a champion of instilling excellence in coding and quality into the team and culture.
B.S. required, preferably in a technical discipline (e.g., computer science).
Highly competitive salary and bonus program participation.
High quality health and dental care plans with no employee contributions and zero deductibles (in network). Flexible spending account.
Generous employee perks (e.g., mobile phone program, gym membership).

title: Senior Software Engineer - Java platform
content:
ServiceNow is the leading enterprise cloud. Our SaaS solutions generate revenue of ~$2B annually, and we are still growing over 30% YOY. We are looking for strong developers to help us build out an early stage, fast growing product.

With a service-orientation toward the activities, tasks and processes that make up day-to-day work life, we help the modern enterprise operate faster and be more scalable than ever before. 

We’re disruptive.  We work hard but try not to take ourselves too seriously.  We are highly adaptable and constantly evolving.  We are passionate about our product, and we live for our customers.  We have high expectations and a career at ServiceNow means challenging yourself to always be better. 

What you get to do in this role:

Developing high quality applications leveraging the industry leading ServiceNow platform.

Working in a Scrum-based Agile development process that is light on documentation and meetings and heavy on coding.

Designing and implement software that is simple, intuitive and easy to use that will allow customers to extend and customize the functionality to meet their specific business needs.

Play a key role in the design and implementation of new products and features while also enhancing the existing product suite.

Translate requirements and mock-ups into fully functional features by working closely with business and product owners, and creative designers.

Collaborate with product managers and user experience designers to deliver delightful experiences.

Build rich, modern web and mobile web experiences that are accessible, progressive and responsive.

In order to be successful in this role, we need someone who has:

Over 5 years of experience designing and building scalable reusable products/components

Passion for software development, debugging and problem-solving.  We are seeking engineers who want to work across technologies and development environments/languages

Strong knowledge of Java, REST, XML, HTML and CSS

Strong problem-solving, debugging skills and an aptitude for learning new technologies

Solid understanding of data modeling and databases (MySQL preferred)

Deep understanding of data structures, algorithms, object-oriented design, design patterns, and performance/scale considerations

Strong written and verbal communication

Must be comfortable with juggling multiple priorities with the ability to manage time effectively

Lead and mentor less experienced developers

Bachelor’s/master’s degree in Computer Science or related discipline 

It would be even better if you have:

Experience with creating enterprise software in the one of the application domains in which ServiceNow competes

Experience developing on the ServiceNow platform and API’s

Ability to create high performance, scalable systems

We provide competitive compensation, generous benefits and a professional atmosphere. This is a very collaborative and inclusive work environment where individuals strong on aptitude and attitude will have an opportunity to grow their professional careers through working with some of the most advanced technology and talented developers in the business.

San Francisco applicants: Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, gender identity, or veteran status.  for assistance.

title: Hardware Test Manager
content:
ServiceNow, The Enterprise IT Cloud Company, is the industry-leading cloud platform provider for building enterprise applications.  We are redefining markets and changing the perception of enterprise software.  Our cloud platform allows enterprise IT to bring together business strategy, application design and operations in a powerfully simple solution.

To sustain our explosive growth, we are looking for drivers—people who thrive on responsibility and live for the next big challenge.  We seek to employ the brightest and most forward-thinking talent on the planet; we're looking for professionals who aren't content with the status quo. People who are more interested in how things could become.  Accelerate your career and succeed in an environment where you can make an impact daily.  We invite you to join in to stand out.


Responsibilities

As the Hardware Test Manager you will own our server and storage test programs. Your team of Hardware Test Engineers will continuously evaluate new hardware solutions and configurations, informing next-gen designs that power the global ServiceNow cloud. Do you enjoy wringing every drop of performance out of a piece of hardware? Or stressing it until it breaks, then determining precisely how and why? If so we’d love to hear from you.

In this role you will:

Manage a small, focused team operating out of a brand new test lab at our Kirkland office.

Strive for efficiency and efficacy in in test design, data gathering, data analysis and reporting. Ensure your team is always delivering complete and trustworthy results before moving on to the next project.

Write and report on the hardware test schedule, adjusting as necessary when new projects warrant prioritization.

Drive ongoing testing of new kernel, firmware and BIOS releases, assessing and communicating the hardware performance implications of rolling them out at scale.

Directly work with Hardware Architects who determine which bleeding-edge technology to test next, often prior to general availability.

Cultivate and maintain strong direct relationships with hardware manufacturers’ engineering organizations.

Work closely with development teams to understand impacts of new software platform enhancements on the hardware stack.

Continuously improve the breadth and depth of test programs, incorporating any new tools or technologies that are suitable to task.

Desired Skills

10+ years profiling and evaluating any combination of Linux server performance, database performance, and storage performance.

3+ years managing a team in an engineering organization.

Experience with one or more structured programming languages (shell, python, C, etc.) required.

Experience with industry standard benchmarking methods and tools required.

Demonstrated ability to successfully lead complex projects.

Excellent communication & skills, conflict management, and interpersonal skills required. Must be able to communicate at a level appropriate to the audience.

Experience with diverse HA storage solutuions (SAN, NAS, NVMeoF, Object) desired.

Bachelor or equivalent experience in Computer Information Systems (CIS), Management Information Systems (MIS), or Computer Science (CS) or related field. Masters preferred.

We provide competitive compensation, generous benefits and a relaxed but professional atmosphere. This is a very collaborative and inclusive work environment where individuals strong on aptitude and attitude will have an opportunity to grow their professional careers through working with some of the most advanced technology and talented engineers in the business.

title: Software Engineering Internship (Summer 2020)
content: Imagine your work day dominated less by emails and spreadsheets and more time given back to you to do your actual job. At ServiceNow, we are making work life more life-like and changing the way the biggest companies in the world are doing business.

Our technology helps structure and automate the flow of work to streamline the delivery of services across the modern enterprise so that individuals can have everything they need within their fingertips, just like they do in real life.
has to say about working at ServiceNow:

“Work within a scrum team, develop code within a corporate setting, use Git to manage source code, how to read through proprietary documentation to learn about our proprietary APIs and code base, work with the company politics to share my views on the design, implementation, and management of the ServiceNow platform”.
“The positive vibes in my team, and the very detailed code reviews given by my mentor and colleagues, which helped me learned a lot”.
“Challenging projects that taught them skills in software development and have a concrete impact on the company”.
“I was really glad to have important work directed my way rather than a bunch of busywork and leftover tasks”.
“Face-to-face exposure to senior execs and having candid conversations to learn about the company, helpful team, autonomy to learn and drive my own projects”.
“I've formed relationship during the summer that I know I will maintain throughout life. Putting yourself out there and letting your ambition shine results in the most rewarding experiences”.
Code high-volume software using primarily C++ and Java
Create web applications using primarily PHP
Implement web interfaces using XHTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Build report interfaces and data feeds
Actively enrolled in an accredited university as a full-time student, pursuing a degree (Bachelors or Masters) in Computer Science or a related field
Experience in C++, Java, Perl, PHP, or Python
High levels of creativity and quick problem-solving capabilities
Ability to obtain and maintain work authorization in the country of employment in 2018

content:
ServiceNow is changing the way people work. With a service-orientation toward the activities, tasks and processes that make up day-to-day work life, we help the modern enterprise operate faster and be more scalable than ever before. 

We’re disruptive.  We work hard but try not to take ourselves too seriously.  We are highly adaptable and constantly evolving.  We are passionate about our product, and we live for our customers.  We have high expectations and a career at ServiceNow means challenging yourself to always be better.
