title: Sr. Software Development Engineer
content: ServiceNow, The Enterprise IT Cloud Company, is the industry-leading cloud platform provider for building enterprise applications.  We are redefining markets and changing the perception of enterprise software.  Our cloud platform allows enterprise IT to bring together business strategy, application design and operations in a powerfully simple solution.

To sustain our explosive growth, we are looking for drivers—people who thrive on responsibility and live for the next big challenge.  We seek to employ the brightest and most forward-thinking talent on the planet; we're looking for professionals who aren't content with the status quo—people who are more interested in how things could become.  Accelerate your career and succeed in an environment where you can make an impact daily.  We invite you to join in to stand out.
Why work here? The people. The product. The future.

As a company, we are growing at a record-breaking speed but still maintain the startup mentality upon which we were founded. We value pure innovation and encourage creativity and collaboration. We are a high performance culture, challenging even the brightest thinkers to execute their ideas and push themselves to the next level. We provide an energetic and inclusive work environment where individuals with the right aptitude and attitude will excel. We play hard, but we work even harder. Think you have what it takes? You are invited to be part of the success – join our team of dedicated professionals and grow your career with us!

We're looking for experienced, passionate, driven software developers who can help us build scalable and reliable cloud computing solutions to support the rapid growth of our SaaS products. As a Software Development Engineer, you will work on solving tough technical challenges in a high energy, startup like environment with experienced industry leaders and with a highly collaborative team.

The Operational Intelligence team applies machine learning and mathematical approaches to solving IT operations management. Our software solutions allows IT to effectively manage Infrastructure Assets, Business Services lifecycle, reduce costs, and improve operational performance and efficiency.

title: Senior Software Engineer
content:
ServiceNow has been named as the most innovative company in the world by Forbes. We have also been ranked #3 on Fortune Future 50. We are the leading enterprise cloud. Our SaaS solutions generate revenue of ~$2B annually, and we are still growing over 30% YOY. We are looking for strong developers to help us build out an early stage, fast growing product.

With a service-orientation toward the activities, tasks and processes that make up day-to-day work life, we help the modern enterprise operate faster and be more scalable than ever before. 

We’re disruptive.  We work hard but try not to take ourselves too seriously.  We are highly adaptable and constantly evolving.  We are passionate about our product, and we live for our customers.  We have high expectations and a career at ServiceNow means challenging yourself to always be better. 

What you get to do in this role:

Developing high quality applications leveraging the industry leading ServiceNow platform.

Working in a Scrum-based Agile development process that is light on documentation and meetings and heavy on coding.

Designing and implement software that is simple, intuitive and easy to use that will allow customers to extend and customize the functionality to meet their specific business needs.

Play a key role in the design and implementation of new products and features while also enhancing the existing product suite.

Translate requirements and mock-ups into fully functional features by working closely with business and product owners, and creative designers.

Collaborate with product managers and user experience designers to deliver delightful experiences.

Build rich, modern web and mobile web experiences that are accessible, progressive and responsive.

In order to be successful in this role, we need someone who has:

Over 5 years of experience designing and building scalable reusable products/components

Passion for software development, debugging and problem-solving.  We are seeking engineers who want to work across technologies and development environments/languages

Strong knowledge of Java, REST, XML, HTML and CSS

Strong problem-solving, debugging skills and an aptitude for learning new technologies

Solid understanding of data modeling and databases (MySQL preferred)

Deep understanding of data structures, algorithms, object-oriented design, design patterns, and performance/scale considerations

Strong written and verbal communication

Must be comfortable with juggling multiple priorities with the ability to manage time effectively

Lead and mentor less experienced developers

Bachelor’s/master’s degree in Computer Science or related discipline 

It would be even better if you have:

Experience with creating enterprise software in the one of the application domains in which ServiceNow competes

Experience developing on the ServiceNow platform and API’s

Ability to create high performance, scalable systems 

We provide competitive compensation, generous benefits and a professional atmosphere. This is a very collaborative and inclusive work environment where individuals strong on aptitude and attitude will have an opportunity to grow their professional careers through working with some of the most advanced technology and talented developers in the business.

title: Senior Staff Software Development Engineer
content:
Description


Job Title: Senior Staff Software Development Engineer
Locations: San Diego, CA or Kirkland, WA

Company

Work matters. It’s where we spend a third of our lives. And the workplace of the future is going to be a great place. We’re dedicated to bringing that to life for people everywhere. That’s why we put people at the heart of everything we do. 

People matter. Our people have a passion for learning, building, and innovating. Whether you’re an engineer, a sales professional, a finance professional, or anything in-between, our roles aim to provide each person with meaningful impact and plenty of space to grow.

The Service Engineering Core team is responsible for maintaining and evolving the command and control system that manages automations of our hosted solutions.

title: Data Scientist - Algorithms, Support Products
content:
Airbnb has become a global platform that connects travelers and hosts from over 34,000 cities. At the backbone of this is a world class customer support team and the innovative technology that enables them. We believe that our service will be a major differentiator and drive Airbnb’s global success and growth. 

The Support Products team is building a technology platform that supports Airbnb as it scales, delivering an exceptional level of customer service while also improving efficiency for customer service agents. Machine learning is key to this vision.

We are seeking a senior data scientist to join our growing Seattle team leveraging machine learning to transform Airbnb support. In addition to collaborating with engineers, designers, product managers, and other data scientists, you will leverage Airbnb’s rich and unique data and state-of-art machine learning infrastructure. 

We have an incredible team of data scientists, our work is highly sought-after, and our impact on the business is tremendous. If you have a proven background in this field and are excited to help build Airbnb’s community, we want to hear from you.

Some projects that you could work on:

Predicting when a customer might have an issue and proactively providing self-solve options.

Conversational assistant (Chatbot) to solve simple cases with minimal human intervention, gather relevant information, and escalate to human agents when necessary.

Smart Customer Support Agent Tools or automated resolution tools to enable efficient and consistent resolution of users’ help requests

Route customer issues to the right customer service agent, matching supply and demand to minimize customer wait times.

Capacity planning models to staff agents with time varying demand and variable service time to minimize wait time in the most cost efficient way.

Some examples of traits that we value: 

Advanced degree in a quantitative field 

3+ years in industry experience developing machine learning models at scale from inception to business impact.

Deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques, experience with natural language processing preferred.

Strong programming skills (Python or R preferred).

Data analytics and data engineering skills (i.e. Hive, Presto, Spark).

Proven ability to tailor machine learning solutions to business problems in a cross functional team.

Experience with distributed machine learning and computing framework (i.e. Spark) preferred.

Experience productionizing machine learning models is a plus.

Benefits

Stock

$2,000 yearly employee travel coupon

Competitive salary

Paid time off 

Medical, dental, & vision insurance

Life & disability coverage

401K

Flexible Spending Accounts

Apple equipment

Daily breakfast, lunch, and dinner

title: Engineering Manager, Tax Platform
content:
Airbnb’s mission is to create a world where people can Belong Anywhere. As we grow to achieve that mission, we’re looking to add highly technical, hands-on, and mission-driven Engineering Managers to lead our engineering efforts.

The Tax Platform team builds critical path service endpoints that are responsible for processing low latency, rules-based calculations with high QPS volumes (tens of thousands of requests per second). The team also works closely with our Payments, Tax and Finance teams to create applications for Tax Calculation, Remittance, Reporting, and User Data Collection. These tax products are a key part of Airbnb’s growth strategy as we continue to create new products in thousands of global jurisdictions. 

As an Engineering Manager on the Tax Platform team you’ll be responsible for leading our technical vision and strategy while championing sustainable processes that create growth opportunities for your team members. 

Responsibilities:

Define technical vision and roadmap while advocating strong engineering principles

Establish processes for collaboration and code quality to help the team operate efficiently

Invest in team members’ career growth as their coach and advocate, helping them advance in their careers

Contribute to engineering-wide initiatives as a member of Airbnb's engineering management team

Recruit and hire talented software engineers in collaboration with Airbnb’s recruiting team

Foster team health to create a high-trust and high-performance environment.

We value Engineering Managers who have:

4+ years of hands-on technical management experience

8+ years of relevant engineering work experience

Experience building high throughput, fault tolerant systems with attention paid to testability and maintainability

Strong coding abilities and experience with architectural patterns of large, high-scale applications

Experience with Agile development methodologies

Actively coached and mentored team members in their careers

* Bonus: Proficiency with Ruby on Rails & Java

* Bonus: Experience with tax engines

Benefits:

Stock

Competitive salaries

Quarterly employee travel coupon

Paid time off

Medical, dental, & vision insurance

Life insurance and disability benefits

Fitness discounts

401K

Flexible Spending Accounts

Apple equipment

Commuter subsidies

Community involvement (4 hours per month to give back to the community)

Company sponsored tech talks and happy hours

Breakfast, lunch, and dinner

Much more...

title: M&A Security Engineer
content:
Airbnb is built on trust. Our security team works hard to improve the security of our platform that enables millions of users to explore the world.

We are looking for people who want to make the Airbnb platform safer for millions of users around the world. We’d love to talk to you if you’re a talented individual who is passionate about finding security weaknesses and crafting scalable and usable solutions. We are enablers who make it easier for engineers to create secure features, not blockers. This is a ‘Mergers and Acquisitions’ (M&A) role which will guide and help grow the security posture of companies as they are acquired. If that mission sounds exciting to you, please reach out!

What are some examples of M&A-related security work at Airbnb?

Guide and help grow the security posture of acquired companies.

Advise on all security engineering related issues, both pre and post-acquisition, with an eye to minimizing risk and integrating systems.

Work to identify areas of security risk, build a roadmap for addressing that risk, and work with the acquisition engineering team to see that through to completion. (Note: There may be multiple acquisitions in different phases of integration at any given time.)

Proactively find ways to improve defense-in-depth.

Help engineers design more secure systems via design input, code review, and penetration testing.

Solve security risks with context-appropriate solutions.

The following experience is relevant to us:

Strong understanding of web application security.

Experience on an internal application security team or, better yet, M&A-specific experience.

Familiarity with adapting modern security tooling to a variety of technology stacks.

Some development experience, ideally with Ruby on Rails and/or Java.

Pentesting, threat modeling, and architecture review experience.

Strong communication skills. (Did you patiently train your relatives and friends how to use Chrome and enable click to play? Awesome, me too.)

4+ years experience in security engineering, technical M&A work, or a related discipline.

Benefits:

Stock

Competitive salaries

Quarterly employee travel coupon

Paid time off

Medical, dental, & vision insurance

Life insurance and disability benefits

Fitness discounts

401K

Flexible Spending Accounts

Commuter subsidies

Community involvement (4 hours per month to give back to the community)

Company sponsored tech talks and happy hours

Much more...

title: Software Engineer, Intern 2020
content:
At Airbnb, we use technology to create human connection all around the world. Our engineering teams see big challenges as opportunities to craft beautiful and scalable solutions that inspire technical innovation both in our company and across the tech and travel industries as a whole. As an engineering intern at Airbnb, you’ll be an integral part of our team where you will face our company’s most ambitious goals. We’ll provide the support, mentorship, fun, and real world experience needed to accelerate your learning and make a real impact on our product; you will write and ship projects to develop new features on our platform from scratch, strengthen our infrastructure, and delight our community of guests and hosts.

What are examples of work that Software Engineering Interns have done at Airbnb?

We’ve created the backend and UI for creating Airbnb gift cards, allowing gift cards to be personalized to specific guests

We built out new functionalities for Airbnb reviews, allowing users to search, summarize, and distill reviews of our listings into succinct and useful highlights

We’ve developed a new, more intuitive interface for message threads to help hosts manage their conversations with guests more easily and efficiently

The following experience is relevant to us:

Strong CS fundamentals gained through current pursuit of Bachelor’s, Master's, or PhD degree in computer science, math or related discipline

Experience using Java, Scala, Ruby and/or Ruby on Rails

Benefits

There are lots of benefits to interning at Airbnb! Some of our interns’ favorites include:

Competitive pay, a generous housing bonus, and Paid Time Off

Quarterly employee travel coupons so you can explore Airbnb’s incredible listings

Daily breakfast, lunch, and dinner inspired by the local cuisine of listings from around the world

Company-sponsored tech talks and social events

Much more...

title: Data Scientist - Inference, Trust
content:
Airbnb has become a global platform that connects travelers and hosts from over 81,000 cities. As such, experimentation is core to our growing business. We want to take a scientific approach to decision-making through careful hypothesis generation and testing and drive actions/refine strategies through insights from experimental analysis.

Our inference data scientists understand the complications of running experiments in a two-sided marketplace, power analysis and stopping criteria, and statistical models to improve power/significance. Another interesting problem space is understanding what to do when we are unable to conduct experiments. How do we understand the impact of something new?

We have a strong team of Data Scientists, our work is highly sought-after, and our impact on the business is tremendous. If you have a proven background in this field and are excited to help build Airbnb’s community, we want to hear from you.

About Trust: Profile Data Science

We work on data products to enhance trust and safety on Airbnb’s platform and also offline. How do we let anyone (whether an individual, team, or business) accurately represent themselves online and easily manage their account preferences? How can we bridge a person’s online reputation with their offline behavior in a way that both grows the business and builds a more inclusive community? Join us if you want to uplevel your skills while solving hard problems with a group of talented people in a highly collaborative environment!

Responsibilities

Design experiments to understand the impact of user profile changes in complex and interlocking parts of the Airbnb action flows

Maintain the right balance between speed to market and scientific rigor when designing solutions

Define and evaluate key metrics and understand what moves them and why

Investigate challenging questions around user experience to understand the voice of our users at scale

Identify critical business problems and create analytical and modeling solutions to inform business decisions with compelling data stories

Own conceptualizing, developing, and maintaining dashboards and visualizations

Partner with Engineering to improve data source quality

Empower the team to answer data questions quickly and easily by building high-quality ground truth data sets

Preferred Qualifications

5+ years industry experience or 2+ years with a Ph.D. in a scientific or quantitative field

Advanced proficiency in SQL and extensive experience with Python or R

Able to identify complex business problems and provide sound experimental approaches to testing hypotheses

Able to communicate clearly and effectively to cross-functional partners of varying technical levels

Able to define relevant metrics that can guide and influence stakeholders to the appropriate and accurate insights

Experience with designing and evaluating experiments in two-sided marketplaces (a plus)

Experience with large-scale data modeling and data set creation (a plus)

Experience building (or willing to learn how to build) data pipelines using Airflow (a plus) 

Benefits

Stock

$2,000 yearly employee travel coupon

Competitive salary

Paid time off 

Medical, dental, & vision insurance

Life & disability coverage

401K

Flexible Spending Accounts

Apple equipment

Daily breakfast, lunch, and dinner

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status

title: Tier and Business Unit Analytics Manager
content:
Founded in 2008, Airbnb’s mission is to create a world where people can belong through healthy travel that is local, authentic, diverse, inclusive and sustainable. Airbnb uniquely leverages technology to economically empower millions of people around the world to unlock and monetize their spaces, passions and talents to become hospitality entrepreneurs. Airbnb’s accommodation marketplace provides access to 5+ million unique places to stay in more than 81,000 cities and 191 countries. With Experiences, Airbnb offers unprecedented access to local communities and interests through 15,000 unique, handcrafted activities run by hosts across 1,000+ cities around the world. Airbnb's people-to-people platform benefits all its stakeholders, including hosts, guests, employees and the communities in which it operates. 


In order to build the world's most loved travel company, we need the world's most interesting and talented people. Are you one of them? If so, we want to talk to you!



Role

The role of analytics manager is accountable for meeting the needs of their key stakeholder in their selected area of focus ensuring the function has the required analytics and insights to achieve their tactical and strategic goals. 

Responsibilities 

Manage analytics and insights needs of global and regional safety/speciality operational service delivery teams while improving the status-quo to meet and exceed targets.

Collaborate and work with Safety/Regional Directors and Service Ops teams.

Set and balance multiple priorities and think strategically for measurable outcomes.

Contribute to and influence team strategy while being heavily focussed on execution.

Focus on developing team members and ensuring overall team objectives are met.

Work with direct reports, teammates, stakeholders and cross-functional partners.

Focus on allocation, completion and quality of team work while guiding, coaching and advising on best practices.

Ability to tailor insights to present clearly to audiences from varied backgrounds

Qualifications

1-2 yrs of prior management or mentoring experience

Master’s or Bachelor's degree in a relevant field of study

5+ years top tier analyst or consulting experience in business intelligence or analytics

Experience with customer service or customer operations analytics a huge plus

Hands-on experience with one or more language(s) used for querying (e.g. SQL)

Experience with Big Data/ Predictive Analytics platforms/languages like Hive, Python, R

Experience with Tableau or similar BI platform to develop reports and dashboards

Hands-on to get things done as needed and ability to work without continual guidance

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

title: iOS Software Engineer, Trust (Seattle)
content:
What is Trust at Airbnb?

Over two million people stay on Airbnb every night and the Trust Engineering team keeps our hosts and guests safe and supported throughout the entire Airbnb experience.

As part of the Trust Engineering team you will be in charge of designing and building scalable and robust systems to detect and mitigate fraud across our entire platform. You will be deeply involved in the technical details of building highly available and real-time risk detection services in close collaboration with product, data science and operations teams to understand ever evolving attack vectors and to keep Airbnb a safe and trusted community.

There are still many unsolved problems to tackle in both online and offline risk, and we're looking for talented engineers to solve these challenges with us.

What is iOS Engineer on Trust at Airbnb?

Millions of iOS users engage with the Airbnb app every day. As an iOS engineer on Trust, your mission is to build experiences that create a feeling of trust and safety while using Airbnb. You are critical to detecting and preventing fraud, as well as protecting users on the iOS platform. We are looking for engineers to tackle projects with large scope, drive significant business impact, and be stewards of our app for years to come.

If you are interested in product development, we’re looking for product-aware engineers who are thoughtful, creative, and passionate about building the best possible user experience. We’re looking for someone who is not only well-versed in iOS development, but also has strong UX/product sensibilities and enjoys working closely with designers, product managers, and data scientists.

If you’re interested in mobile infrastructure, we’re looking for engineers who love collaborating via code reviews and discussions about system architecture. We’re looking for someone who is motivated to improve their teammates’ productivity by building agility tools and shared frameworks.

Projects:

We created an extensible framework called Airlock that can pause a user’s current action and ask for self-serve verification. Airlock is triggered when the system detects risky user behavior, and can happen anywhere inside Airbnb’s iOS app. 

We built a sophisticated identity verification system that provides identity confidence for Airbnb while minimizing the friction on good users.

We are exploring the use of on-device machine learning to detect if a user is uploading valid and high quality media.

We build experiences that provide in-app education to warn and protect users from malicious behavior such as phishing, identity theft, and more.

Minimum Requirements:

2+ years industry experience

Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degree, preferably in CS, or equivalent experience

Experience shipping one or more Swift or Objective-C iOS apps, ideally currently available in the App Store.

Personal projects that show an aptitude for technical excellence and product sense.

Ability to work in areas outside of your usual comfort zone and show motivation for personal growth.

Interest in innovations within the mobile industry.

Benefits:

Stock

Competitive salaries

Quarterly employee travel coupon

Paid time off

Medical, dental, & vision insurance

Life insurance and disability benefits

Fitness discounts

401K

Flexible Spending Accounts

Apple equipment

Commuter subsidies

Community involvement (4 hours per month to give back to the community)

Company sponsored tech talks and happy hours

Breakfast, lunch, and dinner

Much more...

title: Security Engineer
content:
Airbnb is built on trust. Our security team works hard to improve the security of our platform that enables millions of users to explore the world.

We are looking for people who want to make the Airbnb platform safer for millions of users around the world. We’d love to talk to you if you’re a talented individual who is passionate about finding security weaknesses and crafting scalable and usable solutions. We are enablers who make it easier for engineers to create secure features, not blockers. This is a generalist role for an experienced candidate. If our mission sounds exciting to you, please reach out!

What are some examples of application security work at Airbnb?

Broad, generalist scope for an experienced candidate.

Design and creation of tools and frameworks that engineers (love to) use and that improve security. (And maybe open-sourcing them someday?)

Working to identify unaddressed areas of security weakness and driving cleverly engineered, scalable solutions that improve our defense-in-depth.

Improving data security through use of encryption/key management, segregation, or other techniques.

Helping other engineers design more secure systems via design input and code review.

Solving security risks with new, organic solutions.

The following experience is relevant to us:

Significant experience on an internal application security team

Strong understanding of web or mobile application security

Experience as a developer, ideally with Ruby on Rails and Java

Pentesting, threat modeling, and architecture review experience

Strong communication skills (Did you patiently train your relatives and friends how to use Chrome and enable click to play? Awesome, me too.)

5+ years experience in security engineering, or a related discipline

title: Data Science Manager, Algorithms
content:
Airbnb has become a global platform that connects travelers and hosts from over 34,000 cities. At the backbone of this is a world class customer support team and the innovative technology that enables them. We believe that our service will be a major differentiator and drive Airbnb’s global success and growth. 

The Support Products team is building a technology platform that supports Airbnb as it scales, delivering an exceptional level of customer service while also improving efficiency and the customer service agent experience. Machine learning is key to this vision.

We are seeking a Data Science Manager to work out of our growing Seattle office to lead a strong team of data scientists to drive strategy for using machine learning to transform Airbnb support. In addition to collaborating with engineers, designers and product managers, you will leverage Airbnb’s rich and unique data and state-of-art machine learning infrastructure. 

We have an incredible team of data scientists, our work is highly sought-after, and our impact on the business is tremendous. If you have a proven background in this field and are excited to help build Airbnb’s community, we want to hear from you.

Some projects that you would lead:

Predicting when a customer might have an issue and proactively providing self-solve options.

Conversational assistant (Chatbot) to solve simple cases with minimal human intervention, gather relevant information, and escalate to human agents when necessary.

Smart Customer Support Agent Tools or automated resolution tools to enable efficient and consistent resolution of users’ help requests

Route customer issues to the right customer service agent, matching supply and demand to minimize customer wait times.

Capacity planning models to staff agents with time varying demand and variable service time to achieve near zero wait time

Some examples of traits that we value: 

PhD or equivalent work experience in a quantitative field preferred

5+ years in industry, customer service experience preferred

3+ years of mentorship and management experience

Ability to write and mentor code development in SQL and Python

Ability to partner with a diverse set of stakeholders globally

Strong understanding of statistics and machine learning, natural language processing experience preferred

Intuition for data science best practices, stemming from proven experience

Steadfast focus on creating impactful change 

Benefits

Stock

$2,000 yearly employee travel coupon

Competitive salary

Paid time off

Medical, dental, & vision insurance

Life & disability coverage

401K

Flexible Spending Accounts

Apple equipment

Daily breakfast, lunch, and dinner

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status

title: Data Scientist, Intern 2020
content: To apply to our 2020 internship positions, you must be currently enrolled in an academic program during Summer 2020. We recommend applying only once during the hiring cycle (October-March) for consideration across all data science tracks. Any additional applications you submit will not be considered.
Once you apply, please expect to hear back from our team within the next 4-6 weeks.

Airbnb’s mission is to connect people to unique travel experiences, in more than 34,000 cities and 190 Countries. We are making it possible for hosts to supplement their income while helping visitors from around the world experience neighborhoods and communities outside traditional tourist zones.

Here at Airbnb, we’re big fans of travel. We love thinking about the diversity of experiences our host community offers, and we spend a fair amount of time trying to make sense of the tens of thousands of cities where people are booking trips every night. The tricky thing is, most of us haven’t been to Cuba, so we try to come up with creative ways to help people find the experience they’re looking for in places they may have never been. The data science team works in tandem with product management, engineering, and design teams to solve these types of technical challenges.

As a data science intern at Airbnb, you’ll be an integral part of our cross-functional product teams where you will face our company’s most ambitious goals. We’ll provide the support, mentorship, fun, and real world experience needed to accelerate your learning and make a real impact on our product; you’ll use data to guide decisions and products at scale.

Behind the scenes, Data Science infuses Airbnb’s technology with data and helps us understand the way that we share, comprehend and interact with our global community. At Airbnb, one data science job doesn’t fit all. With 200+ data scientists across our San Francisco, Portland and Seattle offices, the way we allow data scientists to deepen their work here is by placing data scientists and our interns in a specialized data science track.
Analytics (Master’s & PhD Only) - (SF & PDX offices only)

Analytics interns concentrate on using data to tell a story through data analysis, product strategy, product execution and working with decision-making tools. This work includes partnering with leadership to prioritize areas of opportunity to drive growth and quality along with evaluating product and business metrics.
Inference (Master’s & PhD Only) - (SF & SEA offices only)

Inference interns use their statistics skills to improve our decision-making and measure the impact of our work. They help Airbnb measure and interpret the impact of changes, leading to improved decision-making.

Algorithms interns are those with an expertise in machine learning. In this track, they will use Airbnb’s vast data to develop novel approaches to challenging problems through infusing data in our product and processes.
There are lots of benefits to interning at Airbnb! Some of our interns’ favorites include:
Corporate Intern Housing OR Intern Housing Stipend
Company-Sponsored Tech Talks and Intern Social Events

title: Engineering Manager, Payments Operational Tooling
content:
The Payments team at Airbnb works on everything related to settling money in Airbnb’s global marketplace. We build technology that powers Airbnb’s massive daily transaction volume to collect payments from guests and distribute payouts to hosts. Our goal is to make the Payment experience on Airbnb as delightful, magical, intuitive, and easy as possible.

See https://www.airbnb.com/careers/departments/engineering/payments to learn more about the team.

The Seattle-based Payments North team is looking for an Engineering Manager to lead our Payments Operational Tooling team. Payments Operational Tooling is a key investment to enable a world class payments operation across the world. The team builds fullstack infrastructure and application tools that abstract the complexity of our payments system and supports efficient operations for multiple internal teams within Airbnb.

We value Engineering Managers who have:

4+ years of hands-on technical management experience

8+ years of relevant engineering work experience

Strong coding abilities and experience with architectural patterns of large, high-scale applications

Experience with building payments systems

Experience in partnering with other leaders in setting product strategy

Successfully partnered with Product, Data Science, Finance, Legal, and Compliance functions

Experience working with and leading cross site teams

Track record in partnering with recruiting to build incredible engineering teams

Actively coached and mentored team members in their careers

Consistently made culture choices that positively impact all of engineering

Shipped several large scale projects with multiple dependencies across teams

Bonus: Proficiency with Ruby on Rails & Java

Bonus: Experience with tax determination solutions

Our team owns the movement of money across all of AirBnB so we have to hold ourselves to a very high bar:

We are a team of entrepreneurs that are highly autonomous and full stack.

We care about availability, reliability, testability, and solid engineering design.

We keep up with change by evolving as individuals.

Our top priorities change frequently where we constantly pivot towards things that are high impact.

We are adaptive and well-balanced when considering solutions and the spectrum of possibilities.

We recognize that crafting software is a technical exercise mixed into a social exercise and thus communication matters, being proactive matters, and being influential matters.

title: Data Scientist - Algorithms, Trust
content:
Trust is at the foundation of every Airbnb experience and as such we aim to make it the most trusted platform in the world. To achieve such goal, the Data Science team relies on a diverse collection of structured and unstructured data to design, build, and support machine learning models to detect and prevent potential negative experiences and fraud attempts.

As a Data Scientist working on Algorithms, Trust, you will have the opportunity to collaborate with a strong team of engineers, product managers, designers and operation agents to build scalable and robust systems to detect, prevent and mitigate fraud on Airbnb. You will be deeply involved in the technical details of building highly available and real-time risk detection services to understand ever evolving attack vectors and to keep Airbnb a safe and trusted community.

Some of the challenges you will face include:

Building machine learning models to detect high risk activities like account takeovers, fake contents and fraudulent transactions, or high risk entities like fake accounts or stolen cards.

Experimentation of new Airbnb product features to deter and mitigate risk.

Working cross functionally with operations and product teams to define and collect labels for model training, optimize effectiveness of manual review, and build self-satisfiable verifications that scale.

Devising optimization models to make optimal business decisions while minimizing risk

Innovating modeling frameworks in this adversarial setup, e.g., how can models collaboratively surface more risks, or how can models adapt to emerging patterns quickly

Building NLP models to detect spam and inappropriate content on the fly.

Utilizing Deep Learning techniques for advanced feature engineering and model building, e.g., how to model for user behaviors sequences, or how can we detect anomalies effectively.

Here are example traits we value:

Advanced degree in quantitative field.

2+ years industry experience developing machine learning models at scale from inception to business impact. Proven ability to tailor your solutions to business problems in a cross functional team.

Deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinning, such as classification, clustering, optimization, deep neural network and natural language processing. 

Strong programming skill (Python, R preferred). 

Versatility to communicate clearly with both technical and non-technical audiences.

Data analytical and data engineering experiences is a plus (Hive, Presto, Spark preferred). 

Experience productionizing real-time machine learning model is a plus. 

Relevant industry experience is a plus.

Benefits

Stock

$2,000 yearly employee travel coupon

Competitive salary

Paid time off 

Medical, dental, & vision insurance

Life & disability coverage

401K

Flexible Spending Accounts

Apple equipment

Daily breakfast, lunch, and dinner

The Getty Images website serves creative, business and media customers in almost 200 countries and is the first place people turn to discover, purchase and share powerful content from the world's best photographers and videographers.

Getty Images works with over 200,000 contributors and hundreds of image partners to provide comprehensive coverage of more than 130,000 news, sport and entertainment events, impactful creative imagery to communicate any commercial concept and the world's deepest digital archive of historic photography.

Getty Images is the starting point for our customers imagery search. Customers are confident that they are going directly to the best source of content, and that Getty's search engine will surface only the most relevant content to them and have the tools they need to refine and explore creatively.

Our customers will be able to communicate effortlessly with Getty Images, in their quest to find the right imagery. Using text, voice, or visual channels, they will have the ability to describe their content needs creatively and thoroughly. Getty Images' search will eliminate the barrier that exists between a creative art director and a technical researcher.

You have a passion for service design. You are an avid technologist who is fascinated with web services, dev ops and cloud computing. You enjoy the challenge of balancing customer needs, business value, and technical solutions. You flourish in a team environment, collaborating with other engineers and product development to understand business problems and drive technology solutions. Getty Images is an equal opportunity employer and strongly supports diversity in the workplace.
Getty Images is moving the world with images, we provide the world’s most compelling content through our sites

. The service teams create and maintain the API’s and underlying service architecture that power our websites, external API’s and internal operations. Focus on delivery with speed and quality

A hunger to improve and grow as an engineer

title: Senior Web Analytics Engineer
content:
Who You Are:

Getty Images is looking for a Senior Web Analytics Engineer responsible for the engineering, design, implementation, and maintenance of web analytics for our customer-facing sites. This role collaborates with marketing, product development, and other analytics stakeholders to clarify requirements and implement creative analytics solutions to accurately, consistently, and robustly support our business goals.  Business stakeholders will rely on the Senior Web Analytics Engineer to provide precise, real-time data to optimize business outcomes. The ability to leverage industry best practices and modern technology concepts to improve our web and marketing analytics capability are essential.

Your Next Challenge

You will join a modern marketing organization that leverages data and best in breed technologies to deliver integrated marketing strategies and tactics to improve the customer experience and drive measurable returns for the business. As a member of the team, you will have the chance to interact with key business stakeholders to clarify business requirements and ensure the right analytics are in place to optimize the site experience and marketing spend. 

We value learning and development, and you will be given every opportunity to work on projects that excite you and help you grow. You will have the opportunity to sit at the intersection of marketing, product, and engineering to inform, support, and execute on the design and optimization of our analytics strategy.

Key responsibilities include:

Optimize and maintain the implementation of Google Analytics (GA), across product & marketing sites

Develop and oversee the implementation of product & marketing tagging strategies using Google Tag Manager (GTM)

Write custom tagging and analytics solutions using JavaScript for multiple sites in a GA360 platform 

Set and enforce code, event naming, and data standards in the analytics systems

Create and provide training to developers & engineers on GTM and GA implementation

Review and provide quality assurance feedback to developers & engineers in analytics deployments

Ensures data is appropriately received, transformed, stored, and made accessible to stakeholders

What You’ll Need

Extensive knowledge of Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager tools

Experience writing tagging and tracking specifications

Experience writing custom JavaScript in Google Tag Manager and enacting design and process improvements

In-depth knowledge of content analytics tools

Experience using Google Cloud Platform and Microsoft Azure cloud platforms for data storage, data movement, and data management using big data solutions

Fluency in the language and common approaches used by digital marketing and web analyst professionals, including ecommerce

Knowledge of data visualization solutions

Familiar with agile methodologies and practices

Experience using quality assurance tracking tools and version control software is desired

Solid understanding of website structure and the relationship between content, user interface and technologies

Bachelor’s degree, preferably in a technical or quantitative discipline

Minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in this field

Ability to work independently, while keeping management informed

Adaptive, flexible and able to respond to a dynamic environment

Strong written and verbal communication skills

title: Senior Product Owner, Data Platform
content:
Job Summary:

The Senior Data Platform Product Owner brings deep knowledge of data platform technology (e.g. database, storage, access, performance, interfaces), business value prioritization methods, critical path dependency identification and solution options for stakeholders (reports, dashboards, visualization, datasets, tools for machine learning, etc.) in accordance with their vision and goals focused on business value.   The PO translates goals and objectives into iterative deliverables for technical implementation. Balancing competing factors (discovery, dependencies, mitigation of risks, highest-ROI, platform health and maintenance, etc.) to prioritize the team backlog to ensure optimal delivery. Manages ongoing negotiation of time, scope and plan of attack with business stakeholders. Empathetically communicates risk, tradeoffs, status, and targets for delivery of the team’s work in timely and adaptive fashion.

Responsibilities:

Exhibit a strong sense of responsibility and ownership for the success of data platform development from prioritization to delivery (including post-deploy monitoring of performance)

Develop a deep technical understanding of our data platform and discovery/exploratory platforms

Define and champion best practices for the data platform

Collaborate with team leads, engineering managers and business partners to understand the business needs and deliver solutions

Elaborate Portfolio needs into user stories that are granular enough to be implemented by the team and provide incremental value to users

Drive new capability development (dataset, report, dashboard, tool, feed)

Work closely with engineering teams, product teams, PMO, data analysts/scientists to understand cross-system needs and impacts

Align with business partners to balance business and technical objectives and manifest these as clear ordered priorities for the team

Work with the team to prioritize, sequence, and deliver using our agile process

Ensure testing strategy is implemented, maintained and adequate to support health of the data platform

Comfortable leading regular agile ceremonies: daily stand ups, development reviews, project and team retrospectives, kick-offs, planning, sizing, demos and be the voice of the user by communicating the value behind each prioritization decision

Help internal users navigate onboarding, scaling and optimizing their usage of our platform to create insights

Understand company business goals and identify strategic opportunities to help partner teams effectively leverage the platform to drive business results

Communicate implementation status and health updates to both business and technology management (formal and informal, regular cadence and ad-hoc)

Measure and communicate success of the platform. Analyze usage of our platform and drive improvements to the accuracy and effectiveness of its capabilities

Define Service Level Agreements and maintain communication regarding platform performance

Collaborate with other teams at Getty to drive platform adoption and help them optimize their implementations

Listen to internal partners to identify new requirements for platform capabilities, tooling and documentation

Qualifications: 

S. or M.S. in a Computer Science or equivalent engineering experience

5+ years of Software engineering or Systems engineering experience

2+ years of Technical Product/Program/Project management experience

Demonstrated business analyst skills

Experience in Big Data and Cloud Computing

Working knowledge of AWS S3, EC2, RDS, Hadoop, Spark, Hive and Snowflake/Redshift

Working knowledge on dashboard/visualization tools such as Tableau or Looker

Good understanding on advanced analytic tools such R

A "can do" attitude with the ability to juggle multiple workstreams and operational support in a fast-paced environment

Story management

Strong written and verbal communication skills, specifically around status, risk, trade-offs, and target delivery reporting

Demonstrated ability to influence cross-functional teams without formal authority

Organizational and coordination experience along with multi-tasking capabilities

Getty Images is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. Getty Images believes that diversity is critical to our success in moving the world with images and is committed to creating an inclusive, mutually respectful environment which celebrates diversity. title: Data Architect
content:
The Data Architect will be responsible for leading design and development of enterprise-wide data architecture and logical/physical data models across master data, data pipelines, big data stores, data analytics and business intelligence platforms. This role will work closely with business users and technology leaders to develop data strategy, enterprise information model, and enterprise data catalog. This is an exciting opportunity to drive business process and data integration across the Getty Platform.   

Who You Are:

This position is responsible for leading the design and development of complex data integration solutions in a highly collaborative software engineering environment. Acts as the liaison between technical teams and business stakeholders in order to facilitate, conceptualize and define integrated data solutions; making sure these solutions align with Enterprise Data Architecture and achieve company wide objectives. 

Your Next Challenge:

Develop and maintain understanding of data architecture and systems comprising Getty Images technology platform.

Lead design and development of logical and physical data models for transactional and analytical datastores.

Lead Getty Images enterprise data governance initiatives. Ensure Getty Images domain driven data architecture evolution.

Evangelize data platform, standards, patterns and best practices across Getty Images business partners.

Work closely with business users and developers to create and maintain data dictionary and data lineage. Help investigate and resolve data anomalies including data quality issues and ambiguous/redundant data definitions. Recommend data integrity checks and controls to ensure enterprise-wide data quality.

Provide technical guidance and support for data warehouse, analytics development, and technology evolution initiatives.

Work closely with data consumers (data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, etc.) to understand needs and challenges and come up with solutions and process improvement recommendations.

Assist with data platform optimization and scalability improvement efforts.

Lead technology rationalization, assessment, and roadmap planning.

Ensure compliance with Getty Images’ policies & procedures, state and federal laws, regulations and standards.

Enhance data security and data auditing capabilities

Help define and govern data-centric SLAs across Getty Images enterprise.

What You’ll Need:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or equivalent experience.

10+ years of experience in designing conceptual, logical and physical data models.

10+ years of experience in strategic data planning and data standards development.

5+ years of experience in data mart, data warehouse, and data lake design and architecture.

5+ years of experience in leveraging enterprise data warehouse modeling constructs, methodologies and practices to ensure flexible, scalable, maintainable, and high-performing databases.

10+ years of experience with multiple database technologies for relational, document-oriented, column-oriented, key-value, graph encompassing schema-less, unstructured and multi-structured data.

7+ years of experience in working with Distributed systems and experience in designing distributed systems solutions.

Proficiency in SQL.

Good knowledge of ETL, ELT and batch.

Experience with analytics, data visualization tools a plus.

Experience in data analysis and forensics.

Experience with data pipelines and dealing with high volume systems and designing solutions for reliability and performance at scale.

Experience with AWS and/or Google cloud data engineering and data science capabilities: RedShift, Athena, BigQuery, Dynamo, Hadoop, Amazon EMR, Spark, SageMaker, Apache Flink, etc.

Experience with streaming architectures including cost analysis, performance tuning, and quality of service concerns.

AWS cloud application development, architecture design, modernization, implementation, and deployment is a plus.

Understanding of cloud computing technologies, business drivers, and emerging computing trends.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills to describe complex technical subjects, develop technical documentation and presentations.

Strong bias for lean and collaborative enterprise architecture process.

Getty Images is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. You have a passion for the world of data. You are an avid technologist who is fascinated with distributed computing, machine learning, and data mining techniques. You leverage the latest tools to create innovative and cutting-edge data solutions. You strive to understand your customer’s needs and pride yourself on your speed of delivery. title: Information Security Analyst
content: You are an intelligent, curious, and exceptionally skilled technologist with a passion for all things tech. Because of your desire to learn new things, you’ve developed a broad set of skills across a variety of technology disciplines including Linux, Windows, Networking, Application Development, DevOps, and of course, Information Security. You possess a senior-level understanding of Information Security principles and practices as well as an understanding of the challenges impacting the protection of data across an e-commerce enterprise. You’re good at finding potential weaknesses and developing and implementing creative solutions to eliminate those weaknesses. Because of your exceptional communication and collaboration skills, you’re often the go-to person for both your peers and business partners when they need help or consulting on an initiative.
Provide security guidance and support for a global e-commerce company with resources in public and private cloud infrastructures.
Develop secure deployment patterns for systems and services.
Automate routine tasks and develop tooling to monitor and enforce security requirements.
Work with application development, product and legal teams to assess the security posture of new applications and services. Document identified risks.
Conduct vulnerability and penetration tests and perform security reviews for applications and services. Summarize findings and recommendations in written form.
Conduct forensic, fraud and other technical investigations.
Build, deploy and support custom and third-party security solutions and services.
Develop, implement and maintain company-wide information security policies and standards.
Analyze, assess and respond to security incidents including participation in on-call rotation.
Develop documentation for security-related processes and procedures.
S. or M.S. Computer Science or equivalent work experience.
5+ years of overall IT experience with 2+ years focused on information security.
Skilled with Linux, Windows, Network, and Cloud architecture and security practices.
Solid understanding of cloud security principles and best practices. AWS experience a big plus.
Strong automation/programming skills (Python, Perl, PHP, PowerShell, etc.).
Familiar with payment card industry (PCI) standards, EU data privacy directive, GDPR, and other information security-related legal and regulatory frameworks.
Knowledgeable of network attack methods and understanding of network/service discovery tactics, system auditing, and malware.
In-depth, hands-on experience with monitoring, detecting, and reporting security weaknesses and enforcing information security and policies in an e-Commerce environment.
Skilled with log and event management solutions such as Splunk.

title: Principal Software Engineer (Front End)
content:
As a Principal Software Engineer for our front-end web applications you will be part of a talented team of software engineers who will drive the next generation of architecture and implementation of our platform.  You are a specialist with a serious level of experience and skill in working with front-end technologies and proven ability to deliver code with high levels of speed and quality. You communicate effectively across all levels of the organization and are a technical leader through your guidance, collaboration and mentoring of engineering staff. You are passionate about technology and generate positive impact throughout the organization through your influence, drive and collaboration across departments.

Your job responsibilities will include but are not limited to:

Drive the evolution of the front-end architecture and technology composition by working in collaboration with other Principal Engineers

Drive and deliver resolution of the most urgent and challenging technical issues

Identify and drive technical front-end initiatives that deliver positive impact for the business and the department

Mentor engineers through coaching, consultation and code review feedback

Drive improvements in the code base, best practices, design patterns and development tools

Collaborate effectively with cross-functional partners to understand business needs and provide solution options, costs and trade-offs

Technically lead front-end teams in maintaining and driving improvements to continually meet and beat the organization and the department’s key performance indicators

Stay current with industry advancements to pragmatically apply to the platform to achieve concrete results

Qualifications:

10+ years’ experience developing large scale front-end web applications

Expert level proficiency in writing modular JavaScript in ES6 (and/or beyond) utilizing common JavaScript design patterns

Significant experience with JavaScript frameworks such as AngularJS, React and/or Vue

Advanced proficiency with web markup, HTML5 and CSS3

Excellent understanding and experience with technologies and tools such as XML, JSON, AJAX, Redux and Webpack

Ideally have solid experience with Ruby on Rails

Experience working with the AWS cloud platform

Fully proficient using version control systems such as Git

Strong problem solving, troubleshooting and performance tuning skills

Proven ability to drive impact and generate results

Excellent teamwork and communication skills with ability to lead and influence

Passion for technology with demonstrated commitment to personal growth and continuous improvement

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent

Who We Are:

Getty Images is the world's leading creator and distributor of visual content and the first place creative professionals turn to discover, purchase and manage imagery. The company's award winning photographers and imagery help customers create inspiring work which appears every day in the world's most influential newspapers, magazines, advertising campaigns, films, television programs, books and Web sites. Headquartered in Seattle, WA and serving customers in more than 100 countries, Getty Images believes in the power of imagery to drive positive change, educate, inform, and entertain. Visit Getty Images at 
http://gettyimages.com

title: Software Engineer
content:
Who You Are:

You are motivated by the technical challenges that come with structured and unstructured data at an enterprise level. Even more, you are energized by bringing solutions and innovations that help the business move forward. You are passionate about building data platforms, frameworks and driving insights from complex multi structured datasets. 

Your Next Challenge:

We’re looking for an experienced Data Engineer to continue to evolve and mature our enterprise data platform. In this role, you will partner closely with product, analytics, and technology stakeholders to continue to grow and innovate the platform by: 

Responsibilities include:

Design, implement and deliver cloud based analytical solutions.

Design and develop high-throughput, low-latency data processing pipelines including data quality and testing.

Identify approaches to extract valuable insights from massive datasets.

Research, evaluate and utilize new technologies, tools and frameworks.

Write well designed and efficient code.

Ensure scalability and high performance of the platform.

Requirements:

7+ years hands-on experience with designing and implementing solutions using distributed technologies.

Expert knowledge in modern distributed architectures and compute / data analytics / storage technologies on AWS Cloud.

Hands-on working experience on Snowflake and Hive/Spark

Understanding of architectural principles and design patterns / styles using parallel large-scale distributed frameworks such as Hadoop and Spark;

Expertise in writing ETLs with strong SQL skills.

Advanced knowledge of a programming languages such as Java or Python

Experience in SQL Server BI stack (SSIS, SSAS, SSRS) will be a plus

Experience with Hadoop, Spark, Kafka and hive

Demonstrate broad knowledge of technical solutions, design patterns, and code for medium/complex applications deployed in production on Hadoop & Spark clusters.

Outstanding analytical skills, excellent team player and delivery mindset.

Experience in performance troubleshooting, SQL optimization, and benchmarking.

Thorough understanding of service-oriented architectures and data processing in high-volume applications.

Knowledge of working in UNIX environment with shell scripting.

Experience building solutions using agile methodologies

Strong bias for action; ability to juggle multiple priorities and create a sense of urgency in a fast-paced, dynamic environment

title: Principal Software Engineer
content:
Principal Software Engineer


Make a positive difference in other people's lives through your work - we’re revolutionizing healthcare for all

Make a big contribution across the entire product stack in a small, passionate team

Enjoy the fantastic views from our Smith Tower offices


Xealth, named one of the Best Small Places to Work in Seattle, is growing!


We’re improving healthcare for everyone by enabling doctors and patients to easily access digital content and services that are relevant, timely, and targeted. Incubated at Providence, we’re disrupting healthcare from the inside and are on a mission to change lives through technology.


Having recently announced a major new partnership that allows physicians to recommend physical products, we're growing our team, and looking for a 
Principal Software Engineer 
to join us in a broad role working across the entire product stack. 


We build scalable applications, develop custom recommendation engines, and run on a modern cloud-based platform - all while integrating tightly into 3rd party EMR and practice management systems. We’re a skilled, passionate team with a track record of success - and are thrilled to be applying our efforts improving healthcare options for everyone. 


We offer a unique opportunity to do something meaningful in a fantastic work environment while developing your engineering skills in a variety of modern web technologies.


As a Principal Engineer at Xealth, you will 


Join a small team writing reusable, testable code

Architect efficient, scalable web applications

Design, develop, and maintain server-side applications using Node.js

Design and develop RESTful Web Services, microservices, APIs, and other interfaces to 3rd party EMR systems like Epic and Cerner

Work in a cross-functional team that reaches across our entire product

Prioritize multiple tasks intelligently, speak up when you see issues

Make a real, positive difference in other people's lives through your work

Other interesting tasks as needed


Our ideal Principal Engineer will have:


7+ years of development experience working on SaaS, cloud, or related applications in an Open Source environment

Hands-on experience with server-side development, ideally Node.js and Javascript 

Experiences designing cloud based, scalable server side architecture solving complex business problems

A track record of mentoring and leading other engineers 

Degree in Computer Science, ideally including coursework in algorithms, data structures, software design, operating systems, and/or strong CS fundamentals

Bonus points for: 
Experience with Open Source technologies, particularly Linux or Docker, experience building data streams utilizing AWS, Kinesis, Athena, or similar, exposure to the healthcare industry, previous startup experience


About Xealth:


"Xealth will dramatically improve the connection between patients and clinicians." 

- Rod Hochman, MD, President & CEO, Providence St. Joseph Hospital


Xealth enables healthcare teams to order digital content, services, and OTC items as easily as they do medications. Patients can then access these digital health prescriptions from the provider's portal, so that they can actively manage their health - improving both client care, and the doctor-client relationship.


Xealth spun out of Providence St. Joseph's Digital Integration Group in 2016. Based in Seattle, the company was founded by the team of serial entrepreneurs behind Swype, an innovative keyboard that reach over 1 billion users, and Boost Mobile, now a Sprint service generating over $5 billion in revenue.


Learn more about us at www.xealth.io
