title: Senior Quality Assurance Engineer
content:
Traditional business lending institutions still rely on highly paper-based processes. They are simply not tooled to be able to underwrite or service loans to startups. Lighter Capital is able to offer non-diluting financing options to early stage businesses that banks wouldn’t touch because our internal processes are supported by high-tech custom built software. This is where you will be adding value to Lighter Capital.


As a Quality Assurance Engineer on our Technology team you will be part of a cultural shift in our quality assurance approach. The mission critical software that powers the origination, servicing and credit monitoring for this innovative Fintech company is being continuously improved and updated as we grow rapidly. You will help us maintain high quality as we ramp up the output velocity of our development team.


You will be working closely with an engineering team and reporting directly to the SVP of Product and Engineering.

WHY YOU’LL APPLY…..

You are fanatically customer oriented (even internal customers) and thrive on applying your curiosity and talents to finding how things work and why they don’t.

You have approached “craftspersonship” level and want to work in an environment where that actually matters.

You thrive in an environment where you self-manage your work, projects, and time. Work:life balance isn’t just a platitude, at Lighter Capital we expect you to manage your hours and achieve your goals.

You prefer small teams of people who are smart with a get-it-done attitude.


WHY WE NEED YOU…..

Our internally built software is mission-critical to the growth and success of our innovative Fintech business, and YOU are going to be the person holding our feet to the fire of quality.

You will enable us to ship value faster and more frequently without breaking things or disrupting users.

Our internal software supports some bizarre and complex user stories and business process - you will develop a sound appreciation for how they all interact and will participate during the design phase of new functionality to highlight usability and testability issues before we’ve written any code.


YOU WILL BE A GOOD FIT IF…..

You have extensive experience testing web software in all manner of methods: scripted, exploratory, boundary, functional...

You have mastered the use of software testing automation and productivity tools

You work well in small teams and are familiar with collaboration tools such as JIRA, Confluence and Aha

Your testing is more like art than engineering

You exude creativity and initiative to improve product test coverage and effectiveness for the entire team

Your leadership on emerging quality assurance methodologies and best practices has resulted in 10x improvements in other places you’ve worked


ABOUT US


We are Lighter Capital, a Seattle based FinTech company with a clear mission to revolutionize startup financing by empowering entrepreneurs to grow their businesses and retain ownership. 


We are a passionate group of individuals where our mission and values guide our decision making. We believe in individual and team development, and align, push and measure ourselves through goal setting. Join our team and feel part of something incredible!


Just like each customer is unique, so is each person, and Lighter Capital is committed to creating an environment where everyone can belong and thrive. We encourage all qualified persons to apply.

title: Senior VR/ AR Engineer
content:
Pluto’s mission is to help humanity transcend physical location. We are looking for engineers who are excited about solving the technological and communication challenges associated with achieving this. As an engineer at Pluto, you'll work on a variety of different technologies and be part of a team that values collaboration, continuous improvement, and solving technical and product problems in an emerging space. Our apps encompass a broad range of development technologies including Swift and C# apps, cross-platform web apps, and Node.js microservices.

What you'll do:

Build a mass-market communication product for spatial computing (AR/VR/MR)

Contribute to the entire product lifecycle from prototype to implementation to ongoing service support

Have the opportunity to work on all areas of our tech stack

Work on a small engineering team in an Agile environment

Mentor and support your fellow teammates

What we're looking for:

5+ years of experience

Experience with pair programming and working in collaborative development environment

Experience writing well-tested, production-quality clean code

Track record of shipping, scaling, and maintaining consumer-facing software products

Experience with a variety of different languages and platforms

Experience working in an Agile/Scrum engineering environment

Familiarity with mentoring and growing early-career engineers

We also expect you to have deep experience in one or more of the following:

Spatial computing (AR, VR, etc)

Games industry or Unity development

Real-time video/audio rendering, including encoding/ decoding, and compression.

WebRTC or other communications/networking

Graphics development, including shader programming, low-level graphics API experience and solid understanding of linear algebra

People management experience

title: Machine Learning Engineer
content: Machine learning is core to our business, driving everything from our long-term and short-term rental income prediction algorithms to our revenue optimization algorithms and our properties acquisition pipeline. We're looking for a talented, experienced ML engineer to help us scale quickly, smartly and nimbly. This role offers a unique opportunity to join an amazing team and grow your career as quickly as Loftium scales.This role reports to our Head of Machine Learning.
Build machine learning products that help drive our business
Make thoughtful architectural decisions with limited information translating business requirements into machine learning products
Communicate decision rationales, formulating project plans and delivering results
Automating model comparison and feature selection to optimize performance
Shipping code to our staging and production environments multiple times a day
Building data pipelines that allow us to improve our machine learning products and services
Design and deploy efficient data services and stores
You have 2+ years experience leveraging machine learning to solve complex business problems
You’re adaptable: You thrive in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment, and understand that the
Excited about Loftium’s mission of making housing more affordable
Bonus: Masters in computer science or other STEM degree
Designing and deploying scalable production machine learning products
Machine learning algorithms (Neural networks, gradient boosting) and model evaluation (cross validation, bias-variance trade-off)
Architecting relational databases (PostgreSQL), NoSQL databases (MongoDB), and data warehouses
Git and GitHub; software development workflows
Managing deployment & operation of cloud services (AWS, Azure etc.)
Leveraging data pipeline frameworks (Airflow, Luigi, Pinball)
Web scraping, mobile api reverse engineering (Crawlera, Charles)
Bonus: Early-stage startup experience, especially joining at the seed or Series A stage and scaling a technical product

title: Senior SDET - Full Stack QA
content:
We’re all in at DoubleDown.  Are you?

We are looking for an experienced Software Development Engineer in Test for our Full Stack QA team! As an SDET on the Full Stack QA team at DoubleDown you'll work closely with our development team to ensure the functional integrity and efficient design of our next generation of features and products. You’ll develop a comprehensive understanding of our tech stack and work closely with other QA teams to develop manual and automated validation strategies for upcoming features. If you're an 'A Player' with a strong customer focus, open source technology experience, and a passion for test development, we want to talk to you!


Be a high roller at DoubleDown

We're DoubleDown Interactive, a talented team of approximately 150 Software Engineers, Game Designers, Artists, Producers, Marketers, Analytical Experts, and more.  Located in Seattle’s International District, we create fun, authentic casino-style entertainment via free-to-play social and mobile games, enjoyed by millions of players worldwide. As a leader in the social casino space, we continue to revolutionize through constant innovation. Known for our fun and collaborative culture, we move quickly to deliver exciting online game experiences to casino enthusiasts and social gamers alike.


What you should bring to the table

5+ years programming in Java or similar OOP language

2+ years writing SQL queries of moderate complexity

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field

Familiarity with mobile app testing strategies and automation frameworks

Experience in setting up device farms like Sauce Labs (or similar)

Understanding of RESTful best practices

Task driven with a great attitude and ability to communicate with many cross functional teams


Other cards you might be holding

Experience working with AWS cloud technologies

Working knowledge of continuous integration systems such as Jenkins/GoCD

Experience developing in code repository systems (GIT preferred)


Placing your best bet - the responsibilities

Identify best-of-breed mobile test automation tooling and help build out a reliable regression suite to increase the speed and quality of our app releases

Perform white/gray box testing to validate functional behavior of features and help scope testing for the black box testing team

Participate in design reviews to help increase the testability and maintainability of our systems

Drive quality process improvements within the QA organization and beyond


Hitting the jackpot

On our Full Stack QA team, you’ll have a chance to work with a broad set of technologies to help define and implement our mobile test automation strategy for emerging new applications that will help the team deliver on exciting new feature for our players. You’ll work with cross functional agile teams to help develop appropriate test strategies for upcoming projects and be an influential voice in the technical design of our applications!


Cashing in on the comps

Getting to the office is a breeze with one of our two company-sponsored transportation options:
ORCA pass, renewed annually

$100 monthly transportation credit


Stow your ride safely in the secured parking garage or bike locker available onsite.

It’s a gaming company, so take a gaming break and get to know your coworkers with a little competitive fun! Square off over ping pong, foosball, or pinball in our arcade.  You’ll find plenty of takers for a tabletop gaming session, too!

Stay in tip-top shape by taking advantage of our onsite fitness center.  Just head down to the first floor of our building, and you’ll have access to state of the art equipment, lockers, and showers. 

Need to relax? Get a massage or enjoy a yoga session right here in the studio! After all, who wants to work without a massage?

Enjoy occasional afternoons off for private viewings of first-run movies and team outings to see the Mariners play.

Hungry? Head to one of our two kitchens fully stocked with snacks and beverages.

You’ll never want to take the day off on Wednesdays, when we even provide a gourmet breakfast.

Want to go out to lunch sometimes, too? Our International District location is perfectly situated near a variety of excellent restaurants.

As if all of this isn't cool enough, you'll love our benefit package.
We offer medical, dental, vision, prescription coverage, maternity/paternity leave, and disability protection (short- and long-term).

Every team member receives 15 days of vacation, 56 hours of sick time, 2 personal floating holidays, and 12 paid calendar holidays per year.

Combine all of this with our amazing work/life balance and company-matched retirement options, and you have the dream job!



Looking for another reason we're the best place in Seattle to work?  We're committed to our role as an Equal Opportunity Employer – we embrace a diverse mix of voices and create a positive environment where everyone belongs.  We don’t just accept difference - we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products, and our communities.  We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.  DoubleDown is committed to providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with physical and mental disabilities.  If you need help completing your application, let us know!  Email us at 
[email protected]
 and one of our awesome HR team members will get you everything you need.  We look forward to meeting you soon!


To learn about us, please visit us 
here
 and watch us 
here


To be considered, you must be at least 18 years of age with the ability to successfully pass a security criminal background investigation.


DoubleDown partners with E-Verify, an Internet-based system that allows businesses to determine the eligibility of their employees to work in the United States.

title: Senior Performance Engineer/SDET
content:
Here at Smartsheet, our team thrives under a lightweight, Agile-like process. We build collaboration software and a collaborative environment is what we offer! With the amount of growth we're experiencing, there is no shortage of problems to be solved. Now is a great time to join our team - we're going to be huge! 


We are looking for a 
Senior Performance Engineer/SDET 
to join our team. At heart, you are a hands-on tester and developer who eagerly meets new challenges, values stability, and will be able to increasingly contribute to the success of our award winning software. This position reports to the Engineering Manager and is based at our headquarters in Bellevue, WA. 



Job Responsibilities: 


Own, design, document and execute test plan for performance project 

Work effectively with Development, Product Management, and Technical Operations 

Be a customer advocate 

Design and implement various tools and/or automation frameworks for efficient testing 

Adopt and establish best engineering practices for the team 

Use performance monitoring tools and reporting results 

Drive load and performance testing of our product 

Lead the design and implementation of various tools for more efficient testing

Work effectively with development and PM counterparts

Assist in the career development of others, actively mentoring individuals and the community

Working with other senior engineers to develop best practices for software across multiple teams


Requirements: 


5+ years of development and performance test experience in a SaaS environment 

Strong SQL/DB Skills 

Experience with Load (JMeter), API (REST Web Services) automation 

Strong coding skills with 5+ years of experience in one of the mainstream OO languages (Java, C#, Python) and work on Data Quality (big data, analytics, statistics,load/performance testing) 

Familiar with Kibana/Grafana, New Relic, DataDog and other similar tools

Experience with common data structures, algorithms, and/or distributed systems 

Exceptional communication skills, eye for details 

Quick learner with passion for testing and becoming domain expert 

Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills 

Excellent written and verbal communication skills 

BS or MS in Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent industry experience 

Legally eligible to work in the U.S. on an ongoing basis 

Familiarity with AWS and proven experience with applications in the cloud

Experience with Selenium for browser automation

Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment with frequent production releases


About Smartsheet


In 2005, Smartsheet was founded on the idea that teams and millions of people worldwide deserve a better way to deliver their very best work. Today, the company delivers a leading cloud-based platform for work execution, empowering organizations to plan, capture, track, automate, and report on work at scale, resulting in more efficient processes and better business outcomes. Smartsheet went public on the New York Stock Exchange in April 2018 and currently enables collaboration, better decision making, and accelerated innovation for over 76,000 domain-based customers in 190 countries, including 96 of the Fortune 100.

Smartsheet is a place where people love what they do and are empowered to do their best work everyday. We support one another and achieve our goals as a team, not as individuals. Each person, at every level, gets to have an impact.

Smartsheet is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Individuals seeking employment at Smartsheet are considered without regard to race, ethnicity, color, age, sex, religion, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, physical or mental disability, registered domestic partner status, caregiver status, marital status, veteran or military status, citizenship status, or any other legally protected category.

title: Principal Software Development Engineer - Cloud
content:
When was the last time you had an opportunity to work at a company that was forging an industry and enabling people to get from idea to impact – fast! Smartsheet’s purpose is to empower everyone to improve how they work. Our business is built on finding great people and getting out of their way while they build and improve our award-winning Software as a Service (SaaS) offering. With over 10 million users, our platform gets used across disparate industries ranging from construction to retail to software development. This presents us with unique technical challenges.

We are looking for a Principal Software Development Engineer to join our application engineering team and help design Smartsheet’s cloud services architecture. In this role, you will lead and positively impact multiple product areas within your functional domain, as well as influence the broader technology organization. You will provide technical leadership for critical areas that significantly impact customer success.

This position is based at our headquarters in Bellevue, WA and will report to the Engineering Leadership team.

Our team focuses on distributed decision making that rewards ownership, transparency, and collaboration. Learn more about our platform here:
Smartsheet Overview Video

Requirements:

3+ years architecting a SaaS, IaaS, or PaaS service running in AWS

4+ years microservice or SOA based web application development

10+ years of combined system architecture experience across multiple OSes, languages and frameworks. Java experience a plus!

Experience with tools such as CloudFormation, CloudTrail, CloudWatch, Elastic Load Balancing, Beanstalk, EC2, Route 53, etc.

Experience with NoSQL DBs, Relational DBs, Object Store architectures across globally replicated cloud instances

Experience building autoscaling distributed systems

BS or MS in Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent industry experience

Strong Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design, data structures and problem solving.

Strong verbal and written communication skills

Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodologies

Positively influences group/company's technical culture and morale

Recognizes, takes ownership of complicated technical cross-team issues and drives them to resolution

Legally eligible to work in the U.S. on an ongoing basis

BS or MS in Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent industry experience

title: Commercial Sales Engineer
content: Smartsheeters truly stand out. It is clear by their attitude and actions that they work for a company that is not only innovative and authentic, but filled with individuals who are supportive, driven and committed to being a part of Smartsheet’s success. Our leadership is comprised of executives with deep experience who are committed to maintaining an environment that promotes personal and professional growth as well as encouraging individuals to take an active role in the vision of the company.
Smartsheet is looking for a proven

who will provide technical leadership throughout the inside sales process. You will serve as a trusted solution and technical advisor during the sales process and provide expertise that ensures successful Smartsheet deployment and adoption. title: Infrastructure Security Engineer
content:
At Smartsheet, we are building the next generation workspace collaboration platform. Trust is one of our core values, and as an engineering organization, we execute that core value by maintaining and innovating on systems that secure our customers’ data. As we continue to grow our customer base, we are seeking a Security Engineer who understands how major systems and enterprises are operated, deployed and defended against the most aggressive threat actors. This role is a critical part of the engineering organization.

A qualified candidate will leverage years of experience in the technology sector in protecting the organization through hardening, configuration, management and operation and monitoring of production systems. This candidate will recommend systems and changes, identify gaps in capabilities. An ideal candidate will be aware of the latest threats and how to mitigate them. Candidates will have a strong understanding of underlying infrastructure technology, how it is deployed and what kinds of structures and configurations lead to the most resilient deployments.The candidate will have a passion for the protection and defense of a company’s key assets and have a “security mindset” for detecting badness and eradicating it. 

The position is on the Infrastructure Security team and will report to the Senior Director of Security Engineering. The position will be located in our 
Bellevue, WA technology headquarters.

Responsibilities:

Managed design, testing, deployment and operation of security systems for infrastructure and other components of the security team. This includes scanning, logging, monitoring and alerting systems.

Select cutting edge tools for endpoint protection, monitoring, and analysis.

Harden systems, cloud and network infrastructure to potential attacks.

Participate in or lead incident response for systems under protection.

Work in concert with other Information Security Functions and team members to influence related aspects of the information security program—providing feedback into control effectiveness (false positives/negatives) and improve risk exposure.

Collaborate across engineering and other operational teams to enhance protection strategies.

Provide SME and Guidance during meetings with senior leadership and business partners on related topics.

Analyze, document and communicate gaps in existing systems and capabilities.

Requirements:

A solid foundation as a Security Infrastructure Engineer.

Demonstrated experience and proficiency in deploying complex systems, engineering new tools or capabilities, and leveraging purpose built or off-the-shelf systems to secure infrastructure.

Have identified security gaps and weaknesses in products and designs.

Strong written and verbal communication, and teaching skills.

Evaluate and communicate risk in a fact-based manner.

Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment with frequent production releases and changes.

Legally eligible to work in the U.S. on an ongoing basis.

Nice to have:

Experience defending IaaS, PaaS or SaaS products and with advanced adversaries.

Deeply understand infrastructure and system security.

Experience implementing and configuring complex product and enterprise infrastructure.

On the ground understanding of complex breach and incident response.

Professional engineering experience.

Experience with FedRAMP or federal government environment or SOC II, ISO 27x and other complex compliance regimes.

title: Principal Software Development Engineer - Front End
content:
When was the last time you had an opportunity to work at a company that was forging an industry and enabling people to get from idea to impact – fast? Smartsheet’s purpose is to empower everyone to improve how they work. Our business is built on finding great people and getting out of their way while they build and improve our award-winning Software as a Service (SaaS) offering. With over 10 million users, our platform gets used across disparate industries ranging from construction to retail to software development. This presents us with unique technical challenges.

We are looking for a Principal UI Software Development Engineer with a passion for Front-End technologies and solving problems of scale in traffic and organizational size. We are looking for a person who wants to design, code and mentor. You will guide and help design our Single Page Application (SPA) UI Framework transition into a decoupled architecture allowing our many development teams to build and deploy UI solutions quickly and independently. You will work across the company in mentoring engineers, consulting with other principal engineers and designing comprehensive SPA UI frameworks and component libraries. You will present to product and engineering leadership to influence the technical direction our UI takes. And you will consult with development teams as they implement the framework designs and components and integrate them into the overall Smartsheet UI application.

This position is based at our Engineering Office in Bellevue, WA and will report to a Director of Application Development. 

Our team focuses on distributed decision making that rewards ownership, transparency, and collaboration. Learn more about our platform here: 
Smartsheet Overview Video

Job Responsibilities:

Create and evangelize a SPA UI Framework standard for the organization

Become the Subject Matter Expert of the organization’s SPA UI Architecture

Identify and evaluate new technologies to bring into our stack 

Design and help build reusable components utilized across our product (React, Redux, Javascript, Typescript, Node.js, html, css)

Consult with other teams across the organization on building UI components and frameworks

Work with design and UX groups to define UI standards

Mentor UI Developers across the company

Requirements:

10+ years software development experience

8+ years web application development

4+ years experience in SaaS application development

Experience building highly scalable, high availability UI applications

Experience building Single Page Applications at scale

Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment with frequent production releases

Legally eligible to work in the U.S. on an ongoing basis

BS or MS in Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent industry experience

Nice to Have:

Experience transforming a monolithic UI into micro frontend architecture 

Experience implementing responsive designs for mobile, tablet, and desktop browsers

Familiarity with SaaS apps (Google Docs, Salesforce, etc.)

Experience developing service framework

title: Principal Software Development Engineer
content:
Are you the go-to person on your team? Do the hard problems always seem to land on your desk because you’re the only one who can solve them? Do you spend more of your time convincing people to let you build what needs to be built than actually building it? Have you spent more than 10 hours in meetings this week? Come work for us and unleash your true potential.

We are looking for a Principal Software Development Engineer to join our Identity and Authentication team. In this role, will be responsible for driving the design and execution of a platform to support Identity and Access services for Smartsheet with a focus on reliability, scalability, and maintainability.

This position is based at our headquarters in Bellevue, WA. 


Job Responsibilities:

Design and build an extensible identity and authentication framework utilizing our existing authentication protocols (SAML, OAuth 2.0, OpenID Connect) and partner-facing APIs

Guide and mentor team members regarding architecture and best practices

Provide thought leadership, and influence others, by solving tough problems and contributing thoughtful feedback on peer design and code reviews

Contribute to full SDLC; defining, prioritizing, designing, implementing, testing, and deploying new features for our platform

Engage in troubleshooting and root cause analysis toward identifying solutions and next steps for production issues.

Own critical features and work in a self-directed, autonomous manner

Requirements: 

BS or MS in Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent industry experience

3+ years architecting a SaaS, IaaS, or PaaS service running in AWS

4+ years microservice or SOA based web application development

9+ years of combined system architecture experience across multiple OSes, languages and frameworks. Java experience is a plus!

Experience with tools such as CloudFormation, CloudTrail, CloudWatch, Elastic Load Balancing, Beanstalk, EC2, Route 53, etc is preferred.

Previous experience with authentication protocols 

Experience with NoSQL DBs, Relational DBs, Object Store architectures across globally replicated cloud instances

Experience building autoscaling distributed systems

Recognizes, takes ownership of complicated technical cross-team issues and drives them to resolution

Legally eligible to work in the U.S. on an ongoing basis

title: Site Reliability Engineer
content: Automation is the key to creating highly reliable large-scale software systems. Are you someone who engineers solutions to problems rather than simply fixing the same thing over and over again?

to join our Engineering Team. In this position you will directly impact the reliability and performance of our critical production application; supporting 24/7 delivery to over 70,000 customers worldwide. You will work as part of a development team to improve application security, availability and performance. We operate our products across both our own data centers, and public cloud providers, such as AWS. Our team owns critical business services like networking and computing infrastructure.

Our business is built on finding top grade talent and empowering them to build and improve our platforms. content: When was the last time you had an opportunity to work at a company that was forging a new industry and enabling people to get from idea to impact—fast! Smartsheet’s purpose is to empower everyone to improve how they work. Our business is built on finding great people and getting out of their way while they build and improve our award-winning Software as a Service (SaaS) offering. With over 10 million users, our platform gets used across disparate industries ranging from construction to retail to software development. This presents us with unique technical challenges.
We are looking for our next
Senior Software Development Engineer - Data Science & ML (Senior SDE)

to play a lead role in developing machine learning-powered assistive features inside Smartsheet. Our team is building features to accelerate and augment the way Smartsheet users collaborate on work. We are looking for an engineer to play a lead role in analyzing our data, cleaning our data, iterating on models, and working with a dedicated team to operationalize and monitor these models. With thousands of subscribing organizations and millions of users, there are lots of opportunities to make a meaningful impact and drive growth through machine learning within Smartsheet. The ideal candidate has built machine learning-based features at a SaaS company in a high paced environment and has strong software development and data science experience.

This position is based at our headquarters in Bellevue, WA and will report to our Engineering Manager. Our team focuses on distributed decision making that rewards ownership, transparency, and collaboration. Learn more about our platform here:
Participate in the entire development life cycle, from concept to release, in a DevOps and Agile environment.
Implement new Smartsheet features and improve the ones we have already built using Java and AWS.
Data mine large datasets and draw actionable insights.
Define and implement how ML models are measured and versioned.
Identify areas for further investigation including additional data.
8 or more years of experience developing production software for a SaaS company, including at least 3 years in a machine learning or data science environment.
BA/BS in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or another technical field.
Proficient in implementing various statistical models and data mining tools (predictive modeling, clustering, logistic regression, multivariate regression, decision trees, neural networks).
Hands-on experience in executing data analysis using tools such as SQL, R, Python, Excel, Tableau, and Google Analytics.
Hands-on experience in building machine learning models using tools such as SciKit Learn, Tensorflow, PyTorch, MXNet.
Experience using tooling to operationalize, monitor and version machine learning models such as Kubeflow, Airflow, MLFlow.
Hands-on experience in building data pipelines using AWS.
Ability to research and learn new technologies, tools, and platforms.
Advanced degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or equivalent.
Experience with front-end development using TypeScript, React, and Redux.
Hands-on experience using Java 8 and above, the Spring framework, and other backend frameworks.
Knowledge and experience with Differential Privacy
Experience developing infrastructure with Terraform, Terragrunt, and Helm.
Ability to draw conclusions from data and recommend actions.
Ability to thrive in an unstructured environment, working autonomously on a strong team to find opportunities and deliver business impact.
Drive projects from concept through completion with minimal guidance.
Focus to make quick strikes, iterate, and produce in high volume.
The smarts to pick up new concepts at light speed, the agility to quickly adjust priorities and shift direction, and the flexibility to contribute to other projects as required.

title: Web Engineer, Business Product
content:
The Business Product team empowers businesses to be successful on Pinterest through self-serve tools. You’ll build experiences that teach businesses what they need to do to be successful and make those flows easy and intuitive. You’ll work with PM, design, data science, and backend engineers to build end-to-end business onboarding and continued success experiences.

What you’ll do:

Design and implement the web frontend for business flows such as domain claiming, Pinterest Tag adoption, scaled content ingestion reporting.

Work with PM and design to define new scenarios and improvements. Use A/B testing to ship new features.

Write dashboards and reports to ensure feature success and gain insights on new opportunities.

What we’re looking for:

1-5 years of experience

Experience writing javascript web applications

Experience with HTML and CSS

Grit: willing to dive into new areas, “win or learn” mindset

#LI-GK1

title: Backend Engineer, Measurement Attribution
content:
Effective advertisers learn how their ads perform, then adapt and optimize based on that information. Join the group that is helping advertisers gain a deep understanding of their ad performance, and generating helpful insights so they can make good decisions about their ad campaigns. The tools we build are both within our own stack, as well as built to allow the advertisers to see the data they want in the tools they already trust.

What you’ll do:

Design and build data processing algorithms and APIs around tracking and reporting against conversions

Move across the whole ads stack adding better reporting, novel insights, and better tools for our advertisers

Integrate with third-party data processing tools like Apache Spark, Flink, and Hadoop

What we’re looking for: 

Passionate about delivering value to customers in the advertising space

Interested in finding new ways to process data more efficiently

Interested in gaining new insights from data and leveraging them to improve Pinterest

1-5 years engineering experience

#LI-GK1

title: Software Engineering Intern
content:
Pinterest brings millions of people the inspiration to create a life they love for everything; whether that be tonight’s dinner, next summer’s vacation, or a dream house down the road. We’re organically growing our team and product, and part of that growth includes infusing our team with Pinterns. We operate with lean product and platform engineering teams focused on high impact and results, and as a Pintern, you'll be working alongside PinPloyees on high impact, high exposure projects. Throughout your internship, you’ll help us maneuver through crazy growth and insane scale while building awesome products and features, creating visually rich experiences, spearheading the discovery problem, and pinpointing tomorrow’s engineering challenges. We offer a 12 week summer internship program in our Seattle office. 

What you’ll do:

Dive into the code base on your very first day

Work on high impact projects and help build the future of Pinterest

Knit across our engineering organization to build new features from scratch

Continually grow both professionally and personally through various learning and development opportunities

What we’re looking for:

Pursuing a CS degree (or related field)

2-3 years of CS classes under your belt (Intro to CS and Algorithms, Advanced Algorithms, Operating Systems and Data Structures are all great!)

Aptitude for JavaScript, CSS, C++, HTML, Python, Java, Go–we use a variety of programming languages and tools

Non-academic coding experience (i.e. hack-a-thons, code challenges, personal projects, GitHub, Open Source, volunteer coding experience, conference participation, Grace Hopper, etc.)

A curious nature with a desire to tackle and solve complex problems

Increase visibility and scale of conversion capture to power our measurement, targeting, and auction products

As a Site Reliability Engineer at Sift you will be responsible for a plethora of tasks and systems that span our entire product and internal infrastructure. Every day, thousands of websites and apps rely on our cloud-based machine learning to eliminate fraud, slash costs, and grow revenue.

Who are you?

You have a strong understanding of large scale computing solutions. You are a strong engineer who thinks of infrastructure as code. You love the idea of building immutable infrastructure and multi-AZ/multi-region fault tolerant systems that are anti-fragile. While you understand the need for monitoring and alerting, you dream of building self-healing systems. You believe in collaboration, acting as a force multiplier, and making the right tradeoffs. And you have been looking for an opportunity to join a well-funded startup where you can use your powers for good (in Sift’s case, to help eliminate fraud on the internet).

What would make you a good fit:

5+ years of experience as DevOps / Site Reliability Engineer

Extensive experience building & managing cloud infrastructure on AWS or GCP

Experience solving problems with production systems and building solutions and automations to prevent them from reoccurring

Proven experience with automation and knowledge of configuration management tools

Experience building infrastructure as code and automating infrastructure provisioning steps, such as CloudFormation/terraform

Strong experience with monitoring and alerting systems, both open source and commercial 

Experience with programming languages such as Java, Python, Ruby, Scala or Go

Familiarity with Docker and container clustering technologies like Docker Swarm, Kubernetes, or AWS ECS

A little about us:

Sift is the leading innovator in Digital Trust & Safety. Hundreds of disruptive, forward-thinking companies like Airbnb, Zillow, and Twitter trust Sift to deliver outstanding customer experience while preventing fraud and abuse.

The Sift engine powers Digital Trust & Safety by helping companies stop fraud before it happens. But it’s not just another anti-fraud platform: Sift enables businesses to tailor experiences to each customer according to the risk they pose. That means fraudsters experience friction, but honest users do not. By drawing on insights from our global network of customers, Sift allows businesses to scale, win, and thrive in the digital era.

Competitive total compensation package

401k plan

Education reimbursement

Catered meals

title: Senior Security Engineer
content:
About the team:

Sift is a highly collaborative environment committed to driving Digital Trust & Safety solutions that protect customers from fraudulent abuse, costing them time, money, and risk to brand reputation. That same drive is applied to securing our own platform; our customers trust with their data and we strive to continuously evolve and adapt our platform by constantly learning, applying the latest technologies, and most importantly, carefully listening to feedback. 

What we’re looking for: 

As a Security Engineer at Sift, you will work across the enterprise to design and develop complex security solutions to protect against today's threats. This high impact role will be part of the Security organization and will be accountable for delivering the security foundation that allows Sift to aggressively move forward, applying the highest standards to protect our customers. 

You will have the opportunity to actively monitor for security threats through detection creation and investigations, help secure our network boundaries from attacks and breaches, harden our security applications and infrastructure to protect our customers data and maintain customer confidence that they are secure when accessing the console. 

What you’ll do:

Directly contribute to Sift's growth by designing and developing security solutions

Leverage your defensive security skills to continuously evolve and mature Sift's security monitoring capabilities to detect active threats, including: detection creation, investigation and response, and threat hunting

Work across the organization to mitigate security events or incidents, establishing scope and impact, performing forensic activities, contributing to internal/external communications, and providing technical guidance to both mitigate the event in a timely manner, but also secure against future attacks

Contribute to post-mortem incident reviews for management and leadership, including root cause, remediation steps, and future improvements to protect a recurrence. 

Work cross-functionally to identify exposed vulnerabilities across Sift applications and infrastructure through automated scanning and actionable reporting 

Drive security best practices at the ground floor by participating in security reviews, threat modeling, and engineering reviews across the org to help identify potential risks before it reaches the customer 

Participate in both technical and non-technical discussions as Security SME, building confidence by effectively communication how our solutions defend against active threats

Provide input on security initiatives to automate and scale security processes across engineering 

What we’re looking for:

3+ years of hands-on experience developing and implementing enterprise wide security controls

Strong technical understanding of software and application security: (e.g. OWASP Top 10) in a continuous development environment 

Experience managing SIEM infrastructure, log ingestion, detection creation, investigations and threat hunts

Clear understanding of Incident Response process with proven examples of contribution: discovery assessment, response, mitigation, root cause analysis, communication, and failure mitigation

Vulnerability scanning experience including scan automation, vulnerability assessments, current attack/defense methodologies, and remediation

Experience with various application security solutions/tools such as code analysis (static & dynamic), vulnerability scanning, pen testing 

Strong communication skills 

Experience driving threat modeling exercises across big data platforms responsible for managing sensitive data 

Good understanding of Linux systems 

Strong scripting skills for process automation

Bonus points: 

Google Cloud Platform (GCP) experience, specifically around adopting and adapting out of box security controls

Bug bounty program development or participation 

Experience in helping drive compliance programs (SOC2, PCI, etc), risk assessments and developing privacy & security engineering principles and best practices

BS in Computer Science or related field

A little about us:

Sift is the leading innovator in Digital Trust & Safety. Hundreds of disruptive, forward-thinking companies like Airbnb, Zillow, and Twitter trust Sift to deliver outstanding customer experience while preventing fraud and abuse.

The Sift engine powers Digital Trust & Safety by helping companies stop fraud before it happens. That means fraudsters experience friction, but honest users do not. By drawing on insights from our global network of customers, Sift allows businesses to scale, win, and thrive in the digital era.

401k plan

title: Senior Software Engineer, Data Science Infrastructure
content:
About the team:

Every day, thousands of websites and apps rely on Sift’s cloud-based machine learning to understand which users and actions they can trust. With this knowledge companies can prevent fraud, grow revenue, and build better user experiences based on trust.

The Data Science Infrastructure team owns the tools that empower the development of new machine learning models and data intelligence at Sift. Experimentation is the lifeblood of machine learning. Our tools simplify the processes for experimentation in the face of greater complexity and scale. They also make it easier to find and analyze the data needed to make decisions.

What we’re looking for:

As an engineer on the Data Science Infrastructure team, you will design and build infrastructure and tooling to make it fast, easy, and cost effective to perform machine learning experimentation and data analysis. Ensuring data and batch processing pipeline availability, stability, and access at production scale is critical to our mission. 

What you’ll do:

Design and build tooling to enable data scientists and ML engineers to quickly iterate on experiments

Motivate, teach, listen and empathize with a variety of engineering and analytical roles

Lead architecture discussions to meet the requirements of machine learning teams at the scale of thousands of models and hundreds of terabytes of data

Implement scalable, high-throughput, fault-tolerant, extensible, and easily maintainable batch processing workflows

Champion and deliver cross-company data engineering initiatives

What would make you a strong fit:

Designed and built scalable, fault-tolerant batch services for production data

Experience iterating on large, complex ETL data pipelines that stretch the limits of available tools and services

Strong software engineering fundamentals

Strong communication & collaboration skills, and a belief that team output is more important than individual output

Experience with big data and related systems

Bonus points:

Experience building backend systems using Java / Python

Familiar with distributed backend data stores (Bigtable) and CAP theorem

Knowledge of cloud computing services

Experience working with large datasets using Spark / MapReduce

title: Senior Software Engineer, Content Integrity
content:
About the team: 

The Content Integrity team's mission is to help customers detect and prevent all forms of spam, scam, and abusive activity done via content generation. We help all sorts of online businesses including marketplaces, communities, dating sites, social networks and messaging services foster healthy interactions between their users and keep unwanted content off their platforms.

What we’re looking for: 

As a senior software engineer, you will be a hands-on leader that owns and drives forward the team's technical vision. You will work with product managers, data scientists and other engineering teams to deliver projects on time and mentors engineers on the team.

What you’ll do: 

You will leverage our vast network of data to train accurate globally-scoped models. We use Deep Learning techniques to analyze user behavior and build offline experimentation systems used to simultaneously evaluate tens of thousands of models. You’ll scale machine learning pipelines used to produce thousands of models derived from many terabytes of data and build systems that automatically explain how a model arrived at a prediction. We hope that you’ll bring some great ideas to the table as well.

What would make you a strong fit: 

Designed and built scalable, low latency, fault-tolerant services

Strong software engineering fundamentals

Experience working with large datasets using technologies like Spark, MapReduce, etc

Strong communication & collaboration skills, and a belief that team output is more important than individual output

Strong understanding of industry best practices

Bonus points: 

Experience working with large scale data on BigTable, HDFS, Cassandra, etc

Experience working with products that leverage machine learning, statistical natural language processing, or computer vision

Understanding of statistical modeling, machine learning, data mining concepts, and a track record of solving problems with these methods

title: Senior Software Engineer, Analyst Platform
content:
About the team:

The Analyst Platform bridges the gap between our machine learning at scale and our customers' needs. By combining a strong sense of what is right for the customer with knowledge of big data and distributed systems, we provide a seamless way for our customers to make decisions, learn insights and navigate the ever-changing world of fraud fighting without needing to understand the complex technology underneath. That means creating a web application that distills complex ML signals, automation tools running on a highly-available multi-service architecture, and providing customer-facing analytics tooling to make endless streams of data understandable, actionable and usable.


What we’re looking for:

We’re looking for an experienced engineer to help drive our product forward, helping to shape our architecture, and sharpen our toolset as we scale up for our enterprise customers. You should be able to craft simple, straightforward solutions to difficult, open-ended problems, while driving improvement that makes the team better.


Great candidates will be passionate about providing great end-to-end customer experience and building the components powering our service. You’ll bring experience in taking your ideas from concept to customer, at scale, with high quality, and on time. You thrive on high-growth, high-impact opportunities at a growing startup. You have a clear sense of how you can leverage your strengths and past experience while learning new things. You excel at creating order from ambiguity, and distilling simplicity from complexity.


What you’ll do:

Drive for clarity through complexity, partnering with Engineering Leadership and Product Management to determine the right balance of scope and schedule

Collaborate with other members of our Analyst Platform team as we continue building industry-leading products to promote digital trust and safety

Help guide the overall architecture of the analyst platform components

Always look for opportunities to improve engineering practices


What would make you a strong fit:

5+ years experience designing/delivering highly-available services

Experience with RESTful services, API design

Experience working in Java

Some familiarity with Javascript, HTML, CSS, and React

Strong communication & collaboration skills - a team-first, product-first mindset

title: Senior Software Engineer - Web Services (Bellevue, WA)
content:
WHO WE ARE

Seagull Scientific has always done one thing—and done it exceptionally well. Its BarTender® software transforms information into labels, barcodes, RFID tags, smartcards, and documents that drive business and improve safety, security, efficiency and compliance.

Headquartered in Bellevue, Washington, with branch offices in Madrid, Taipei, and Tokyo, Seagull Scientific's software is used in more than 150 countries and across virtually every industry. For more information about Seagull Scientific, please visit www.bartendersoftware.com.

This position is located in Bellevue, Washington.

WHO YOU ARE

You are a strong team player who appreciates excellence, who is passionate about their work and fair in their interactions with people. You are a professional software engineer who possesses a wide range of technical capabilities, including a solid background in C++/C#, SQL, web technologies (HTTP, REST, OAuth, etc.), network technologies (TCP, UDP, WCF, etc.) and Windows UI APIs (WPF, WinForms, Win32, etc.).

WHAT YOU WILL DO

Contribute features to a suite of shipping products

Assist with the development of scalable web service technologies

Design and implement key product features

Be part of a team

Meet deadlines, strive for continual process improvement, and be self-motivated

WHAT WE REQUIRE

5+ years of C++/C# experience

Solid understanding of web related technologies (HTTP, REST, OAuth, etc.), network technologies (TCP, UDP, WCF, etc.) and Windows UI APIs (WPF, WinForms, Win32, etc.)

Interest in developing scalable web services

Self-driven and able to work as member of a small team

EDUCATION

A degree in a relevant field.

TERMS OF EMPLOYMENT

Full-time position with benefits

Must be able to cover your own costs for relocation and travel for onsite interviews

Ability to provide documentation that proves authorization to work in the US without visa sponsorship

BENEFITS 

Excellent medical, dental, and vision plan

401K with 100% employer matching up to 3.0% with a 3-year vesting period

Competitive PTO Package

Paid company holidays

Competitive salary

On-site fitness center and deli

Free parking or transportation subsidy (ORCA)

Tuition-reimbursement benefits

Company-paid life insurance, short term and long-term disability benefits

Access to green space and Bellevue Open Space Trail System

Fun staff and team-building activities—anniversary party, lunches and seasonal events

OUR CULTURE

We are fair, we are passionate, we appreciate excellence and we act as a team. We offer a dynamic, culturally diverse and fun environment in which people with energy, creativity and passion work together to deliver amazing product experiences for our customers. You will be part of a team where your insights and ideas are valued.

DIVERSITY AND INCLUSION

Seagull Scientific has a company culture that respects a diverse and unified team from a range of backgrounds whose different perspectives enrich our business. Everyone at Seagull is treated fairly, with respect, and is encouraged to voice their opinion.

EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY

Seagull Scientific Inc. provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment.

content:

Seagull Scientific has always done one thing—and done it exceptionally well. Our BarTender® software transforms information into labels, barcodes, RFID tags, smartcards, and documents that drive business and improve safety, security, efficiency and compliance. We have also developed more than 3,000 drivers for a variety of thermal, inkjet and identification card printers, which support advanced features such as linear and 2D barcodes, RFID and magnetic stripe encoding.

Headquartered in Bellevue, Washington, with branch offices in Madrid, Taipei, and Tokyo, Seagull Scientific's software is used in more than 150 countries and across virtually every industry. For more information about Seagull Scientific, please visit www.bartendersoftware.com.

This position is located in Bellevue, Washington.

You are a strong team player who appreciates excellence, who is passionate about their work and fair in their interactions with people. You are a software engineering professional who possesses a wide range of design capabilities, including a solid background in C++.

Design and implement new printer drivers, as well as maintain existing drivers (in C++) 

Development of new features and maintenance for existing printer drivers

title: Software Development Engineer
content:
HELP US BUILD THE NEXT GENERATION RADAR

It’s not often you get the chance to change industries by bringing truly breakthrough technology to market – technology that not only disrupts existing markets, but creates vast new ones. It’s hard and challenging work, but it’s also exciting, energizing, satisfying, and rewarding!

Drones, autonomous cars and trucks, heavy machines, even flying cars. Echodyne has applied the physics of metamaterials to create a new category of sensor that provides the critical high-resolution, ground-truth data that autonomous machines and vehicles need to operate safely at any time and in any weather.

Echodyne’s Metamaterials Electronically Scanning Array (MESA) is changing the way people think about commercial radar. Built on decades of research, Echodyne brings high-performance radar to commercial markets and applications constrained by Cost, Size, Weight or Power.

We are looking for a motivated and passionate Software Development Engineer.  participate in the whole product development life cycle with us, from concept through deployment and operations.

What you’ll do:

Program in C++ in a Linux environment.

Design, build, test, and improve our MESA products.  Own the development, testing, and debugging of code modules and libraries.

Help drive and support testing efforts across teams and projects.

Work alongside radar, signal processing, and other software engineers to implement platform functionality to meet specific system control and signal processing needs.

What we’re looking for: 

Experience designing and building Linux-based software applications in C++

Strong verbal and written communication skills

Desire and ability to learn quickly and be part of a world-class team

Knowledge of software development life cycle, and good coding practices

Excellent problem solving, debugging and troubleshooting skills

Software testing.  Test automation and infrastructure a plus 

A bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, related field, or equivalent

Nice to have extras:

Experience building tailored Linux OS’s (we use Yocto and Bitbake) and administering a Linux environment

Software architecture expertise - describing and implementing new software designs using design patterns and off-the-shelf components

Embedded systems programing and interfacing embedded systems to host computers and peripherals; using common communications protocols (UART, SPI, QSPI, I2C, TCPIP)

Hardware debugging and code testing using oscilloscopes, logic analyzers, multi-meters

Understanding of sampling theory, digital filtering, and ADC signal digitization is a plus.

Technologies & Tools we use (you don’t need to know all of these):

Linux, Git, Bitbucket, Jira, Confluence, Jenkins, Docker, PyPi.

GCC, CMake, Eclipse, Python, pip, virtualenv, Visual Studio Code.

Our Benefits: 

Multiple medical, dental and vision plans to choose from; select the ones that are right for you.

Company paid disability and life insurance

Flexible time off – Generous paid time off as long as business objectives are being met; paid office closure days and sick leave

Lots of healthy snack options

Locker rooms/showers

Fun company events, plus ping pong, can jam and board games

Discounts on cell phone service, computers, movie tickets, travel and more

Echodyne is an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse workforce.

title: Solutions Engineer - Seattle
content:
Curalate is looking for talented front-end web developers to join our Solutions engineering team. Our software-as-a-service product empowers marketers at over 850 of the world’s greatest brands to gather, analyze, and monetize imagery from across the visual web. To be most effective, Curalate needs to create user experiences that integrate directly into these brands’ existing data flows and pipelines. These experiences will be seen by millions of customers every day and are mission critical for both Curalate and our clients; when successful, they allow our clients to drive real ROI from our tools and services. In addition, the insights we gain from these integrations play a critical role in improving our product and shaping our long-term roadmap.

Check out our Engineering Blog to get a window into what we are building at Curalate and what we're geeked about! 

Responsibilities:

As a Front End Engineer, you will write clean JavaScript, HTML, and CSS that leverages Curalate APIs to deliver best-in-class user experiences. Your work will be powered by a cutting-edge React / Redux code base that you will be responsible for maintaining and extending.

Our work is highly-visible -- over five million customers see it every day -- so the margin for error is small. Your exceptional problem solving skills and creative out-of-the-box thinking will be vital for thriving in this role.

About You:

As a Front End engineer, you must have strong web development skills. This means:

You have 2+ years of professional web development experience

You live, eat and breathe JS, HTML, and CSS

You have professional-grade Git skills and experience with modern build tools

You have an extensive background in building beautiful, cross-device, cross-browser web experiences

Gold Stars:

Experience with React and Redux

You’ve worked with big brands on high traffic projects

You love learning & playing with web technology so much that you've got a side project, go to meetups, or contribute to open source.

About Us:

Curalate enables brands to use social content and social audiences to sell more effectively online. Over 1,000 brands and retailers use Curalate to turn images and videos into shoppable content on their sites, social channels, ads, and emails. Curalate was launched in 2012, is an official marketing partner of Pinterest, Facebook, and Instagram and has offices in Philadelphia, New York City, Seattle and London.

No recruiters, please.
